review.title: Awesome location
review.reviewText: Great hotel in an even better location. Staff was very friendly and the room in the tower was spacious.

review.title: Very nice accommodations on Union Square.
review.reviewText:
Beautiful hotel on Union Square.
Missing amenities - Mini Bar, Turn down service.  otherwise perfect.

review.title: College Football Game
review.reviewText: Super staff at front desk, restaurant, bell man , car attendant
review.locationRemarks: Heart of SF, easy walking , cable car, BART, shops, attractions

review.title: Nice hotel with beautiful location - Right in the
review.reviewText:
Easy accessing to many interesting places with cable car down the street and bart services within the town centre.

Highly recommend
review.negativeRemarks: Perfect stay
review.locationRemarks: Cable cars + many others interesting places- Good Shopping area

review.title: Location is downtown San Francisco.
review.reviewText: The location of this Westin is very central downtown.  We thought it was pretty pricey.  Their valet parking is $67 a day which is a lot.  The rooms are very small because this is an old hotel.  What really disappointed us about the hotel is the quality of wine they carry for being in California, the wine capital of the United States.

review.title: 74 dlls parking per night
review.reviewText:
74 dlls parking per night, crazy, good location.
hotel Ok but 74 dlls parking

review.title: Noisy pipes prevent sleep
review.reviewText: Hotel knows certain groups of rooms have problems where the pipes bang all night long. This started on our fourth night. Got no sleep. Called desk at 1am and were told there was a quiet room on our floor, but we would have to pack up everything, then check out of room and check in to new room, instead of just letting us in to the new room to get some sleep on our last night. And we were very clear when we first checked in that we wanted a quiet room. We pay a hotel for a room to sleep in, if it can not provide that, it has failed.
review.negativeRemarks: Give guests quiet rooms, and better customer service to be more accomodating to client complaints
review.locationRemarks: SFMOMA and John's Grill, cable cars

review.title: Nice hotel in the centre of the city
review.reviewText: Had a great stay the beds are great rooms are old but clean hotel is in a good location
Always a good experience at the Weston.  Hotel was a little older than expected but clean.  Staff was great.  I would stay there again.

review.title: Union Square prime location
review.reviewText: The Hotel is beautiful and in an awesome location.  The staff and the hotel is in good condition in fact we stayed in the recently renovated tower which was more modern and more to my liking.  I did not stay in the older tower so I am not sure what those rooms were like.  The Hotel was also smack in the heart of downtown shopping which could be dangerous for some as there was everything from Designer to discount shopping within a block of the Hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the character of the public areas such as the Oak room which has beautiful woodwork.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is pretty costly, so you are better off without a car utilizing cabs, Uber, Lyft, public rail or cable cars and of course walking.
review.locationRemarks: The location allowed us to be able to walk to the Theater district, Chinatown, Little Italy, even the pier.  Everything seemed to be 15 minutes away.

review.title: It was a Westin (Heavenly Beds!).
review.reviewText: Union Square, Heavenly Beds, large room, it was great! We got a complimentary late check out which let us explore a bit more before we had to go to the airport. The elevator key process made us feel secure.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was LARGE. It was great even though our view was of the taller tower, but we hardly were there anyway.
review.negativeRemarks: We loved it. Its always nice to get out of town and come back to a cozy bed after a long day of sight seeing.
review.locationRemarks: What is there to say? It is in the heart of San Francisco and within walking distance of transportation. All you need to do is step outside.

review.reviewText: Great hotel.  Good blend of modern comfort and history with a great location. Very large rooms by any standards, especially San Francisco where I'm usually staying in a shoe box.  Area outside the hotel is very congested but lots to do.  Parking seems like a mess but somehow they make it work as long as you have some patience and plan ahead.  No pool which is a bit disappointing if you're traveling with kids.  They could do a better job at the front desk with check in and check out.  Long lines, awkward layout, and curiously long interactions between visitors and hotel staff.  None of the negatives were enough to detract from my overall excellent experience at this Westin.

review.title: Weekend in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We chose the Westin St. Francis for sentimental reasons as I had stayed there with my mother when I was a child.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is great.   The employee who checked us in (early) could not have been nicer and he was very helpful with a map to areas we wanted to see
review.negativeRemarks: We found that they were extremely slow to pick up room service tables, glasses left in the hallway etc.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is right across the street.  Lots of shopping and restaurants nearby.  Easy to get a cab, but lots of places to walk to.

review.title: Excellent location and spacious room
review.reviewText: Had a good experience as the location of the hotel is excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Room decor
review.locationRemarks: Lots of things to do nearby. Perfect location.

review.reviewText: Great location, been to better hotels so can't give it 5 stars but otherwise no complaints. The breakfast option is convenient but it's the same standard hotel buffet you'll find anywhere. Unless you're there for business, save your money and try out some of local options within walking distance instead.

review.title: Great hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: Stayed for a week in late August. Great location in Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Gym was very small. Hotel bar was dark and secluded.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel on Union Square
review.reviewText: Iconic Hotel on Union Square.  Clean and convenient - three blocks from BART - Good eats near by.  Central location.
review.negativeRemarks: I wish they would give tours of the hotel as it has a rich history

review.title: Nice hotel with good location
review.reviewText: Great hotel with great service employees. Good and well maintained gym.

review.title: Hotel in Union Square near to all upmarket shops
review.reviewText: If you stay here don't book standard rooms, go for tower rooms. Rooms in the old hotel are dated and very cramped and definitely not 4*, we would rate them 2* at best for the prices charged. The newer rooms in the tower are more spacious and warrent the 4*. Sign up for the SPG loyalty card (free) and you get free room internet access (usually charged per day). The staff are reasonably helpful but don't explain the workings of the hotel and its amenities (we had to ask how to use the lift for the first time - as did several other guests during our stay).
review.positiveRemarks: The tower rooms are spacious and have fantastic views around the city, as do the open, outside lifts to the tower rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: The tower rooms are tired, the mini bar not stocked, confusing lift operations, cramped standard rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Right in Union Square, with all good named shops and restaurants, easy for public transport and tour buses.

review.title: Landmark hotel
review.reviewText: Landmark hotel with great location.  Wonderful staff.  Rooms a bit dated for the price.  Where are you supposed to plug in the coffee pot?

review.title: Bad hotel
review.reviewText:
Veryyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy
Baddddddddddd and expensive

review.title: Nice hotel on Union Square
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the hotel, the staff was friendly, the room was nice and my son enjoyed riding up and down the glass elevators. Two complaints - the lobby was way too cold - it was as cold as San Francisco. Also - and not the hotel's fault, but we had a rom in the back of the hotel and across the street loud street music played every night from around 8 PM to a little after 10 PM.
review.negativeRemarks: warmer lobby

review.title: Great location clean and wonderful staff.
review.reviewText:
Staff made it just that much better....location perfect but Ryan at the front desk checking us in was so helpful and respectful. James who was curbside valet was awesome....also our bellman (which I forgot his name) very friendly and easy to work with. All three of them had great personalities and you would like to say hey when you get off work come join us.....the only bad experience was the concierge (woman) kind of rude when asking a simple question BUT she could not take away from all the other staff especially the three mentioned at the top.

Room was clean and very comfortable....a great bed for sure. They also made sure that champagne and strawberries were waiting in the room when we arrived (thanks to Ryan)....they were paid for so no one gets the wrong idea (but very tasty and decent champagne. We would stay in a heart beat again......
review.positiveRemarks: Just about everything....service makes a huge difference with us. Don't have to just wait on us but being considerate respectful helpful cringes nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of Union Square.

review.title: Downtown SF
review.reviewText: Great location in downtown SF, near shopping and Resturants

review.title: a superb experience
review.reviewText: A superb experience. Exceptional customer service from all staff. I enjoyed every minute of my stay. Excellent setting and people.

review.title: great location in union square
review.reviewText: The room was clean, although the bathroom and closet space was a little on the small size.  Disappointed that breakfast and wifi was not included in the price. The room had a musty, damp smell. The location was great for restaurants, night life and transportation, therefore could be a little to the noisy side.
review.negativeRemarks: The musty smell and the overall appearance of the hallways on the bedroom floors.
review.locationRemarks: Directly in front of Union Square. Plenty of restaurants, shopping and transportation close by.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, very clean wish the room is a little bigger.

review.title: Underwhelming
review.reviewText:
I've been looking forward to being able to book in to this hotel for a few years and finally got the chance.

The hotel is ok, but underwhelming to be honest. We had a two bed room in the tower. The beds were small, given the room was for 4 people there was only enough stuff for two setup in the room. 

We were on the 5 floor with a view of a back of a building so had no sunlight. 

Perhaps this was because we got a good deal on the room? Also charge for wifi! Who still does this!?!?

Location was good, I just overall expected higher quality than the other hotels I stayed in SF. I won't be booking again.

review.title: ummmmmm not coming back.
review.reviewText:
Thirty minutes to check in for room. No designated pet floor or rooms. Pets stay in any room. Yuck! Asked for a quiet location and was told they could not give me a quiet room. 
Old and worn. Lobby is like walking through Disneyland. Crazy crowded.

Very nice personnel. Only snarky one the male concierge who wasn't very helpful and impatient 
But room was great. Front desk staff super nice

review.title: Great as always
review.reviewText:
Have been staying here since the 1970s. Staff is great. Rooms are very comfortable. Wifi is great. Lobby bar/restaurant staff is excellent and a great place to grab a quick bite or people watch. Location is outstanding. 
Wish they would reopen the large bar/restaurant to the left of the clock by the entrance. The ambiance of that bar was one of my favs.

review.title: Mini Bar checking person is terrible.
review.reviewText:
The bed is so comfortable, the location is convenient, but at first day , when we stay at room about 3pm, Mimi bar checking person just open the door, then we say we are in room, so he(or she) left, after we went to dinner, about 8 pm we found our room door just open and unlock. So scary⋯, almost 5 hr our room door just unlocked, It's lucky our room just behind the corner seems nothing lost, but is really make we feel so terrible, no privacy at all(my passport.my computer⋯everything in room)

After we respond, the security person checked⋯， and told us it just the mini bar person come, anyway the manage(Mary) apologize to us and give us a gift to make we feel better, we accept(It's already happen, right?)

Next day morning, 8:15AM somebody knocked the door, it!s the clean person, she stand front another room, said to me she will come back later, and then when I sleep at the comfortable bed, she knocked the door at 9 am again. 

What a day! Why they just work so hard and so early? I don't know, maybe it's just want let me know~everything Is not so easy to just enjoy the joy when other people work so hard.
review.negativeRemarks: Don' t make your staff to disturb guest.
review.locationRemarks: Sighing & Shopping!

review.title: Great hotel in Union Square !!!
review.reviewText: Hotel great the staff very polite apart from a waitress in the clock cocktail lounge,she bought our drinks and asked very aggressively how we were going to pay,she loomed over us until we told her,this happened to others in the bar she was very rude.
review.positiveRemarks: The location,front of desk staff cleanliness.
review.negativeRemarks: Free wifi in all rooms.The waitresses attitude in the cocktail bar.
review.locationRemarks: Very central everything close by.

review.title: Luxury Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is very clean, luxury and nice, but the rooms are small.
Great location for all San Fran tourist spots and shopping hotel is also really big so it's always busy! Never a shortage of cabs out front either
Lovely hotel. I highly recommend a room with the view of Union Square.

review.title: Lovely Hotel, Perfect Location
review.reviewText: We were very pleased staying at The Westin in Union Square. It is centrally located for amazing shopping. We had a lovely room in the old part of the hotel. The only thing I would say is seeing that our room was in the original part of the hotel it was quite small & we could hear everything going on out in the hall. Other than that the hotel was great.
review.positiveRemarks: Central location. Very historic & beautiful! Great staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Our room was quite small, but don't know how that could be improved. Maybe some better toiletries as well.
review.locationRemarks: Smack dab in the middle of Union Square & amazing shopping!

review.title: Slow check-in
review.reviewText: Check in took more than 35 mins; check out took 25 mins and there were only 3 people in line. There was clearly not enough to staff to handle the influx of check-ins. The environment in the hotel is frenetic and is not a pleasant or relaxing experience. The room was tiny. The staff was the only highlight...they were polite and helpful.

review.title: Excellent hotel, close to everything.
review.reviewText: Staff was amazing, views were breath taking will be back soon!

review.title: Beautiful Grand Hotel
review.reviewText: The carpets were a little old and worn but the hotel was beautiful.  Rooms were large and we had a great view of Union Square.   The checkin line was a little long but I would definitely stay in the hotel again.  The staff made up for any inconveniences that we had.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful grand entrance.  Large grand rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Check in line.  Drink prices in the bar.
review.locationRemarks: Location is excellent.  Located on Union Square and right on the trolley line.

review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very good, hotel location was  very good.

review.title: Nice location - easy to get around
review.reviewText: Overall this Westin was a nice place to stay - you are right down in Union Sq with many close shops and restaurants. We stayed in the newer tower.  We were supposed to get a higher level room when we checked in but none were available, but the receptionist said she would make sure it's all taken care of the next day.  She said our bags and everything would be moved for us and we didn't have to do a thing. Of course, that did not happen. When we came back from our adventures for the day, nothing was done and they didn't even have it in the system. The new person we talked to took care of it though. Overall, the hotel was convenient and clean. The bed was comfortable but the sheets were scratchy and not at all soft - that would be my biggest complaint.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and cleanliness in the newer tower.
review.negativeRemarks: Sheets could be less starchy and more soft.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of shopping and good food within walking distance.

review.title: Excellent location and historical property
review.reviewText: Comfortable stay but staff are slightly rude . I strongly recommend this hotel due to hotel location and nice property

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: The location is perfect.  A lot of shopping and restaurants around the hotel.  The hotel is old but well kept with an upscale vibe.

review.title: Location, Location
review.reviewText: Location is the key to my hotel experience. Very centrally location to everything I wanted to do. Felt very safe walking around the area at anytime of day

Over all a nice hotel. Comfy and clean bed...the toilet was the only weird thing. It was an industrial type toilet...like you'd find in a public restroom...and the toilet seat was very old and peeling...not what you'd expect for the price in the supposed "updated" tower of the hotel. Everything was otherwise clean and staff was helpful and friendly.

review.title: Great location right on union square -
review.reviewText: Easy cable car acces and lots of shopping nearby. This is a great location.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean spacious rooms - we were on the 26th floor with views of the Golden Gate Bridge and Coit tower.
review.negativeRemarks: More pillows!
review.locationRemarks: Right in union square surrounded by fantastic shopping. Breakfast at Sears diner is a must. The cable car is close but the lines were so long we opted

review.title: The hotel was absolutely beautiful.
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed this hotel. It was beautiful and the staff was accommodating. The room was a little small but we didn't spend much time in the room anyway. I would stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was a little bit small and didn't have much of a view but everything was in good condition and the bed was really comfortable.

review.title: Holiday
review.reviewText:
It was very pleasurable; the hotel was central to all our needs.

Regards alexa

review.title: Perfect location for restaurants & shopping
review.reviewText: I've stayed in about 5+ hotels in San Francisco and the Westin St. Francis by far has the best locations. Also, the rooms (we stayed in the deluxe king in the Tower building) is very spacious compared to other hotels in the area. Downside is the room service food. (spent $60 ish for some soup and a medium pizza.) While they have plenty of options before 10:30p.m. there are better quality options outside of the hotel that are walking distance, which is great if you can withstand walking through the chilly San Francisco nights. Another downside is the bathrooms are pretty outdated with your commercial-style toilet. Overall great hotel, with fantastic views and the other guests, seem to be families and/or couples. I've heard complaints of thin walls, but I've slept great. The staff is friendly. Would stay again when we want to be in Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Update bathrooms especially toilets.
review.locationRemarks: Department stores, close to the cable cars, bunch of coffee/bakery options. A variety of restaurants with multiple choices of cuisine.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Great staff, comfortable rooms, perfect union square location.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good and kind reception. The location is perfect. I'll be coming back to stay.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel in the middle of the shopping district. Great views of the Golden Gate Bridge.
This was a great hotel for the money and location

Excellent location however a single
 Bed room is extremely small. Barely enough room for the Bed.
The room was very small, walls were thin and you could hear other guests.

review.title: Not alot of Bang for your Buck.
review.reviewText: The only nice thing was that it was on Union Square and many stores to shop near by but other than that just not what i expected of a hotel like this. To start, the rooms were too small, my apartment room back home is roomier compared to the room i stayed in. In addition, i understand i stayed on the landmark building( the older side and known for its crown moldings and other details) but room just felt old and in great need of a Renovation. A bud of mine stayed at a hotel three blocks away for half the price, he showed me pictures of room and other details of hotels inside and it was really nice, next year iam deff booking at a different hotel.

review.title: Excellent hotel very close to lots of amenities
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, great spot very close to lots of Shopping places, restaurants,amenities. Excellent rooms, very nice staff and service

review.title: Nice, just squeezed in a 4star
review.reviewText:
Beautiful architecture.  Wonderful location.  Never saw the main restaurant open and didn't bother to ask about it.  Would have loved to have had a place to go on the top floors for views, dinner, or drinks.  Small room but comfortable.  Charges for EVERYTHING except the coffee in the room.  Over priced.
We go to SFO a lot and the homeless have exploded, they were everywhere.  The city has taken a downturn not addressing this issue.  We were almost hacked on as we were leaving the hotel.  Very sad that this beautiful city has not addressed this issue until now.  Mental health is really difficult.
Wish there would have been more staff around to ask questions to.  Yes, we could have called concierge or walked to them but there were just so many people.  Maybe if the front desk folks offered information upon check in.  "have you stayed with us before?" would have opened up to many questions.
review.negativeRemarks: Availability of staff at more than one location.  Concierge location is hidden and out of the way.
review.locationRemarks: Union square, shopping, restaurants, muni, cable cars, Westfield mall.  We went to the Giants game and it was very convenient to the muni.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Landmark rooms looking tired traveled alone and felt very safe in hotel. Oak room needs a total revamp. Like the green room program
Great hotel in a good location.  If you enjoy a hotel with a rich history, you would truly appreciate the Westin St. Francis.

review.title: Do not get an upgrade room
review.reviewText: I upgraded the room since I had a visitor. The room was supposed to be the one with view. However, when I got the the room, there was no view, it was only high floor. I called the lobby right away, however they said all the rooms are occupied and they can't upgrade the room for no charge. Then they downgraded the room so that I can get a better view but did not honor me any charges back. Only points to use later. I had planned for this trip months ago and it was not pleasent for me.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Enjoyed stay,close to everything. Hotel clean, staff friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay there again if in San Fran.

review.title: Location excellent
review.reviewText:
The hotel is old, overused, even in the new tower, pillows areover over used , sampoos are not up to 4 stars hotel
Lobby is big and nice on union square

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: I took my 15 year old granddaughter for a San Francisco trip and chose this hotel and so happy I did. It is located in a safe district, restaurants , shopping stores and of course the cable cars run directly in front and other means of transportation is at your convenience too. We had a room on the 23rd floor with a city view. The staff was very helpful answering my questions to insure my plans would go smoothly. I highly recommend this hotel and if I return to SF in the future this is were I will stay.
review.positiveRemarks: First class atmosphere the moment you walk in. Rooms are large and nice spa showers.
review.negativeRemarks: Two chairs by the window rather than one 😊
review.locationRemarks: Major shopping stores, good restaurants, we especially enjoyed the Mason Cafe. All kinds of transportation close by.

review.title: Classic style hotel with great access
review.reviewText: This hotel has great access to a lot of what union square has to offer.  There are plenty of cabs and pick up ride sharing spots around the park in front.  The hotel is a classic style hotel but this also means the walls can be paper thin.  You can read in other reviews that all your rooms will have thin walls so if you or your neighbors are noisy it will be unpleasant.  For the most part, it was well worth the trip.

review.title: Perfect location, nice hotel, we're very happy.
review.reviewText: Like like like.. Perfect location, nice hotel, everything was beautiful. Thank you..

review.title: Not the best.
review.reviewText:
Hotel lobby is nice, but you have to neg for the room what you paid for it, got misinformation
from hotel personal about breakfast time,  also you can hear most of the noise thru the walls, outside homeless people everywhere, feels unsafe.
Next visit will stay at Hotel Continental instead
I would recommend this hotel.  It is situated right on Powell and Union Square.  The hotel is clean, rooms are nice and the hotel staff were accomodating

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: An excellent location with great facilities and staff. If you want to have a grand holiday in San Francisco then the Westin St Francis is the place to stay. Highly recommended. Our hotel of choice every time we are in SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi should be included.
review.locationRemarks: Union square, cable cars and access to shopping and tourist activities.

review.title: Hotel location is perfect!
review.reviewText: Great location with easy access to tourist areas and shopping. Hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. We paid a little extra for king size bed and view, it was totally worth it! Highly recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice, friendly staff, location, dog friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, cable carts, tourist bus, china town

review.title: 3 Star Hotel
review.reviewText: The location allows this group to get away with a lot of unacceptable service. The grand deluxe rooms are nice. If you want a 4 star experience you will want to avoid depending upon most any staff person in this place. It has been in the decline from a service standpoint for the past 10 years. In the Clock Bar people were mocking the service and leaving due to the behavior of the servers. In the elevator people talked about how "ghetto" the service is in the hotel. There are just too many stories to about how poor the service is here. If I stay again I will not spend one dollar more than what it cost to stay in the room ever again. This Westin location just does not get what service should be. They also charge for wi fi .... I'll bargain hunt this place if I ever want to view union square from my room.

review.title: Central location, good spot for shopping
review.reviewText: Nice central location. Hotel is outdated. Poor amenities
Everything was perfect!  Stayed in the new tower and the elevator ride alone was worth it.  Great staff!
It was great. Food and drinks are expensive, but what isn't in SF.

review.title: Beautiful hotel close to BART.
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful, just a short walk from BART, comfy bed, lovely and helpful concierge named Danka. My daughter and I enjoyed our stay.
Staff was exceptionaland so was our room and the location.

review.title: Perfect location, excellent service, great views!
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at the St Francis. I was by myself, on the 7th floor of the Tower, and asked for a higher floor. So the staff moved me to room 2187, which is amazing with stunning views of downtown SF. Extremely friendly, genuine staff, from the reception to the concierge. Great room service. I highly recommend this landmark hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, service, you feel you are in a hotel with a past but with modern facilities.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!
review.locationRemarks: You are at the heart of the city, so everything is nearby: cable cars, shops, Chinatown, Ferry building,

review.title: Grand hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Had a nice stay, room was comfortable and spacious and in a great location.
review.negativeRemarks: Buffet breakfast was a bit ordinary, and no free wi-fi a bit of a shock! even cheap hotels throughout the states offer free wifi. At $14.90 a day I di

review.title: The best location!
review.reviewText: I love this Westin, mainly because of its location. We stayed in the Tower Building--room was big for SF standards, awesome view of Union Square and the bay. Only thing missing was Bourbon Steakhouse (closed) which is one of the reasons we would even travel to SF.  Despite that missing element, we will definitely be back.
review.negativeRemarks: Front lobby seemed dark. Bathroom in room seemed like it hadn't been cleaned prior to check-in.
review.locationRemarks: Great location! Lots of things to do nearby.

review.title: Even better than we expected!
review.reviewText: We stayed here for a few nights to do college visits nearby with our daughter.  After reading the other reviews we booked in the Tower - it was quiet as could be.  The staff was absolutely great - they proactively gave us a discount for wifi based on starwoods membership.  Although expensive to park, the staff got the car in and out very quickly - we checked in on Thursday and out on Saturday - did not have any wait time in check-in line at all.  One of the staff associates, Yaser, was particularly awesome, providing great recommendations and helping us out overall during our stay.  The cable car stops right out front - the Celtics game was on in the lobby :) and a fun "clock" bar right downstairs - what more could you want?!
It's a great location. Some of the rooms are small but nice.  Staff was friendly at check in. Nice tasting room located in the lobby area. There is also a nice fitness center.

review.title: Nice area
review.reviewText: On second day room was not cleaned until 5pm! We needed to shower and get ready to dinner party we were going to. Had to wait for room service to bring us clean towels, soap and make bed.

review.title: Better than the reviews
review.reviewText: A great hotel in the middle of the city. Easy to find and easy to get to anywhere from it. Great bar downstairs.
The location was great! Close to so many things. Beautiful hotel with lovely rooms. Elevator system was so helpful-never had to wait. Felt the Oak Room was overpriced.

review.title: Comfortable Beds!
review.reviewText: My first time staying and will definitely do it again.

review.title: anniversary weekend
review.reviewText: We arrived to the hotel 10 minutes before our check in time. Our room was not ready, which was understandable. They told us they would call us when it was ready, but should not be long. However, they still took all my information and credit card, but since the room was not ready, I had to come back for the key. After waiting 20 minutes past check in time, they called me to let me know it was ready. The frustrating part was that there was a large line and they made me wait just to pick up my key. Well after waiting in line for 10 minutes, I got my keys and they did not work. I had to go back in line and let them know. Finally we got our keys and we went up to our room, which the elevators are tricky, since you cannot access them without your key working, so be advised. Our room was clean and small. The bed was not as comfortable as I expected for being the Westin, especially with the prices of room service, rooms, and parking.The room was also not as clean as expected. I found a small sewing needle in the carpet, which I almost stepped on. That is not okay. Overall, I would say, the  location is good, but I would not stay at the Westin just because of the outrageous prices and the service was not to my expectations.
review.negativeRemarks: Service
review.locationRemarks: You are at union square and in the middle of all shopping stores. It is a central location.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, friendly staff and good size room
review.reviewText: We stayed in one of the 400 sq ft rooms in the Tower Section.  It was a very comfortable room, spacious bathroom at a very good rate.  Stayed on the 8th floor, still some noise floats up from below, but hey, you have to remember you're staying in the heart of the city.  There was definitely a draft that you could feel through the windows so we kept the drapes closed early morning and evening.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of Union Square.  Close to all transportation, short walk from BART to our hotel.

review.title: Really busy location - on union square!
review.reviewText: Really nice hotel, just busy and pricy. Breakfast was not great, slow service, runny oatmeal,
The staff was amazing at check in. Gave us water bottles while we were in line. Rick helped us to our room. Gave us the scoop on what to do.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved the historical pictures in the lobby. We love historical hotels. Lobby was beautiful.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent. We Wales everywhere

review.title: Great Hotel and a great value. Staff was excellent
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the Westin for just one night on Saturday April 10, and we wished we had more time and had a longer stay. 

Our experience started well when the front desk upgraded our room without us asking and then when we got to our room we were very pleasantly surprised by how big it was. The bed was so comfortable and the pillows were quality. The bathroom was clean and well appointed and also pretty large for a hotel room. People that have stayed in hotels in London, Paris or NY would be so surprised by how much space they get for such a reasonable price. 

I want to call out the concierge service and specifically Jeff. I had been out walking around the neighborhood and stopped and bought a six pack of bottled beer to enjoy while watching my World Champion Warriors win yet another game and tie the record for all time NBA wins in a season. I assumed there would be a bottle opener in the room, but there was not. I quickly went to the concierge desk and asked if they had one so I wouldn't have to go searching the neighborhood and missing some of the Warriors game. Well, Jeff was manning the desk and he pulled his bottle opener off his personal key chain and gave it to me and said don't worry about bringing it back. 

Now that is going the extra mile to give great service and I thank Jeff! For this reason as much as any other, I would return to the Westin! Hiring great people to serve their guests is really important and they did a great job hiring Jeff. He was cheerful and he
review.positiveRemarks: Jeff at the Concierge Desk was awesome.  Front Desk staff were great too
review.negativeRemarks: I always wish things didn't cost so much... but that is life
review.locationRemarks: The obvious is Union Square, but the Westfield Mall is a cool and unique mall and only a couple blocks away

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: .   Room looks tired and dated.  Old fashion decor.  Pillows were flat.  Not my taste.  Building looks grand in the lobby, that was about it.
review.negativeRemarks: Fresh coat of paint, new rugs, fluffy pillows.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of shopping, restaurants, close to the Bart.

review.reviewText: hotel is a little outdated, other than that the experience was good. staff is excellent
review.negativeRemarks: add usb ports in rooms

review.title: Central hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Room was as advertised, clean, comfortable with a partial view of Union Square. Welcoming reception staff and bag storage facility. I would have preferred to have given up the view for a room which was not next to two lift shafts.
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proofing.
review.locationRemarks: Accessible to all major tourist attractions and conference hotels. Easily accessible by BART.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to Bart
review.reviewText: Our first night was wonderful, we had a room in the tower with an in credible view. We decided to stay another night but weren't able to keep the same room. The staff was very helpful and did all the moving for us. The second room was not as nice and more expensive.  Also there was lots of hair on the shower wall that housekeeping must have missed. Overall we would stay there again.

review.title: Great hotel all around
review.reviewText:
Great location 
Spacious rooms
Great staff
Clean
My kids loved this hotel 
Glass elevator is a treat, gives you a beautiful view of the city,
I recommend the delux rooms to get the best experience of this hotel

review.title: I will stay this hotel again
review.reviewText:
Hotel staffs are awesome.
Especially, front staffs and bell staffs.They helped me a lot.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower water was not hot enough...
review.locationRemarks: Next to Union square, nice location.

review.title: Central Location Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We had a great stay here.  We paid for a Grand Deluxe room in the Tower, worth every penny.  Great view of the Coit Tower from our room.  Plenty of places to eat nearby as the Westin is expensive for food.
review.negativeRemarks: Lift system is a little chaotic - Tower room lifts often blocked by chatting conventioneers
review.locationRemarks: Bang on Unio Square

review.title: Very good location, near trolly and bus pick up
review.reviewText: The hotel was at a great location on Union square. The trolly and buses picked up right outside the hotel and if we needed, there were always cabs available.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi was a little pricey in the room at $15/day
review.locationRemarks: Right off Union square, lots of great shopping and walking around. Chinatown was only a couple of blocks away.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Good stay, no place to eat breakfast in the hotel. Coffee was not complimentary.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
Not bad, room was small 
Staff could be more friendly

review.title: Excelent location and room size but
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel could not been better, and the room was over 70 square meters, nevertheless the bed matress was old and the doors conecting to other romos did not sealed very well, so you could hear conversations from next romos clearly.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs new matress and sealing of conecting doors to adjacent rooms

review.title: good weekend getaway
review.reviewText: Clean room, easy check in, everything was good. Excellent location. Room was very small but I hear this is the norm in San Fran. Would recommend and would return.

review.title: Last minute
review.reviewText: Great location and nice rooms. There was some construction being done in the lobby so it was a little confusing where to check in. But nothing major.

review.title: Nice hotel very centraly located to alot of things
review.reviewText: We went up for a short trip and booked it with Expedia. Very easy and everything went smooth from start to finish,
review.negativeRemarks: Not much.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is close by cabs will take you anywhere else

review.title: Awful dirty hotel with rude staff.
review.reviewText: I can't even begin to explain the horrid conditions I stayed in for 3 days.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is fun.

review.title: Nice location , that's the only extra point
review.reviewText: Not good restaurant, very expensive , and the rooms looks old and had a weird smell

review.title: central location with easy access to transport
review.reviewText: clean and friendly staff. I had excellent meals in the hotel .
review.negativeRemarks: Provide water in the fitness room. Provide free room wifi
review.locationRemarks: great location for shopping.

review.title: Nice hotel to the union square
Weekend get away
review.reviewText: Location, location, location. Union Sguare. Plus hotel and staff are awesome.

review.title: Nice hotel by union square.
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay, this hotel is great right by union square,?great location.

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The room was a little small, but other than that, the service was very good and the location was amazing.

review.title: Free pizza in the refrigerator when I checked in.
review.reviewText: Which was left by the last guest I guess. Pretty gross.

review.title: Top notch "grand" hotel but expensive
review.reviewText:
Stayed 4 nights with my wife and our 2 year old. Big comfy room with perfect views - we loved it.
Friendly staff and centrally located - everything was within walking distance. Easy to hop on a train from the airport and take it right to the hotel which is literally 2 mins away from the station. We will stay with them again!
review.negativeRemarks: reduce room service prices
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located by the shopping, restaurants, a local brewery, the street car and the train station (for the airport)

review.title: Great location for what I wanted to do
review.reviewText: Concierge was very helpful.    Lobby is beautiful.   The bed was heavenly.
review.negativeRemarks: AM wait staff in Oak Room had loud voices.  They called to me from 10 feet away to ask if I wanted coffee.   When they talked to anyone at any table
review.locationRemarks: Union Square.  What more can I say

review.title: Good location, needs refurbishment
review.reviewText: Hotel needs major refurbishment. Rooms are large but carpets are stained and worn and bathrooms are old.
Excellent room and location for price.  Would definitely stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location - shopping, local transportation, great restaurants

review.title: Old and dated.
review.reviewText: Hotel has character. However it is old and dated. Hallways and guest rooms need a facelift.

review.title: Wonderful location.  The staff was very pleasant.
review.reviewText: The hotel was wonderful, beautiful and charming, right on Union Square.  You could not ask for a better location.  Would definitely stay there and recommend it to friends.  The only problem we had was OUR NEIGHBORS:(  We went away to celebrate the long Valentine's/Presidents Day weekend.  The first night we were next to a lady with a crying baby and a toddler who never slept.  We were moved to another room and unfortunately there was an extremely loud couple who stayed up late with the TV blasting and woke up before 7 a.m. and were loud again. Can't blame the hotel for the neighbors, just a very unfortunate experience for us.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the staff and the old charm
review.negativeRemarks: Have sections of hotel where people agree to be respectful of their neighbors and no children are allowed.

review.reviewText: stayed for 2 nites, wonderful. We stayed in the higher building so the city view is nice.

review.title: Not all Westins are created equal
review.reviewText:
This hotel is beautiful. However, the service is awful. When I arrived there were at least 6 people waiting to check in and only 2 staff. I ordered room service after a long day of travel. It took well over 45 minutes to arrive and it was awful. I chalked it up to maybe it was due to the late hour. I ordered breakfast the next morning. Was told it would arrive in 25 minutes, but I was still waiting after an hour. It finally arrived and again was awful. 

On the bright side, my room was clean and comfortable. The hotel is very pretty, but don't expect service to keep up with the appearance.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in an excellent location for anyone who wants to go shopping and even walk to the ferry building. We were promised a room with the Cityview,  our view was of the building next-door.  The early check-in (10 AM) made up for the lack of our view.  My complaint is that you could hear our neighbors above us. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and would strongly recommend it primarily because of its location.
review.positiveRemarks: First and foremost the location. Secondly,  The heavenly bed it is large and very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The only thing that I found was lacking was an area where you could sit and relax without having to feel like you have to order a drink or snack.
review.locationRemarks: Located near some of the best stores San Francisco has to offer; if the purpose of your trip is shopping I would strongly recommend this hotel

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: I was in the "new tower" it's old drafty and dirty for the money you spend to stay here I would expect atleast a clean comfortable room which you won't find here. Location is awesome staff were amazing.
As always a great stay. This is always our favorite place to stay while in the city.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, great location.
review.reviewText:
This trip was just a Saturday night.
Have stayed here many times, great location, beautiful old hotel, like the newer tower rooms. Right in the center of everything.
Like the restaurants and bars.

review.title: Lovely hotel on Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel and rooms are lovely and very well kept.  Getting to and from places on Union Square is easy and there are great restaurants and shopping near by.  The only problem I have is the prices in their restaurants and bars.  Yes, it's San Francisco and yes, it's a Westin, but it's TOO much.  We went to the bar, ordered a glass of house wine and a Grey Goose martini.  After having to get a waitresses attention (she was talking with her friends at the bar) we paid $32 before tip.  That's too much for a 10 minute experience.  The restaurant had similar prices so we went 2 blocks away (each night we stayed) and had amazing dinners and wine for about 2/3 the price.  If money is no object to you though, I'd highly recommend the Westin St. Francis.  People are friendly and the atmosphere is beautiful.

review.title: Perfect Location & awesome breakfast
review.reviewText: The hotel has a perfect location, just 3 blocks away from market street, you have access to transport, shopping and transportation easily. The hotel lobby facilities are very nice but the rooms are just plain and not in sync with the lobby presence, rooms are simple and kind of ugly and a little dirty.

review.title: Good location of hotel but avoid the old tower
review.reviewText: Nice location but stayed in the old tower. Room given was very noisy. Requested a change and was given an interior room. Older room and quite cramped. The in-house dining waiter couldnt fit the tray past the bed to the table area where i was seated. But the food was good
review.negativeRemarks: upgrade the rooms

review.title: Heart of shopping district
review.reviewText: lots of good shopping nearby. not so many restaurants. housekeeping was a bit slow on their feet and did not clean our room for two days! hotel is nice, food quality was also not bad. if housekeeping improves then it's a pretty good hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: housekeeping!

review.reviewText: Our room sounded like it was located right above a kitchen. At four AM every morning we were woken up by loud banging and yelling. The rooms were pretty disappointing. Pretty much a plain white room. No decor.

review.title: Class and comfort
review.reviewText:
Cannot fault the Westin St. Francis - it was superb.  There was a big conference on during our stay and check-in was still a breeze.  The place is immaculate and very impressive.  We had a room on the 22nd floor of the tower and it was newly renovated and very generous in size - as in you actually need to take a short walk to get to your bathroom from the room's living area.  The bed was luxurious, the view from the tower was great and while we didn't dine in the hotel, the steak restaurant nonetheless looks mouth-watering.  In addition, the location of the hotel with regards to downtown and access to shopping and transport cannot be topped.  

It was a first rate experience but remember, you also need to pay first rate prices.  In this case though, there was no regret on our part in paying a premium to stay at this fantastic hotel.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Overall good experience.  Can't ask for a better location.  Had to wait a long line to get the room but they offered bottled water as we waited.  Nice gesture.  The room they gave us was very small but that's expected in SF.  Unfortunately, our view was of a rooftop so we just kept the curtains closed.  Nothing fancy in the room but it was comfy and clean. Staff was great.  Hotel doesn't really have that SF charm but would stay again.

review.title: Nice Hotel, terrible attention at the restaurant
review.reviewText:
It is a beautiful building in front of Civic Center, I went with my whole family to spend the Christmas holidays. 
I don't have any complains about the front desk, or the hotel staff in general. However we did spend a terrible experience when trying to eat at the hotel restaurant Bourbon Steak, the hostess was super rude, when we asked for a table for 8 he just said he didn't have any available table for such a large party, then we asked for 2 tables of 4, we didn't care if we were dining together, he also said no, I even asked for a table just for 1 person to see what will be his answer and he still said no, with no further explanation when we clearly could see that the restaurant was half empty. I asked him if there was a dress code and he just said no and that was it, we couldn't eat at our hotel restaurant. We were a party of 8 people flying from Mexico to spend 5 nights at San Francisco, I would think that we can afford dinning in there. When we walk off there, we could see that he was admitting other people with no reservations, I think he meant "NO LATINOS".
review.positiveRemarks: It is perfectly near of several attractions, you can either go shopping to all the magnificent shops around the hotel, or take the Big bus from there.

review.title: Expensive hotel in the heart of SF
review.reviewText: Clean, beautiful lobby. Elevators were safe. Rooms were tiny with little upgrading. Felt like I was staying in a Victorian Era room. Valet parking was convenient but took too much time to return car. Staff was polite.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Must be good on the higher floor but unfortunately not on the 3rd floor. It was noisy and very disturbing, besides the uncomfortable size that felt like I was against the wall.

review.title: Second stay
review.reviewText: Wanted a low floor and got it with a warning about noise on New Year's Eve. Quite happy to accept this and noise was minimal anyway. Initial room smelt of smoke. Put into another (better) room with no quibble at all.
review.negativeRemarks: Allowing booked taxis / shuttles to collect at door rather than in the street.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic location - convenient for everything, especially shops.

review.reviewText: Nice hotel,good location,center of city ...............................
Old run down, does not feel like a Westin.  Noisy.

review.title: Won't stay again
review.reviewText: I have gone to the WSF for 19 years and it has routinely disappointed and deteriorated gradually in terms of service, communication, ability to honor a reservation etc over time. This was my last visit to this location. Check in is at 3pm and we did not have a room until 5:20pm. We were not offered any compensation for our loss of time other than a free bottle of water. Our plans were ruined / altered for the holiday weekend as a result. It boggles my mind how hotel staff and especially management could allow a guest who is paying for the grand deluxe room to be delayed over 2 hours in their room and not offer some sort of accommodation other than water. I am not name calling when I say this, but the service is simply "classless."

review.title: Great place, but needs a little update.
review.reviewText: The hotel staff is excellent. Would stay again. Location is central to everything.

review.title: Excellent customer service
review.reviewText:
One of the best places to stay in town. Excellent customer service and a very nice upscale hotel. It is  right next to union square. 
But, be aware, it is a very busy and crowded area.

review.title: Hotel was average
review.reviewText: The hotel has a nice lobby, restaurants, bars, and is close to shopping and tourist attractions. The staff/customer service was just okay. The parking is ridiculously expensive. The rooms are tiny, reminded me of NYC. The bed was comfortable.
Christmas play/holiday stay with daughter and granddaughters!  Excellent time!
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Wonderful, classic and in the middle of Union Square!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: In general the hotel is excellent, but it has one important inconvenience: we did not expect that access to internet is not free, it's $14.95 a day
review.negativeRemarks: See above
review.locationRemarks: The location is ideal

review.title: Beautiful over the holidays
review.reviewText: Excellent service for a busy time of year. If you stay in the Landmark section be prepared for very old rooms, though they have character and decorated tastefully. We paid for several hotel rooms for family due to our wedding. The Queen room in Landmark section is quite small. King much larger room. The view was of a brick wall which wasn't so good. The rooms near the street hear noise from live music in Union Square, if you go to bed before midnight you hear it. light from the hallway comes in through the doors. Overall we had a wonderful time!

review.title: Classic hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Great classic hotel, old world charm, right in the heart of union square, very friendly and helpful staff, nice large clean rooms, will definitely be back, I recommend highly

review.title: Very convenient and a very accommodating staff
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely helpful in all ways. We do have a billing issue that has not been resolved yet.
review.locationRemarks: Cable car is right in front and a host of restaurants are nearby.

review.title: Beautiful view
review.reviewText: I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family.will comeback soon

review.title: Packed with tourists
review.reviewText: This hotel used to be lovely, now it is under staffed, and over booked. Check in/out will take 40 minutes minimum, and the valet is so backed up they give out beepers and say 15 minutes minimum before your car is ready. It has a nice location in theory but the amount of people they cram in here makes any advantage moot. Don't stay here even at what seems like a good price. The rooms are tiny and on top of each other. Stay outside the union Square area or another hotel.
Check in took 30 minutes of waiting in line, didn't get that two double beds I asked for several weeks before, at 4 pm the room was not ready and the concierge was not helpful.
Everything was very nice.  The toilets were very industrial in the rooms.  Very unapprsling

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Saw mold in the bathroom and sheets had blood on them :(

review.title: The only good thing about this hotel is its locati
review.reviewText: Why do I have to write here?Why do I have to write here?Why do I have to write here?Why do I have to write here?Why do I have to write here?Why do I have to write here?

review.title: Historic Hotel, crowed during holidays
review.reviewText:
Hotel was right on Union Square. Location was convenient to Powell BART, Chinatown, waterfront and other spots. Because of Christmas holiday, there were way too many people in the hotel lobby, at Union Square, and nearby.

Room was nicely furnished, although closet door would hit the night stand. King size bed was comfy. Rain shower head was really nice.

My son and I liked the fitness room. We did not eat at the hotel, as there were many places to eat nearby.

Reading about the history of the hotel was fun -- lots of old photos and display cases.

review.title: Expedia confirmed a view of Union Square - NOT
review.reviewText: Although I was promised a view of Union Square while booking, it did not happen and all rooms were sold out when I arrived.  I was extremely disappointed and likely will not book on Expedia again.  It was very expensive accommodations for a room which was not what I specifically requested.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Check in was a disaster. Worst customer service. The guy could barely look up and didn't smile, greet me or offer anything of any value. I wanted to upgrade my room and he said that wasn't in my reservation. Completely clueless. Then stuck us by 3 elevators and gave us a King for 4 people "because that's what my reservation said." Never again will I stay at the Westin. Totally spoiled what was supposed to be a special Xmas trip. Better off at the Marriott. This place is also a zoo and it took 30 mins to get the car, 40 to get luggage checked and the housekeeping was rude. This hotel needs an overhaul.

review.title: Disappointing for Westin standards
review.reviewText: Checking in with more than five computer terminals, there was only one staff checking in people as a result the line was unforgivingly long and wait was long. Efficiency is not the norm here as we have to wait at the concierge in line again just to ask for umbrella. The lady that check us in was very friendly and helpful but she was all alone to check in every body . Beautiful hotel and location was perfect and historic building too. Just understaffed.

review.title: Nice Hotel Prime Location
review.reviewText: Hotel was beautiful and staff was  friendly upon arrival.   I was annoyed that I reserved a room with double beds and it was unavailable. The hotel offered to give me a bigger suite with a king bed and rollaway bed instead which was ok but the bigger suite was bigger because it was wheelchair accessible and I didn't get the tub I was looking forward too.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel and friendly staff. The staff was very friendly. The hotel offers bars and coffee shops. The rooms were clean and had a nice view. I definetly come back.

review.title: Historic Hotel in The Center of Everything
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, great staff, would highly recommend.  It is very touristy, however, so it can be crowded.

review.title: So close to everything
review.reviewText: Awesome experience and so festive this time of year

photos.caption: Union Square in front of hotel
TV, Coffee, Mini-bar in hotel room

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location.  Walking distance to almost everything.  The hotel is definitely more upscale than others that I have paid more for in the Downtown / Union Square area.  I am a Starwood preferred guest and we got our room upgraded with free internet.  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Francisco.

review.title: Good Location Crumbling Grandeur
review.reviewText: Location and staff excellent. However the decor and and cleanliness of the hallways is not acceptable. The halls look seedy and poorly maintained. There are dirty sports near the doors to service areas and the furniture has not been changed since the '60's. Carpet badly in need of upgrading. Presents a seedy and declining environment.
review.negativeRemarks: Decor and cleanliness of hallways
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic Union Square location

review.reviewText: Excellent trip. Hotel is in a great location.  Stayed in the older section of the hotel. Rooms were nice but THD bathrooms are small.

review.title: Nice historic hotel on Union Sq.
review.reviewText: The hotel is historic, very nice, and located next to the vibrant Union Square. Shopping, entertainment and sightseeing options are all close by. I was disappointed with my room which was quite small and had very poor bed that sagged in the center.
review.negativeRemarks: Better bed and furnishing. I had the impression I was in room and a wing of the hotel overdue for renovation.
review.locationRemarks: Location is excellent.

review.title: Stay away from the older section
review.reviewText:
We only stayed one night, and booked through Expedia, which always has me questioning whether or not that relegates you to the less-than-worthy in aristocratic hotels like the St. Francis.

In any case, we were given a room in the older part of the hotel. While it retains the charm of eras gone by, it also presents the standards of an older era. The room was very small. The view was out into an alley and another wall of the hotel. The windows didn't open, the room was a bit musty, and there was no fan in the also-small bathroom, which wasn't far from the bed.

Had we been staying more than one night, we would have requested to move to a better room. So be prepared. . .
review.negativeRemarks: Read above
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location, right on Union Square.

review.title: Holiday party
review.reviewText: The service was excellent from check-in to check-out. The rooms were clean and the location was in perfect.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the Festive decorations.
review.negativeRemarks: na
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is directly across the street and is decorated for Christmas.

review.title: Very small room, overpriced, nickel and dime fees.
review.reviewText:
Great location for shopping and restaurants. 

Very small room and bathroom. Bathroom did not have an exhaust fan, the mini fridge was stocked full with their overpriced beverages so you cannot put any food or personal beverages in it. 

Wifi is NOT free - they charge $14.95 per two days. If you are going to charge 4 - 5 star level prices, at least give your customers basic amenities. 

My next visit to SF I will be staying elsewhere - and in this price range, I will have many options.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location for shopping and restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: Complimentary Wifi - install a fan in the small/cramped bathroom(s). Provide refrigerator space for food leftovers or guest beverages.
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently located next to Union Square. Easy access for shopping, food, and transportation.

review.title: uncomfortable bed
review.reviewText: The hotel and staff are amazing, great service and attitude, but the bed was uncomfortable so not great sleep!

review.title: A fantastic location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We wanted a hotel in a central location and could not have chosen better than the Westin St Francis over the holiday period in November. There was a real buzz about the hotel with special events for Thanksgiving and Christmas.  Our rooms were quiet and the famous beds exceptionally comfortable. The hotel is close to shops, cafes for breakfast, cable cars and the red bus tours. The staff were always helpful and interested in making our holiday a success.  We liked the option of having the rooms made up every third day and the vouchers we wer given as a result.
review.positiveRemarks: Having a such comfortable base in the centre of the city.
review.negativeRemarks:
I would have liked a bedside light in my room. My daughter had 2!
The restaurant was OK but the decor a bit dated given standards overall
review.locationRemarks: ride the cable cars and the street cars which will get you to most places in the city.

review.title: CENTRALLY LOCATED IN DOWNTOWN SAN FRANCISCO
review.reviewText: My wife and I travelled again to San Francisco and chose the Westin St. Francis because of excellent service and prime location next to Union Square.  As usual, the service and amenities were first rate!  The only consideration that I would pause, was the Oak Room restaurant was closed for breakfast and lunch.  This was unusual because we have attended the hotel with this restaurant open for B, L, and D.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location!  Service and ambiance.
review.negativeRemarks: Open the Oak Room for all meals.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, shopping, Cable Cars, SF Opera, SF Symphony, Musical Theatre, and many, many restaurants!

review.title: Style and location, perfect.
review.reviewText: We go every year Christmas shopping in San Francisco and always stay at the St. Francis.  It is a classic and has the best location in the city.

review.title: Kings and Queens
review.reviewText: Our Westin St Francis experience completely exceeded our expectations. We plan to return again very soon. The facilities are first class and the staff treated us like Kings and Queens!

review.title: Gd location 4 our Christmas party
review.reviewText: It was just nice 2 be close 2 the store's. I mean shopping.

review.title: Staff doesn't care, dated hotel, needs help!
review.reviewText: Good luck having a normal experience here. If your room key works after about 2 hrs of back and forth with new keys because the staff doesn't care enough to come try with you, you'll enjoy the 100kb/s BLAZING fast internet (and yes, that is meant to be very sarcastic...it's slow as heck). If you've enjoyed that, you'll enjoy the hair and backup that appears in your tub and sink when you go to take a shower the next morning. If you haven't had enough fun yet, when you decide to come back for your second night, you may enjoy the luxury of being locked out of your room for a second night in a row. You come down to the lobby and get to wait another 30 minutes in line to get it fixed because you aren't a premiere member of the hotel; on top of that, the staff informs you of this when you attempt to bypass the 'standard line' and send you to the "normal person" line instead of addressing the issue. You'll be happily escorted by the manager to your room and given a coupon worth a free breakfast. Sure, I got an upgraded room but the wallpaper was falling off, the toilet seat was about to fall off, and the room in general hadn't had a deep clean in a long time. I'm sure that this is all probably just an anomaly but the hotel staff REALLY didn't care aside from one of the bellhops who was kind enough to find the hotel manager for me because the front-desk staff wouldn't help me anymore. I will never be back and wouldn't recommend this hotel to anybody to ever stay at.
review.positiveRemarks: The only good thing about this hotel is its' proximity to Union Square and the amenities of San Francisco. The lobby is beautiful.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff's caring could really use some improvement. Attention to details in rooms could be improved as well.
review.locationRemarks: There are a ton of things to do nearby, Union Square is a fantastic location.

review.title: Too crowded
review.reviewText: Honestly, it's a nice, clean hotel but there's no mini bar, the bathroom had very poor lighting, and there's no breakfast or even continental-type food available (and for this price they should provide some kind of food). It's right in the heart of Union Square, which is nice, but crowded. You can barely walk through their foyer. I expected a bit more for the price.

review.title: The hotel is very old and it shows.
review.reviewText: The rooms are good in terms of size but they look very old.  I was very disappointed because we were given an inside room (I think most of the rooms are inside) and you look at a brick wall that makes the room dark, specious but dark.  I asked for a change, which they granted but no much improvement.

review.title: Honeymoon
review.reviewText:
Called the hotel a week prior to our arrival, spoke to the front desk and mention this was our Honeymoon, so if there were any conciderations that could be offered, this would be most appreciated! Btw, prepaid our hotel stay of 5 Nights some 8 weeks prior. 

Long story short. Our room, on the 22 floor was ok, not a view of the square as had been mentioned. Nothing special at all!! Btw. Wasn't looking for a gift basket with fresh flowers. Champaign, strawberries and chocolates, a simple card acknowledging our honeymoon would have been nice!

Same goes for the concierge, prearranged a few special dinners with honeymoon in mind!! Once again the resturants were told nothing of the sort so I handled it myself with our captain!

A bit disappointed to say the least.

review.title: Awesome!
review.reviewText: My  wife and I had a blast. Hotel was clean and very romantic for the two of us.

review.title: Thanksgiving Stay
review.reviewText: Great location. Great views from higher floors. Front desk was able to check us in early which was really helpful as we were traveling from out of town. Directly in front of the hotel is union Square. Only bummer was $60 parking fee and no bar access until 4:00 PM.

review.title: Mad dash to get a passport!
review.reviewText: We only had 4 days to get a passport to leave the country.  I hadn't realized that my passport had expired.  There was an office in downtown San Francisco, so we booked a room at the Westin, having stayed there before and liked it very much.  This trip, we had a tower room on one of the top floors with a terrific view.  The room was charming and very clean with super comfortable beds!  I wish we could have stayed another night!!
review.positiveRemarks: The great customer service, beautiful rooms and wonderful beds!!!
review.negativeRemarks: I can't think of anything!
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is right in the middle of Union Square with lots of shopping.  The cable cars go right by the hotel.  It's a great central location.

review.title: It was really nice, this hotel location is a plus
review.reviewText: Awesome hotel, the staff very knowledgeable and friendly. Definitely a come back to this hotel.

review.title: Nice Hotel, Expensive WiFi/Breakfast
review.reviewText:
The hotel is right in the middle of Union Square which is fantastic. The staff and room were both great.

The only complaint I have is that 2 and a half days of wireless internet and one breakfast cost me $118. The breakfast was a nice buffet, but not worth the $32 per person that was charged.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location. Great staff. Clean room.
review.negativeRemarks: Wireless internet price lowered. Breakfast buffet price lowered.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of Union Square. A very busy part of town but plenty of shopping and restaurants are nearby. Easy to use the public transportation

review.reviewText: A great central location to stay.  The hotel has old world charm with modern ameneties

review.title: Close to holiday shopping
review.reviewText: We reserved the new building, two queens.  Instead we got the old hotel side, the rooms are musky.  We could hear every noise outside, and the rooms next to us, a woman had a loud conversation at 6am, we weren't able to sleep.  The mattresses were very uncomfortable. The lobby, the restaurants were excellent, but the hotel accommodations were terrible, not what we expected.

review.title: Holiday Fun
review.reviewText: We have stayed at the St Francis in the past & like its close proximity to Union Square, upscale shopping & fine dining.  It is especially festive during the holidays.  We always have a commitment to return home but maybe in the future will get to see the lighting of the Christmas tree in the Square. Love the history of the hotel.

review.title: Holliday Get Away
review.reviewText:
It was a Thanksgiving and a Birthday Celebration with our son and daughter-in-law and couldn't have been more perfect!
We even received an upgrade to a corner room suite.  What a glorious surprise.  Thank you.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was perfect and we had a lovely view of the city.
review.negativeRemarks: A candy mint on the pillow would have been super!
review.locationRemarks: We enjoyed Christmas shopping in Union Square and it really gave us the Christmas Spirit!

review.title: Great location, bad shower
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice and right on union square. However, the shower had low pressure and wasn't that warm. The room and bed was comfortable though.

review.title: Great helpful staff and very well located
review.reviewText: Great staff and excellent location in the centre of San Fran. Definitely stay there again.

review.title: Thanksgiving at Union square
review.reviewText:
The best location in San Francisco. Quality of facility and staff is excellent. Simply love to be located across from 
Union Square and all of the shopping options.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: best location in SF. Trolley cars to wharf, shopping all around you.

review.reviewText:
Nice place to be around the holidays
Great location atUnion Square

review.title: Pleasant
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time and a relaxing stay. In room dinning was quit pricey, but good food. We will stay there again sometime.
Great location, beautiful hotel and very clean. Good clock bar for happy hour.
very central location, with view over Union Square. Clean. Friendly staff.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location.
review.reviewText: The staff and service were wonderful and the ambiance too.  I was disappointed that the room had a stall shower with no bath tub, and the shower actually had hair on the wall. Surprising, considering that the rest of the room seemed quite clean.  We dined at  Bourbon Steak, the food and service were excellent, but bring a full wallet.
review.positiveRemarks: The service and courtesy of the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Nice sized room with nice sized bathroom, so why no tub?
review.locationRemarks: Right on union square, so great location for shopping and experiencing the Heart of San Francisco...Pun intended.

review.reviewText: I arrived early no room which I understand but clerk offered to call when room was ready. No call. Room I had in serious need of updating. So not worth the price.

review.title: Perfect, central and safe location.
review.reviewText: Beautiful, large room with stunning decor.  We moved to this hotel from another hotel (stupidly booked in the dodgy Tenderloin district) and we pleasantly surprised to have an 830am check in when we were only planning on leaving our bags at the hotel until their advertised 3pm check in.  Can't recommended this hotel highly enough.

review.title: Heart of Union Square.
review.reviewText:
If you'd like a hotel near shopping, restaurants , this is the hotel for you. 
The hotel also has several restaurants: Michel Mina, Oak Room.
review.negativeRemarks: Refrigerator without mini bar.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, shopping, shopping. Close to some restaurants.

review.reviewText: We only stayed one night and really were not in the hotel that much. But I would stay again.

review.title: Very nice hotel close to centre of Shopping
review.reviewText: location is excellent, very clean and comfortable.
Very good location, but totally outdated hotel. No closet, no cabinet, not even a luggage caddy in the room. Friendly staff, though.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent experience. It was my birthday and they sent me a bottle of champagne and chocolates to my room as a gift

review.title: Nice hotel in central location
review.reviewText: Staff were extremely helpful at the Westin St Francisco. We had beautiful weather during our 5 days in November. covered many miles on foot which is the best way to see close up. The municipal transport system is fantastic and an eight day pass for $35 is worth every centre. Alcatraz is a must see.

review.title: No scooter accessibility.
review.reviewText: The hotel did not have walk in shower or access for scooter in the rooms.

review.title: Great location overlooking Union Square
review.reviewText: My wife and I travelled there for our anniversary. We were in a great room overlooking Union Square yet it was still quiet from the traffic. The room was beautiful, clean and comfortable. The staff was very pleasant and offered great suggestions for restaurants as well as helping us arrange for our early flight home. We were within walking distance (that's a relative term..lots of hills wherever you go but we work out regularly) but there was a trolley car stop right outside the door. Great places to eat all around us.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything. It was beautiful. The place was spotless. The staff (everybody) was nice and pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing. Unless you count wifi. Not having to pay for that would have been nice.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square has lots of shopping nearby as well as restaurants for all price ranges. You're within a decent walk of  great local places to eat too.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: The valet parking is outrageous !!! The temperature in the room was bad and we had a contant leak noise in shower. The hotel was nice in some areas but I would not stay again.

review.title: This hotel was extremely nice.
review.reviewText: I love this hotel. It was beautiful inside and out, and very elegant. It was right in the center of union square with a great view and the service was just amazing. I would most definitely go back.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, awesome location.
review.reviewText: Never disappointed when we stay here. Dinner at Bourbon Steak House was amazing

review.title: Excellent spot by Union Sq
review.reviewText: Just what we expected, stayed in the Tower building on one of the high levels (30th) floor.

review.title: Poor technological Infrastructure
review.reviewText: Wifi is so bad that you cannot work. Even the TV reboots, I guess it too is streamed. Called their helpdesk, no response. The hotel is showing its age. Not recommended for business travellers. Room service is very limited, though delivery charges is only $5. I am a Gold SPG member, have stayed in much better Westins
review.positiveRemarks: Location is very nice. In the heart of Union Square
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi and TV. There are better options in Union Square
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is as central as it gets. Powell Street has the cable car, great shopping and restaurants. Lots of panhandlers, so beware

review.title: Not very satisfied
review.reviewText: Not very satisfied with the hotel stay. Not up to the standard of a Westin Hotel

review.title: perfect location!
