review.reviewText: One of the best hotels to stay in, in San Francisco. Location is everything..Parking is not a problem because of the underground parking structure in union square which is right in front of the hotel. if you just leave your car there..it's so easy to find public transportation close to the hotel.

review.title: Excellent location!
review.reviewText: This hotel was great.  Walking distance to everything.  We had a blast in SF and would definitely stay at the Westin again!

review.title: Historic Union Square Icon
review.reviewText: Excellent staff, nice room, great location. Did get some street noise - not unexpected due to city center location. Everything shopping and food related is within walking or Powell Ave. BART station distance. UBER and Lyft service in less than 5 minutes plus taxis lined up outside at all hours.
review.positiveRemarks: Facilities - old school luxury. Staff - old school service.
review.negativeRemarks: Not sure if anything can be done for the general cleanliness of the Union Square proximity - more of a city problem I gather.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square shopping + Mall 4 blocks away w/ great food court (real churrascaria!). Walgreens 1 block away has fresh food and best souvenir prices.

review.title: Great Location !!!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at The Westin St. Francis very much. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted and shown how to get to our room. It was our anniversary and they sent up a bottle of Champagne & chocolate covered strawberries which was the icing on the cake on top of our gorgeous view !!! the room was very clean & spacious with very comfortable beds. The only complaints I have is that there is no bottled water in the room so we had to drink tap water until we left to pick some up from the Walgreens down the street. Also the wifi is an absolute nightmare trying to connect that was very frustrating for my husband. They charge 14.95 a day I believe ? I'm sure if you ask them to throw it in upon check out they won't charge we asked and they gave it to us free which honestly they should automatically include . The location is great close to everything shops , dining , entertainment you name it. It was a great stay if we ever return to San Fransisco we would stay here for sure.

review.title: heart of union square
review.reviewText:
stayed here the same weekend as the women's marathon, so it was crowded.  something happened with our room availability so we were offered the Chairman's Suite for 1 night, which was on the 3rd floor in the Landmark.  this place was huge!  it was large enough to probably sleep 15 people if it was allowed!  the suite had a dining room, kitchen, sitting room, and a huge living room.  there was no bedroom, but they rolled in two beds for me and my friend.  the next day, they moved us to a room in the Tower on the 20th floor.  room was also clean and had a great view of Coit Tower.  
tried to use the business center to print football tickets.  however, I was put off by the $7.95 charge for 15 mins of Internet, plus $1 for each page of printing.  WiFi was available but they charged $14.95 per day.  in a place like this, I would expect complimentary access.  
parking was expensive too.  we parked in their garage for 1 night.  the next night, we moved our car to a cheaper garage 1/2 the price about a block down the street.  the hotel had shops and a restaurant.  
it's literally in Union Square so it's convenient and lively.  overall, the stay was great.  April from the front desk was very helpful and was extremely friendly!

review.title: Great location On union square
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel!  Up cycled old hotel, so cute!  Restaurants, shopping, bars all right there within walking distance!  Tour busses & trolley car right there too. Clean!  A bit noisy at night if your a lite sleeper... I liked hearing the street noise.  I thought it was a bit over priced at $179 a night.  I would stay here again
review.negativeRemarks: A bit over priced
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, bars, restaurants, transportation close

review.reviewText:
Front savice very slow and No good.
We couldn't crack in 7pm.
Not clean room.

review.title: Getaway in the heart of the city!
review.reviewText: This is my second time staying here and I plan on coming back again! Luxury hotel right on Union Square! The Glass Elevator in the Tower Building is a must!

review.title: Fantastic location! Super close to shopping
review.reviewText: My only complaint is the parking fee. We rented a car and it cost us $60 per night to park it at the hotel. This seems pretty steep. Also, it took the valet workers at least 20 min each time to bring us our car

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel on the heart of San Francisco. Room service was excellent.

review.title: Great anniversary weekend. Great staff.
review.reviewText: One of numerous visits to SF, but first time at the Westin. The lady that checked us in was very on top of things given that we had ended up booking two reservations back to back in order to add an extra night. She made sure we didn't have to switch rooms and that our experience would be unaffected and seamless from a billing perspective. The staff efficiently resolved a strange situation at the hotel lounge where for some reason the servers were poorly attentive and did not want to accommodate us charging the bar tab to our room.

review.title: Central location
review.reviewText:
Our flight from Vancouver got into San Francisco at 0815k. We were at the hotel by 0930k hoping for an early check in. The four of us dropped off our bags and went for breakfast.
The hotel called and both rooms were ready in an hour....
review.positiveRemarks: A little more upscale than others we've stayed at in this area.
review.negativeRemarks: Take the minibar out of the room and put in a fridge.
review.locationRemarks: This is our seventh trip to the Bay in recent years and the hub is Union Square.

review.title: Good hotel. Great location!
review.reviewText: Room was small. No view. Gym was excellent. Location is outstanding. On union square. 3 blocks from BART(subway) station. Check in took a long time. Keys to the room didn't work and I had to wait in line again to get new keys. Staff apologized. I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Hotel right in the middle
review.reviewText: They charge you extra for the wifi even if you pay mor than a thousand bucks a weekend, thats really the worst. very old condition you could expect way more than that for that much money

review.title: Nice Pit Stop on the Way to Napa
review.reviewText: I was excited to stay in this well located hotel on my way to wine country for a business meeting. I was disappointed in the decor and felt that it needed freshening. While the rooms were nice, they also were kind of dull. The beds were great and the rooms were quiet so we slept like rocks. I like old hotels but I was most disappointed in the bar and restaurant amenities. The Old Clock Bar was dark and didn't have any charm. The Bourbon Steak House didn't appeal to me and the Oak Room while nice inside didn't compel me to eat there. I think what I missed most was a bar that was lively and relatively bright maybe with some entertainment. I also had issue with the elevators in that you had to enter the floor you wanted to go to on a low mounted keypad and they stick your card key in a narrow slot in about 2 seconds or you couldn't get to your floor. Given the darkness and in a crowd it very difficult. It takes some getting used to.
review.negativeRemarks: Update the decor and enlarge, and update the Old Clock Bar.
review.locationRemarks: The location for shopping, eating and sight seeing was great.

review.title: Great view of Union Square.
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel, great location.  Steakhouse was expensive and disappointing. Room was large with a great view. Staff all very helpful and courteous.

review.title: Nice hotel, very good location
review.reviewText: we went into the city for just a little weekend get away, hotel was perfectly located for what we wanted to do, Union square, China town, Giants game and plenty of good eating spots around
review.negativeRemarks: none, very pleasant staff, even though we don't typically have much contact with hotel staff
review.locationRemarks: plenty of shopping, resturants etc, within walking distance. Johnny Foleys dueling piano bar was a real fun experiance.

review.title: Location n views
review.reviewText: Stayed in the starwood preffered floor.. 27.. The views are beautiful very romantic at night. You can see the golden gate and all bay. I reccomend high high floor. Walking distance to everything. Eat at Bourbon Steak. Lobby bar good. Definately coming back.

review.title: Grand hotel in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The Westin, St Francis is a grand old hotel in the heart of San Francisco, set on the famous Union Square. In terms of location - there probably isn't a better spot in the whole City.
The check in staff and concierge desk staff were superb - both friendly and helpful - as were the valet parking team and luggage storage staff. 10/10 for them. 
The rooms are a bit underwhelming in terms of decor - but the beds were large and fantastically comfy. 

Apart from a small gripe about being woken up every morning by room service, I really enjoyed this hotel. It isn't as 'groovy' or 'trendy' as the boutique hotels - but San Francisco is a City for exploring - and I didn't really spend that much time using the hotels amenities. The buffet breakfast was perfectly adequate but we chose to eat out in the evenings, so can't comment on the in-house restaurant. But is was full every evening - so I guess it was OK.

I was travelling with my adult kids, aged 20 and 23 - and we had a blast. I'd stay again.
review.positiveRemarks:
Location, location, location.
Union Square outside the front door, with all the main stores within easy reach on foot.
review.negativeRemarks: Room service. Every night I hung the 'do-not-disturb' message on the door - and every morning room service came in and woke us up. Bit disappointing.
review.locationRemarks: All the big retail stores. The Cheesecake Factory in Macy's. The famous SF cable Cars. All within walking distance of the hotel's front door

review.title: Right across from Union Square and super shopping
review.reviewText: I was there for a wedding and everywhere I needed to go was within walking distance.  I spent a whole day at Macys and found a better outfit for the wedding than the one I brought with me.
review.positiveRemarks: The location couldn't be better!  And the hotel is lovely, old school.  The room was small (especially the bathroom) but very comfortable and bed was
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom too small
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic shopping, Saks Fifth Ave; Macys, Nordstroms - lots of restaurants

review.reviewText: Great and friendly staff. Rooms were clean and the bed was so comfortable.
Nice historic hotel. Best location. Fantastic view from the tower. Don't eat at the steakhouse. Famous chef, but is realy an overpriced tourist trap.

review.title: Very small room with big closet. View of shaft.
review.reviewText: Out biggest issue was that we had to wait over five minutes for hot water

review.title: Room was NOISEY, small and needing repair
review.reviewText: Heard the room on one side watching television into the night, woke to the sound of guests on the other side taking showers. It was Motel 6 quality. Won't go back.

review.title: How to spend vacation dollars
review.reviewText: This hotel although very elegant, prices the heck out of everything that other hotels consider normal.  Starting with charging $14.95 for a small amount of internet wifi usage.  It's a matter of walking down the street to a Starbucks to get free internet.  Spending over $500 for a night's sleep should have some perks.  The snacks cupboard tells you that if you lift something off the shelf to look at it, you had better do it quickly, since if it's off the shelf more than 10 seconds it will automatically appear on your bill.  Altogether a less than happy start to our vacation.

review.title: Needed get away.
review.reviewText: My father just passed away and the last year had been incredibly stressful. The Westin St. Francis felt like a big hug. From the friendly greeting at arrival, to a beautiful room and then wine tasting with Russel from Chateau Montelena, our short stay breathed life back into me.

review.title: Excellent hotel!
review.reviewText:
This Hotel is perfectly located. You won't need a rental car. Walking distance to The Embarcadero. Walking distance to Chinatown. Sightseen bus stop in front of the hotel (Union Square). Cable car in front of the hotel. Surrounded by restaurants, stores, big stores.
The room was excellent. The staff is very kind. No cons at all!. Strongly recommended!.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. No need to rent a car. Walking distance. Excellent room.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to The Embarcadero (10 min), Chinatown (3 min) and all big stores. Union Square. Restaurants all around.

review.title: Noisy.  Rooms too small.  So was the bathroom
review.reviewText: Too noisy.   Could hear people next door talking.   Room was too small.  Not impressed at all

review.title: Gorgeous historic hotel in the city center
review.reviewText: The hotel was wonderful. Our room was very comfortable with the view of the Union Square. EVERYTHING was close by and we could not be happier with our choice.

review.title: beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: We love that the hotel was centrally located to everything we wanted to do and see

review.title: Great hotel for tourists visiting SF!
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is amazing and close to tons of great shopping and eateries.  There are tour buses right outside the hotel at Union Square and the cable cars pass by (a definite must try if you are visiting SF).  Although the rooms in the landmark building seem to require a bit of an update, we did not mind this too much as we were out exploring most of the day.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to my family and friends!

review.title: Across the street from Union Square
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel located within walking distance to everything, shops, restaurants & transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: I can't think of anything.
review.locationRemarks: Cable car stops in front of the hotel. Transportation is within walking distance. Taxi cab in from of hotel as well.

photos.caption: Severly worn and matted down carpet

review.title: Not what I would consider Westin Quality
review.reviewText: I was placed in a Queen Room in the Historic portion of the hotel. The room was tiny, in disrepair and well worn.  The mattress was lumpy, carpet was matted down, sink was cracked in two places, the tub was discolored and the tub spout was leaking.  After the 1st night I asked to be moved and was told that I should not expect the room to be fresh, in good repair and/or clean and comfortable since it was in the historic portion of the hotel!  My only option was to pay an extra $40/night in order to move into the more modern hotel tower!
review.negativeRemarks: The property needs a major renovation!
review.locationRemarks: Right at Union square, shopping and dining.

review.title: Good location, friendly and helpful staff.
review.reviewText: We stayed in the older part of the building, it needs an upgrade but was clean, comfortable and not cramped so we were okay with it. If you like newer properties ask to stay in the newer building. There are other old hotels in the area that are more interesting but they all cost about the same and some have a lot smaller rooms. We also like the kimpton hotels, such as the Monaco and the Prescott.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. Location is perfect. Loved the square excitement

review.title: Westin; the BEST!!!!
review.reviewText: Traveling to San Francisco for the first time we were unsure where to stay.  We selected the St. Francis Westin at Union Square and couldn't have been more pleased.  It was absolutely the best location with regards to walking to restaurants, shopping, the hop on/ hop off bus and live entertainment.  We stayed in the tower which is the newer portion of the hotel.  It was spacious, comfortable and clean.  Would definitely recommend staying here and would do so again.
review.positiveRemarks: The décor, the cleanliness and the comfort.
review.negativeRemarks: The gentlemen in the lobby area seemed more interested in talking among themselves than assisting guests.  And the toilet paper was cheap!!!
review.locationRemarks: Location was superb!!!!  Easy walk to shops, restaurants and the Hop on/ Hop off tour bus.

review.title: Convenient hotel, centrally located at Union Squar
review.reviewText: Typical smallish room in a dated hotel . Bed leaves a lot to be desired. Rain forest shower head was great. Great view of the Square, 9th floor corner room was a little noisy however. Will use the hotel again, but will insist on a much better bed. 3 nights in a bad bed was hard on this 60 yr. olds back 😄

review.title: Excellent Stay
review.reviewText: Great time, great service.  This hotel I a jewel in the city.

review.title: Great location for the rate
review.reviewText: The hotel is just in front of Union Sq. From there you can walk everywhere... shops...restaurants....to the bay...everywhere. Good conditions on the new tower...nice space in the room, really clean...nice shower, good TV guide. Overall, I would say it is a nice 4 stars in the middle of Union Sq.

review.title: Wonderful!
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel. Beautiful, great location, wonderful views and such history!

review.title: Great location in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Located in the heart of Union Square. Close to everything including transportation. Room was in the old part of hotel and the bed was not comfortable at all. If staying again I would not stay in the old part of the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location to activities, shopping, transportation, Shows, etc.
review.negativeRemarks: They need to replace the mattress's in the historic building.
review.locationRemarks: Location to activities, shopping, transportation, Shows, etc.

review.title: They can take a reservation, but not keep it.
review.reviewText: We booked, and prepaid, a King Deluxe Room in the new Tower one month before our stay. at check in we were told they didn't have anymore of these rooms. We were given a room in the "Classic" building of the hotel, the original decades old building. We went from a new 400 sqft room to an old 150-200 sqft room. The kicker is that we weren't reimbursed for the difference in the rooms until I inquired at checkout. At check in we were given two vouchers for free coffee and were told there wasn't much of a difference. I looked on their  website and found that there was a big difference. How do you confirm a reservation and then not have the room available for the customer?
review.positiveRemarks: Good location on Union Square. Otherwise, that's it.
review.negativeRemarks: Have a room available for customer when they reserved said room.
review.locationRemarks: Right down town. Lots of theaters, museums, galleries, restaurants, and shopping.

review.title: Great hotel, Fabulous restaurant, Convenient
review.reviewText: I would stay here again.  The hotel was nice, clean, friendly,... basically everything I want from a hotel.  The location is good for vacationing with shuttle buses right outside front door.  There are many areas to see in San Francisco and I guess a room with a view of the water would be the most desired but probably beyond my budget, so for the price this location was convenient. There is endless shopping surrounding this hotel although we did not partake in this at all.  We ate at the Steak House in the hotel the first night and it was outstanding.  Then we ventured out to the countless options for fine foods around town. Bottom line is I liked this place.

review.title: Superb view
review.reviewText: On the 29th floor perched high above Union Square we had a panoramic view of downtown. As a minor earthquake rattled the Bay area we were secure.

review.title: Nice hotel , in the heart of SF at Union square
review.reviewText: We have to wait for checkin, room is not ready until 5 pm, so Front desk lady gave us $75 hotel credit. We are very happy. Wish I remember her name. Pardon my old age. She gave us the view room on 2090 too!
review.negativeRemarks: we had 4 people booked for the room, but towels for only 2 in the bathroom. We got it when I call, but will be nice if all are there.
review.locationRemarks: a few blocks to Macy, China town, trolly, lots of brand name shopping around.

review.title: Good luck location but chaotic.
review.reviewText: Friday check ins are tough.  Hotel always swarming with guests and visitors.  Not restful.

review.title: nice location but rooms need updates
review.reviewText: staff are nice, location is great, but the rooms are too old and very small. Hallways are dark and dingy. The A/C unit in my room is extremely loud. I ended up shutting the A/C off while I was sleeping. For the money I paid, it's disappointing.

review.title: Great hotel, location.
review.reviewText: We got a very nice North-West room on the 32nd floor, Great view, comfortable bed, we will come back again.
review.positiveRemarks: The room we got on the 32nd floor.

review.title: Stayed in the tower. Awesome view from 28th floor
review.reviewText: Peak season, so it was crowded. Everything else was great. Location in the heart of the Union Square area.

review.title: nice hotel, old section has old charm feel
review.reviewText: awesome lobby, stayed in the old section, room had an old charm feel with modern comforts.   Super easy parking across the street in public parking garage, much cheaper than the valet.   Cable car stop right in front of hotel.   Didn't eat at the hotel but the surrounding block has awesome food and drinking establishments.   Walked to the Pier 39/Fisherman's wharf during the day for the experience (good distance but fun).  I would stay here again, the elevators are card access with floor specific stops so not a long wait for a ride up and down.
review.positiveRemarks: location, lobby, and the big screen video projection on the back wall of the check in area.
review.negativeRemarks: Older part of the hotel; in the rooms spice them up a bit to give a little more old world feel.
review.locationRemarks: Sears Restaurant was Outstanding!!!!!  Cable Car, shopping,

review.reviewText: Room card didnt work, waited out of room over half an hour.
Great location with large room and large bathroom.
review.positiveRemarks: large room comfortable beds and large bathroom with plenty of counter space!
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: great shopping

review.title: Nice hotel downtown San Fran.
review.reviewText: Great location.  Walking distance to many places.  Elevators were fast and hardly ever a wait.  But, for a 4 star hotel they should have queen size beds in the rooms.  Beds are too small.  Nice bathrooms.  Parking charge way too expensive.  I would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds need to be queen size
review.locationRemarks: Great location.  Lots of shopping and restaurants near by.  Tour bus stops and trolleys across the street.

review.title: Hotel in union square
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice. Staff was helpful and friendly. Elevators were very convenient

review.title: Great hotel to stay
review.reviewText: Centrally located and so getting around is convenient. I took the Bart train from SFO to Powell and it took 3 blocks from there to the hotel. That saved me time and $$ instead of taxi or shuttle. The hotel is nice and they let me checked in early. I stayed on the Tower building and so it was new. Would stay again next time I'm in SF.

review.title: Very nice location that is the best about the hote
review.reviewText: Nothing really to say the location is the best but nothing other than that

review.title: Excellent location. Comfortable room.
review.reviewText: Enjoy my stay a lot. My room has a nice view of Union Square.  Will come back soon.

review.title: Close to shopping
review.reviewText: I love the Westin St. Francis, you can wal right out your door to shopping. However, I would request the tower rooms next time I stay as they are nicer than the landmark rooms.

review.title: Excellent hotel - close enough to AT&T Park
review.reviewText:
Very easy and convenient and uncomplicated. And I have nothing more to say, I'm a very busy
man and you are eating up my time!!
review.positiveRemarks: The building itself and proximity to Giants ballpark.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing comes to mind.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient location to AT&T Park

review.title: Hotel  San Francisco
review.reviewText:
We were on a family road trip ending up in San Francisco.

This hotel is in the perfect location,close to everything and right in the heart of all the high end shops.

I think it's a great value hotel. Rooms are clean,comfortable, quiet.

Not the "swankiest" but again, you get what you pay for and our stay was very comfortable and served our purpose perfectly.
I'd definitely stay here again.

review.title: Nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Gooooooood. but parking fee is toooooo expensive.

review.title: Great location, good service, a very pleasant stay
review.reviewText: Enjoyed everything about the place was good. Didn't eat there as so many other places nearby which are more reasonably priced.
review.negativeRemarks: How about a guide to the TV chanels? Don't know what's on which chanel
review.locationRemarks: Great location, close to good restaurants, shopping and ground transport

review.title: Classic spot
review.reviewText: Stayed for business. Room in the tower. Service excellent. Reasonable price for Westin and Union Sq. Totally recommend.
review.locationRemarks: Union Sq. Very tourist-centered. But very convenient for business travelers

review.title: Great location and accommodations
review.reviewText: The lobby welcomes you to a gorgeous hotel, which is perfectly placed in Union Square. Since SF is 7 miles by 7 miles total, this really is the perfect spot to stay. The cable car is outside, the train is 3-4 blocks away, and an Ueber or taxi is available almost on demand. We really enjoyed our stay, and the Heavenly beds are awesome.

review.title: Great city views
review.reviewText: We recently spent a weekend in SF as tourists and chose this hotel largely for location.  Booking on several websites was very confusing for differentiating room options.  We stayed in the tower, upper floors, and loved the views facing the financial district.  The view includes COIT tower to the far left and the bay bridge to the right.  Cable car stop was just outside the front of the hotel, as was hopon/hopoff bus stop.  Reasonable hotel price but, as expected, expensive food and overnight parking.  I'd use this hotel again.

review.title: Clock Bar
review.reviewText: The staff was amazing and the room quite clean.  Great location! A big problem was the closing of the bar.  We were told the bar would be open til 2:00a.m. Friday it closed at 12:00, and on Saturday night it closed before 11:00p.m.  That is unacceptable.  I was a woman by myself and did not feel comfortable going out on the streets alone.  It was one of the reasons I picked that Hotel.   Disappointing!
review.negativeRemarks: Let customers know the correct closing times of restaurants and bars.   The bartenders just closed when they felt like it.

review.title: Always a fantastic stay
review.reviewText: The Westin has the perfect location right on union square, the rooms are spacious and comfortable and the staff always friendly and accommodating

review.title: Classic San Francisco.
review.reviewText: I travel to San Francisco regularly and this property is always among my top choices. Friendly staff and classic but vibrant atmosphere. Close to everything downtown.

review.title: A company is only as good as it's people...
review.reviewText: A company is only as good as it's people and when the people are terrible so is the company. The front desk staff at the Westin had no clue as to their own product. They also tried to sell me into staying into less of a room that I paid for because I bought my room through Expedia. I will not be staying at this hotel in the future.
review.negativeRemarks: The front desk staff needs to all be replaced, from the desk manager down.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, tons of bars, restaurants, shopping, sites to see.

review.title: Nice hotel, exc location
review.reviewText: We stayed there for 7 nights, the hotel was fine and it's location is perfect for tourists. We had some issues with our room; the floor had like bubbles so it was lifted up in some places, one day we didn't had hot water in our shower and the phone stopped working. Also we could hear the noise from the street in our room so we complain and they changed us to a better room. Even thought we paid a lot of money per night and this issues shouldn't had happen since the beginning. If I go back to San Francisco I'll look for another hotel near this one or if you still want to stay here ask them to give you a room in the new tower.

review.title: So sweet ! Yvonne in the concierge was amazing!
review.reviewText: Amazing. Right in the city and in the heart of San Francisco

review.title: Excellent hotel and location.
review.reviewText: I have had the pleasure to stay at the Westin St. Francis twice in the last 3-months and each time was a great experience.  The location is next to all public transit options and within walking distance to restaurants of all prices ranges. The service at breakfast was awesome. I would have given 5 stars,  however there was an inconvenient mix up with our luggage when changing rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Meals and drink a bit pricey, but then again that's San Francisco.

review.reviewText: I have stayed in many San Francisco Hotel and this was the most quiet.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, quiet, good service, very comfortable beds, and good food.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean up Union Square
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, China Town, and food.

review.title: North Texas
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Westin St Francis was great the check in with Jason was the best he was very helpful throughout the trip!   We will definitely stay here again and we will tell our friends from Texas too!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and friendly staff all around
review.locationRemarks: The location of the Westin St. Francis was ideal all the designer shopping and various dining choices were just a walk outside the hotel.

review.title: Elegance with a View
review.reviewText:
We stayed in the Landmark building, a section with a lot of charm, elegance and history. Our window overlooked Union Square, the best view in the city.
The staff was accommodating and friendly. Every staff member went above and beyond. 
We will be staying at the Westin St. Francis whenever we come to San Francisco.

review.title: I wanted to love it, but...
review.reviewText: This is a classic, beautiful (on the outside) hotel right on Union Square.  The room was disappointing, which I've learned to live with when I visit truly historic hotels in the downtown.  The room was really small, and had a view of a light shaft and dozens of other rooms looking into the same light shaft.  Not really a problem, as we didn't ask or pay for a room with a view.  The room had beautiful period detailing on the walls and doors.  The room also had a distinct smell of cigarettes, as it must have been a smoking room in the past.  The room overall appeared clean, but there were someone else's clothes left in the dresser.  Nothing terrible or appalling, but not the overall quality I would expect from a Westin hotel.  For my next trip, I will find a newer hotel in the vicinity with modern-day sized rooms, and at least a view of the street.
review.positiveRemarks: It was old and historic.  It was perfectly located.  The lobby was beautiful.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was old and small.  It also had a distinct smell of cigarette smoke.  There were someone else's clothes left in the dresser!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Perfect location, especially for shopping and getting on tour buses which load across the street.  Very nice facility including a good workout facility.

review.title: Modern, clean and perfect location
review.reviewText: I always know that I will have a great experience at a Westin property and the St. Francis was no exception.  The property was modern and elegant.  The staff was friendly.  The rooms were comfortable and clean with great views of San Francisco [from the towers].  Most importantly, the location at Union Square was perfect.  I will definitely return!
review.negativeRemarks: Keep doing what you are doing.
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect in the heart of Union Square. Walking distance to Chinatown, Market Street for shopping, and the cable cars on Powell.

review.title: Great for any traveler
review.reviewText: I stayed for 3 nights for business.  I work in the FiDi, so walking is a breeze from this location.  The room was spacious and the bed was amazing.  There is no happy hour like some other hotels, but that didn't bother me.  Lobby staff were very nice and offered bottled water while I was waiting in the very short line to check in.  Got 1000 points for going green with my room cleaning.  I will definitely be back.
review.positiveRemarks: The workout room was large and had both cardio and weight equipment.  All in great condition.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is central to so much, shopping, the water, China Town, FIDI, anything you want to do, you can walk to.

review.title: Overpriced and overrated.
review.reviewText:
Supposedly "upgraded" from Landmark building but inferior. Faucets reversed from norm, toilet so low only suitable for children. Lights out in bath (reported, never fixed). Very loud boom noise from nearby airshaft on regular basis. Very high priced considering most normal extras missing, room size very average and very expensive parking. Have stayed many times in the past in Landmark building, but price exceeds value. Loved it in the past but now will not return.

All the employees were exceptionally polite and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Attention to detail. Provide usual amenities like shower caps, lotion, etc and sufficient coffee needs. FIX PLUMBING ISSUES. Quiet the airshaft.
review.locationRemarks: Good location on Union Square with lots of shopping and access to transportation.

review.title: Across from Union Square
review.reviewText: We stayed in the "Landmark" (old) building but our room was quite pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: Free Wifi.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping and theater

review.reviewText: Stayed here many times.  Great location, good hotel for 1st timers.

review.title: Great Location, Small rooms
review.reviewText: If you want to be in the thick of the sights and sounds of San Fran, then stay here! Great location, close to everything we wanted to see. Our room was shockingly small, felt like we were in a closet. But it was clean and it did the job. I would stay here again, but in the new Tower and not the landmark building.

review.title: The Westin Hotel a beautiful experience!
review.reviewText:
From the moment I checked in the service at the hotel was excellent! 
Every staff member went out of their way to ensure all my needs were met which often exceeded my expectations.
review.positiveRemarks:
Room was clean and well appointed also hotel was in a prime location. 
Close to great restaurants and wonderful shopping!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing, service was excellent!
review.locationRemarks: Lots to do in Union Square area!

review.title: Perfect stay
review.reviewText: Our overall experience was amazing.  The staff was 5 star. very accomodating will definetley stay there again.  The room was spacoious, up to date, extremely clean and comfortable.  so quiet.  the bed and pillows were beyond comfort.  as a matter of fact I am gouing to buy the Westin's Down pillow online.  the parking was easy In and out and they were very fast at getting our car.  The Bellman was extremly helpful and cutious.  Overall an amazing perfect experience.  Nothing to complain about.
review.positiveRemarks: Our overall experience was amazing.  The staff was 5 star. very accomodating will definetly stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Front and center Unioin square-everything is at your doorstep within a block away.  best shopping and restaraunts

review.title: anniversary weekend at the st. francis
review.reviewText: we had a really great time. the room was really spacious and the beds very comfy  the in room dining though very pricey was very tasty service from valet parking check in room service outstanding
review.positiveRemarks: old world charm but with all the modern amenities
review.negativeRemarks: pricey 75$ for a breakfast for two is a bit much
review.locationRemarks: close to everything  shopping  theaters

review.title: perfect location
review.reviewText: wonderful beds good food excellent staff fun elevators
review.negativeRemarks: different shower heads
review.locationRemarks: shopping Theatre cable cars Union Square

review.title: Signature Hotel on Union Square
review.reviewText: We liked our stay.  The location is perfect, the room was comfortable and clean.  Not even all that small for the bargain level room.  We might book it again.  Staff was helpful and professional.
review.locationRemarks: China town, bike rental, shopping, dining, nightlife, cable car.  San Francisco!

review.reviewText: Only stayed one night,but had a great time. Hotel was a little expensive ,but you are paying for the location. I live close to SF and have stayed in most of the hotels in the part of the city. Some of the smaller hotels are just as nice as this one.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel only had one expensive restaurant. Would gave been nice to have more of a selection of restaurant at the actual hotel
review.locationRemarks: Great hotel for shopping and exploring downtown SF. A short cab/bus ride to any other part of the city is available at any time.

review.title: Excellent location. The best San Fran location!!!
review.reviewText:
This hotel is in the best location. The parking was too expensive. Come on now 58 dollars. They could do better for guests. 

The rooms were clean and the bed was like sleeping in a cloud. Not that I have slept on a cloud but omg it was nice. The tourist busses and trolies are across the street. Best location. I have one 4 rating because 58 dollars for parking is not fair.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We had a great stay. The hotel was very grand and the rooms were smaller than typical double bed rooms but the layout made up for it. I really loved it and would stay there again! Very nice granite floors in the bathroom.

Overall was good.
Didn't think we should have to pay for internet
review.negativeRemarks: Free internet
review.locationRemarks: Close to lots of tourist attractions

review.title: Birthday celebration
review.reviewText: The only Cain I have is when we tried to watch a movie it kept kicking is out of the movie and it took several minutes to get it started again after. Few calls to the front.  Other than that it was a great stay.
Our stay was wonderful! The staff was courteous, helpful and efficient! The vintage ambience was lovely!

review.title: Fantastic staff
review.reviewText: The front desk staff is wonderful-sent cookies and milk to our room for my daughter's birthday.  Bell service is also very helpful with restraunt recommendations. Overall great experience!

review.title: Great location..
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Westin.. Staff was very nice & helpful since was our first time to San Fransisco ...

review.title: It was a very convenient location for my visit.
review.reviewText: The beds were comfortable and room clean.  We were very tired with family activities so by the time we returned to the hotel we were very tired and went to sleep immediately.
review.positiveRemarks: It brought back memories of our stay at The St Francis over 40 years ago during the Christmas Holidays.  There were 16 family members for the weekend.

review.title: Best San Francisco address
review.reviewText: best location in the heart of Union Square. All amenities are close at hand. This location is "live". If you're looking for quiet, find another place
review.positiveRemarks: classic SF hotel. Tons of history. Very dressy.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed was lumpy and uncomfortable. I can't say anything good about the bed. ->Room 775-good bed would have made this a 5 star review
review.locationRemarks: everything is here--find out for yourself--this coming from a former SF resident (21years)

review.title: Great location right in Union Square
review.reviewText: Staff very friendly and helpful, beautiful Hotel, great location and dining

review.title: Nicely restored landmark hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: If you want to be right next to Union Square, then this hotel is a good choice. It is large and well kept. My room was on a lower floor with no view but was quiet as it was isolated from the noise of Union Square. It was large, nicely furnished with walk in closet and a fine bathroom. The staff is very attentive although check in was a little bit of a wait.

review.title: Great hotel, great location, great experience
review.reviewText:
Stayed in one night instead of going out for dinner and had the most amazing meal at the Oak Room I think it's called downstairs. The service was amazing, and the meal was unbelievable. What a surprise. 
This is just a good hotel. Great staff, service, and it's beautiful.
review.negativeRemarks: I wish hotels would learn to put fans in the fitness center. This one is well equipped, clean and attractive, but no air flow.
review.locationRemarks: Everything. Perfect location. Pier 1 and the ferry is walking distance, along with more stuff than I can list.

review.title: Parking is just way to expensive...
review.reviewText: Great area and also close to walk a dog... Son lives there and lots of good restaurants..
review.negativeRemarks: Parking prices

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: We stayed in the older section as requested. Beautiful wide hallways, room large, bathroom updated. Staff was exceptional .

review.title: Nice location. Spartan amenities for a westin
review.reviewText: Everything's available but have to ask, thus have to spend more on tips.
review.negativeRemarks: Have the room amenities inside the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Union square! Perfect for business or pleasure

review.title: Squeaking Floor and stumping noises
review.reviewText:
Paying over $300 per night but we couldn't sleep until 2 a.m. due to unbearable noises. These started 6:00 a.m again..Very annoying with noisy upstairs over midnight.We complained of the inconvenience but received just a small piece of apologizing letter for noise.
Clean room with heavenly beds might be good but SQUEAKING FLOOR,STUMPING NOISE AND CONSTANT WATER RUNNING NOISE WAS TERRIBLE AND INTOLERABLE.

review.title: Westin
review.reviewText:
Our 2 night stay at the Westin was good.  The room was very comfortable with a great view of Union Sq.  We were close to all the shops & restaurants.  
We stayed in the older section of the Westin...not the new Tower.  We could hear our neighbors very clearly.  I left the fan on all the time to reduce the noise. 
I would stay at the Westin again in the newer section where the walls are not supposed to be so thin.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was great.  The bed was comfortable.  The amenities in the room were great.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel could do with some sound proofing.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great.  There is shopping right outside your door.  Golden Gate Bridge is abt an hour's walk.  China Town, the Tram is all within 5min

review.title: If you like vintage landmark hotels, this is your
review.reviewText: Westin San Francis have the best of both worlds. Old vintage room on the landmark building and modern tower. All at the centre of SFO, THE UNION SQUARE.  Love to wake up at the cable cars bells every morning. Staff Excelent, room and beds excellent. I've been here many times.  Fully recommended

review.title: Nice Hotel, central location
review.reviewText: Great experience. The room was clean and quiet, nice view. Centrally located, close to many shopping and dining establishments.

review.title: Central location for cable cars and Bart
review.reviewText: Very glamorous hotel in an excellent location.  Good for sightseeing.
review.negativeRemarks: Free Wi-Fi and more coffee in the room
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, anywhere by public transport

review.title: Amazing hotel right in front of Union Square
review.reviewText: The Westin is an amazing Hotel! The service was great & the workers were friendly. I would DEFINITELY recommend this Hotel to anyone who wants to tour/vacation in San Francisco.

review.title: Historic hotel in Union square
review.reviewText: Pretty historic hotel close to shopping and restaurants.   Spacious room with two beds and sofa. In room coffee maker, mini bar.
review.positiveRemarks:
Spacious room with two double beds and sofa. Good room with children
Excellent restaurants and in room dining
review.negativeRemarks: Larger in room dining menu
review.locationRemarks:
Union square shopping and restaurants 
Easy access to the city and freeway

review.title: somewhat faded; great location
review.reviewText:
We have stayed at the St. Francis several times in the past 30 years because of the convenient location in the heart of the city. Our experiences have ranged from excellent to disappointing. On our previous visit there had been a major problem with our room location. Hotel staff told us that we had been misled (essentially lied to) by the staff making the reservation who were located in India and "promised everyone" specific accommodations that were not available.
Despite this, because of past positive stays we decided to return.
review.positiveRemarks: Very helpful and welcoming staff. excellent location.  We were able to check in early.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide seating for guests during check in and check out process other than in the bar/restaurant. Dirty worn carpets in room. Dust under bed.
review.locationRemarks: Every part of the city is easily accessible from the hotel. Much is walkable. Many convenient transportation options.

review.title: Underwhelmed
review.reviewText: We unfortunately found the staff to be rather unfriendly. Housekeeping was vacuuming and mopping the floors in the room next door sometime during the night. It was still dark out and and I was too tired to get up to find out why.
Booked at the last minute. Great place. No problems. Not sure I like the new elevator controls?
Excellent historic hotel that is refurbished in excellent taste
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping was a little lacking
review.locationRemarks: Near shopping, public transport and great eats

review.title: Terrible staff
review.reviewText: I booked a room at the new tower and got a room at the old one. I required a microwave in advance and when i arrived I learned there was none available. Long wait for room service and awful food.

review.title: Location, Location, LOCATION!
review.reviewText: This hotel is absolutely perfect for those who want to be near all of the shopping on Powell st., China Town, and even Little Italy. We come to San Fransisco Every couple months and usually stay in South San Fransisco by the airport because it is more affordable but this time we stayed here and we walked and walked all over the city it was a different experience so much fun! We didn't have to worry about finding parking like we always do. We parked in the parking garage right in front of TIffany's & Co. and Saks Fifth. There is a garage and for 24hrs it was about 30 dollars compared to the valet parking at the hotel $50-70 depending on your car.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is absolutely beautiful and in the heart of Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Our only dislike about the hotel were the rooms. For such a beautiful, exquisite hotel on the outside and even inside (lobby) the rooms were pretty ou
review.locationRemarks: Shops (Union Square), Eatery, China Town, Little Italy.

review.title: BITTER SWEET
review.reviewText: my experience at this Hotel was pretty terrible. When my family and I checked in we realized there was a mistake on our reservations booked thru Expedia. (We thought we had booked 2 rooms but really only booked 1). So we immediately tried booking another room with the front desk but was told that there was no vacancy. So we quickly logged online thru Hotels.com and booked another room for the remainder of the trip. Since we were walking while making the reservation for the extra room on our iPhone we accidently booked an extra night then needed. 2 minutes after hitting submit, I called Hotels.com to cancel that extra night and was told that it was possible but they just needed an "okay" from the Westin's manager. It turns out that the manager refused to allow hotels.com to cancel the extra night and reimburse my money.
review.positiveRemarks: This hotel is in a great location.
review.negativeRemarks: the staff can be improved. everyone I came across had major attitude.
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect for shopping and dining.

review.reviewText: Great location. Easy to use public transportation.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is great for public transportation.

review.title: On the decline
review.reviewText: Great location as many would know. Checking in is like buying a used car as far as negotiating a room that does most would not pay for if they knew what they were going to get. You are going to want to push for a window facing out of the building and not an "interior only" view. You will pay the same price as someone who has more sq footage and a better view but will be stuck with half the experience and space. The staff is truly just plain rude, lazy and then some. I asked for a late check out and then had 3 people come pound on my door and then attempt to enter within 5 seconds of the knock to see if I was gone yet and this was before normal check out time. The Clock bar drinks are very hit or miss these days which will matter to you when you see how much you pay. Internet connection was horrible. My comforter was wet when I got into the closet / room I paid for. I have been going to this hotel for 15 years and each year it gets worse. The experience use to be one that matched the history, ambiance, and price. Now it is a profit squeeze and in my humble opinion on the verge of have seeing its best days behind it.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff, pricing, cleanliness, and transparency on the variation in rooms.

review.title: The perfect spot
review.reviewText: Spent an overnight with girlfriends and was cozy and perfect and welcoming.

review.title: Great hotel central location
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel, beautiful views.  Elevators close too quickly.

review.title: Great central hotel - good access to all areas
review.reviewText: Rooms of good size. Well appointed. Upgraded to SPG which was nice. Bed very comfortable. Location  central and served our purpose of family wedding at City Hall perfectly.

review.title: First time stay
review.reviewText: I loved the beauty of the hotel and facilities, my biggest grief was I was on the 12th floor and it was too hot for me. I had the air conditioner on the whole time at 60* and my room never cooled down below 75*...that doesn't sound very hot, but when you're in a room where the air is NOT circulating it becomes stifling. It took 3 calls to concierge to obtain 1 fan and that didn't help much so after another 3 calls and no 2nd fan I left a note for my housekeeper of my room to obtain the 2nd fan. She did and I gave her a $100 tip because it was worth it to me!! She was awesome!! Being an older hotel explains the antiquated air conditioning and I understand that. This was my first time spending that kind of money for a hotel or trip for that matter and I don't regret it, just the location of my room.
review.negativeRemarks: Definitely the upper floors need better cooling.
review.locationRemarks: My first stop was Swarovski and my 2nd was Louis Vuitton...lots to do and see within walking distance.

review.title: Great Location in Union Square
review.reviewText: I usually LOVE this hotel, but my room in the landmark section was just ok.  I was right next door to another room and could hear everything.  I was also near  a service elevator that I could clearly hear going up and down every few minutes.  Other than that, it'sin a great location.  I will go back, but I will ask to stay in the newer section of the hotel.

review.title: Adequate hotel, but not for us.
review.reviewText: The St. Francis/Westin is an historic hotel on Union Square.  We stayed in the old building facing the Square.  The room was small, but had high ceilings and a great view.   The hallways are spacious.  Unfortunately, the Square is very noisy with street musicians playing until 9:00 - 10:00 in the evening.  Also, the elevators are only operable with your key card.  It's a security feature, but difficult to use.  Also, the St. Francis charges for internet: $80 bucks over 5 days.   It's a huge hotel, so you are just a number to the staff.  We much prefer the Kimpton Monaco a few blocks away where the staff greet you name and are amazingly friendly and helpful.  And internet is free!  We only stayed at the St. Francis because the Monaco restaurant was being renovated.
review.negativeRemarks: The things we disliked such as location would be hard to change.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is the center of everything in San Francisco which has pluses and minuses.

review.title: Elegant modern hotel
review.reviewText:
Beautiful hotel: gorgeous rooms and huge lobby with lots of options for shops, bar, lounge, coffee, etc. 

Right across the street from Union square, and next to all of the best shops and restaurants.

Loved our stay and will absolutely be coming back!
Mold in restrooms? Gross! I stayed there before and recalled a much better stay, not sure if I would recommend this place again.

review.title: Great hotel close to everything.
review.reviewText: The hotel and staff were great. They offered great suggestions when we asked about place to eat. Our room faced another room so we didnt get a view. Didn't mind because we spent majority of time outside site seeing. When we first arrived our TV wasn't working, they sent up a handy man and fixed it quick even credited us a free movie. If you want a view just make sure you upgrade.

review.title: Great hotel with SF prices
review.reviewText: Great hotel, in the middle and heart of union square SF. Close to everything. With good location, good service, and the heart of downtown, expect SF prices. Parking and extra charges.

review.title: Business Trip
review.reviewText: Location is great. Can get busy with convention/business travelers which equally can make it noisy if you are looking to relax in evening after working all day.  I love the Westin Hotels and this one in particular has great restaurants. Not least the staff are very friendly and helpful
review.negativeRemarks: quiet places to sit, work and have a drink
review.locationRemarks: Near all major shops, walking distance to the local restaurant scene and I walked to Moscone each day

review.title: Always a great stay-try to get updated rooms!
review.reviewText: Hotel is in prime location to explore San Francisco's Union Square Area.  Great shopping, dining, and theatre, and comedy clubs near.
review.positiveRemarks: location and cleanliness. Hotel Staff was wonderful.

review.title: Hotel room theft left unresolved
review.reviewText:
We chose to stay at Westin because of the high marks and great location, that we dreadfully regret later on. During our stay, someone went into our room and stole our 2 coats. Not very expensive ones, but both had sentimental values. When we reported the theft, we had to speak to several people, from the front desk, the security, even the manager on duty. It has now been 4 days and the case is still unresolved. Even worse is that NO ONE from this hotel has contacted me about any progress and/or update. Our several attempts at calling them and following up led to empty promises and no resolution.
One of the managers we spoke to mentioned that one of their employees was caught going inside our room, but declined to give any info, as they were investigating the case. 
So if you value your belongings and sense of security, I suggest you stay somewhere else.
review.negativeRemarks: Management. Security. Guest services.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Awesome place to stay in a great location. Beautiful views and the room was so comfortable. Got an upgrade upon check in and the staff was very friendly. Will definitely stay again.

review.title: Completely inflexible!
review.reviewText: I made an incorrect 3 night booking, the 23rd - 26th, and had intended to book the 22nd - 25th (still 3 nights).  They allowed me to check in early, but charged me rack rate for the first night, and refused to credit back what now became the 4th night of my reservation.

review.title: Pleasure
review.reviewText: Our 2nd visit to SFco, we love this hotel because its location and comfort

review.title: Expensive, out dated
review.reviewText: Booked a single room on a last minute business trip to SF. Paid $629/night for a closet of a room with worn carpeting, outdated fixtures, and dirt/dust all
review.negativeRemarks: Update the rooms... seriously.

review.title: Location provides a good base for other activities
review.reviewText: I am not a fan of hotels and I don't like spending this much money but we were meeting friends there so we went along with it. It turned out to be very comfortable and convenient for seeing the city together.
review.negativeRemarks: Each room should have a small microwave and fridge for restaurant leftovers and heating up hot drinks.
review.locationRemarks: Close to BART and cable car. Reasonable restaurants within walking distance. Recommend SF City Guides free walking tours.

review.title: Terrible experience.
review.reviewText: We paid large $$$$$$ for 2 rooms for 2 nights and the rooms couldn't be more than 120 square feet. The rooms were old and terribly equipped. The dressing mirror was in the closet which you couldn't even open all the way because the bed side table was in the way. Upon arrival we were never asked if we needed any help with our bags or given any direction what so ever on any amenities in the hotel or in the area. the wait staff in the lobby bar looked more inconvenienced than should be when asked for a bar menu....perhaps it was because we were coming from out of country or the fact that they had the JP Morgan convention in the hotel, but this was an absolute rip off the the largest degree!! in fact I don't think i will stay in another Westin because of this experience.
review.negativeRemarks: everything

review.title: Great hotel and a great location
review.reviewText: We stayed in the Westin St Francis for 6 nights over New Year in a deluxe Tower room and found the room to be large, very quiet and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Free wifi in the rooms.  A kettle to make a cup of tea properly.  Biscuits to have with tea/coffee.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, right in the middle of downtown, lots of shops and good transport links to everywhere else, most things within walking distance.

review.title: Gorgeous & Comfy Hotel But No Free WiFi?
review.reviewText: We loved our stay at this hotel except for 1 matter- No free in room wifi?
review.positiveRemarks:
Great Location
Room Size
In Room Dining
Restaurants in and around hotel
review.negativeRemarks: Free wifi in room

review.title: SUPURB HOTE and GREAT STAFF
review.reviewText:
Despite being busy during the holidays, everything went well. The Front of House staff were great and could not do enough to ensure all was in order. Without any request, they provided an upgraded room - one directly overlooking Geary St. rather than an inside room looking at nothing.  Although there was some street noise, it was nothing of a problem.

 The housekeeping staff were prompt, efficient and did a first class job throughout my stay. The room was cleaned in a timely manner and was always left neat and tidy. Just great!!!

The Oak Room is a great dining facility.  The food was excellent.  Christmas dinner was part buffet with orders for the entre.  There was a good selection and the food was HOT - not restaurant cool.
review.positiveRemarks:
Location. Location. Location.

The St. Francis is close to restaurants, stores, transportation - bus and cable cars.
review.negativeRemarks: Better lighting in front of the elevators so that you can easily see both the directions for use and the room card slot which is difficult to see.
review.locationRemarks: For shoppers, there are the big department stores - Union Square or Market St.  Union Square was most interesting - skating, music etc.

review.title: St Francis San Francisco 2014-15
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel and staff old fashioned hotel in good way recommend to anyone who likes stylish hotel .
review.positiveRemarks: Apart from noisy kids sadly sigm of times everything .
review.negativeRemarks: Banning kids .
review.locationRemarks: Everything nearby great central location in San Francisco .

review.title: Fantastic location in Union Square
review.reviewText: Just spent two nights at the Westin St. Francis hotel. Loved the location right across the street from Union Square Park. Our Landmark room was not ready when we arrived early so we were upgraded to the tower rooms 27th floor.  The view was amazing. The ride up in the glass elevator was really neat. The beds were very comfortable and the blankets super warm. We did hear quite a bit of noise the first night from other rooms, so it wasn't quite as quiet as I like. The second night was much quieter. Everyone that we encountered on the hotel staff was friendly and very helpful. I would definitely stay here again as we loved the location. It's very convenient to ice skating and shopping. It's a nice safe area.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the hotel room and view.
review.negativeRemarks: Better noise proofing. Can hear other guests shower and flush toilets.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square Park is across the street. Ice skating, shopping, Westfield Mall, cable car, huge Macy's, lots of restaurants.

review.title: Lovely Hotel Ruined by Traffic Problems
review.reviewText: Great hotel, however the nightmare of trying to get in and out of the parking garage would make me loathe to stay here again. Also the elevators malfunctioned for a couple of hours and had to walk down 14 flights of stairs so as to not miss a meeting, they are computerized and something went wrong with the computer settings. Such a shame as the hotel was lovely, but these 2 details ruined a nice experience for us.
review.positiveRemarks: Lovely bed, great staff, great view from 14th floor Tower.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking garage.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, everything is there.

review.title: excellent excellent
review.reviewText: the location, the area around, the staff, the room facilities, and every thing u want was incredible and great.. the staff r very friendly, the hotel was really managed well and this is one of the most greatful hotel i have been before

review.title: Xmas nite
review.reviewText: We only spent an overnite as it was an extension to our timeshare unit at the club donetello. They were kind enough to give us a room over looking Union square with the xmas tree and ice rink. Very nice view room, thanks

review.title: Nice room but housekeeping service was lacking
review.reviewText: The hotel and room were nice.  The bad part was the breakfast line was just really long & the hotel should realized that when you have people waiting tge should at least accommodate at least the people in line before 10am.  The next thing, we were gone all day& came at 8pm tge room hasn't been clean.  We call for housekeeper and were told 20min. No one show up.  We left for dinner, 2 hours later they barely finished cleaning!  So disappointed.
Old room, no view looked out window at a brick wall 6 feet away. Very expensive and still had to pay to park the car there. Good location next to Union Square.

review.title: Pretty disappointing
review.reviewText: Room was small and poorly appointed.  The bathroom was tiny, the sink stopper was broken; few bathroom amenities ( very old hair dryer stuck on a boarded up window... No shower cap) No counter space. A full trash bag was in the hall outside our room upon our afternoon arrival and was there the next afternoon as well. Seemed the hotel was indifferent to our experience once they had our payment.
review.positiveRemarks: Housekeeping staff was friendly and welcoming.
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrade their rooms.

review.title: Wrong information for # of guests
review.reviewText:
They got a wrong information for our number of people to stay, We were four of us, but they got two.
Problem was amenity things, because every day they provided to us that two set of bath towels and others.
I don't know which made a mistake (Expedia or Hotel), I hope you will be good communications next time.
Best regards,

review.title: St Francis, SF
review.reviewText: Elegant old hotel. Needs new hall carpet. Parking very expensive...$55 per night.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Loved the location of the hotel, close to everything in Union square as well as Westfield mall. Only complaint the room was tiny but we had a corner room.
Beautiful hotel, recent upgrade on rooms, spacious and very comfortable

review.title: Awesome location and historic hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful and historic hotel in the heart of union square. Beds were so comfy with blackout shades we could've slept in forever.

review.title: 65th birthday
review.reviewText: Double beds for two adults to sleep in was not very comfortable, I have NEVER stayed in a Hotel with a double bed. Should had been queen beds, not to mention the bedspreads did not even fit the beds.  The room had absolutely no charm, very cold.  For a Westin property very disappointed.  I would never stay at this location again.  Last year it was the Fairmont, I will be sure to book my room at that hotel for my next visit.  Over priced

Very nice stay. My only complaint (and I hear this is the case for all fancy hotels) is that the hotel charges for wi-fi and television (everything is ppv but news from Japan and infomercials)!  When I can get both at Days Inn for free, it makes me think twice about springing for any fancy hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: View (anything above 12th floor is good), bed (heavenly), spacious room, nice linens, quiet, great landmark hotel. Riding the elevator is fun.
review.negativeRemarks: Free wi-fi and TV added. End tables with lamps on BOTH sides of bed.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for a downtown SF stay.

review.title: Christmas shopping visit
review.reviewText: Great place to stay for our pre-Christmas shopping

review.title: A disappointing stay
review.reviewText: We have stayed at this hotel numerous times and, at those times, would give an excellent review in all categories.  This time the heater didn't work and it took them some time to fix it.  We had to stay up until they finally got someone to come to the room.  We had asked for a roll-away when making the reservation but because the room was too small, they could not fill that request!  All of the staff had been wonderful except for one incident when my adult daughter asked the concierge the way to the rest room which is outside the dining area.  The person first ignored her and then was abrupt with her.  All of these incidents surprised us.
review.positiveRemarks: We like the location, the elegance of the lobby, and--for the most part--the service.
review.negativeRemarks: My question is: are they giving us lesser accommodations because we are going through AARP Expedia?
review.locationRemarks: All of Union Square is located outside your window.

review.title: Pre Christmas Stay
review.reviewText: Expected more value for the price and location.  Got a much nicer room at a competitive hotel in Napa for half the price.
review.negativeRemarks: average value for the premium price

review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful and friendly. Great location - nice room.

review.title: Holiday Shopping in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel. The staff was friendly and we had a wonderful time shopping. Everything is at your front door. Iceskating, the Christmas tree at Union Square, it was all fabulous!

review.title: Over priced parking
review.reviewText: Do not park you're car here! Was charged 110$ for two days. Makes no sense!

review.title: Beautiful & central location
review.reviewText: The standard of the service, room and location were ideal and we enjoyed our stay. The only let down was no free wifi however they did offer free flight checkin, boarding pass printing & ticketmaster online access in the lobby.

review.title: CHECKED IN TOO LATE
review.reviewText: Checked in for a 2 night stay at 12 noon. Was told  the room was not ready but we will call you when it is. At 4:40pm we went back to check in, NO PHONE CALL. Was given a lower floor room and told we had been assigned a higher floor room but they are all taken now. Well I guess when they say they will call you, they don't mean it.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service at check in
review.locationRemarks: It's Union Square SF, what's not to do?

review.title: No Mistakes
review.reviewText: I travel a lot. Stayed in many Westins.  They're all great- But, this one made no mistakes during my stay. I was inpressed.

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: Just there one night, great location, will return, love the lobby and room

review.title: Great hotel on Union Square
review.reviewText: Overall a very positive experience and the staff was exceptional

review.title: St Francis Sfo
review.reviewText:
Comfortable nice decor clean and upscale, room rate was reasonable and across the street from union square and close to all shopping!
Have breakfast down the street at Sears have an appetite portions are huge!

review.title: Excellent central location
review.reviewText:
Very well located in centre of SF. Beautiful turn of the century entrance and restaurants. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Concierge well informed and efficient. Great breakfast buffet in very pleasant environment.
To be recommended.
review.negativeRemarks: air-conditioning was very loud
review.locationRemarks: Everything is relatively nearby

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay for our wedding anniversary at the Westin. The hotel staff let us have a early check in ( 11 am ) , late check out 2 pm and also offered us complimentary wine for our anniversary . The location is very convenient and the view from our room was awesome at night .

review.title: Location and class!
review.reviewText: There's no better place on Union Square than the St. Francis.  If you like the older classic SFO hotel style, then opt for a room in the front original building.  It's VERY quiet due to solid old-time construction.  The large square footage of our view room was nice.  The floor space lends itself to more furniture in the room, which was a bit sparse, but otherwise very nice.  We'll go back for sure.
review.negativeRemarks: more nicer furniture in the room.  needs some art and wall mirrors
review.locationRemarks: Union Square.  duh.

review.title: center of town. Very cool
review.reviewText: all was very good but the bourbon steak house was very below what I expected....steak was 84 bucks and white  wine selection by the glass in California was very bad...should have eaten elsewhere...
review.negativeRemarks: wine selection by the glass
review.locationRemarks: skating( ice skating for the neighbors south of me in Canada)   in 75 degree weather last Friday was cool in park at Union square

review.title: Roomy, Quiet, and Very Comfortable
review.reviewText:
When we arrived, our room wasn't ready in the renovated towers, so they offered a room in the landmark building. I was hesitant not knowing what to expect with the age of the building and so forth. We decided to take the room. It was excellent. A large room, with vaulted ceiling, and vintage ambiance. The bathroom was very spacious, with an upgraded rain shower, and handle. The beds were warm and comfortable. The room temperature remained comfortable all through our stay. Also a plus, we did not hear any noise from other guests. Usually, one can hear the TV or toilet flush and occasional voices in another room (even in expensive hotels). 

Another plus, was having the Bourbon Steak House in the hotel. We wanted dessert and a drink in the late evening. We asked just to sit in the bar area. They gave us a nice table, and always filled our water glasses, and asked how we were doing. They never tried to rush us. We had exquisite desserts, brown butter sponge cake, and Irish coffee.

Overall, I give this experience FIVE STARS! Thank you!
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet, and roomy accommodations, plus a terrific ambiance.
review.negativeRemarks: We did have trouble with our room keys not working, the maid was so kind to let us in our room and we called down and new keys were brought up to us.
review.locationRemarks: The location was excellent, it's across the street from Union Square where shopping, eating, and cable car adventures await!

review.reviewText: Simply decadent. From the immediate recognition of how to make out anniversary extra special to the wonderful room, our stay was excellent.

review.title: Excellent service and staff
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay. The service and staff were fantastic

review.title: Stayed here multiple times.
review.reviewText: There is nothing really "outstanding" about the rooms.  It is the history of the hotel that we enjoy.Prices don't just

review.title: Nike 1/2 Marathon
review.reviewText: Great place to stay if you're running the Nike 1/2 Marathon. The location is as close as you can get to the start line. We were given a late check out which helped with our running the 1/2 marathon. The employee who checked us in was very professional and nice.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was very clean and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: It would have been nice to have a microwave and refrigerator in the room.
review.locationRemarks: The location is absolutely wonderful. You're close to all the great shopping in San Francisco. Also you're within walking distance to China Town.

review.reviewText: Great stay.  Lovely property! I would recommend this hotel in San Francisco!
We enjoyed our stay at the Westin St. Francis at Union Square. Good location, good restaurants, shopping other sights. Hotel was nice, rooms clean and updated.

review.title: OK.
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were exceptional from check-in to check-out and parking. The coffee in the lobby I rate a D and would be an F if one of the 3 people wasn't doing her job as well as the jobs of the other 2 and maintained a smile.
review.negativeRemarks: I have never experienced a gas station toilet in a hotel of this caliber. The shower hardware looks like the install person said good enough.
review.locationRemarks: Good walking exercise to many pubs and restaurants.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: at first  I was upset at the front desk for not giving me a decent room only after I was assertive in my demand to change my room I was transferred to a better location which was available with no issue. Parking is expensive
review.positiveRemarks: great location great gym bar and restaurant.  food is a bit expensive and wifi is not free otherwise great hotel.. you should ask for a specific room
review.negativeRemarks: wifi should be free

review.title: slappy work here and there, but good location.
review.reviewText: service on front desk, room service, was good. but room was not very clean. Found  some hair in bath tub and in bed. Very lazy doorman. Location is great.

review.title: Classic San Francisco hotel with great history.
review.reviewText: I think for the price of the hotel, the rooms could be kicked up a notch.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean, quality rooms. Location is great if you need to be in the thick of Union Square or downtown. The restaurants and bar in the hotel are good
review.negativeRemarks: Pricing is high for the room, room service, and parking.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: I had a great time. The service was excellent and everyone was very helpful.

review.title: Excellent hotel in the heart of SF
review.reviewText: Good location, nice view and spacious room.  The staff was courteous and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Luxurious feeling  throughout, and the bathrobes were divine..
review.negativeRemarks: More drawer space
review.locationRemarks: Union Square area close to all transportation, shopping and  many of SF's attractions

review.title: Perfect location in Union Square
review.reviewText: This hotel is an old one but beautifully kept and super comfy. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Super close to Bart and Trolley car. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because it was loud.  There was either a generator or an a/c unit outside that we could hear all night... BUT it didn't keep us up, we were out late every night and as soon as we got back we were able to fall asleep. It was just noticeable while you were hanging out.. I absolutely love this hotel and will definitely stay here again!!

review.title: Not much bang for your buck
review.reviewText: Good, over all, but why in this day and age do big hotel chains still charge for wi-fi in the room? It's like your parents charging you to use the kitchen when you visit!

review.title: Great Location, Noisy Pipes
review.reviewText:
Staying in Union square is SF is great, but hearing all the other guest flushing is not so nice. The room had no view, but was rather large and spacious. Furniture was a bit worn, and we were surprised to find condiments and wine glasses outside the room on our arrival. I thought someone might still be in there.

Bed and bedding was nice.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: A great stay in a lovely hotel. location was spot-on as there was a lot of great shopping within 10 minutes walk. The cable car runs past outside the front door and it was only about a five minute walk from the Powell Station BART station. We came off an international long haul flight, caught the BART from the airport and walked to the Hotel within about an hour and a half.
