The hop-on hop-off buses have a stop right opposite the hotel outside Macys. There is a great range of eating establishments with in five minutes walk of the Hotel if you wan to eat out. We really enjoyed San Francisco, it was a great icy and had a nice relaxed feeling to it.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the room, the decor and the staff
review.negativeRemarks: Not much comes to mind
review.locationRemarks: Great location for transport, shopping and food and watching the world go by in Union Squar

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We had a blast....top of the mark sucks.   More extractions with facials.  Lemonade in lobby was a treat!!

review.title: Not happy with accommodation
review.reviewText: I booked an updated king room a week in advance for a special occasion.  Upon arrival I was told that the hotel overbooked their king rooms. I was offered a hotel credit of $50 and a room with a queen bed. Having no choice I had to accept and was given a small outdated room. I was very disappointed being that I was familiar with the hotel and knew what they had in king rooms.

review.title: Classic hotel on Union Square
review.reviewText: When we booked our 4 night stay, we searched for a hotel with character which exemplified the city of San Francisco.  We chose St Francis as it had history, architecture and a story to tell (other options were too modern - where you can find in any city). We were celebrating our 20 year anniversary and  a complementary bottle of champagne and lovely chocolate coated strawberries were sent to our room.  The views from our room across the city to the bay were spectacular with the fog rolling in.  The grand king room was well appointed with plenty of room.  You will have to stay 24 floors or higher in the tower section for the views. The front desk staff were also very accommodating and did their best to get us a room at the highest possible level.  The external glass elevators were a treat. St Francis is in the best location across Union Square; the hop on hop off buses and cable car are just across the street; and shopping at the door step OMG!  The concierge staff were helpful and recommended a few great restaurants. The down side was that the carpet was not very clean in our room and the cost.  Beware - it is a very expensive hotel to stay, however you pay for the location and the history. It was worth the experience!
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the character & architecture. Felt like stepping into a grand era. Grand king rooms were modern & spacious. Best of all - LOCATION!
review.negativeRemarks: Ensure carpets in rooms are vacuumed really well,as there was hair on carpet.
review.locationRemarks: Hop on hop off  to take you to Alcatraz, Golden Gate Bridge, Fisherman Wharf etc, excellent shopping inc SAKS & Macys, fantastic restaurants

review.title: WESTIN ST FRANCIS HOTEL SAN FRANCISCO
review.reviewText: Hello, It is labor day 9-1-2014.  My wife and I as well as our two children, Rocksey & Ginger , two beautiful female Dashound Dogs stayed at your hotel this last weekend. My wife being of Philippino descent had never been to San Francisco, and I made it happen this weekend, We live in Beautiful Shasta County near Lake Shasta. We arrived Friday Morn. to your hotel. {this was my choice as I believe the Westin St Francis is my choice hotel when going to San Francisco. Your Staff from the time we arrived, till the time of checkout, was so friendly and helpful, my wife was so impressed. The Registration Counter Staff was great, Your Conseiars, your maids, and everyone made our weekend a "Great One". Your staff as well as a lot of guests, showed so much attention to our two little weiner dogs, the people ask to take photos of the dogs as well. My wife still comments on how Lovely & well maintained the hotel is. And no corners were cut, when it came to the construction & finish work. Again Thank you the Staff of the" Hotel Westin St Francis Union Square" San Francisco.  D. Rick & Marlyn Jones
review.positiveRemarks: The whole Hospitality setting, I can see that with all the employees, really enjoy there jobs & take great stride in making sure your stay great.
review.negativeRemarks: Free Internet Access
review.locationRemarks: Having brought two small dogs, we did the tour bus travel this time on 3 different bus rides & enjoyed every minute.

review.title: Hometown Escape
review.reviewText: I just wanted a night to myself, so I last minute booked here.  The lobby and main areas are a bit too crowded and busy for my local girl tastes, but I was blown away by the room.  It was huge, lovely, modern while still being and SF classic.  I just kept telling people, I cannot believe how great the room is!  The bed was so comfy, and I slept wonderfully.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators are tricky as heck.  Doorman didn't offer to help me with my bags when I arrived.

review.title: Near union square
review.reviewText: Hotel is good but we have window that see the big hole off hotel

review.title: Nice downtown hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful property, excellent location, nice large rooms, but not well maintained and in desperate need of refurbishment, service was very average.
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping was shabby as were curtains, carpets, and room furniture.
review.locationRemarks: Only hotel actually in union square, in the heart of main shopping and dining area.

review.title: Best hotel in S.F.
review.reviewText: We had the best view of union square. The room was beautiful and very spacious. The bed was unreal and so were the pillows. The westin spares no expenses for comfort. Definitely coming back here.

review.title: Wonderful room   Great location
review.reviewText: As a family of 4 with 2 grown children, we had plenty of room to spread out in a large room with a view of Union Square in heart of San Francisco.  The staff recommended some excellent places to eat all within walking distance.  We had a great low key meal at Jasper's Corner Tap as well as a great steak dinner at John's Grill.
review.positiveRemarks: All members of the staff were very friendly and helpful.  They made us feel welcome and comfortable during our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: It is a little pricey to park your car in the garage, so I would recommend utilizing the plentiful sources of public transportation to get around.
review.locationRemarks: Within 2 blocks we could get on a cable car that took us down to the waterfront.  At Union Square you can hop on a bus and get a tour of the city.

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: We were supposed to go to Jikton for a function and was supposed to stay there. So glad we didn't! At Hikton I didn't like the atmosphere! Staying at St Francis was awesome! Nice rooms and great staff!  Thank you!!!

review.title: Great hotel in union square
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very helpful. They were able to check me in early after a very long day of travel. I shared the room with three other friends and we felt that we had more than enough room. Beds were very confortable and the bathroom was beautiful.

review.title: Classic hotel
review.reviewText:
This is a classic hotel in a great location.   The staff was very helpful.  The front desk concierge helped my wife settle into the lobby while I returned our rental car.  

My only complaint was that at check in time of 3pm, our room was not ready.  At 3:45pm, I was invited to check in.  After receiving my room key I asked if it was in the tower building, per the reservation.  It was not.  While our room was very nice, it had absolutely no view, which I was looking for when I specifically reserved a tower room.  The front desk clerk then offered to let me wait for a tower room, but suggested it would be a long wait.  We were tired from traveling, so we accepted the interior room.  It seems to me, when a hotel provides a check in time, they should have the staff to insure rooms are ready at that time.  And if the type of room on the reservation is not available, they should let the customer know up front that they are not getting the preferred room and then offer some type of compensation.
review.positiveRemarks: Classic charm with tall ceilings, large hallways, chandeliers.  Very nice room.
review.negativeRemarks: Check in timeliness.
review.locationRemarks: BART/MUNI nearby, cable cars across the street.

review.title: great hotel.. close to everything
review.reviewText:
rooms very clean
elevator system the best I have ever used
line ups for access to the concierge
close proximity to most of what San Francisco has to offer
we had a great time
would recommend this hotel to everyone
review.positiveRemarks: my friend stay here every time she is in the city

review.title: Perfect location!
review.reviewText:
This hotel is in the middle of everything! All the shopping you need is just outside the door. And union square is where you can find anything to do, from a double decker tour to the famous trolley ride. Everything else is just a short cab ride $7-$10 to just about anywhere! 
The hotel is historic and beautiful. My only issue was that they offered the 'green' experience. Which we thought was just not changing sheets. Well it turned out that if you choose the 'green' option, no one will touch your room. I would have liked the room to be cleaned, bed made and replacement of any towels as needed. We came back from our day out to an unkept room. Wasn't a fan of that! Oh well...I guess I know for next time.

review.title: excellent location
review.reviewText: great hotel. Though the hotel is very expensive, I was surprised that we had to pay for wifi in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: include wifi in the room rate.  more table and chairs to seat in the lobby. it was very crowded in the morning during breakfast
review.locationRemarks: the city tour buses park just in front.  the start line of one the cable car is very close.  Shopping stores very close.

review.title: Wonderful hotel.
review.reviewText: We had a great stay. Very nice hotel that is convenient to everything.  Lots of amenities. Friendly staff. Would stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the beds were so comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: To provide free internet in rooms.

review.title: Great Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This was our first time in SF, and the Westin was the perfect place to stay for comfort, cleanliness, convenience and very helpful conscierres. We would highly recommend this hotel, as our experience with it was great.
review.negativeRemarks: not that I can think of
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located, as we walked to Chinatown, Pier 39, high end shopping, restaurants

review.title: Great location, on Union Square!
review.reviewText: Easy check in. Beautiful room. Very helpful staff.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, food at Bourbon Street restaurant
review.negativeRemarks: The staff had not finished the room clean (poorly made bed, didn't empty the garbage). Reception gave me extra points earned and offered extra points!

review.title: Center of Everything
review.reviewText: The hotel is a great location for exploring SF.  You are very close to all the tourist attractions and mass transit is a few blocks away at most.  I would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, large rooms, nice views in the newer tower.
review.locationRemarks: Near everything.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Older hotel but updated & modern touches. Very convenient in Union Square to all the attractions.  The staff was excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: It took a while for the hot water in the sink to become hot.  Shower was fine, just the sink.
review.negativeRemarks: Faster warm water in the sink.

review.title: Expensive, but comfortable
review.reviewText: I spent 5 nights at the Westin St. Francis for a work trip. I found the staff to be pleasant, the decor splendid, and the bed incredibly comfortable. My room in the Tower was quite nice, although surprisingly small for the price tag. That said, I don't think you're likely to find a better deal for a hotel in the heart of San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable bed, nice staff, very clean, plenty of in-hotel services.
review.negativeRemarks: Better dinner options at The Oak Room.

review.title: Very accommodating staff.
review.reviewText: Joy was more than helpful when I checked into the hotel. We were early arriving due to our flight and she went above and beyond to get us checked in and into our room early.

review.title: Excellent hotel and great location!
review.reviewText: I love the stay in The Westin St Francis (tower building). It's right in Union Sqaure. Excellent location! The room is big enough to accommodate two people and the king size bed is generous and very comfortable!
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent location and heavenly bed. Bathroom is great (very clean and big).
review.negativeRemarks: I was disturbed by the staff for house keeping.
review.locationRemarks: Enjoy the city view, fine dining and lots of shopping in Union square. Go for a ride in a cable car and so on.

review.reviewText: Very friendly and focused staff.  Really wanted to make sure we had a great visit!  Went above and beyond!

review.title: Summer in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Love this place and it isn't the first time I've stayed here.  My only issue was the room was warm so the air conditioning didn't seem to be working that well, but to be fair I didn't call to ask for service.    Crazy that they don't have free WIFI.  With the price of a hotel night and quality of the overall service, free wifi should definitely be included.
review.positiveRemarks: location and beauty of staying in something other than a glass box.
review.negativeRemarks: free wifi
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to everything - shopping, great restaurants, tour buses, trolly cars etc. Wonderful activities in Union Square.

review.title: Magical weekend with my niece
review.reviewText: My 18 year old niece and I planned a very special shopping weekend at the Westin for he high school graduation gift.  We lounged on the Westin's Heavenly Beds, watched movies, ordered room service - which was very timely and high quality.  The service was excellent.  . This hotel is classy,  with excellent customer service, perfect location for shopping, sight seeing, the theater or just for relaxing and enjoying the activities in Union Square.  We will definitely come again!!
review.positiveRemarks: We love the décor of this hotel and the friendly, accommodating staff.  The food and drinks are excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: I really can't think of anything and I have traveled extensively!
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is right on Union square in the center of the best shopping area.  There are several world renowned restaurants within walking distance.

review.title: Ok stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and pleasant to stay in...our only problem was the toilet.  After a couple of flushes, it wouldn't stop flushing.  We called the front desk to have someone come in and fix it.  The technician showed up promptly, fixed the toilet and left.  We didn't use the toilet until the next morning only to find out that it would not flush.  We checked out and told the front desk about our situation.  They were nice enough to waive our parking.

review.title: Could be nicer.  fees, fees, fees.......
review.reviewText:
The hotel, room, etc was pretty nice.  Checking in and out was not as great, checking in, line of people, only 3 staff doing check ins, 10 computers available.  Checking out, had to stand in line, only 1 person at the computer, I wanted a receipt, but they did not drop off at the room anymore, so line for me.  Probably waited 15 minutes.

Parking, valet only.  Pretty pricey, would have been nice to know before I arrived, and I think it should be included part of the nightly fees anyways, but just my thought. 

I guess if you're paying this much for a hotel stay, you should expect separate fees for everything.
review.negativeRemarks: Fees, fees, fees, for everything, no internet as part of your stay, you had to pay for that too.

review.title: Awesome Union Square Location
review.reviewText:
I stayed at the St. Francis for a "girl's trip" with my sister and 16 year old niece.  It was my niece's first time in San Francisco and we wanted a special experience.  The foyer is grand and opulent and the history is evident.  The hotel was all that we hoped for.  We stayed in a Tower Room which was spacious and modern.  The bedding was wonderful and the bed was very comfortable.  The towels and bathroom essentials were nice, too.  The view wasn't great but we came to San Francisco to be out about so it was okay.  

We took the BART from SFO and walked the 3 or so blocks to the hotel so it was very convenient.  The concierge was quite informative and made some good restaurant recommendations.  (We found the "Four Seas" in Chinatown on our own..great Dim Sum and highly recommended by the 3 of us) 
The St Francis was all that we hoped for and more.  When my husband and I go back to San Francisco we would stay here...it's a beautiful and historic hotel and the convenience is perfect.  It was worth every penny we paid.  If you are looking for a memorable San Francisco stay, this is the place for you.
review.positiveRemarks: We especially liked the convenient location and the

review.title: Tourist trap not up to Westin standards.
review.reviewText:
You would think that you could count on Westin in a large market like San Francisco to deliver a quality experience and room.  Not at this "Grand" old hotel.

The lobby, room and entire property was worn like an old shoe.  The carpet was shabby.  My room was "upgraded" due to being a SPG frequent traveler.  I could not have been more disappointed.

The bed, while comfortable, was not a Heavenly Bed. My room was dirty, bathroom stocked with towels that had someone's hair on two of them.  It was not pleasant.

I arrived late after a very long day of travel and work.  If it had not been 10PM at check in, I would have insisted on something being done.  

I would not recommend this hotel at all.  It was not inexpensive but it should have been.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was great.  Positive, accommodating and professional.
review.negativeRemarks: Dirty, tired and looking like a worn hotel that needs attention.  They are resting on their location and reputation.
review.locationRemarks: Noisy, lots of street people and tourists.

review.title: Excellent service, clean hotel.
review.reviewText: Great hotel to stay at. Very close to many eateries and shops. The concierge was fabulous! Very knowledgable and provided excellent service!
review.locationRemarks: Awesome! Cable cars and BART system nearby which makes it easy to get around the city. We did not rent a car for this reason. Saved us a bunch.

review.title: Fancy noisy hotel.
review.reviewText: The hotel is elegant, however, there is loud "hip hop" music in the lobby making the hotel less than serene.  If you are looking for a party atmosphere, would be fine, but 6am is not when I want to hear loud music.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel itself is well kept, and feels very safe. It is in a very busy part of San Francisco
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was very expensive. It was better to find off site parking. The room itself was very small, but the bed was comfortable.

review.reviewText: Perfect location with well appointed and generous rooms. We stayed in a corner king room (room 1209) and it was an incredible view of Union Square. Highly recommend!
review.locationRemarks: Perfect Location! Close to Bart, trolley, tourist buses and walkable to nearly everywhere.

review.title: Awesome location
review.reviewText: Everything was awesome except Room was a little small and the bed was uncomfortable.

review.title: Concierge of Westin hotel is very helpful
review.reviewText:
The concierge provided us all the places we must see and how to go as we didn't have the San Francisco bus ride guide.  We would like to thank Raymond and Kristy from the Concierge as without them our trip would not be that perfect.  

The SuperShuttle is a very good choice with good price for us to transport to airport too as we had a early flight and 6 persons with 6 luggages.
review.locationRemarks: Close to downtown and lots of cafe and restaurants, shopping malls like Macy.  Close to cable car terminal too.

review.title: Super convenient location
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff was excellent from bellman, to house keeper! Everyone was helpful and friendly. The only thing is there's no pool in the hotel. It would have been nice after a day of running around to soak in hot tub for a bit. The hotel does offer passes to a fitness club a block away but we did not want to do that. 
We stayed in the newer tower and the room was roomy. Even though the beds were double it felt mora like two queen beds.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to shopping, sites & cable car.
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a safe area and we were dropped off in front of the hotel every evening while riding the cable car, which is an experience!
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, shopping, eating, etc.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location opposite union square.
review.reviewText: My experience was great and will return to the westin when again back on vacation in San Fran..

review.title: Year end stay
review.reviewText: My wife, my daughter and I had a VERY nice experience staying in this hotel. We especially enjoyed the views from the room towards Union Square and the City.
review.positiveRemarks: Firendly staff, great room, excellent location.
review.negativeRemarks: Price

review.title: On Union Square!
review.reviewText: Hotel Staff very friendly, attentive, professional.

review.title: Very Disappointing
review.reviewText: Reserved a room with 2 beds; got a room with 1 bed.  Hotel staff was not helpful.  Room was extremely noisy, the décor old and worn out and not what one would expect from a premium hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: décor, staff, service

review.title: Nice Hotel close to a lot of activities ..
review.reviewText: The hotel and staff were great But we got put in the older section of the Hotel. The room was very clean but a bit noisy and outdated. The Location was great with its proximity to shopping, restaraunts, and bars.
review.negativeRemarks: Staying in the newer section
review.locationRemarks: Location was great. Shopping / Bars / Food / Sightseeing

review.title: Very nice place!
review.reviewText: The Westin St. Francis is a beautiful building on Union Square.  Although a bit pricey, we had an excellent stay there and would certainly consider staying there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Very comfortable, soft and comfy beds :)
review.locationRemarks: We went to SF for a particular event, but there are so many things to do in San Francisco!

review.title: Excellent hotel right on Union Square.
review.reviewText: We had booked to stay in another hotel in San Francisco but it turned out to be so awful that we had to find a much better place to stay. The Westin St Francis was fantastic and did not disappoint. We'd read reviews about no free wifi in the rooms but there is free wifi in the guest lobby where you can get a drink, something to eat and surf to your hearts content so not having wifi in the room is not an issue at all. We'd recommend this hotel anytime and will be staying in it on our next visit for sure.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Excellent accommodations. Close proximity to union square, safe area, great view and nice staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is too high! $62 overnight

review.title: Westin St Francis Review
review.reviewText: Great experience at the hotel.  Very accommodating and friendly staff along with the beautiful hotel itself.  Excellent location for Union Square shopping and dining.
review.negativeRemarks: Add more weight equipment to the fitness center and improve the ventilation of the fitness facility.

review.title: Great Hotel!! Fabulous Location!!
review.reviewText: Location can't be beat!!  Only a couple of blocks walk from the BART and Trolley turnabout. No need to rent a car or take a taxi.   Arrived early morning and was prepared to check luggage until later in day.  Pleasantly surprised that they had a room available for us (and it was even an upgrade).  Room was updated and in a recently renovated section of the hotel.  Nice decor, spacious and comfortable.  Will definitely stay there again!!..... Staff, accommodations & location were great!!
review.positiveRemarks: Liked it all.  There really wasn't anything we didn't like.
review.locationRemarks: Directly across from Union Square.  Close to shopping/restaurants.  Walking distance (about 1.5 mi) to Wharf, Lombard, China Town, Nob Hill etc.

review.title: Loud and the Gym is marginal.
review.reviewText: You can hear your neighbor snore and have conference calls. The gym is to small and not useful given the size of the hotel. Other than that the stay way great.

The woman who checked us in was very pleasant and helpful, as well as the concierge when we asked about ferry schedules and how to get to the ferry building.
All around enjoyable stay.
review.locationRemarks: The location was great!  Walk straight down Powell and get to Muni, or the buses to the ferry bldg., Golden Gate Park. Union Sqr right across the st.

review.title: Cannot beat location
review.reviewText: Great hotel, and located right in the heart of Union Square and close to everything. Staff was helpful if ever needed and pointed us to right direction when needed. Classy place, than you Westin!
review.locationRemarks: Visit Anabelle's you will NOT be disappointed.

review.title: Great location, beautiful hotel.
review.reviewText: We have used the hotel before. Great overall experience.

review.title: great hotel and location!!
review.reviewText: couldn't have been better! very clean, friendly staff and great location
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: great restaurants, shopping, transportation just outside the hotel; BART train from the SFO arrives just 2-3 blocks away.

review.title: Great stay-well worth it!
review.reviewText:
Our stay at the Westin St. Francis was excellent. The grand deluxe room in the tower building was clean and very spacious. The heavenly beds were "heavenly" and a great treat to indulge yourself in after a long full day of sightseeing SFO. Our room was on the 28 floor with incredible city view and the glass elevators to our floor (tower building) had city and bay views. If you can, request higher floors as it will be quieter and better views (hotel right on a very busy main road).

Hotel is centrally located to shopping, restaurants, transportation (cable cars, muni, Bart and tour bus companies. Chinatown gates is within walking distance and cable car stop is in front of hotel. Walgreens is half a block away so you can pick up snacks or meals to take back to your room.

Front desk and concierge staff was very friendly and helpful. Housekeeping promptly attended to my request. A great service that the hotel provided was an airline checkin machine to get your boarding pass 24 hours in advance (depending on your airline policy). The Oak Room restaurant is a little pricey but very good food (I had the flat iron steak and was cooked perfectly to my liking).

In short, I would recommend this hotel and definitely stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Free wifi in your room, although the hotel has free wifi in the lobby with relaxing sitting areas to talk or work on your computer.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We had a great stay in the Westin Hotel union square, the location is outstanding every thing is walking distance from the hotel

review.title: 4 nights in SF
review.reviewText:
Recently spent 4 nights at The Westin on Memorial Day weekend which we were not away of until we arrived but the hotel was fantastic.
Rooms and location exceeded our expectation and the weather was amazing.

review.title: very nice hotel and an excellent location
review.reviewText: Great location, very comfortable, the staff very nice, quick check inn and out.
review.negativeRemarks: The view of my room wasn´t nice
review.locationRemarks: Very good location and close to everithing

review.title: Very nice and convenient hotel
review.reviewText: A very nice room and good service but if you want food at the hotel it very overpriced. Good but pricey. I would still stay here. Pick the tower. Great view.
review.negativeRemarks: Food is pricey.
review.locationRemarks: Location is perfect.

review.title: Great hotel on Union Square
review.reviewText: We had a great time at the St. Francis celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary in San Francisco. It is a beautiful, historic hotel on Union Square. So many things to do & see within walking distance of the hotel. The only snag was the handle for the shower kept breaking (too many plastic pieces). The hotel set us up in a day room so we could shower & then put us in a new room. The staff was very apologetic for the inconvenience & comp'd our parking fees, gave us a free breakfast, & free wi-fi for our troubles. We will be back for #30 or 35!
review.positiveRemarks: It's historical background w/ pictures of movie stars & dignitaries visiting there, it's location on U ion Square, the heavenly bed. Great staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Higher grade plumbing fixtures. Seriously, how many times will the broken plastic piece keep them from having rooms available?
review.locationRemarks: Union Square has so many stores. Chinatown, North Beach, French Quarter, financial district all nearby. Cable car stop in front of hotel.

review.title: Hotel is old. Not what I expected from Westin.
review.reviewText: Hotel is old and not what you'd expect from a Westin hotel. Our room was old looking and smelled moldy and because we stayed one night, we thought we could tolerate it. The lobby was beautiful and staff professional, attentive and polite. I just could not get over our room which affected our overall experience which was just ok.

review.title: The room werent as clean , bad customer service
review.reviewText: The bed sheets were smelling really bad, you never get any of the order from room service, and the staff werent responsible.

review.title: GREAT HOTEL! GREAT LOCATION!
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the perfect location! Beautiful hotel, friendly staff.... just overall amazing!
review.negativeRemarks: Add a pool
review.locationRemarks: EVERYTHING is close by! Right at your door step actually.

review.title: Great hotel. Great location.
review.reviewText: Everything ran smoothly. The locations was perfect.

review.title: Horrible experience
review.reviewText: I reserved "adjoining" rooms for myself and my three sisters. I was told there would be a door that connects the rooms that we could open. When we checked in early, the staff said the room was not ready. My sister gave her cell phone # and we sat at the bar in the lobby and waited for the phone call. After almost 2 hours we went up to the front desk and were told that our rooms were 8 doors down from each other. We waited for another 45 minutes to speak to a manager. Finally they got us rooms next to each other. They did comp us our drinks and put a bottle of wine in each room. But the initial sting of that encounter ruined my opinion of that hotel forever. I will never go back!

review.title: Fabulous!!
review.reviewText: Fab! Very nice., staff, room, libations and location. Will be going again!!

review.title: excellent hotel with great staff !
review.reviewText: we had a wonderful stay at the westin st francis. Location is ideal to visit SF Union Square. Staff was courteous and upgraded us to a bigger room in landmark tower - really nice.
Great experience. Very helpful check in people The new elevator call buttons work very well and efficiently. We stayed in the new part of the hotel

Charging for Wi-Fi is a really TACKY policy. It feels like the airlines--looking for every opportunity to increase revenue. Just raise your room rate a dollar or so and you will not leave your guests with a sour taste in their mouth.
review.negativeRemarks: Institute Free Wi-Fi - it's not like it is denying others access to the internet (as is the case regarding the business services computers.

review.title: $60 a day for parking and $40 for eggs.
review.reviewText: Newly remodeled tower building is like a bad 80's nightmare. Rooms are like an econolodge and everything but the bathroom is ugly. Smells like vomit and ammonia. For an old Hotel, there is no style in the lobby or bar. EVERYTHING costs an arm and a leg... We got the upgraded suite and still it was small and cheesy. I have seen better decor in a holiday inn.
review.negativeRemarks: Decoration is cheap and UGLY... Carpet Paintings or prints lamps furniture all screams Made in China.
review.locationRemarks: SF has become too crowded. The Finite space of the city does not lend itself well to its current popularity. So sad to see the greatest city playedout

review.title: Weekend Getaway
review.reviewText: My wife and I needed an escape for the weekend and the St Francis did not disappoint! To be honest, we have spent at least 15 weekends here over the years, and we absolutely love it! Great location, great service, great memories !
Great location, right on Union Square, which also makes getting in/out a pain because there's traffic all the time.  Rooms are fairly small, just a bed, no other space really.

review.title: Bit disappointed
review.reviewText: Lobby, bar and staff were great. However, the noise level between rooms was off the charts. I expect street noise when staying in Union Square, but not hearing TV's, toilets flushing, tap water being turned off/on, heavy stomping, voices caring from room above and next door. I stayed for 3 nights and was not able to get a full nights sleep. Room décor was dated, I expected a bit more given the $300 per night bill. I wouldn't choose to stay again, but would go back to the bar, and restaurant.

review.title: Booked hotel thru Expedia.
review.reviewText: Received a room in older section of hotel. Old grungy and very small room. Room faced another section of their building and we could see people in their rooms on other side of building. Requested change and was given another grungy room but building across way was a little further away so a bit more private. Sold room to us at full rate that we paid the second night for a room in the newer building , room was comfortable. Took two hours to sort out Expedia booking and overall experience of hotel was off putting due to delays and bad room first evening. I would not use this hotel again or Expedia. Parking extra on already prime rate.
review.negativeRemarks: Stop selling old room at top rates. Remodel old section. Parking could be less expensive
review.locationRemarks: Prime location with many great shops and restaurants.

review.reviewText: Very clean and nice. Very good for the price. Would stay there again.
Location is the best. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The only down side we experienced was a smoke smell in the room and I was sure we booked a non-smoking room.

review.title: Great location, great staff
review.reviewText:
Can't beat location and staff were excellent.  Actually left charger for Mac book air at home and the front desk had one for us.

Try to find a hotel that has that specific laptop charger in stock!!  Not very likely.

review.title: Nice hotel with small rooms, spoiled by "policy"
review.reviewText:
This hotel appears great, until you deal with the staff. Bell Desk members who stand in your way, waiting for a tip, while you are trying to unload your kids from a car. They knock on the door, over and over, even with a Do Not Disturb sign on it. The maid cleans the room, but leaves any drinks on the tables (like Starbucks coffee cups).

It's a great location and a nice hotel, totally ruined by the service.
review.negativeRemarks: The service.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square.

review.reviewText:
room was small and window overlooked inner corridor...dark and depressing
noise from adjoining rooms made it feel like a college dorm.
we were approached by a beligerent homeless man in the lobby waiting for the elevator
parking was ridiculously expensive
enjoyed the bar downstairs

review.title: Location Location Location
review.reviewText:
Fantastic location !!! Smack-bang @ Union Square.
Very easy access to famous cable cars, BART n bus system.
Lots of eating options right at the door step.
One phone call n our room was changed from 12th to 19th floor.
Concierge staff could be more courteous n helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Concierge staff could be more courteous n helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Smack bang @ Union Square !!! 1min walk to lots of restaurants, cafés, Starbucks, Macy's, Walgreens !!!

review.title: I love the beauty of the Landmark Tower.
review.reviewText: The staff was excellent, from valet, checkin reception to maids. We had a view room overlooking Union Square. This was very nice.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Small room, but very comfortable. Faces Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: A little dusty - a bit of attention to cleanliness is needed.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: Really liked this hotel overall-close to restaurants, shops, cable cars. Staff is super friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice gym! Old building has charm.
review.negativeRemarks: Small things-bathroom light switch is outside bathroom and little kids 6-8 years old in the gym on treadmills-mildly annoying & dangerous.
review.locationRemarks: Great location in Union Square.

review.title: Right in the center of city
review.reviewText: Very pleasant stay at this hotel. Room is immaculate and comfortable. Staff is very friendly. Conveniently situated at the heart of the city. Great stay!
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience and proximity to the activities in the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking, as in any major hotel, is very expensive.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: My husband and I went with our four kids and got an adjoining room. It was perfect for us. Being in Union Square gave us a lot to do in the short time we had in SF.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping in Union Square was a treat and we also went to Wesfield mall on market street for a little more shopping and Jamba Juice for the kids.

review.title: Long weekend in the heart of S.F.
review.reviewText: We hadn't stayed at the Westin St. Francis for some time (have been trying other hotels in S.F. lately), and while I absolutely love the grand-ness of the hotel, it's location, ambiance and popularity, I honestly think for what you get (regular deluxe King room), it is over-priced. The bathroom we had this time (11th floor) was about as small as one can be. I will say, the bed is amazingly comfortable! Quality sheets and linens, and wonderful. No doubt a gorgeous hotel, but for a standard room for the weekend -- I would rather go elsewhere for less money and get WAY more. SF is a city so easy to get around in - while not being in the heart of Union Square may seem like a downside...there are plenty of other beautiful hotels way more worth the $$$. The price is for the location more than it is for the quality of the room provided.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom size was ridiculously small (Rm 1169). Would recommend updating and remodeling.

review.title: Good location hotel
review.reviewText: Nice stay, good place, and amazing city. Just next to union square and you can take cable car to fisher wharf easily.

review.title: Great Hotel in a Great Location
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff, very well kept hotel, very clean, good sized room and bathroom. Location is excellent; Cable Car for Powell/Mason and Powell/Hyde passes entrance. Turntable is 3 blocks away; join the queue there to ensure you get a seat. Tourist Centre for info at Powell BART entrance. Buses along Market Street to Pier 39 and Alcatraz Cruises; Buses to Golden Gate Park (Museums and Japanese Tea Garden). Hotel is 2 blocks from Chinatown Gate. Union Square, relax and have a coffee or hit the shops. Good restaurants nearby; New Delhi for Indian, Jack's Grill (Maltese Falcon) for steak, plus lots more. Buy a City Pass!
review.negativeRemarks: Have someone stand at the lift/elevator to remind guests how to gain access to their floor!
review.locationRemarks: Union Square; Powell Street (Powell/Hyde, Powell/Mason) Cable Car passes by the entrance, Chinatown, Market Street, Shops, Coffee in the Square.

review.title: Exceptional Hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed for 6 days and were very pleased with the experience. The staff was exceptional across the board, friendly, accommodating, and very helpful. The hotel overall was very clean and well decorated and our room was quiet, large and clean. You can't beat the location right on Union Square in close proximity to restaurants of all kinds, shopping, and attractions. We will definitely stay there again.

review.title: St. Francis always meets expectations
review.reviewText: Stayed here in a tower deluxe room for the Easter long weekend. Ususally stay here once a year and the St Francis is always a consistent choice. Rooms are newly renovated, clean, comfortable and quiet. Staff is friendly and professional. Plus you can't beat the location. Close to everything, shopping, China town, cable car stop right in front and lots of great restaurants just steps away.

review.title: Old but central
review.reviewText: Old, small rooms, good restaurants (Bourbon steak house excellent). Spotty service (waited 4 hrs for room to get ready after 3pm checkin)

review.title: The Room
review.reviewText:
I consider the room very small. There were 2 chairs for sitting, 1 office type at the desk, the other a very small slipper chair type. The bed was comfortable enough for sleeping, but was up so high you could not sit there. The room had absolutely No view, it looked out at the windows of another building..

Air conditioning and fan were very loud....

Room service was ok, and the food acceptable, but we had dinner with some guests in the main restaurant, and the food at the best was bad, after trying a couple of bites, I did not eat mine.

We will not stay here on our next trip to SF
review.positiveRemarks: It has a nice history and is at Union Square
review.negativeRemarks: An improved lobby with places to sit
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to some great stores

review.title: Great hotel, staff and location.
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel and a wonderful experience from the moment I got to the lobby. After flying all night they quickly allowed me to check in and gave me and early checkin to boot! No hassle or fee! Staff was super sweet. Room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. I was in the older tower so no view but location was great!

review.title: union square
review.reviewText:
easy entry and sign up service.

seems geared to the business community
review.locationRemarks: location super

review.title: Switched Rooms
review.reviewText:
My reservation was for a queen room in the Landmark Building, which I was told on arrival was not available. I was accommodated in a king room in the Tower, which I assume was an upgrade. I was disappointed, however, because I had anticipated staying in the Landmark Building.

Once past that disappointment, everything else was fine and met my expectations for this type of hotel.

review.title: It was hideous in every way. They didn't hold a ro
review.reviewText: You should refund my money. It was the worst hotel experience of my life I don't want to relive it

review.title: Here's what I expected and what I got.
review.reviewText: Staying at the Westin downtown SF, you are walking distance of everything. Shopping , great restaurants, the whole nine. If that's what you're looking for, perfect - if you don't mind a small hotel room - seriously. The room was small - we had a "Queen" bed - didn't look like a queen to me. Between the wall and bed, there was maybe 4 feet on each side. Small bathroom, and additional closet was also crammed in there. For the price, ($260, $60 for overnight parking), I would not stay there again. You can stay a little further away, get a taxi and probably have more money to enjoy yourself.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, great restaurants.

review.title: Central hotel right on Union
review.reviewText: Stylish, comfortable hotel with friendly staff and a great restaurant. Room service hot chocolate was incredible.

review.title: Hotel at Union Square
review.reviewText: Arrived late evening and received a downgraded room (closet) since the one book was unavailable. SOunded as if I received a room consistent with an Expedia booking, not in a good way. Reeived modest but not full compensation. Room was changed the following day. New room was nice, no phone and a new mini bar and a room for handicapped. I expected the paint to still be wet.
review.negativeRemarks: Prefer no bait and switch room tactics

review.title: Good location for shopping and sight seeing.
review.reviewText:
Supper location for shopping and sightseing in référence to walking and the transportations.
Hotel's iconic history is interesting as well as amusing. Architectural details are so important to preserve and the Ansel Adams' photographs of the building blow me away! Thank you.
review.negativeRemarks: Keep it going as long as you can, preserving the architecture and it's history!
review.locationRemarks: Fabulous !

review.title: Lovely room and amazing room-service breakfast
review.reviewText: We stayed one night for a quick trip to the city. The staff was very helpful and courteous. Our room was simple, but very clean and comfortable. The location is great-- right on Union Square, with super easy taxi service to get to the wharf or anywhere else. We will definitely stay there again!

review.title: Last minute trip near union square.
review.reviewText: The bars and restaraunts were nice. However, for the price I would expect more out of the room. The room was incredibly small and felt clausterphobic. The tv would not work right and our view was of another building that had a window that looked directly in to ours.

review.title: Love this hotel!!
review.reviewText: Awesome hotel! Perfect location for Union Square!! Beautiful rooms and very nice people. Can't wait to go back!

review.title: Gave our room away
review.reviewText: We were disappointed with the hotel because when we arrived they did not have the king room in the tower building available, even though we pre paid for the hotel. They did credit us the additional cost we paid for the King and tower building but only in a hotel credit, not cash or credit card. Also, the only room that was available was a living room suite in the landmark building but it did not have a bedroom so they rolled in a cot for me to sleep on.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff is very nice and hotel is very clean dispite the old musty smell that goes with a landmark hotel .
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel should have credited me for my room since I did not get what I had booked and paid for :(

review.title: Great location in Union Square
review.reviewText: We stay at this hotel for the convenience of being in Union Square. It has a 5* restaurant located inside with a great lounge bar. However, we were disappointed in our room's bathroom. The toilet was one seen in a public lavatory.....you had to lower the lid each time to step on the lever to flush. The marble tile surrounding the base of the toilet was worn, stained and looked like it was always wet. There was no fan in the bathroom so after one person took a shower, another had to wait until the steam had lifted or put your make-up on or do your hair in the bedroom. The shampoo and conditioner were not of quality and we ended up buying our own at the nearby Walgreen's.
review.negativeRemarks: Please.....update the bathrooms!

review.title: Very nice quiet hotel
review.reviewText: Quiet lovely hotel. Near shopping and cable cars. We walked everywhere nearby china town, embarcadero, Asian Art museum, japan town, and Fillmore district. We were able to leave our luggage at the hotel while we took the cable car to Fishermans wharf and we had lunch there. We really appreciated The Westin St Francis - they took really good care of us. We will be back!

review.title: First time in SF
review.reviewText: Great staff at check in. Overall great experience. Nice room with fridge and comfy bed.
review.positiveRemarks: loved location and room in the towers
review.negativeRemarks: fridge not very cold but came up to temp fairly quick

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: The hotel was conveniently located in the heart of the city. We got to stay in the very recently updated room. Front staff was very friendly and gave us a free upgrade to a king size bed. Would definitely stay here again!!
review.positiveRemarks: Renovated room, location, $5 voucher for every day you do not have room changed over.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing - great hotel :)

review.title: Lovely historic hotel
review.reviewText: Had 3 nights here...staying at the St. Francis is always a pleasure.

review.title: Great place to stay.
review.reviewText: We had a great time and the staff was very helpful.
review.locationRemarks: I the heart of the city!

review.title: Great location and setting
review.reviewText: We wanted to stay in the city. This exceeded our expectations. We will be back

review.title: Fun right outside the front door.
review.reviewText:
I recently did an weekend stay at the St Francis. What a wonderful Hotel! The Chinease New Year was happening right outside the property. I could watch it from my room window.

The hotel has great history that you can learn throughout the spacious lobby. Great food inside and outside the hotel. Oh...though I don't care, so many do. There is a coffee maker in your room. And yes, they do charge a fee to stay there. Read the print, its there.

Cable cars are just a block away.

Union Square is just outside the front door. The weather was great...look forward to my return.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms are small, but the bed was comfortable, the room was really clean. The front staff got me checked in 4 hours early.
review.negativeRemarks: Well...not much the hotel can do about the homeless. They are a little aggressive. You can't make the room any larger, especially the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Name a type of food you like, and the area will have it. Its a great walking area. Cabs are plentiful. And the Wharf has a number of things to see.

review.title: conveniently located
review.reviewText: The room was clean,however one of the blinds was broken and there was a crack in the sink in the bathroom. Apart from that the room was well maintained by housekeeping during our stay.The hotel is well located for the bart, cable cars and other muni transportation. It is within distance to many attractions and shopping. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is central to everything,easy to get to.

review.title: Lovely old hotel, great service, worn in places.
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly, efficient and knowledgeable. Love the elevators. I had an older room, which was fine, but it looks a little worn in places. A very loud fan when the heat came on.
review.positiveRemarks: I love hotels that keep their historical feel, and the St. Francis has retained it in places. My room had a little chandelier, for instance.
review.negativeRemarks: Musty smell in halls. A too loud fan in my room. Also a loose faucet.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is the best of the best. Fabulous shopping, restaurants, bars, theaters, galleries, and transportation - right outside the door.

review.title: Front desk staff very surly, rest of staff great!
review.reviewText:
Front desk staff was not friendly or helpful at all. Very abrubt and surly.

Concierge was very pleasant and helpful.

Housekeeping and room service very accommodating and helpful.

review.title: Expected more from a nice hotel
review.reviewText: When we checked in, we were given a key to a room that was already occupied. Fortunately, that person wasn't around when we opened their door, but that's a pretty huge screw-up that left me wondering what was to stop someone else from coming into my room? On top of that, they tried to charge us for parking during our stay, even though we didn't have a car. Beyond that, the room was on the small side, with very few accessible plugs. There was a coffee maker in the room that we had to move into the bathroom to use because there simply weren't any outlets within reach of its actual storage place.
review.positiveRemarks: I love the location, and the Bourbon Steak restaurant is fantastic.
review.negativeRemarks: Service, security, convenience, facilities
review.locationRemarks: It's in Union Square in San Francisco. There's tons nearby.

review.title: Excellent location for tourist experience
review.reviewText: We had 4 days to explore San Francisco & this was centrally located for all the cultural events & restaurants that we visited. The staff were very helpful in getting tickets & suggesting restaurants & making reservations.
review.positiveRemarks: Location & service at a reasonable price.
review.negativeRemarks: The air quality. Our room was a little stuffy for sleeping.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located for transportation, great restaurants nearby, major department stores & other shopping next door.

review.title: Leisurely night in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I had a good nights stay at the Westin St Francis in SF. Should have made it longer.
review.positiveRemarks: The comfortable bed and the glass elevators.
review.locationRemarks: Great location and many things to do. Theaters and food.

review.title: Great hotel to stay at.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, and the staff was generous. The food was great and the bar was elegant.

review.title: Center of Union Square
review.reviewText: Booked a classic queen. Small but just right for one person or two. Clean and staff is friendly and classy.

review.title: Great location, average hotel
review.reviewText: The location could not have been better. However, the accommodations were average at best. The room was outdated, dusty, the vents were dirty and the chairs had tears in them. I expected more. I will stick with the boutique hotels in the area.

review.title: Old section could use a remodel
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel in most respects, but the original rooms have redone bathrooms, and they need to redo the rooms themselves. Need better sitting at least. Rooms are like a $100 motel.

review.title: St. Francis: excellent
review.reviewText: The old section of the hotel has plenty of character, and we really enjoy those rooms. My wife left her purse in the main area while waiting for our car. When we returned one hour later, the staff responded immediately and with empathy to our plight, and they found the purse in security. The head of housekeeping, Max, was particularly active in the search. We had a wonderful stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing, since they returned the clock to its rightful place. My parents met under the clock before World War II.
review.locationRemarks: Hike up to Nob and Russian Hills around Grace Cathedral, then down to the Wharf and Crissey Field, dinner at Scoma's.

review.title: Never again
review.reviewText:
I'm very disappointed in the room we where given, not only was it small but the room had a bad smell. Very noisy and a very small bed.
I will never stay here again nor would I recommend this to anyone,
Especially for the high rates they charge I would expect much more.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel and a great location. A little pricey but would stay again.

review.title: St Francis Westin Hotel is magnificent!
review.reviewText: Fantastic guest services, phenomenal bar downstairs (The Clock Bar), and terific gym and spa. Definitely my favorite hotel in the states.

review.title: Good Union Square Hotel.
review.reviewText: Good hotel , pleasant atmosphere, old and new part (I was in the old section). I was upgraded at reception- always a plus! I was only there for 3 nights for a conference. Helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi didn't work in room but got refunded (although I think all 4 and 5 star hotels need to provide free wifi.
review.locationRemarks: Union square. Bustling. Tram on doorstep. Great ships nearby and easy access for everything.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location, super comfortable beds
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location. This was my first time to San Fran and I was so happy I ended up here. The staff is great. The rooms are very spacious. My only complaint is that there's no free WIFI. Seems like for a hotel of this price/caliber, WIFI should be included. If you want WIFI, you have to pay $14.95 a day! The cafe is super expensive too - almost $4 for a small bottle of water. But overall, it was a great stay.

review.title: Beautiful Historic Building-Hallway noise is loud
review.reviewText:
What can I say, the building is beautiful, it's in the heard of Union Square, everything is in walking distance, loved the place. I would definitely stay here again.

My only gripes were the ghost stories - google it, and the noise from the hallways seemed to reverberate sound louder than in other hotels. The loudness could be attributed to the high ceilings and the composition of the walls/hardwood doors. We stayed two nights and each night I could hear people down the hall coming and going from their rooms and dishes clanking from room service trays being put out.
review.negativeRemarks: Give patrons an option to stay in the newer hotel tower instead of shoving them in the old haunted building.
review.locationRemarks: Mall, designer stores, bars, cafe's, everything to eat, and of course the SF Cable Cars.

review.title: Breath taking and memorable
review.reviewText: Perfect getaway with the perfect person ....forever cherished !

review.title: Superb location, not luxury, I can stay again
review.reviewText: The hotel was really good located, good facilities, but I don't like to much drunk people in the lobby and smell like club.
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrade restaurants and upgrade some rooms

review.title: Central
review.reviewText: We went during a very busy time of year. More staff would have been appreciated.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds/Pillows/Linens could be upgraded.
review.locationRemarks: Lots and lots of shopping. The hotel was very central for all the activities we wanted to do.

review.reviewText: Great restaurant and wine list; central and historic location; helpful staff; large comfortable room.

review.title: nicely located in SF. Rooms old and very small,
review.reviewText: Hotel rooms need to be renovated, very small including bathrooms, water in shower is poor. Need more staff on front desk to help guests.
review.positiveRemarks: great location and lobby is great
review.negativeRemarks: see above
review.locationRemarks: great location with lots of shops near by

review.positiveRemarks: Great location and very friendly and helpful staff
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom fixtures are old and hard to use

review.positiveRemarks: Great location and very friendly and helpful staff
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom fixtures are old and hard to use

review.title: Middle Class Friendly.
review.reviewText:
We saved for this vacation. This was to be an elegant treat and it was. We stayed in an elegant hotel near top class shopping. However, the staff made me feel fine about my jeans and tennis shoes.

We stayed at the St Francis because I have loved it since a little girl.However as we have 10 and 13 year olds we should have stayed at the Wharf. I did not make it into Macy's and the Museums because we spent our time on Alcatraz (tour departs from Wharf), at Ripley's, and the Exploratorium, and at ATT park for a show. All of theses are closer to the Wharf.

St Francis is the place to stay if you plan mostly Museums, shopping, and Theater.
review.positiveRemarks: They upgraded us for free to a room with an amazing view.
review.negativeRemarks: Get rid of the in room vending machines. They have the snack bar and refrigerator with overpriced items ($3 candy bar). It ruins the ambiance.
review.locationRemarks: It is right on Union Sq. Great for theaters and shopping.

review.title: Only one problem !!
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel built in 1904 with beautiful architecture. Excellent location right in the heart of downtown San Francisco. The only problem I find with this hotel is that the noise that comes from other rooms and hallway is rather loud. You have the impression that the person walking out the elevator is inside your room. I didn't hear anything during the night after the whole floor was quiet but I am not sure people didn't listen to me snoring all night.
review.positiveRemarks: architecture and history of the place
review.negativeRemarks: sound proofing
review.locationRemarks: location is good, near to all major brand clothing stores and you can hop into a cable car right in front of the hotel

review.reviewText: Perfect for Christmas atmosphere around Union Square.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff all very pleasant and helpful!
review.negativeRemarks: We were happy with everything.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for holiday atmosphere and walking around!

review.title: Centrally located
review.reviewText: Hotel was in great location and up to my expectations as far as the room. There was a big surprise in the cost of parking. I felt that I was forced into using the parking once I finally got into the garage and at no time was I advised of how much it would cost until I read the back of the valet ticket. I understand there is a parking problem in the area but guests of the hotel should be charged the minimum or average of other adjacent garages, not top dollar. When I asked for advised from the front desk the clerk was not helpful.

Maybe I was expecting to much from this hotel but the only good thing about it was the location. The Bed was old the lounge chair was stained the bathroom was in need of a upgrade . I would compare this hotel to a upgraded motel 6!!
review.negativeRemarks: not much

review.title: Much enjoyed
review.reviewText: I took my 12 year old grandson, visiting from San Diego, to see the Christmas decorations, the iceskating and the city. We stayed at the Westin St. Francis and it was a perfect. The hotel was ideally located and the staff and the facility were perfect.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Union square, theater, na proximity to Golden Gate ferries

review.title: Very good location with view of heart of downtown.
Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Somewhat tired but perfectly located right on union square. Three nights in two rooms with college age kids and mom and dad. Good beds and bathrooms. Nice lobby Starbucks and bar area. Close to everything and helpful staff.

review.title: In dire need of a renovation, overly-touristy
review.reviewText: We booked the hotel because of the location, and because we were a large group of 10 people, for which a larger hotel was more suitable. As soon as we walked into our rooms we knew we had made a terrible mistake. The rooms are outdated, musty, dirty, smelly, and small. We had rooms in both the landmark building and the so-called modern tower building. Their idea of modern is late 80's. Both set of rooms were incredibly disappointing. Even though we knew that staying right in union sq. would be touristy, this hotel has hundreds of people walking in the lobby, a Starbucks-type coffee shop that also serves as their lobby bar (?) and with very few seats for that matter. Its like staying in TIMES SQUARE rather that Union Sq. If you like that sort of thing go for it, otherwise avoid at all cost!!! On the positive side, it is centrally located, the staff is courteous and willing to help, and there are plenty of transportation options available in the property. The concierge was helpful arranging private transportation, giving directions, but they will unmistakably direct you to the classic "tourist trap" restaurants with bad food that you would expect from a hotel like this. Do not follow the concierge recommendations for restaurants if you are a discerning diner. If you like a certain level of luxury/comfort/privacy/exclusivity that you wont find from your run of the mill hotel, do not stay here.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything!
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of union sq.

review.title: NOISY!!
review.reviewText: Old building with adjoining wood doors No soundproofing. Can hear breathing from the next room.
Great hotel and was very quiet and enjoyable !
review.negativeRemarks: ? Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located to everything

review.title: Great location on Union Square
review.reviewText: Great bed but pillows were awful. Room was clean with good amenities. Would stay again!

review.title: Great location on Union Square
review.reviewText: Great bed but pillows were awful. Room was clean with good amenities. Would stay again!

review.title: Went to San Francisco or Christmas
review.reviewText: The hotel outdoes itself in holiday wonderfulness we had a great time when we lost our credit card the staff very helpful.

review.title: Choose somewhere else to stay
review.reviewText: The only nice thing about the hotel is that it was close to downtown. Room was much smaller than photos advertised on-line. Lobby was super crowded with lots of non-hotel guests. The room was not cleaned very well, including a half drunk bottle of Vitamin water in the mini bar, which also smelled of moldy dairy products.

review.title: Great location. Walking distance to theaters.
review.reviewText: Everything was great, but water was tepid. Could never get nice warm/hot water for shower. Room service was excellent. Quoted 25-30 minutes but arrived in about 15 minutes and was great for dine-in food.

review.title: Always a pleasure to stay at St Francis.
review.reviewText: Christmas Eve plus 2 days. Hotel decorated beautifully for Christmas. Coffee pot in room difficult to use. Get some Keurigs. Curious about new exercise program loaner
review.negativeRemarks: Keurig coffee makers in room.
review.locationRemarks: Shop, east, theatre

review.title: Hotel is surrounded by multitude of shops
review.reviewText: Very professional and hotel courteous staff, which made our stay a very pleasant one. Would visit the Westin St. Francis again and would highly recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: I enjoyed the location and the elegant interior; both at a very good price.
review.negativeRemarks: I personally would have preferred firmer pillows, along with blankets in the room, but other than that everything else was great.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is surrounded by high-end shops and is in the middle of union square. This location is ideal for walking & for access to tour buses/cable cars

review.title: Grand hotel in perfect location
review.reviewText: Stayed three nights in the original section of this grand hotel. Have stayed in the new section and prefer the older. Room was clean, quiet, bright and cheery, very well appointed with new furniture, and quite roomy.
review.positiveRemarks: Love the character, history and details of this grand hotel which reflects old San Francisco tradition.
review.locationRemarks: The St. Francis is perfectly located on Union Square. Shop, attend the theater, visit galleries, enjoy finest in dining.

review.title: Christmas 2013
review.reviewText: Drape rod pulled from ceiling, unclean room, not just unclean from previous guest, but an accumulation of dirt and grime. Wouldn't stay here again, plenty of other fine hotels.

review.title: Classic SF Hotel but Small Rooms
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful hotel from the outside in the center of SF's Union Square. And I love that it's classic and survived the huge earthquake and fire. But the rooms were underwhelming and it seems like they were cut in half. I booked a king bedroom. But since we did not arrive until the evening as that's when we got into SF, they gave away our room. Not sure if the king room is bigger but we ended up with what felt like a full size bed (albeit comfortable) in a room just a few feet bigger than the bed. The hotel did give us a $70 credit to be used in hotel, which helped. The windows were small and did not let in natural light. The bathroom was cold and the sink never gave us hot or warm water. But shower did. Strange. The TV should have been across from the bed rather than on one side. The back half of hotel with the fun elevators does not have the classic look from the outside. Not sure why as it appears disjointed. We had breakfast in the hotel and it was $85 for two (overpriced for what we ate). We also hung out at the Clock Bar and that was okay. Server was friendly. And how come no one is there to open the doors when you have all your luggage and are walking up the stairs?? So overall - the experience was disappointing.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms, service, prices, holding the room you booked (or confirming that you are arriving before giving it away)
review.locationRemarks: Great location, lots of restaurants and bars and shopping

review.reviewText: While ideal location this historic hotel needs a face lift especially in the older section. The water pressure was dismal and the water ran hot and cold.
review.negativeRemarks: Plumbing

review.title: Elegant hotel with ideal location
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay at the Westin St. Francis Hotel at Union Square. It's an ideal location situated in the heart of the city. The hotel itself is an elegant and inviting place. The staff is extremely friendly and very helpful. The rooms were spacious, clean and room service kept it well stocked.
review.positiveRemarks: The comfortable & spacious rooms, the room service, friendly hotel staff and the festive decorations.
review.locationRemarks: It is located in front of Union Square and the shops which are all within walking distance are amazing!

review.reviewText: Great stay with all 4 rooms on the same floor! Very polite staff and we will return! Thank you!

review.title: Centrally located in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Great location, staff and facilities. The first room we were in was small. The TV was not in front of the bed but to the side which made for awkward viewing. The bathroom mirror was not in front of the lavatory but to the side. The old room geometry did not lend itself well to modern conveniences.

Next room was changed due to our request. Adjacent room guests were smoking and after repeated warnings by hotel staff were fined and removed from the hotel. We were upgraded to a larger room with a view of Union Square. Very professional hotel staff.

Would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Central City location. Historic significance of building.
review.locationRemarks: Great flexibility to do anything in the City because of the location.

review.title: A Gem!
review.reviewText:
The Westin St Francis is still a beautiful, classic hotel located in the heart of the city, Union Square.
The hotel itself is a vintage gem. My stay was comfortable & loved the contemporary bedding & upgraded shower heads in the bathroom.
Great place for coctails at The Clock bar in the lobby - also the open lounge is xlnt stop for a drink.
Close to everything including trolley - so get a city map and enjoy the sights! If you need a taxi, doorman will hail one right in front of hotel.
Plenty of fine dining in all districts of this captivating city!
review.locationRemarks: Located in the heart of the city! You can get anywhere in the city by foot, trolley, bus or taxi!

review.title: Great location, ok room.
review.reviewText:
The location was central to everything.

The room #1275 was noisy noisy noisy! I was right next to stairs and I heard every time someone moved. Also, while I know I should have just called and asked for new sheets, there was a very weird debris on the sheets. It looked like they had been washed with paper and had tiny pieces of paper(hopefully) all over them. I just slept on the top of the bed, but it definitely wasn't ideal.

review.title: Great location with parking.
review.reviewText: Ease of dealing with Expedia is very good.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice if there was a casual coffee shop like it had years ago.
review.locationRemarks: Location is good for for restaurants, art galleries, shopping and transportation.

review.title: Westin St. Francis is an over-rated hotel
review.reviewText:
Being my first time in San Francisco for a holiday, I booked The Westin St. Francis for its landmark location, which is just beside Union Square. I paid around $280 per night and stayed for 3 nights. The room which I stayed in, a Classic Queen at the Landmark Building, was disappointing. 1) The room is small 2) There wasn't even a kettle or a fridge to chill your drinks. Yes, there was a bar-fridge, but guess what? It's fully packed with inventory that you have to pay, once you remove any of those within 10 seconds. (Yes, they installed sensors all over the fridge!) I called the reception to ask how I could store my own bottles, and they then sent a separate fridge to my room. It is also very disappointing that WiFi is not provided (well unless you're a Starwood VVIP member or something). Just seems that this hotel wants to earn the last dollar from every guest.

Basically, don't expect very good in-room amenities or services. This hotel is to me, over-rated. I would definitely not stay here again. I would advise you to find other hotels in the vicinity.

review.negativeRemarks: room could use update, carpet is old.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location

review.positiveRemarks: easy to locate and within walking distance of subway, buses and cable car. Great beds! Quiet floor/did not hear anyone in the hallways.
review.locationRemarks: great location - easy to walk to shops, restaurants, public transportation. Union square across street and location of many events.

review.title: Had a fabulous weekend!!
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay!! The location is fantastic. Cable car out front. Union Square was beautiful with skating rink and Christmas tree close to metro and great shopping. Will definitely stay here agai. Next time I am in San Francisco! Thank you for a memorable trip!!

review.title: Good hotel.
review.reviewText: All that you would expect from a Weston. Staff efficient but a little impersonal. Really cheap toilet paper in an otherwise up market room. Great location.

review.title: Nice Hotel. Great location. got a great deal
review.positiveRemarks: check in was easy and the staff was amazing.
review.negativeRemarks: room location was in the very back corner, not sure because of deal pricing, but not great location in hotel
review.locationRemarks: food is all over the place nearby. a little pricy but it is SF.

review.title: Historic hotel with modern amenities
review.reviewText: Love the location perfect for being close to everything. Doormen were amazingly helpful for whatever we needed. The hotel is gorgeous and the history is evident at every turn. At the same time every modern amenity was available.

review.title: Close to everything!
review.reviewText: The minute you walk in to the beautiful Westin, you are greeted by elegance. This is the place to stay for convenience to all the sightseeing venues San Francisco has to offer. The new skating rink is directly across the street. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Our room was small, but the bathroom was large and beautifully updated, and the closet was large. The bed was extremely comfortable. So much history in this gorgeous hotel. We will be back!

review.title: Wedding and Vacation in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We attended our son's wedding which was held at the wonderful Yerba Buena Gardens, a few blocks away from the Westin St. Francis. The wedding party then moved back to the Westin where we all dined in the Bourbon Steak Dining. The food (multiple courses ) was tantalizingly delicious and cooked to perfection as expected. We all consumed a wonderful selection of California wines and liquors through out the evening. We then had a sinfully delicious deserts and cappuccino to finish the evening off. It was so nice to then be able to just walk to the elevator and our awaiting room with the dream bed. It was a night of opulence and creature comforts which will be truly remembered by myself and my wife as well as the rest of the wedding party. Our breakfasts in the Oak Room was a wonderful way to start the days we stayed there, with cheerful greetings and tasty foods.
review.positiveRemarks: The convenience, the doorman with all the street information and a ready cab, and being able to say we were staying at the Westin.
review.negativeRemarks: We enjoyed everything from
review.locationRemarks: We are walkers, so even though we bought the Big Bus Tour which was across the street, we ended up walking in all directions from the Hotel.

review.title: Perfect Central Location
review.reviewText: Lovely long weekend walking to galleries, Chinatown, outstanding restaurants.
review.positiveRemarks: Love the history and the elegance and the international feel with languages from around the world being spoken wherever you turn. Hotel food good.
review.negativeRemarks: Most staff is stiff, formal, COLD -- not warm and welcoming. They do their job -- and that is the problem: it's a job not a calling. Train them.

review.title: Great location for all purposes.
review.reviewText: Was able to use public transportation to and from the Wharf, Excellent Shopping and plenty of eating areas. Just a cab ride to Marina or Pacific Heights for dinner.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, Close to public transportation, Easy access to Cable Cars. Plenty of dining options.

review.title: Great location and great hotel
review.reviewText: I was very happy to spend three nights at the Westin St Francis. My room was beautiful and quiet. The location was convenient and near great shopping. The spa and gym were awesome.

review.title: Good place in the heart of the shopping district.
TV
review.reviewText:
is a very nice..
what a great view....
review.negativeRemarks: not that many tv channels... sports channes. not music system.

review.title: Great stay after NWM
review.reviewText: Stayed here for the NWM. Right next to the start line and expo. Close to shopping in Union Square and Westfield Mall.
review.negativeRemarks: n/a
review.locationRemarks: Union Square and in the heart of the city.

review.title: Westin St Francis Union Square
review.reviewText: Lobby area up to date but rooms were very out dated for the cost. Additionally there was a charge for wi if per day.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel in a great location, for a fair price
review.negativeRemarks: Room size
review.locationRemarks: In the heart in union sq

review.title: Heart of Union Square
review.reviewText: The Westin St. Francis, San Francisco was simply wonderful. Smooth check in, smooth check out, attentive staff, beautiful views from the 28th floor.
