I thought the elevator access was cool and neat. I have really no bad complaints about this place. I would definitely stay here again. The Heavenly Beds, speak for themselves...truly heavenly! The room is equipped with a mini bar, we didn't use anything in it, but used it for our own items. The hotel had no problem making sure we were not charged for anything, no big issue! I like when big hotels take ownership and handle things, before the customer has to get upset and go into deep explanation. They know people like to buy their own items and use the fridge to store them. You can also have a fridge delivered to you if needed. So, overall The Westin St. Francis was fantabulous! Great Location, Wonderful food and sites in the heart of San Francisco. My husband and I was thoroughly pleased!
review.positiveRemarks: The Location was amazing. The staff was so courteous and polite.
review.negativeRemarks: I love to order room service. However, after reviewing the charges and gratuities it was way to expensive. Cheaper finger food items would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of shopping, great small restaurants and big restaurants. Walking distance to everything. Cabs near by, a park. You name it, this loc. has it.

review.title: Get the Royal Treatment in Union Square
review.reviewText:
I first stayed at the St Francis in the mid-90s while traveling on business and remember thinking everything about the hotel was beautiful. Glad to have had the opportunity to visit with them again.

Rumor has it the Tower section of the hotel has a glass elevator you can take to the 32nd floor to get a breathtaking view of the city. We didn't have a chance to do that unfortunately.
review.locationRemarks: Located right across the street from Union Square, the St Francis is right in the middle of all the great shopping San Francisco has to offer.

review.title: Magnificent
review.reviewText: Perfect location. Amazing and helpful staff. Stayed there for three days. Will choose this hotel in my next visit

review.title: Very nice hotel, right across from union square.
review.reviewText: Welcoming staff, very clean. Valet services were very quick. This is just an overall very nice place to stay and made us feel at home.
review.locationRemarks: Attractions, eateries, bars and everything in walking distance.

review.title: Great location, central to everything we did.
review.reviewText:
After viewing the breath taking lobby, the staff is what made this such a pleasant and special stay. From the bellman who actually remembered us and did something unexpected and beyond caring, to our house keeper, who was a jewell. She adapted to our routine, always had a smile on her face, recognized us in other parts of the hotel. The first morning, we asked for extra coffee and everyday thereafter, the "extra" was there.

The concierge was attentive, asking questions to validate our desires, before making spot on recommendations. The front desk was always helpful and one took special interest, when seeing one of us wearing her favorite college sports attire.
review.positiveRemarks: It is a jewel to be treasured and the staff make it shine with genuine welcome.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't try to fix what isn't broken!
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is centrally located for everything we wanted to do. With a clipper pass, we could get on the cable car and go anywhere in a few minutes.

review.title: Over Rated
review.reviewText: I must of had the worst room on the entire floor. Very small room. Little if any light as the window faced the lightwell. The bathroom was so small it was hard to turn around without hitting something. The shower door would not close and it would swing open and hit me while I was shaving in front of the sink. Very dissapointing

review.title: Nice hotel but very pricey
review.reviewText:
Just returned from a stay at the Weston St Francis, Nice hotel but expensive, the room was nice but small, the noise from anyone flushing the WC in adjacent rooms was unbelievably loud, also the cost of the room did not include a wifi connection in the room although the main reception did have wifi, (I have stayed in much lower rated hotels which did have free wifi), had a breakfast one morning on my stay which was very nice but again expensive.
All in all a nice place but overpriced couldn't beat the location though right on Union Square.
review.positiveRemarks: Very elegant hotel & reception area and staff very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Sort out the noisy plumbing, and they should be providing free wifi in the rooms at these rates.
review.locationRemarks: Great location on Union Square, take a trip on one of the trolleys outside the hotel, take a tour bus you can hop on and hop off anywhere on route.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The Westin St. Francis is located at Union Square. It was easy walking distance to shopping, Chinatown and other attractions. We took a hop on hop off bus tour around town and we could get on right across the street. A trolley also stopped very near here. The rooms were small but very clean and what else can you expect from an historical hotel. It was a very enjoyable stay.

review.title: Historic hotel on Union Square in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Our check in time was over two hours late. We called at 1:30pm to check on check in time and we're told it was 3pm. We did not get to our room until after 5pm. This pretty much ruined our afternoon as we were told that the room would be ready soon so we waited in the lobby. Very disappointing. Also Internet access was 15 dollars a day and to use a refrigerator you had to request one as the one in the room was filled with beverages and snacks for sale. If you moved one your account was charged within 10 seconds. I know everyone needs to make a little money but it seemed like the we're very aggressive. The hotel was nice and all of the employees we came in contact with were OK. Very disappointing stay overall.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was good. Beds were very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Room layouts could be improved. Information flow to customers regarding room availability would help.

review.title: noisey room,sink broken,toilet did not work
review.reviewText: ask if they could so kindley fix toilet to flush right. came back later nothing had been done.
review.negativeRemarks: Get better management
review.locationRemarks: everything

review.title: location and staff TOPS !!
review.reviewText: The wife and I stayed at the Westin St. Francis as a little get-away from the everyday grind. The hotel lived up to the high expectations we had and we were very pleased. Upon arrival I asked for a room upgrade and got a great room on a high floor ( never hurts to ask i guess ). the view was excellent. Staff were friendly and more than accommodating. I would definitley add this hotel to your list when researching places to stay in San Francisco

review.title: Nice hotel in union square
review.reviewText: Stayed here for a mini vacation..nice hotel..little further from wharf and activities than I would have liked..wasn't as easy to catch street cars as we thought..they were always full..but really nice if you don't mind walking...

review.title: Disappointed St Francis Westin
review.reviewText: The hotel was in perfect location of downtown San Francisco. We booked our rooms (3 couples..) about 8 months ago, as we had a family wedding their. No problem they told us. They have no hotel shuttle from the airport. We booked everything together, and everyone was on a different floor, not even close to each other. The rooms were very small, our room the safe, and the phone did not work. We reported this to the maid, since we couldn't use the phone, nothing was ever done about either. No fans in the bathroom after a steamy shower. 1 of the rooms had the robes that it promised in the description, and the other room, the iron didn't work. Also no wi fi unless you bought it for $15 a day. I know this sounds petty in the big circle of life, but when you have paid for a wedding their, and many family/friends staying their..it should be more than average. Extremely tough when you needed to iron something, have to get dressed and run up 6 floors, then back down. I took good jewelry but had to put it in another room, also had to use my cell phone to call another room. The wedding was beautiful, but I know we won't stay their again when we come into town. We were very disappointed.
review.negativeRemarks: upgrade some of the older rooms. put people at least on the same floor when they book together. free wi fi.
review.locationRemarks: location was great, shopping was right their. down a couple blocks to get the street cars/cable cars.

review.title: Westin Union Square
review.reviewText: Very satisfied. Met my expectations and was as advertised for quality.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience to city. Safety. Amenities. Staff services and recommendations.
review.locationRemarks: All transportation is outside the door at Union Square, or easily arranged by the staff. Lots of great stores and sights nearby.

review.title: Nice hotel at Union Square!
review.reviewText: Very convenient and great beds. It can use a refrigerator for personnel use.

review.title: OK hotel in the expensive Union Square area.
review.reviewText: Being tired from our flight, we were made to wait at least 30min. while the un-smiling young room clerk tried to find our room assignment. After, several tries on her computer, she consulted a manager 3 times before she finally got us a room which she said was an up-grade from the one we were supposed to have. Our room was supposed to be reserved for us! The up-grade room didn't seem to be any better than what we had expected as the one we re-quested. Then it had a leaky sink & the TV had problems. It was clean & the maids did a good job & were very friendly.

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: Delightful hotel.... elegant comfortable and graceful but up todate.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything....location, location, location on Union Square
review.locationRemarks: Near theatres

review.title: Nice location. Way too expensive.
review.reviewText: needs more maintenance in the rooms. Westin brand is not what it used to be.

review.title: Perfect!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very accommodating during our stay; room was excellent

review.title: Great vintage hotel with modern amenities.
review.reviewText: Great night in a fabulous location. So easy to take advantage of the entire city from this location. I will stay there always.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms are large with large bathrooms. I love the lobby bar.
review.negativeRemarks: All was great- perhaps an easy accessible plug on the desk for the accessories and coffee maker.
review.locationRemarks: Everything a metro city has to offer. Great choices for eating, entertainment, tourist attractions, shopping and people watching.

review.title: Great Location, Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: We chose the St. Francis for our weekend getaway and 49er opening season game. The staff is wonderful, our room was large and very comfortable, quiet floor. You can walk in any direction and find yourself a great place to eat and shop! Parking is a little pricey but that is standard in San Francisco.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel stay was great. The location is right on Union Square within blocks of the SF Trolley, BART, bus, or almost anywhere you want to go. There is shopping all around with more historical areas like Chinatown and Nob Hill very close. I would definitely stay there again. One bit of criticism is the WiFi is awful everywhere, whether you pay for in room or use free connection in lobby. Not a big deal though if you are going out sightseeing or shopping. Better to use free wifi at nearby starbucks or other shops than use in the Westin.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and historical look. Clearly this is a refurbished old hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi.

review.title: Great hotel with perfect location
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel with perfect location. There is a cable car that picks you up right in front of the hotel. You are minutes from all major shopping areas. Most places were only a 10 min cab ride away if we didn't want to walk or take the cable car. Cable car ride was about 10 min to Fisherman's Wharf. Also we took the Bart from the airport which was a 45 min ride to the hotel and only had to walk 5 blocks once we got there. The Wine tour we took picked us up right across the street ...literally we picked a great location! Hotel overall was easy, friendly, clean and comfortable. We are definitely going to stay here again!

review.title: San Francisco Stay
review.reviewText: Great weather in San Francisco in September. Hotel food too expensive. Great location for shopping.
review.negativeRemarks: The mattresses were lumpy. The shower didn't work correctly. If I had known that it is a pet friendly hotel I would not have booked here.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in the heart of San Francisco!
review.reviewText: My stay at the Westin St. Francis was wonderful! The hotel is beautiful! The location is right in the heart of San Francisco. The hotel staff provided excellent customer service. I would definitely stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is beautiful and is so historic.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing - everything was perfect.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is great! Right in the heart of the city. Great for shopping!

review.title: In the heart of the city
review.reviewText: I love the location of this hotel very much. Right on union square where the cable cars pass. It's a very nice hotel, after all it's westin. Wonderful stay with helpful staff all over and tons of areas in the lobby to sit & use their free wifi (in lobby only). Wifi in the rooms has surcharge.

review.title: Roadtrip weekend of fun! =)
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I went to San Francisco for the weekend. We arrived Friday morning & left Sunday afternoon. It was a great getaway for us to spend together & get away from the heat where we live! Our weekend was full of activities & we loved that the hotel was close to everything!!!! Friday we went on a bike tour of San Francisco. We rode bikes for about 3 hrs, we rode them on the golden gate bridge, Sausalito, fisherman's wharf and we took a boat ride back to San Francisco! It was a workout but amazing experience!! In the night we went to a couple bars around the hotel! So much fun but the drinks and entrance fees were expensive (made me feel like i was in Vegas!) Saturday we went to the O.Co coliseum to watch the A's game! The hotel was amazingly beautiful & elegant! We loved that in order to get to your room you had to enter your room key(made us feel safe). The room was a bit small(it didnt matter because we were mostly out everyday) but very clean and comfy! Hotel staff were super friendly! Loved it! Parking, unfortunately was a bit pricy...so we did not park at the hotel, we parked across the hotel where it was like 30-40$ cheaper(saved us some money!). We did have breakfast at an amazing restaurant called Sears which is less than a block away! it was delicious! A definitely must try! Overall the hotel and location of hotel was awesome. There were many many stores to shop and a bar in every corner! Great weekend!
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel staff was very helpful! the room was comfy. The hotel made me feel safe! The decor and architecture of the hotel was beautiful an luxurious!
review.negativeRemarks: the fee for parking in hotel should be lowered down. A bit too pricey
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf, Sears restaurant (amazing breakfast & freshly squeezed orange juice), Shopping, Sausalito, Alcatraz, Angel Island, many lounges

review.title: right at union square
review.reviewText: very relaxing and beautiful inside and very clean. I would stay there again

review.title: Pleasant
review.reviewText:
We were disappointed that the clock tower was removed. We had been there years ago, and the place has been modernized.
No clock tower to meet as. I think this was a mistake, since it was a SF icon. Also, no dancing on the top floor either, its now a meeting room. The Westin chain has taken the charm out of the hotel. Its very good, just no charm anymore.
review.positiveRemarks: I think it's insulting that they try to have you give up the daily maid service for Westin points. We are paying for daily maid service
review.locationRemarks: Its in Union Square, Bart close, cable cars, Sear Fine food for breakfast. Excellent location

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We had a corner room on an upper floor and the view was incredible. It was quiet, clean and comfortable. The location is perfect - you can walk to the Embarcadero or you can shop til you drop as Nordstrom's, Saks, etc. are all close by.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the corner room and the location.
review.negativeRemarks: Adding a fan setting on the a/c to "on" so there would be a soft background noise all of the time. Also, the bath towels looked old.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, shopping and shopping! Also, the tourist attractions and the farmer's market down on the Embarcadero were fun to walk to.

review.title: Great location, noisy room
review.reviewText: We really liked the location of this hotel as it's in a beautiful, historic building right in the heart of Union Square, however, the room was mediocre at best. We stayed there two nights and realized the second night the window was broken so we could hear EVERYTHING going on outside and were awoken multiple times throughout the night. We were even on an upper level floor. I would think that when you pay this much for a hotel, they could at least make sure the room is in working order and windows intact.
review.negativeRemarks: Room and amenities
review.locationRemarks: Union Square

review.title: Not worth the price
review.reviewText: Paying $450 for a room, one would expect at least a free wifi but nothing like that. The hotel charges $6.25 for a bottle of water and a can of diet coke is $5.25. Not a friendly hotel. The room is really run down and would need an update. The bathroom is worn and used! I do understand the location is great but not worth the price
review.locationRemarks: Location is excellent

review.title: Awesome location. In the heart of the city.
review.reviewText: Loved the location. Easy access to everything. While we didn't spend a lot of time at the hotel itself, the staff and interior were first class. The room was very nice and roomy. Wish it had a usable refrigerator, as the one in the room was filled to the brim with the mini-bar items.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, dining and access to all the sites.

review.title: 50 years in the Westin
review.reviewText: We have been staying in the westin for 50 years. It is an elegant hotel with great bones (rooms and central spaces) that needs an update in its services to keep up with the competition. The wonderful old cocktail lounge that served as a meeting place is gone, and there is nothing in its place. We wnnt to the new restaurant/bar for happy hour and the bartender did not know how to make an old fashioned (too much sugar, I could make a better cocktail in my room.) On top of that he and his supervisor were surly when I complained. Either bring back the old lounge or something with a buzz that will bring people in not push them out. On top of that major failure the reception service was poor (failed to explain the very nice late checkout featured on Sundays). The bathrooms need upgrading and it would be nice if there was a phone on the desk. The location is wonderful and the rooms are spacious but the hotel needs to be better run.

review.title: Hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: Location location location! Walking easy to high end shops! Great restaurants in the area. Parking is expensive, don't be shocked, it was worth being so central! Will come back!
review.negativeRemarks: Price for parking
review.locationRemarks: High end shopping, great restaurants, everything is easy access

review.title: Excellent staff at the next hotel makeover
review.reviewText: Fantastic and attentive staff however rooms/hotel are in need of renovation. Have stayed at Westins around the world only to notice that US Westins sometimes are not as nice as the ones in Emerging Markets. The edifice on Union Square is great if you don't mind feeling like you are not at a newer Westin. The high touch and attentive staff help remind you that you are at Westin.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location, half hour walk to AT&T Park, cable car stop right outside of hotel, bus tours right across the street at Union Square. If you want to be a tourist this is a great location. Felt safe at night.

review.title: Awesome hotel
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time staying here! Beautiful hotel in the middle of downtown San Francisco. We upgraded to a room with a view and were so glad that we did, view of the city was amazing!

review.title: Westin St Francis August 2013
review.reviewText: The room was adequate. The carpets were noticeably soiled and a little creepy. My husband had a need to have a linen suit cleaned. The suit pants came back fine, but the jacked looked faded and grayish and there was a mark on the collar that was previously not there. The woodwork aroung the baseboards was a little dirty also.
review.negativeRemarks: the cleanliness of the rugs

review.title: One of San Francisco's classic, historic hotels.
review.reviewText: Everything went as smooth as we could be from check-in to check-out. A great, old-fashioned hotel with all the charm we expected.
review.positiveRemarks: It's old-school charm and its celebration of its own history.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of Union Square, San Francisco's premiere shopping district. Many options for shopping, eating, and whatever you wish.

review.title: Historic but noisy on the 12th floor
review.reviewText: We stayed on the 12th floor in the original building. Walls are very thin so you can hear everything that's happening in the ajorning room. Depending on who is there, this was very annoying..
review.locationRemarks: Great location, much to do around Union Square. Cable Car stop is across the street.

review.title: SF of old
review.reviewText: Was initially given room on 28th floor of the newer tower but changed to the historic part since the only elevators in newer part were glass and not appropriate to someone with fear of heights. Staff was exceptionally helpful. Front desk changed room with no problem, the concierge recommended excellent seafood place 1/2 block away and made the reservations, and the head of the front desk took time out of her busy day to help me with a special issue. Would definitely stay here again and again.
review.positiveRemarks: The newer tower was nice but cookie-cutter. The historic tower gave the feeling of being back in the heyday of San Francisco in the 20's.
review.negativeRemarks: have an option of at least one non-glass elevator in the newer tower
review.locationRemarks: right on Union Square. Near high end shopping and some great restaurants and an iconic cable car turntable---fun to watch.

review.title: My stay
review.reviewText:
The room was very comfortable and big compared to the other hotel
we usually stay at. The beds even though we had two doubles were very
nice and comfy. We got a great nights sleep. Bathroom also big and spacious.
Only downside...the rug was dirty and my husband's feet were dirty after walking
on it and there was duct tape all around one window. What's with that?
Hotel staff very helpful and friendly. Will definitely stay there again
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness of rugs and repairs on window
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located near bart and walking distance to sights, shopping and restaurants

review.title: Grand HotelI
review.reviewText: If Presidents can stay there, so can my wife and I. This Grand Hotel reflects an integral piece of San Francisco history. Book early and check multiple sites ( including the hotels) to obtain the best(s) rates. If you want to be in the "heart" of Union Square you cannot get any closer. Enjoy!
review.positiveRemarks: The Grandeur and History are obvious and the very courteous staff keeps all things going in the right direction.
review.negativeRemarks: Have some of the " street musicians " relocate But it is San Francisco after all!
review.locationRemarks: This is prime time real estate: Shopping, Theatre, Museums. Walk to everything including walks to North Beach, Chinatown, and the Ferry Building.

review.title: Great location, Staff helpful.
review.reviewText: We use this hotel each time I am in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Union Square????

review.title: A great place in a great location!
review.reviewText: My favorite place to stay in San Francisco. Enough said!
review.negativeRemarks: NA.
review.locationRemarks: What do you want? It's all there and within walking distance.

review.title: Central location
review.reviewText: We brought friends of ours, who have never been to SF before, to Sf. The fell in love with the city and it's many attractions. The restaurants were greet, North Beach Restaurant, Johnie's, the wharf restaurants and others. This is our 15th trip to SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Great access to the cable cars, shopping, great restaurants and attractions.

review.title: Good location. Clean and easy to get in and out of
review.reviewText:
Parking $60 per night! Overall great experience. Rooms s little bigger than most. Had
Great location . Easy to walk everywhere . Trolley stop right next to. Would definitely recommend for price range.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking costs!
review.locationRemarks: Union square and Chinatown close !

review.title: Very convenient!!
review.reviewText:
I stayed in this hotel with my family, the hotel was in the city center
in the middle of all attractions. Beside the location I would say the hotel was standard nothing exceptional about it.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms could be better
review.locationRemarks: Center location

review.title: Perfect location!! But got taken advantage of!
review.reviewText: The hotel was super nice with huge hallways which was very cool. But as I am a younger traveler, I think I got taken a little advantage of. While the room was very clean, it was tiny. The two of us could barely open both of our suitcases at the same time. Additionally the toilet was industrial which seemed a little cheap for the hotel. Also, the maids woke us up twice trying to get into the room to clean. Once at 6:15 and the other at 7:20. VERY ANNOYING!

review.title: OK hotel, but better options around!
review.reviewText: Business trip to SF. Good location. Very average hotel for the price! Good gym
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant (Oak Room) is really bad and overpriced, breakfast also.
review.locationRemarks: Tons of stuff around

review.title: Beautiful-Classic San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: We ended up at the Westin on a spur of the moment "vacation" and was extremely happy to be able to obtain a room at the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The ambiance of the hotel took you to a "back-in-time" feel.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is located in the heart of Union Square and is extremely close to almost everything: Chinatown, Pier 39, Financial District, etc.

review.title: Very nice hotel at Union Square
review.reviewText: Stayed there for 4 days over the weekend. Hotel has experienced staff in all the right functions that get it done right and quick: parking valet, bellman, check-in/out, Oak room meal service, concierge, security, etc... Westin beds and pillows are the best in the industry for a great night sleep and rest in my opinion. Great to walk out the door and in be in the great shopping district and walking distance to many attractions, access to taxis and public transportation, and other dining options.
review.negativeRemarks: Better parking rates- $74/day with tax! Better breakfast buffet rate - >$30 with tip.
review.locationRemarks: Too many to list them all: shopping, arts, dining, etc...everything in urban setting.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: If you want to be in the center of everything, this is a great hotel. The rooms are "traditional," which means old. However, if you are there to see San Francisco, you are not going to spend a great deal of time hanging out in your hotel room. It is easy to access numerous restaurants and attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms were not updated.
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurants and easy access to transportation and downtown sites.

review.title: Week in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great hotel in an even better location. This is the biggest attraction for this hotel. Of course, it does have a great history and some wonderful old buildings. We stayed in a high floor Tower room. These give better views but are not part of the older hotel building itself. We had a great experience. The one thing which i would mention that was an annoyance more than anything else but, there were 4 of us in the hotel room and each day the housekeeping left only 3 towels. Each day, we would ring down and tell the "guest service" representative. And each day, they would apologise and make sure that housekeeping knew to leave 4 towels. Happened on all 5 days we stayed there!!
review.locationRemarks: It is right in Union Square and next to the cable car terminus in Powell Street

review.title: Westin St Francis
review.reviewText:
The room for $240 plus parking $60 was disappointing
The room was Very small, bed very uncomfortable
Both my husband and I woke up back aches
No view at all out window
First time at this Westin and not good
We usually stay Hyatt

review.title: It was dirty and small.
review.reviewText: Didn't enjoy stay. It was very unclean and needed a serious upgrade Also very small
review.positiveRemarks: Bed was comfortable. It was in good area
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness of room and hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping and eating.

review.title: Nice hotel in the heart of Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel is in the heart of union square for great shopping and restaurants
review.locationRemarks: Union square is where all of the shopping is

review.title: Best Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The whole experince was GREAT! The consierges' assisted me with PERFECT directions and restaurants to dine in. Since it was our anniversary, Jeff personally made our reservations at the restaurant (which was a dining experience).When I called the front desk to inform them of loud and obnoxious guests, they took immediate action to silence them. The cleaning staff was VERY friendly and ALWAYS asked me how my stay was. The doormen were ALWAYS there to assist with our bags and retrieving taxis.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing, a great experience and would highly recommend anyone to stay at The Westin St. Francis. My wife and I will next time we visit San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: You could not ask for a better location. Stores, restaurants, bars, parks, chinatown, were all within walking distance.

review.title: centrally located hotel
review.reviewText: This Hotel is in the middle of downtown San Francisco. Many sights and neighborhoods are within walking distance. Public transportation is nearby for farther destinations.
review.locationRemarks: Central location Most neighborhoods are within walking distance. Many restaurants nearby with convenient Public transportation .

review.title: HAPPY and Very enjoyable stay.
review.reviewText: Nothing to say, but it was a treat! Location, service and smiles.
review.negativeRemarks: I did not receive my morning paper 2 out of 3 mornings.

review.title: Great historic hotel
review.reviewText: Hubby and I wanted a place to stay after an event in downtown San Francisco. The St. Francis front lobby is beautiful. The room was classic hotel furnishing with a nice view of the square. The windows open so you can actually hear the music below. The bed was very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: There were no shower caps....
review.locationRemarks: The St. Francis is located near lots of restaurants and theater.

review.title: Great location with good restaurants
review.reviewText: This hotel has tremendous history from presidents and queens staying at this hotel. Amenities are updated but the toilet is old school from grade school.
review.negativeRemarks: Update bathroom, and I stayed in their high floor premium rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Powell St cable car, SF shopping center, theater district

review.title: Great Hotel, great location
review.reviewText: We stayed overnight and were given an upgraded room because we were Starwood Preferred Guests. We had a great view of the city, Union Square, and could see AT&T Park from our room. The staff was very accommodating and friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: The room and its view. Excellent!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing I can think of.
review.locationRemarks: Great location in the middle of Union Square. Great shopping.

review.title: Noisy lounge and restaurant
review.reviewText: The lounge and restaurant, Mina's, was too noisy to. Even enjoy a cocktail, and the prices are exorbitant.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, eateries, cable cars

review.title: good stay and hotel, especially service group
review.reviewText: we had two minor issues that we needed to call service group. they responded super fast.
review.positiveRemarks: nice hotel in downtown closer to union sq and cable car route.
review.locationRemarks: union sq, ferry building, shopping...

review.title: Fantastic
review.reviewText:
Beautiful hotel. Staff very helpful.The rooms are spotless.

.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location on Union Square

review.title: Historical and conveniently located hotel
review.reviewText: hotel personnel attentive and informative making our stay a most enjoyable one.
review.negativeRemarks: carpet cleaning
review.locationRemarks: excellent location as it was convenient to walk to shopping and dining or to get transportation to other locations.

review.title: Historical Hotel
review.reviewText: Historical hotel with great ambiance. However we were shoved in the back with little view, no complimentary robes anymore? Also the room seemed as if it were designed for one when they knew 2 were checking in. Too bad.
review.negativeRemarks: See above comments

review.title: Hotel was really nice.
review.reviewText: The staff was ok. The location is perfect for San Francisco. Wasn't too happy about the price of parking, I parked across street and saved money.

review.title: Westin St Francis, a Great Place To Stay
review.reviewText: I appreciated the willingness of the staff to answer questions, assist the traveler in any way, and willing to make changes if possible. I appreciated the willingness of staff to recommend places to go, eat, shop etc. I also appreciated the kindness we received from the cleaning staff, to front desk staff, security, front door staff and anyone else in between
review.positiveRemarks: The comfy beds. After a day of walking and visiting the sights of San Francisco, it was great to fall into a comfy bed
review.negativeRemarks: Paying for Wireless in the room. It would be nice to have this for free
review.locationRemarks: Central to shopping and the sights of San Francisco

review.title: San Francisco Downtown
review.reviewText: Staff very helpful, but a very small room for the price we paid.
review.negativeRemarks: Carpeting old and dirty looking in the hallways
review.locationRemarks: In a good location to everything.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, wonderful location.
review.reviewText: Great guided tour of the city. Centrally located. Much do within walking distance.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff efficiency, and a great room with a view.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Ant number of restaurants, shops, and any destination in the city is taxi or cable car away. No rental car needed.

review.title: Great location and hotel was very nice, great rest
review.reviewText: I loved the bedding and pillows the best...best sleep ever
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Great location to everything

review.title: Great location and very nice staff
review.reviewText: Great hotel with a friendly staff. The beds were comfortable and the room was very clean. The upscale lobby is very large and well kept. There are a few nice shops located within the hotel and Union Square is literally right out the front door. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: TIRED OLD TRADITIONAL HOTEL IN A GREAT LOCATION
review.reviewText: Old traditional hotel in a great location. The main entrance hall on Union Square was dark and dingy. Room was adequate but the decoration was dull in shades of cream with no pictures or colour on the walls, Bathroom was tiny and cramped. Check-in was slow, with long queues for us and noticed throughout our stay. Biggest complaint was that there was no WiFi in the rooms unless you paid a daily fee of $15. They did offer free WiFi in the social areas/coffee shop/reception area but space was always at a premium and in any case too public to Skype.
review.negativeRemarks: DULL AND DINGY FOYER; CRAMPED BATHROOM; PAY-TO-USE WIFI
review.locationRemarks: LOCATED ON UNION SQUARE - GREAT SHOPPING AND DINING OPTIONS

review.title: Noisy and not up to standard
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the Westin St Francis for 3 nights of which we had 1 good nights sleep. The hotel is in a great location close to Union Square. Security is poor ie. 15 guests walked through the front door and up to the room next to ours at 2am to party. Other hotels would have checked room keys before allowing entry. It took 1 hour for security to remove offenders after numerous complaints. TV was left up loud in adjoining room following night with noisy guests arriving at 4am.
This is a dog friendly establishment - if you have allergies .........
Lobby was not cleaned often. Coffee cups and plates were left on tables with guests moving them aside.
Overall I think the Westin St Francis management & staff have become complacent and are trading on the name.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: Next to Union Square

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Wonderful location and close to transportation for major attractions. Inwouldndefinitelybstay here again. The concierge service was top notch !!!!!

review.title: Great weekend
review.reviewText: It was unbelievable. Very Clean. Ideal being in downtown

review.title: Westin st Francis
review.reviewText: Great location. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms in older section of hotel small but clean and bed super comfy. We would definitely stay again !!
review.locationRemarks: Can catch cable car right outside the door,great shopping Loved the restaurant Sears right up the street

review.title: Westin St Francis
review.reviewText:
Great hotel, we had a very nice experience.

Staff were friendly and hopped at any request.

Rooms were nice and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing really
review.locationRemarks: its good, very central.

review.title: Employees
review.reviewText: The hotel staff went above and beyond our expectations.
review.positiveRemarks: Had to be the staff -- they ensured all our needs were met
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Accessible to anywhere we wanted to go.

review.title: Long time in the works...
review.reviewText: I haven't been to SF in over 20 years, and when I was younger, I would walk through the lobby of this gracious old landmark and think "Someday I will come and stay here..." Well, I did that last week and it didn't disappoint! Loved the room, the staff, the food. It added a beautiful measure of elegance to a fantastic road trip! Thank you!
review.positiveRemarks: Loved to read about the history of this old girl.
review.locationRemarks: So convenient!

review.title: Best location in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The St Francis is part of San Francisco's history. It survived the Great Earthquake and it became a local icon. It's got this old world charm, the room ceilings are super high, the bed and pillows are to die for. Best of all? Location, walking distance to all the main attractions in Downtown and near the public transport (cable cars, buses, streetcars, Bart etc)

The only thing missing? Pool/hot tub, and a spa.

review.title: God Made A Way Out Of No Way!
review.reviewText: I had a most wonderful time and i would like to thank everyone there!
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: san francusco

review.title: Nice place and close to everything
review.reviewText:
This is a very nice place to stay. Learning the history of the building was a highlight for sure.
The rooms were a little dusty and because of the wind, the room was a little loud. The windows were whistling.
I enjoyed the comfort of the beds and the space in the rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: dust the rooms more and have the windows sealed better... wind and street noise was very easy to hear.
review.locationRemarks: Lefty's is across the street. A lot of baseball history and AT&T park was in walking distance

review.title: Enjoyable stay.
review.reviewText: Enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Great location right in Union Square.

review.title: A weekend getaway
review.reviewText: The Westin had super comfortable beds and our room was spacious. The view wasn't great from the 18th floor so I would recommend that if you are going to stay in the tower to request a higher floor but all in all it was a very nice experience.
review.negativeRemarks: THE PRICE OF THE IN ROOM SERVICES
review.locationRemarks: A GOOD SPOT RIGHT IN UNION SQUARE

review.title: Disappointment
review.reviewText: The hotel has a great history and a superb location but unfortunately the rooms were very disappointing (old, grim and not very clean). Also staff are uncooperative and rude. Serious uplifting is needed.
review.negativeRemarks: staff and rooms
review.locationRemarks: Right across from Union Sq with all major attractions within a walking distance.

review.title: Nice Hotel but needs beds replaced.
review.reviewText: We have stayed several times. Always in the new tower because we know that it's clean. We tried the older tower in the past. The room was musty and a little moldy. We have high sensitivity to mold and dust. We moved to the new tower and never had this issue again. The staff is friendly and first class. Parking is a bit expensive but you can park across the street in the Union Square parking for literally half the price. The hotel is beautiful all in all. The lobby is grande. The restaurants on premises are really nice. There is also great places to eat within close walking distance. We love hanging out in Union Square (which is across the street from the main entrance). There's always lots to see and do in the area. The biggest gripe is with the beds. They need to be replaced in some rooms. This last trip we were in a King. We could only use half the bed. The other half sagged so much in the middle that I had a hard time sleeping and ended up with a back ache the first night. Fortunately we like to cuttle so we were OK using only one side. As stated at the beginning, we have stayed several times and will continue to stay here whenever we are in the city. We love this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff. Beautiful lobby area. Right across the street from Union Square. Stay in the new tower and get a high room overlooking the square.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds need to be replaced. The bed we slept in was a King. One whole side of the bed was sagging in the center. I woke up with a sore back.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located to all kinds of things to do. Union Square is across the street. The Presidio is a short drive. Disney museum there is amazing!

review.title: Nice hotel, bustling and busy lobby
review.reviewText: I live in the area but decided to stay at this hotel after a night out on the town. We were able to check in early (12pm) which was great because we had a jam packed day. Accomodations were clean and comfortable.

review.title: in the heart of union square
review.reviewText: Great location, got a great price. The bed is definitely heavenly.

review.title: A classic hotel.
review.reviewText: The staff couldn't be any friendlier. The room was very well kept, but very small bathrooms. Would recommend the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: One gets a feeling of being on a historic site. The staff is great. The Oak Room is an excellent place to eat in the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Good central location. The pier is a short cap ride. Good shopping in walking distance.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Perfect to walk everywhere we wanted to go in SF. Room was nice and clean. Hotel staff was friendly and inviting.

review.title: Excellent service.
review.reviewText: Excellent staff service no wait line at both check in and check out.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for stores and bars

review.title: Great!!!!!
review.reviewText: Loved the antiquity of this hotel and the surrounding area. The hotel staff was great!!

review.title: Great stay in San Francisco Bay.
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and courteous and willing to help.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything was great
review.locationRemarks: Great downtown location.

review.title: Good place, un clean
review.reviewText: It ac was literally full with dust .. it took them 2 days to fix it

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: Great hotel room, staff and location. Only good things to say.
review.positiveRemarks: The vintage preservation of hotel and fixtures. The fitness room had plenty workable equipment. The location was great. You can walk many places.
review.negativeRemarks: No pool
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient

review.title: First and last time
review.reviewText: This hotel is very disappointing for a Westin expected standard.

review.title: Good location, but weathered.
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is fantastic. The bar is also a scene unto itself. But, like many historic buildings, it is run down in many ways. The staff are not particularly helpful and seem to think that being busy is an excuse for doing a less than stellar job. I won't be back. There are too many better options around that neighbourhood (The Clift for example!).
review.negativeRemarks: Staff

review.title: GOOD LOCATION... NEEDS UPDATING!
review.reviewText:
Pros: Perfect location, nice lobby, large bedroom.
Cons: awkward tv placement. worn carpets. dated bathroom. poor lighting. lack of vending machines. We request another robe, and although we got a nice response, they failed to bring it.

review.title: Great hotel for meetings.
review.reviewText: Working with this hotel was a very good experience. The professionalism and friendliness was greatly appreciated.

review.title: Small,old rooms with too wide hallways.
review.reviewText:
There are issues with old hotels, and St Francis Westin is no different. Rooms very small, handle on bathroom door pulls off, closet musty smell, carpet old and smells, decor very plain,tv slow,smaller LCD, started with 2wine glasses & 3 smaller glasses, on day 2 lost 1 wine glass, on day 3 lost the second, view was totally non existant looking at next row of rooms, elevators old, smaller with 1 going to basement instead of lobby, charged 9.00 for 1bottle of water, WiFi was iffy& painful to set up

Good points were excellent location, room had v.good coffee maker for 10oz cups of good coffee, shops and restaurants of all types were excellent in close proximity, room service/service phone number dealt with all issues quickly.
review.negativeRemarks: Old hotel issues: small rooms in poor condition,musty smells.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.

review.title: Best for business, ok for families.
review.reviewText: First time staying here. Check in was smooth, staff helpful and the food at Bourbon Steak was really wonderful. The room was slightly dated but in keeping with a landmark hotel. As with any hotel, there are always noisy neighbors and the sound from the hall was quite loud. Overall, I would stay again. Fabulous location!

review.title: Nice Hotel.
review.reviewText: The St. Francis is a very nice upscale Hotel. a little on the expsensive side, but that's San Francisco !!!
review.negativeRemarks: outlets in the room are poorly placed

review.title: Great location, terrible valet, cool building.
review.reviewText: We booked and paid for a room with a king size bed..When we arrived they said they only had a room w/ twins or a queen. We took the queen...Which was right behind the elevator so we heard the mechanical noises of the elevator all night along. The valet took about 35 min to get our car making us late to our dinner reservations...Which is not a big deal if they weren't charging $51 per night for the parking overnight. I recommend parking across the street in the public parking under union square for $29-34 per night and not having to deal with the valet. The rooms are nice, the building is classic, and the location is probably the best you can find.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet. Terrible service. 35min wait with no one ahead of us. $51 per night.
review.locationRemarks: Heart of SF.

review.title: Iconic Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location and excellent service. Hotel is beautiful condition considering its age. It is quite busy, but is well run.
review.negativeRemarks: Very buzzy
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic

review.title: February Weekend Getaway
review.reviewText: Love the decor and loved that we got to stay in the original building. Much prefer this location to the tourist hive of Fisherman's Wharf or seedier downtown areas.
review.positiveRemarks: When I think San Francisco, I think about its rich history and ornate architecture. This hotel embodies all that.
review.negativeRemarks: Range of tv channels
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of downtown. Can't do better.

review.title: A good weekend
review.reviewText: The room was pretty small but well kept up. The valet parking was great and the people working were very good. The hotel was well kept upand all the employees that worked there were very helpfull. Thank you and we would highly recommend it to others and would return ourselves.
review.negativeRemarks: Trying to get to the hotel valet parking was hard.
review.locationRemarks: It was great close to shops and taxi service was easy to catch.

review.title: Comfortable room, convenient location
review.reviewText: All the hotel staff (at check-in, in restaurant, housekeeping) were very friendly and customer-focused. The room was a bit disappointing because the room was small, carpet and chair were old and tattered, and the room could use a general uplift (for eg, a fresh coat of paint). I chose this hotel because of it's central location to shopping, restaurants, etc. I would stay at this hotel again if the price is right.
review.negativeRemarks: Small, outdated room
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located in the Union Square

review.title: Avoid J P Morgan convention week!
review.reviewText:
The Westin St. Francis is an old hotel nicely situated in Union Square. We could walk to the Embarcadaro, movie theaters, restaurants, Chinatown and some decent restaurants. The place was deluged with a business convention when we were there: security everywhere and the lobby, etc packed with people all day and evening. The king bed room was on the small side, the armchair very uncomfortable (I like to read in a chair, not the bed) and the bathroom was minuscule. The shower had one of those rain shower heads in a tub with that gerryrigged shower curtain going all around , you know the kind that sticks to you when you are in there. Ugh really. The 70's wallpaper was peeling and the stickum marble tiled floor just looked cheap.
It was clean enough (I hope!). Didn't try room service or any of the amenities really. If the price is right and you are planning an active stay in SF, this would be OK.
review.negativeRemarks: Room furniture, bath size and generally worn and ugly decor

review.title: Great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Great hotel (new tower), with the right size and overal services. Rooms in the new tower are big as well as the bathrooms. However, bathrooms do not have a regular door and I found this not very practical. Overnight cost for a car was way too expensive ($51). Service was very good.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms keys easily fail to work
review.locationRemarks: In a great location - Union Square

review.title: great historical hotel, excellent location
review.reviewText: great location.Central to shopping and fine dining
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: great for shopping and dining

review.title: Busy, busy hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was very crowded and it took a long time to valet our car and to check in. Our room was lovely with a great view of San Francisco. At check out time, not ours, the elevators were slow and crowded. We got stuck on the 11th floor. A call to maintenence reset the elevator and we continued on our way. We were pleased with the luggage storage and car pick up when we did check out. I would stay here again!!
review.positiveRemarks: The view from the 27th floor was amazing
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel was CROWDED
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location

review.title: Great Union Square location
review.reviewText: Beautiful lobby, great downtown location. Room was spacious, nice furnishings, nothing fancy. Annoying minibar that charges the moment you try to put something in it, but we were able to get a mini fridge at no charge.

review.title: Location!
review.reviewText:
can go wrong with location. tour bus right outside your hotel (union square) with 20 destinations. great for seeing the city in one day and getting an idea where you want to spend the rest or your days. Pass on the room service. Not worth paying $20 plus dollars for a couple eggs and bacon. My wife and I paid $55 for bowl of soup and a small appetizer. Lori's dinner across the street has awesome breakfast for 1/2 the price. Pick up some snacks and the corner store also down the street. Touch anything in your frig and you will pay for it. $7 for a candy bar (LOL) That's a little silly.

Great employee service! Loren and the front desk was exceptional.
review.positiveRemarks: felt safe and was close to everything
review.negativeRemarks: have to pay for internet access
review.locationRemarks: perfect

review.title: Westin St Francis Stands Out!
review.reviewText:
The hotel room was a delightful surprise. No $$ have been spared to create an lovely in-room ambience and the services offered by the room were numerous and appreciated. The ceiling chandelier was really a unexpected touch. The hotel seems to be the thriving hub of the district, close to Union Square which, in December, is a fantasy land. Also, lots of restaurants and diners in the vicinity that provide delicious meals for reasonable prices.
The hotel and its location were the main reason why our trip to San Francisco was so fabulous. Thanks Expedia; I would not have found the hotel without your help.

review.title: Christmas vacation in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
First time in San Francisco. Hotel in perfect location and beautiful - could not have been better.
Hotel and staff members first class..very clean, staff members friendly and very helpful with all our questions. If I have the opportunity to visit San Francisco again, I will definitely stay at The Westin St Francis.....
review.positiveRemarks: Loved everything about it. It was Christmas and the hotel was decorated beautifully.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location.... located directly across from Union Square. Lots of things going on in that area and the shopping was fantastic.

photos.caption: View of city from our room
Real time window behind front desk

review.title: Holidays in Union Square San Francisco Experience.
review.reviewText:
We are in love with the Westin St. Francis! Although I had read some reviews about 'old' rooms etc., we had a lovely tower room on the 26th floor facing towards Union Square. We couldn't see the whole square, but it was still a lovely view of the downtown & cityscape.

We wanted the experience of staying in the city during the holiday and we definitely got what we were looking for. We didn't use any of the hotel facilities while we were there - only there one day,but there was definitely a number of different options for dining. Expect to pay the higher prices in this type of hotel. Because we were so close to everything, we were able to find plenty of other choices close by that fit better within our budget.

The only downside of our visit was the rainy weather. We had hoped do some sightseeing, but decided to let go of those since we are somewhat 'local' to the area. The upside of the bad weather was that we were happy to be able to go out shopping around the square and turn around and there was our hotel so close by.

We will definitely be back and highly recommend this hotel. Just do some research and read reviews before you book.
review.positiveRemarks: Taking the glass elevator up to our room. I like that you now have to use your room key to access the elevator, which is nice for security.
review.negativeRemarks: Having to pay $50 plus tax for valet parking! Again with the weather, we felt it was worth it to pull in the garage & hand over keys to someone else

review.title: Expensive food..
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in the middle of Union Square, great location. The room service is the most expensive I have ever had, the restaurants are very expensive and have a terrible service. Even with a reservation you won't get your table on time.
review.negativeRemarks: room service
review.locationRemarks: very convenient

review.title: Not so great.
review.reviewText: The hotel room was dreadful.The hotel seems to be rundown.

review.title: My review
review.reviewText: Overall experience was excellent. As expected, it wasn't cheap but we got what we paid for. I would recommend to anyone interested in visiting the beautiful city of San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: expense of the restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: excellent location

review.title: Great hotel, great location, great view (if lucky)

review.negativeRemarks: Happened to get a pretty terrible view, basically just cement.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.

review.title: A perfect place to stay while Christmas shopping.
review.reviewText: Lovely old SF hotel. Classic design & motif, nicely appointed and very cozy and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: The beds were the most comfortable I've ever slept in!
review.negativeRemarks: Noise on street: man drumming on tin drums on the corner for hours at night.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent for shopping.

review.title: Great day vacation at Westin St. Francis
review.reviewText: The Westin St Francis is probably the most amazing hotel I've ever stay in. My room was very comfortable, neat and clean, and the view of the union square from our room was the cherry on top. I would definetly come back to this hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was so comfy and soft that is so relaxing.
review.negativeRemarks: Absolutely nothing

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Standard clean hotel. Nice enough to take your wife to for a nice weekend trip to sf. Not over board on the fancy pomp.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice old hotel in a good location for easy access to dining and shopping and mass transit.
review.negativeRemarks: Slightly pretentious.
review.locationRemarks: Union square plenty of things to do within easy walking distance

review.title: Great Union Square Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel in the heart of Union Square. Spacious clean room with comfortable bed and large, clean bathroom. Great for families especially during the holidays.
review.negativeRemarks: Very crowded and busy lobby
review.locationRemarks: Excellent.....in the heart of Union Square.

review.title: Great Frisco local!
review.reviewText: The tower overlooking the Union Square was great 27th.
review.negativeRemarks: Mattress could use a foam pad on it, alittle hard.
review.locationRemarks: Great central local, walk to shops.

review.title: Union Square
review.reviewText: The location is great, for shopping in union square. Actually I will probably stay there again, if I get a chance. I got a discount at the hotel which made it worth the stay.
review.negativeRemarks: parking fee

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: This is a good place to stay right on union square all you need is there. The hotel is well presented. I'd return tommorow.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing

review.title: Great service
review.reviewText: I have been traveling for 35 years and have come to hate staying in hotels. The service at the SF sets it apart; I welcome my stay there.
review.negativeRemarks: My room was very small, but i should have expected it for the rate that I got at the last minute.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Great place for business travel
review.reviewText: What a wonderful place to stay. Located near the trolleys, shopping and dining!! Within walking distance of the Moscone Conv Center

review.title: Girls weekend
review.reviewText: Staff were great! Friendly and attentive. Our room (6th floor) hallway was cold and unfriendly. Not an area that felt safe. Orchid display (front lobby) was dusty and needed a good clean: should have sparked.. Saturday evening taxi line (November 10th), elderly gentleman who represented your hotel.. He was fantastic, long lines and he defused all angry guests. We enjoyed our weekend in the city.. Thank you for the opportunity to share.
review.negativeRemarks: Corridors on hotel rooms level and lack of sparkle in displays!
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic

review.title: Beautiful Packaging of Mediocre Room
review.reviewText: Beautiful lobby, great location, dingy, ugly little over-priced room. Also, it was amazing in a city that aspires to be "world class" that few of the staff spoke Spanish.

review.title: GRADE... F
review.reviewText:
Ugh. Totally disapponinted. There was no hot water. The shower didn't work. The elevators took forever.
The bed was so uncomfortable, the pillows felt like they stuffed chunks of fluff to try to fill up old pillows. I wouldn't recommend this hotel.
I ordered breakfast to be delivered and they didn't show up. I had to call them 3 times.
The room was quite... I never heard the neighbors thru the wall.
The bar and dining was expensive. The area (union square) was great
review.negativeRemarks: Bed and pillows
review.locationRemarks: It was great

review.title: Wonderful hotel still worthy of a "special" status
review.reviewText: This continues to be a wonderful hotel. What was sad to see was the round table in the hotel lobby (at the main entrance) where people deposited their empty Starbuck coffee cups and no one from the hotel removed the cups. It looked sloppy and not well managed for a hotel of this historical reputation.
review.positiveRemarks: Wonderful classy hotel well situated in the city.
review.negativeRemarks: The empty Starbuck coffee cups left in the hotel entrance.
review.locationRemarks: Superb location. Handy to wonderful shopping, cable car, and restaurants.

review.title: Central San Francisco location
review.reviewText: Historic hotel in central and convenient location. We got last minute reservations on a crowded weekend. Our room in the old section was tiny, had an air shaft view, and smelled strangely of a stable. Housekeeping's spray was only temporarily effective in reducing the smell. Otherwise amenities were good.

review.title: Great Location, Great Room, Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel had great service, a very clean room and great location. TheeSuperb cable car access, great shopping and eating within steps made my stay a great experience. The staff was very helpful to get me a car back to the airport. The hotel breakfast bar is great to grab something quick and get out exploring the city. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Best location in the city, its a fun cable car ride to the wharf, and steps from the best eating and shopping in the bay area.

review.title: Oasis among the bustle
review.reviewText: The bed was amazing. I slept like a baby. I had an interior room with no view but it helped minimize noise from busy Union Square. It was easy to reach all parts of the city, and we did, while staying this hotel. The only issue was the closest. The door knob kept falling off and I didn't figure out till the second night that the bulb illuminating the closet was triggered by a button in the door jam. This hotel was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators not all working during very busy time
review.locationRemarks: Center of the universe

review.title: the st francis
review.reviewText: Quality accomodation in a perfect location, value for money, in all superb

review.title: I would recommend staying at this hotel.
review.reviewText: I love the location of this hotel and have stayed in it before. The room was clean, the staff was friendly and helpful. I was able to get a later check out with no problem which I appreciated very much. I love the classic elegance of this hotel. The one downfall this time is that there were street bands on the corner below our room playing extremely loud music (drums) most of the evening. The Music sounded as if it were right in the room. I will say however that they stopped playing I guess around 10 every night but it was still distracting for when we were in the room during that time period.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and elegance of my surroundings
review.negativeRemarks: Street band noise
review.locationRemarks: Fabulous

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: We had a great experience at the Westin St. Francis. Easy (and early) check-in. Staff was very accommodating and helpful! We will definitely return.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location - close to everything and short cab ride / cable car ride anywhere!

review.title: Fine room, tiny beds.
review.reviewText:
Great location, but no view below 10th floor. Elevators a hassle.

Beds are too small for two adults. My wife and I are both smaller than average, yet were still uncomfortable. Felt like we were in a twin bed, no even a full size. Family of four is stretched to fit in two bed room. Room size allows for queens, but these are much smaller than even a full.
review.negativeRemarks: Small beds
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for downtown sites.

review.title: Nice place by Union Square
review.reviewText: Great location downtown. Stayed in the older section which was quaint - not modern steel and glass which may not appeal to some. I think newer tower on other side of hotel. Can walk to lots of downtown shops etc.

review.title: wasn't that special
review.reviewText: There was nothing special to say about my experience at this hotel

review.title: Great location but noisy.
review.reviewText: Fantastic location. Nice service all around. Our room was on the 3rd floor on Union Square side which meant a lot of noise.....from the hotel's banquet room as well as Union Square itself. A higher floor would have been better. In addition, we felt nickeled and dimed when the hotel charged $15/day for internet service and when I purchased an 8 oz bottle of Diet Coke at the barista stand.....for $4.00.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from Union Square and banquet room event was loud in our 3rd floor room.
review.locationRemarks: Great central location for cable car, BART and shopping.

review.title: Great hotel for great San Fransisco location.
review.reviewText: Bathrobes in Room 3099 would have been a welcome improvement.
review.positiveRemarks: Speed of regiatration. Efficiency and courtesy of front desk clerks. Assistance of front desk clerks even after checking in. Superb.
review.negativeRemarks: Incident on Tower Elevators last Friday PM. Please see below.
review.locationRemarks: Superb for shopping and safety.

review.title: A Tradition - As good today as 30 years ago!
review.reviewText: The St. Francis is the tradition-rich home base for the annual USC Weekender. All these years later, it did not disappoint. Room was beautifully upgraded with all the trademark Westin touches. Perfect location.
review.positiveRemarks: Pleasant stay, great bed and linens.
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect for being in the downton center. Easy transportation to all sites. Great shopping and restaurants within an easy walk.

review.title: Great Location for Touring, Shopping & Visisting
review.reviewText: Stately hotel, Beautiful, well maintained & preserved. Excellent location & amenities. Will stay again when possible.
review.positiveRemarks: Coffee & wine bars, shoe doctor and reatail shopping.
review.locationRemarks: Fabulously located on Union Square. Great shopping. Central location for the area. Great garage & valet service.

review.title: Location and history
review.reviewText: Great location, near to shops restaurants of all price ranges. This is the second time we have stayed here. We will again. Beds are superb. The hotel has a very interetsing history.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant was pricey but many alternatives nearby.
review.locationRemarks: Right on Union Square adjacent to C able Cars

review.title: Beautiful view!!
review.reviewText: Super friendly people!! Veery nice room and lobby. The bar is EXPENSIVE!

review.title: Comfortable beds!
review.reviewText: The Westin is a pretty nice hotel. The staff are friendly and will greet you whenever they have the chance. The rooms are clean and the bed is super comfortable. I recommend this hotel for everyone.

review.title: Great upscale hotel at a good price!
review.reviewText: from the front desk at check in, the concierge, doorman, and housekeeping our trip to SF was fantastic at the Westin St Francis. Great location. Very clean, upscale hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, very clean, helpful staff
review.locationRemarks: tour buses and cable car right out the front door. This hotel is ON Union Square.

review.title: Good location but my room was noisy
review.reviewText:
The hotel's in a great location, right on Union Square and only 5 minutes walk away from a large shopping mall.

The hotel itself was okay, impressive hallway and public areas but the lifts were slow and one was out of action for maintenance, which led to queues. There were also long queues on check in and check out due to a staff shortage, which I found quite irritating. If you have a SPG loyalty card you'll find that unless you're gold or above there's no dedicated line.

Staff were okay. Concierge were particularly helpful, giving me a map and directions to local cinemas and a book store. The reception staff varied, with one member being a little passive aggressive that I wasn't clear on their green programme and what it meant (which I have a whole separate rant about).

Worst part of the stay was the room. It was in an older part of the hotel and I picked up every noise from the hallway and the room next door, which kept me awake - had I been there for more than 2 nights, I'd have asked to move. The toilet also gurgled at odd intervals. The room itself was on the smallish side but that isn't an issue for me and I found the bed comfortable.

I did get contacted by the hotel afterwards apologising for the noise issue and making a note for future stays, which I appreciated and thought was good customer service. Not sure I'd automatically stay there next time as I prefer the HIlton but it did influence this review.

review.title: No sound proof windows.
review.reviewText:
We spent 4 nights at the St. Francis over labour day weekend and it was tough getting any sleep. We had an upgraded room on the 15 floor, a tower king room.

From the band playing down in the street at night to protestors at the Hotel Frank next door in the morning. (0650 hrs in the morning on sunday and 0700 hrs wednesday!)

The hotel staff commiserated with us when we complained but seemed indifferent and said that if something could have been done they would have done it. Thats the left coast for you.

Sound came through the windows like an old cottage on lake scugog.

The location is prime and the price you pay to be right down at union square is considerable. Monetarily and with some sleep deprivation thrown in.

Next time we are staying at a hotel away from union square and with sound proofed windows.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise level

review.title: An unwanted surprise
review.reviewText: Very nice bed, bedding and mattress...which is what's needed for a good night's sleep. They had a "green" program that was strange the way it was executed... I've ssurprise " lesser" hotels who ask, as did the Westin, if you chose to repeat the use of linens for a second day. The strange part here was if you chose the option then you had NO housekeeping service that day, including trash pickup, vacuuming, etc. For the price one pays at the Westin St Francis, I really didn't think I'd have to made my own bed!

review.title: Union Square stay at the Westin St Francis
review.reviewText:
Older hotel in a great location right opposite Union Square where most things are at your fingertips.
Rooms are comfy and clean unfortunately we did not get a view of the square or the water.
Enjoyed our stay and would return.
One downside was that there was a noisy protest in the square each morning at 7am however as we got up early most days it did not really effect us
review.negativeRemarks: Protest noise
review.locationRemarks: Right on Union Square

review.title: 50th Birthday couple from Florida
review.reviewText: Great location. Close walking distance to everything downtown. Room on the 21st floor had fantastic views over the city and towards the bay. We comfortably slept with the curtains open. Room was quiet and private. Staff were very helpful and professional especially the concierge whom we sought advice and bookings from several times a day. Expensive in general so we ate elsewhere and the mini wine bar in the room automatically bills you as you move stuff around to put your own stuff in.. Its weight sensitive so they told me (bill sorted upon check out so the desk reassured). Linens were lovely but mattress could have been a bit more comfortable. Internet in the room is expensive at $15 a day, lobby is free though. Our hotel choice was a bit of a shot in the dark when we planned our vacation but we would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Opulant place in the midst of downtown. Perfect location.. Fantastic view from the upper floors..
review.negativeRemarks: Mattress is so-so, in room Internet is expensive
review.locationRemarks: Couldnt be better

review.title: Not worth the money
review.reviewText: The room was very bland, old, tired and tiny. We elected to go "green" so that sheets and towels did not need to be changed. At every other hotel, the room is still tidied with the bed made. Not here.!! Check in staff very snobby. For a lot of money, the hotel offered little but a beautiful lobby and well dressed clientele. Would never stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: small, crowded room, indifferent service
review.locationRemarks: central but very crowded and noisy during the daytime

review.title: Great Location and Service
review.reviewText: Fantastitic location in Union Square -- close to great shopping and great food. The check-in staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Same with the concierge. Their recommendations for dinners (Farallon, Le Mar, Bourbon Steak) provided us with a great variety and experience. Our room, especially the bathroom was a little small, but what you'd expect from an older hotel. The only complaint we had was the chair in the room needed to be replaced, or cleaned (old stain on chair).

review.title: Elegant hotel for anniversary celebration
review.reviewText: Great location. Beds are comfy, but small (double).
review.negativeRemarks: Double beds--too small
review.locationRemarks: Awesome. Right in Union Square

review.title: Great location, fine hotel
review.reviewText: Great location right on Union Square, convenient for shopping and dining. Access to two cable car routes. Rooms very nice, good views of downtown.

review.title: great stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Everything was wonderful except internet access was lacking. The cost per day was excessive - lesser hotels have free internet access.

review.title: Good hotel in convenient location
review.reviewText: This hotel is conveniently located on Union Square. Beautiful lobby. I found the hotel staff to be very friendly; the Concierge was consistently helpful. My room was clean and comfortable--I would rate the bed an "A+" for comfort.

review.title: Nice property
review.reviewText:
Room was not as nice as anticipated, in an odd location at the end of a corridor, which made it smaller than usual it seemed for a king room. Bed was not a true king as our feet hung over the end, although it was wider than a queen. Maybe it was a Cal King turned sideways?!
The hotel over all is a lovely old building, well maintained. We didn't eat at the restaurants. Had a drink in the Clock Bar, where service was very slow at 5 p.m. and the drink served was not what we ordered.

review.title: Great hotel for a weekend getaway
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful and the location is very good. The rooms in the old part of the hotel are very small. We moved over to the new tower to a king room and the size was much better. If your room faces Geary Street it is much noiser than if your room faces either Union Square or Post Street. Restaurants, cafe and bar are much more expensive than the surrounding restaurants.

review.title: Wonderful stay at the Westin San Francisco (SF)
review.reviewText: Andrew handled my check in- he was efficient, pleasant and helpful with directions. He even offered to store my bags while we went out for dinner. The hotel is centrally located and close to shops/restraurants. It's elegant- crown modeling in the room and marble sink! Most importantly- the bed was heavenly!

review.title: Labor dispute is loud in the morning
review.reviewText: The Hotel Frank, right around the corner from the St. Francis, is having a labor dispute. Every morning, from 7:00 AM - 8:00 AM, a picket line is formed and is very loud. Suggest you do not stay on the Geary St. side of the hotel. The Post St. side of the hotel is fine, the noise is not as loud. Other than that, the stay at the hotel was excellent.

review.title: Good Location,
review.reviewText: Though the public areas were lovely, our room in the tower on the 20th floor was a bit worn.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators were slow.

review.title: Very Nice hotel and well located
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, could do a better job cleaning and making up the rooms. Rooms were not vacuumed during our stay (we stayed three nights).
