Had to ask the maid to make up the sofa bed(???). Skip the Bourbon restaurant- it is very loud, seems more of a bar than a restaurant. Service is lousy and very expensive. The wine list is defficient considering the bill you pay. It is plain stupid to go to this place for a nice dinner when you have the Morton´s Steak house around the corner! What drove us crazy was that after all this they sent us the bill with a 20 % tip without even letting us decide. We immediately gave it back and wanted to call the manager. They corrected the mistake immediately. I think they are trying to abuse their clients. We still gave 15 % which I think was also too much considering service and trying to pull us off.
review.positiveRemarks: Service at Front desk, concierge and bell boys
review.negativeRemarks: The Bourbon Steakhouse
review.locationRemarks: Could not be better

review.title: Honeymoon in SF
review.reviewText:
When we met the hotel manager purely by chance and mentioned it was our honeymoon, we returned to the room to find a complimentary bottle of bubbly, chocolate dipped strawberries and a card. A very nice surprise!

Upon check-out we found several bar/snack items charged to the bill (~$25.00 worth) when in fact we'd used none. When I brought it up to the desk clerk,she said that there were sensors in the fridge (?) and if we moved items (we did), it would record it... Looked like a regular fridge to me. Anyway, no problems getting the bill corrected.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, heritage, comfy bed, nicely appointed room.
review.negativeRemarks:
Late evening street noise even though we were on the 20th floor.
Go with the male concierges if possible. The women were much less accommodating
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic. Very central. The street cars run right past the front door and the tour buses depart from Union Square which is right across the street.

review.title: Great Hotel and Location
review.reviewText: This hotel has a great location. It is close to the cable cars, shopping, Chinatown, and the hop-on/hop-off buses. The staff was friendly and helpful, but they could be a little more informed about inexpensive dining in the area. I would stay there again if I visited San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, history of the hotel, and views from the 32nd floor
review.locationRemarks: Near many of the attractions in the city and public transportation

review.title: Wonderful Experience for Senior Couples
review.reviewText: Hotel was conventiently located and enabled us to visit several key areas on foot including shopping, food and sightseeing. Our room was ample for the two of us with ample supply of linens, sundry items and reading materials regarding San Francisco. The hotel staff was knowledgeable and able to answer all of our questions in a prompt and courteous manner. Would definitely return and recommend to family and friends.
review.positiveRemarks: Sophisticated and Elegant with vast history
review.negativeRemarks: Only people on floor not to receive daily newspapers
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to all

review.title: Prime location!
review.reviewText: Everything, especially the location and service, were first class.Remember that almost everyone gets tipped, and that ran high. Valet in, valet out, porter in, porter out, concierge for tour tickets, etc. Beds and linens first class, no city noise and the ultimate location at Union Square!

review.title: Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: Very historic hotel located in front of Union Square close to shopping. Great staff and service. The carpet throughout the hotel is showing signs of wear and the place could use some paint or a good scrubbing. The room was small with room for the bed and a TV , and the walls were a bit thin. Overall OK, but for the money would choose another hotel on my next visit.
review.positiveRemarks: The service and friendliness of the staff was great.
review.negativeRemarks: The general condition/appearance of the room floors and the small size of the room was disappointing.
review.locationRemarks: Very central location, great for shopping.

review.title: Great in prison.
review.reviewText: Clean and perfect location. I liked the attentiveness of the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Bar had no tv
review.locationRemarks: great spot

review.title: Great place in Union Square
review.reviewText: Great location. We were in the towers so had a great view from the 18th floor. Great lounge.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: The location is perfect, the service was good and the rooms adequate. The sound insulation left a lot to be desired
review.negativeRemarks: Sound insulation in rooms
review.locationRemarks: Can not be beat.

review.title: CHANTING.check out rah rah rah....................
review.reviewText: Noisy as we were next door to an every morning on strike chant from a hotel staff. It would of been nice to SLEEP..........We did not have an option to move from it.
review.negativeRemarks: noise.price

review.title: Pretty darn good
review.reviewText: The room was small, but very clean. The staff was friendly and nice. Beware - it costs $51 a night to park! That caught me off guard somewhat, but I guess that is the big city!

review.title: Average (not great and not terrible) .... Just ok
review.reviewText: Was very disappointed with the room .... extremely small and bathroom was dirty. By the second night the bathroom doorknob had fallen off .... not impressed with the upkeep of the rooms at all .... I was certainly much more money for what was given to me.
review.negativeRemarks: Room
review.locationRemarks: Central Location (convenient)

review.title: LOUD!
review.reviewText: The hotel's location is right downtown, very handy but also so loud! I was there for four nights and didn't sleep through the night even once. The street noise, a neighboring hotel's picket line (7:00 AM daily start time), emergency vehicles, nightly live music across the street, etc. Location, location, location! If you're a heavy sleeper, it's the perfect location. If not, try a different spot.
review.positiveRemarks: It was in a very convenient location!
review.negativeRemarks: The street noise kept me up every night.
review.locationRemarks: right downtown

review.title: Let down
review.reviewText:
Dingy bathroom... very poor lighting...hard for my wife to do her hair-makeup etc.. There were no bath robes. Room and bathroom very out of date. My room was next to the elevator. Had noise from it continuously day and night.

My wife and I were regulars at this hotel, but will never stay there again. Very poor image for the Westin Group of hotels.
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Old tower....Is scary, dirty, and the AC does not
review.reviewText:
Bad , Bad , Bad!!! I travel a lot along with being part of production team that produces travel shows, and I was extremely disappointed with my experience. As an Expedia elite traveler , I have come to expect good service from most places I stay. This was a night mare on a business trip none the less.
When I arrived to the hotel, they let me know they had a room for me but it was very small or would I prefer a bigger room with double beds.
They forgot to mention they put me in a room that smelt like I entered into an old dungeon. I was placed in the old tower, where the rooms should be completely redone!
Not having time to fix the problem, I tried staying in the room…Finally at 2a I had enough with the not fully working AC and the dust smell.
Although nothing was done until the next morning and two room changes into the new tower…It was an incredibly disappointing experience
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms

review.title: Grand Deluxe King Tower Room
review.reviewText: Room 2489 was clean although if you are thoroughly inspecting the room, then you will find dust on some things such as night stand lamp, mirrors, mini bar, etc. Although we could not hear our neighbors next door, we could hear noises from outside even though we were on the 24th floor and on the "quiet street side". But we found by leaving the AC on high and on fan, it ran constantly and this blocked out the street noises for us at night (you can easily hear sirens, bells from the cable cars, construction noises). So over all we did like the hotel but my husband was dissappointed that the hotel was charging us over $300 a night and wanted to charge $15 daily for wifi.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel charged for everything - nothing was free
review.locationRemarks: Location was great although we did have trouble finding the subway. Never found it in fact.

review.title: Weekend city retreat!
review.reviewText:
Really looked forward to staying at this famous hotel. Great location and lots going on around it. The older main part of the hotel is as you would imagine from the outside, lots of great character and historic. We stayed in the newer towers, which were probably built in the 70's. The room was bigger than most of the ones we have stayed at in San Francisco. The rooms was clean and presentable. The only moderate complaint we had was the sink in the bathroom did not drain very well. Not a huge deal. If we were to stay here again we would probably stay in the older part of the hotel to get a different experience with more character and history.

Be prepared for a lot of noise, due to this hotel being in Union Square, lots of taxi's honking at all hours of the night and sirens. The two days we stayed here, there was a labor protest going on across the street and they had a nice bullhorn they used to shout through......we arrived at 3:00pm and they were going strong, they seemed to quiet up around 6:00pm. But they started bright and early at 7:00am the next morning, obviously this is not the hotels fault at all.......this is San Francisco so be prepared for that problem where ever you stay! Overall nice place that we would recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is great for shopping and dining.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise level outside of hotel.

review.title: Do it again
review.reviewText: Good quality big Hotel in a Great location. We would recommend to everyone. But take a pullover, San Francisco was cold :)

review.title: Not a good choice.
review.reviewText: Way too small of a room for the price. The bed was 1/4 the size of the room. The bathroom was tiny.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of room and price.

review.title: Have pile of money, stay in convenient location
review.reviewText: Super expensive, but so is a lot of San Francisco. Location is awesome. Some gouging on the edges should, however, not go unmentioned. $20 per 24hrs for wi-fi? Really? Remember to bring your own modem and poach their wired network. No getting around the $51 a day for parking, though. Go in and out as often as you like to get your money's worth there. Savvier travelers will most definitely find better bargains elsewhere.
review.locationRemarks: Right on Union Sq. Trip over the cable car line out the front door. Trolley to the Embarcadero is just a couple blocks away.

review.title: poor staff service
review.reviewText: A somewhat pleasing hotel let down by poor staff service

review.title: Lovely, Historic Hotel
review.reviewText:
Have stayed here before and the greatest part of this hotel is it's location - you cannot beat it - the very best location in SF.

It's a lovely, old hotel and much has been updated and renovated. It's charming and comfortable and clean but not really a perfect 5. No views of the Bay due to being right on Union Square and surrounded by other tall buildings. In the summer, it's really crowded and busy!
review.negativeRemarks: old toilet with public-restroom type flush handle
review.locationRemarks: Perfect - right on Union Square, walk out to the cable car. Can walk to shops, restaurants, music, galleries etc.

review.title: Central location
review.reviewText: Decent hotel in a central location. I would recommend this for hotel for first time San Francisco visitors who are learning their way around the city. On another trip, we may opt to stay at a newer hotel (we were in the traditional part of the Westin, not the newer towers). Union Square is quite busy and touristy, which has benefits, but as "seasoned" travelers the next time, we may opt for some a little more off the beaten path as we prefer the more local "neighborhood" feel.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was extremely comfortable. The location of the hotel right on Union Square is ideal for hooking up with transportation, tours and shopping
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom was a bit small and we had a noisy family in the room next door and could hear them loud and clear.

review.title: Will be back!
review.reviewText: Went for a quick weekend getaway to celebrate our anniversary. Room had everything we needed... Excellent location for shopping, dining and entertainment. Even found time for the Filmore Jazz Festival.
review.locationRemarks: Incredibly convenient location in the heart of Union Square.

review.title: Great hotel, great location!
review.reviewText: Great location. Very comfortable bed. We had a pleasant stay.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I think it would have been a better experience if we had not gotten stuck with the handicap accessible room, which meant we did not get the Heavenly Shower, though we did have the standard Heavenly Bed and Heavenly sheets. The location was great, right on Union Square, but no view to speak of. Within walking distance of many things in downtown SF and easy access to trolley, sight seeing buses, and BART.

review.title: Great stay.
review.reviewText: The beds really are heavenly. No complaints of anything.

review.title: Great location but...
review.reviewText: Great location. Queen size room way too small... Back view on lower flower very unpleasant... small windows... Changed for double... much better.

review.title: business travel
review.reviewText: Great hotel and location, very convenient and perfect for business travel.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: The older part of the hotel is very nice. The tower is more like a 3 star than a 4. Charging for wi-fi these days is really outdated. The location is great. Parking is rediculously expensive like any big city. The staff was very pleasant.
review.locationRemarks: On Union Square, near a lot of great shops and restaraunts. Short walk to china town.

review.title: Find Comfort Elsewhere!
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was difficult, front desk did not answer the phone on a few occasions and hotel asked for an additional $35 per night for a roll away bed. We had four nights reserved, however we checked out after the first night and moved to another hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The Expedia photos do not meet expectation
review.negativeRemarks: Wallpaper does not make for an "Upgrade"
review.locationRemarks: High traffic area

review.title: best hotel if shopping is your thing!
review.reviewText: the concierge was very helpful. Food was pricey, but good. Dogs are allowed, but you could not tell they were there. Convenient to cable cars and trolleys, therefore convenient to everything.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The location was perfect for nearby shopping and reaching other sites via cable car. I would definitely stay again! My only complaint was the level of noise from the street (expected in a big city), hallway and adjacent room. But overall, a great hotel in a great location!
review.locationRemarks: Excellent!

review.title: Great Hotel for everyone
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, clean, good staff, good location, 3rd time staying at this hotel in last 5 years. I would recommend this to everyone.

review.title: Great hotel stay.
review.reviewText: Beautiful old hotel centrally located at Union Square. Clean, comfortable, and professional staff.

review.title: Hotel has gone down hill
review.reviewText: The chaise lounger had been used for purposes normally a bed is used for; still had stains to show for it & makeup smears on it. The comforter was dirty, hadn't been washed. We called down and complained. They tried to clean the chaise & ended up replacing it. It was disgusting to look at. The conforter got replaced as well. But for a high end hotel, it was very dissapointing that the room was left in that condition for us to find. We have always stayed there when we've been in the city but will never go back.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful stay. The hotel was great! The staff was great! The food and drinks were great! The hotel is in a wonderful location with the trolley stop right outside the door and Union Square, restaurants and shopping right there. The only issue I had was that there was an organized labor protest every morning against the hotel next door that woke me up all four mornings and was so loud I had to conduct a business call for an hour in the bathroom. I can't fault the Westin, but they could have compensated us some way or forced the city to only approve the protest at noon when most people are impacted.
review.negativeRemarks: Protestors next door every morning and a $51/day valet fee.
review.locationRemarks: Right on the trolley stop

review.title: Westin St. Francis
review.reviewText: Did not like the French doors into the bathroom. No free wifi. Called the concierge and she could not tell me the name of the handbag store in the lobby. Was put on hold for 5 minutes or so and was finally told the name. Called lost and found for an item left in room. The man was very helpful. But item not found. Had the buffet breakfast, it was decent. Staff friendly and professional. Fitness center steam room not open at 6:00am workout. Would stay their again, but would make sure I had wifi and no French doors.
review.negativeRemarks: Room layout
review.locationRemarks: Convienent.

review.title: Be careful of what 5 stars means..
review.reviewText: I always book my travel through Expedia & what I see on the website is what I see when I get to my destination. Well not this time. What I saw on the website is nothing compared to what I saw when I got to San Francisco. Th clerks were very nice. I felt the concierge kept pushing certain restaurants as if they were getting a cut from the restaurant. All I can say is Daily Grill & Toni's in Little Italy were fantastic! stay away from Scoma's! Overpriced & food was not good! The room size is good for 2 ppl but the rooms needed a good cleaning. The shower curtains had stains & the shower heads were filthy! All I can say is be careful booking travel to San Fran hotels cause what you see on the website is not what you will get. And to think I went with a hotel that got 5 stars from Expedia & other travel sites. I would hate to see what a 3 star hotel would have given me. I will give you a tip saver, buy the week pass for the cable cars. You can hop on & hop off whenever you want for $27 for the whole week vs. paying $6.00 for just one way. If you plan on going to Alcatraz pre-book cause tours sell out super fast.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, close to cable cars, shopping & location again
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness of the room
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to great shopping, cable cars pick you right in the front of hotel

review.title: Westin St. Francis Union Square, San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Hotel was conveniently located. Staff was friendly and helpful. Wonderful stay.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: I would have liked free wifi in the room, but everything else was nice. Very clean, and bed was very comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to everything downtown, and right off the cable cars and union square as well.

review.title: Overcharged
review.reviewText: I was overcharged for in room refreshments. The room was very expensive for the quality recieved. The Stanford Court at the corner of Powell and California is a much better value and the rooms are very nice.

review.title: OK but slow check in
review.reviewText: Very slow check in. We waited over half an hour in line.

review.title: Stay in May
review.reviewText: Staff was generally helpful. For the valet parking, it is not clear what is supposed to be covered in the charge as it was handled separately according to the Front Desk since I booked the accommodations through another service.
review.positiveRemarks: Bed was very comfortable. I had one of the best rests. The shower dual heads was very helpful, also.
review.negativeRemarks: A small night-light would be helpful in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. It is accessbile to everything readily.

review.title: Review from a Bay Area resident
review.reviewText: I had been wanting to stay at the Westin St. Francis for years and finally got the chance this past weekend. Being from the Bay Area I'm sure my experience was a bit different than the usual domestic or international visitor who stays here on a vacation to SF, however I was pleased to see that the Westin met all my expectations from ease of checking in/checking out as well as the friendliness of the staff. My wife and I brought our dog with us (Shih Tzu) and didn't run into any issues, simply filling out an additional pet form upon check in to cover damages, etc. should they occur. I will definitely recommend this hotel to any friends/relatives wanting to stay in the Union Square area on a trip to SF. Yes, it's a little pricey but I think everyone should try it at least once and the convenience of the location, which is absolutely fantastic for any shopping, dining or casually hanging out in the square, cannot be matched.
review.negativeRemarks: size of room, expensive
review.locationRemarks: Location cannot be beat. Perfect for those shopping, dining and going out in the Union Square area

review.title: disappointed value for this hotel
review.reviewText: very old rooms very dissapointed for the price i paid had to continuously ask for plain coffee not decaf. glasses were left outside my room on the floor for days. no robe, no free water, no internet in rooms. also to top it off and guy came into my room i was on a long distance call and he said i want to check the fridge i said i havent used it he said i need to come in and register it and shoved his way in. i was shocked
review.negativeRemarks: read above
review.locationRemarks: it was busy but okay tons of nice hotels around it tooi

review.title: St. Francis
review.reviewText: Absolutely fabulous hotel. Wonderful location, ambiance and quality. The staff was helpful and the nostalgic feel made it a perfect stay.
review.locationRemarks: Very conveniently located to restaurants and shopping. The cable car passes right in front of the St. Francis. We rode it "half way to the stars!"

review.title: Wedding stay
review.reviewText: Beautiful Hotel, location great, staff very helpful and friendly.

review.title: St Francis
review.reviewText: Stayed in the landmark building. Brilliant room overlooking Union Square. Bathroom very small, but room size and comfort made up for it.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Size and position of room 509. Good gym. Great bar and restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of wifi. Small bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Couldn't beat it if you're there for a sightseeing + shopping holiday.

review.title: Not clean enough
review.reviewText: Disappointed with the cleanliness of the room. Carpet dirty.

review.title: The Westin St. Francis
review.reviewText: The hotel was fabulous and in a perfect location right on Union Square near upscale shopping and dining. It was a stone's throw from the Powell Street cable line which goes to the trendy areas and Fisherman Wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: did have any "least favorites"
review.locationRemarks: perfect...within walking distance to many areas

review.title: St. Francis: Not at the Peak
review.reviewText: The St. Francis has lost a notch in quality in terms of attractiveness for business travellers, compared to 15 years ago. The breakfast was several notches down from past years. Overall, the location is outstanding for the business traveller.
review.positiveRemarks: Location; Upgraded to a large, quiet room but no view of the water (this would have been a double upgrade).
review.negativeRemarks: Food
review.locationRemarks: St. Francis has the best location in San Francisco; everyone knows it

review.title: Worse place we ever stay
review.reviewText:
The room was too small, very unattractive, the bed cover was white, but you could see very light dirty spots on it. The carpet on the room was kind of old and dirty.
The worse part was the bathroom. The tub was too small and narrow and when you closed the shower curtain and start to shower, the curtain moves toward you and gets attached to your wet body and makes difficult to shower. My wife is petite and had the same problem. We try to close the bathroom door to avoid any type of air draft, but it did not help. The water did not get hot enough, even after turning the water all the way to "hot". Next to the bathroom sink that was a small wood panel that gives access to the pipes and it almost fell on my wife's feet without us touching it. I had to put it back.
All through the night we could hear door slamming because the room doors have a door closer at the top that are too strong, so anytime someone come in or out of their room, it would make a loud bang. As we moved from our room to the elevator we could hear people in their rooms, so the doors and walls do not give any privacy and makes at night you can hear other rooms TVs and conversations.
We did not complain to the hotel because we had a very packed schedule and did not have much time in between the things we had to do, places to go and the times we spent at the hotel.
It was very disappointing, specially for a hotel with such good reviews and high price. Would not recommend to anyone and would never stay their again.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything else.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, closed to shops, restaurants and right at Union Square.

review.title: mats in the bathtubs
review.reviewText: I am an older woman and found the bathtub floor extremely slippery. It would be less dangerous if a mat were supplied. The hotel itself was fine and close to a lot of stores and restaurants.....great place to stay!

review.title: a fun stay in great location
review.reviewText: A beautiful hotel in a great location. It was close to many eating places and to shopping. The concierge was very helpful.

review.title: Romantic and inspiring hotel!!!!
review.reviewText: Beautiful and romantic hotel. Inspiring view through the room to union square. I recommended strongly to visit San Francisco like me on my fifth wedding anniversary....

review.title: Westin St. Francis
review.reviewText: You cannot possibly find a better location in San Francisco, directly on Union Square. We stayed in the older part of the hotel, and it was very nice. Hotel staff were courteous and helpful, and the Clock Bar in the lobby was a great place to hang out.

review.title: Bathroom Quality
review.reviewText: Towels in the bathroom were poor quality - hard to dry you.

review.title: Good View and close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Very good view at high tower floor. Quiet and nice room w/ two beds. Good for family. Will come back for a visit again

review.title: Family Vacation
review.reviewText: Great hotel...clean rooms.....friendly staff. Awesome location!
review.negativeRemarks: No swimming pool or hot tub. Needing to pay for Internet service in room.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location! Walking distance to shopping and dining. Cable car stops right at front door!

review.title: night in SF
review.reviewText:
bathroom was a bit small, but wife and i were there just for one night meeing friends from out of town. we got the smallest room on purpose since we were really just going to sleep there 1 night.

location is great, right on Union Square and close to some good restaurants. parking is also available. it's underground right below union square. it's $34 for a day, so do that instead of the $51 offered by the hotel (the probably just park the car in the same garage)

review.title: Not worthy
review.reviewText:
Westin is ok but expectations are too high.
A lot of noise goes through the walls such as water and tubs.
Room is too small and staff is not as friendly as expected. All services are out of the rate such as parking. Location is the best asset of this hotel but there are plenty with similar ammenities. Next time, I wont stay at the Westin.

review.title: The Best Hotel!
review.reviewText: There is no other hotel to stay at if you are visting San Francisco. Absolutely the nicest and most beautiful historical hotel in North America! Will always stay here when we visit San Francisco.

review.title: Pretty fabulous.
review.reviewText:
The only thing missing was a shower cap and Q-Tips, which I would have expected along with all the other opulence. That is the worst thing I can say.
The view of Union Square was fantastic, and the charm and elegance of the hotel was breathtaking.
review.positiveRemarks: The elegance and old-fashioned San Francisco style - right down to the garage attendants.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent.

review.title: My stay
review.reviewText: So much history belong to this great horel. Worth the experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Leaving
review.locationRemarks: Prime

review.title: Great location outweighs the cost
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel in a prime location in San Francisco. A bit pricer than I typically care for, but they let me check in early to accomodate my business meetings.

review.title: Good location. Cold hospitality
review.reviewText: I would recommend the hotel for its location. Book only if it's on a good offer price. It's not worth staying if you are paying full price. The hotel sucks in the area of hospitality. The service staff , from the door man to the concierge to the receptionist to the chamber maids, do not exude the qualities of the service/hospitality industry, eg warmth, friendliness
review.negativeRemarks: The staff
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: A classic!
review.reviewText:
Classic, well located, comfortable.

Had a security issue with a strange person walking in the elevator asking for money.
review.negativeRemarks: An informal/casual restaurant would be nice
review.locationRemarks: Great for business

review.title: Excellent Experience at Saint Francis Weston S.F.
review.reviewText: The staff was very accommodating and went out of their way to make me comfortable! The entire experience was delightful. Thank you for giving me the the benefit of a lower rate.
review.positiveRemarks: Parking at hotel- Bell service brought luggage immediately to room
review.negativeRemarks: NA
review.locationRemarks: Excellent Union Square Location Close to Restaurants - Shopping etc

review.title: Great location...poor accommodations.
review.reviewText: Location of the hotel is great but that is about it. The bathroom was not clean and I felt I needed to clean the tub prior showering. The noise level of the room was very high. We could hear the people next to us as if they were standing in our room and the noise from outside was very distracting - we were on the 7th floor. Hotel staff was not paraticularly friendly nor helpful. Every bit of information we got from the Concierge was mostly inaccurate. Fortunately the city has so much to offer we didn't spend much time in the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The Concierge, theperson you rely on to assist you with the things you don't know about the city, did not provide very accurate information.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square - close to shopping and other great areas to visit (Chinatown, the Wharf). Public transportation is easily accessible from the hotel.

review.title: Good location, cool. $14 internet, NOT cool.
review.reviewText:
This hotel is all about location, location, location.
Located right next to Union Square, it is very convenient for SF tours.
However, other than that, the hotel is just so-so. Check-in was slow, so was check-out.
The elevator is absolutely horrible, almost scary.
The room is alright, with some hideous wallpaper, but the bed is very comfortable. Amenities in the room is good, however, given that it is a Westin, nothing less should be expected.
Personally, I find $14 for one day of internet is just ABSURD. Being a hotel filled with history is one thing, but leaving living standard in the past (such as charging for internet) is ridiculous.
review.negativeRemarks: internet charge
review.locationRemarks: great!

review.title: Great hotel. Perfect location
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Perfect location in the heart of downtown SF. Disappointed by the room keys that weren't working well. Other than that, it's worth staying at St Francis.
review.negativeRemarks: room keys. refreshments in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect. Downtown SF. Perfect for shopping. Everything in walking distance.

review.title: Landmark hotel with dirty rooms and poor service
review.reviewText:
SF landmark hotel with great history and superb lobby, but with so-so corridors and tiny rooms that shall be kept much cleaner than they are now (empty beer cans behind the TV set/desk!). Bathrooms are even tinier and way less convenient than those that we had on cruise ships! The room cleaning stuff was awful: how about waking you up at 8:00 AM on Sunday with smashing knocks on the door and loud yells: "Cleaning! Cleaning!" Than, seemingly, they made a lot of load noise in the corridor, so no sleep after Saturday night. When I reported the problem to front desk, they understood it at once and admitted that room maids are not the best in their establishment and may be very annoying... Nice!
Water flow from the faucets and shower was alternating between too cold and too hot with cycle of about one minute, which made me get used to it quite quick.
The fridge/minibar will sense presence/absence of standard stuff on its selves, and charge you accordingly, even if you just pull their stuff out and put your stuff in. Actually, you may get charged more than once during one-night stay, as it was with me! And don't forget about this feeling that you are being watched by the hotel...
review.negativeRemarks: Tiny dirty rooms, bad room maids
review.locationRemarks: Union Square in San Francisco - Superb location!

review.title: Pleasant Stay
review.reviewText: Great Location. Well kept hotel. Would recommend for someone who wants to be at Union Square.

review.title: Grand old hotel that is mixed with the W.
review.reviewText: Its a grand old hotel that feels like the W has invated the lobby. But overall its a great hotel and you cant beat the location.
review.positiveRemarks: The classic old rooms in the front of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The lack of space in the clock bar.

review.title: Not so suite!!!
review.reviewText: F & B is outstanding thanks to Micheal Mina and Company, the rest is in bad need of an update. Room decor is simple, tired and outdated. The curtains in my room that faced dead east wouldn't stay closed all the way, Hello Sunshine!!! The fact that the best room available is really only an executive room, not a suite is ridiculous for a Hotel this size, also get rid of the spray everywhere double shower head and flimsy shower curtain combo that allows water to go everywhere in the bathroom. This hotel should be the absolute best Westin can offer instead of basically nice airport accommodations.
review.negativeRemarks: The room, the room, the room
review.locationRemarks: Great Location

review.title: Amazing Weekend Getaway!
review.reviewText: We were able to enjoy the renewal spa. It was amazing! The therapist were fantastic. Overall the hotel is beautiful and our stay was amazing!
review.positiveRemarks: The outside of the building the historical factor was beautiful
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of San Francsico and lots of great shopping.

review.title: Silence is golden...
review.reviewText: The walls are too thin. I could hear noise from the room above us. I could hear noise from people in the hall ways.

review.title: Noisy, old and overprice
review.reviewText: Noisy, overprice, there were trash on the waste baskets upon check in. There was a constant noise all night coming From a motor or some equipment. It's old smells like an old house. The location is the only highlight

review.title: Good location, but not worth the cost.
review.reviewText: Was a little dissapointed at how small the room was. I couldn't even open the closet door all the way b/c of an end table that had no where else to move to. Also the bathtub drain was clogged and tub would fill with water if you showered. There was a small closet for your clothes but not a dresser for storage. Had to live out of the suitcase which then took up all the floor space. Only good thing was a very good hotel lobby for meeting up with large groups. Location was very ideal as well.
review.negativeRemarks: Room size
review.locationRemarks: centrally located downtown

review.title: Dan
review.reviewText: Very Happy with everything this hotel has to offer.....EXCEPT they put a small fridge in your room filled to the top with water, snacks, etc for approx $5-10 per item. Fridge is on a "motion" sensor so you cannot put anything you purchase into the fridge. Just a full blown out money-grab.
review.negativeRemarks: no useable fridge.
review.locationRemarks: couldnt ask for a better location

review.title: san francisco classic
review.reviewText: newly renovated towers are very nice while keeping the charm of the hotel
review.locationRemarks: great central location to union square

review.title: Heavenly is there motto. I agree :)
review.reviewText: Amazing hotel. Wonderful staff. Room was clean and luxurious. Bed was amazing to sleep in. Definitely recommend this hotel!!
review.positiveRemarks: the bed and the lotion and shampoos
review.negativeRemarks: water pressure of hotel was sub-par, i would understand maybe not having enough hot water but fluctuation pressure is a drag
review.locationRemarks: location is optimal for shopping and night life

review.title: Very Comfortable, Great Location but Disappointing
review.reviewText: First time staying at this hotel. Although I would recommend this hotel because of its fabulous location, I was disappointed in that the mini bar was not stocked of snack items (I wouldn't have purchased any - incredibly expensive, but the fact that the fridge was not stocked properly did not say much for housekeeping) and the other irritating factor about this hotel is that on Sunday morning at 7:00 a.m. there was shouting, clanging and disruptive noise. When I called the Front Desk they told me that there wasn't anything they could do about the noise as it was a protest of some sort across the street and the hotel does not have any idea when they are going to protest. My question was, OK protest but at least there must be a city ordinance to keep them from that awful raucous on a Sunday morning when people are trying to sleep. Apparently there is not. Perhaps the hotel TOP management should work harder on a petition to get the city to stop noise before 10:00 a.m. on Sunday mornings!!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Noise Factor

review.title: Come to hotel lobby in your underwear...
review.reviewText:
Room service has the best food I've tasted at any big hotel chain.
Only glitch was when I called and asked for an extra hour due to an incoming conference business call, and was told I would have to go to the front desk to ask. For a physician still in his skivvies 20 minutes before the call, this was a bit too much. So, I left without participating in the call.

Admin should be more accomodating to their professional travelers. Some just might be Nobel prize winners.
review.negativeRemarks: prices on bar in room could dent the national debt. $7 for a diet Coke?? Give me a break.
review.locationRemarks: Best on the West Coast of USA

review.title: GREAT SERVICE , GOOD HOTEL
review.reviewText: great staff , and great service, consergie excelent, the rooms are worn-out

review.title: Basic room in need of updating/remodeled..
review.reviewText: Disappointing..very dirty/old carpets in room & very basic room .. Needs to be remodeled/ updated..The staff were nice & very helpful..I've stayed in alot of hotels, resorts & would give it 3 star max. Nice view in the room.

review.title: Above Average Stay
review.reviewText: We had a great view of Union Square. The main complaint about our room was the carpet. Very dingy and needed to be replaced. Other than that, and the exhorbitant cost for parking and wireless internet, we enjoyed our stay. Of course, the main attraction of this hotel is the spectacular lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Carpet in Room; high cost of parking and internet
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for lots of shopping

review.title: Terrific holiday experience
review.reviewText: A lovely old hotel in the center if San Francisco's shopping and theater district. We like to stay there during the holiday season. The staf is very kind and we often get upgraded to a room overlooking the big Christmas tree in the Square.

review.title: Would come back to the Westin again
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is the main reason we chose to stay here. It is located on Powell street right on Union Square. Many other hotels advertised their location as being on Union Square but are actually a few blocks away. I recommend parking under Union Square for a better rate.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is pricey
review.locationRemarks: Right on Powell street on Union Square, next to Macy's and all the major shops.

review.title: Westin St. Francis
review.reviewText: We love the location and the staff was all excellent!

review.title: The once a year SF visit
review.reviewText: Always stay here when I visit SF which is usually 1 or 2 nights right before Christmas. Central and great location, quiet, comfortable and the beds...THE BEST BEDS.

review.title: Westin St.Francis,Union Square
review.reviewText:
Entryway, main lobby--decadent,plush,welcoming,very nice.Staff,professional and welcoming, Rooms,plush bed,very comfortable.Bathroom,just fine not over the top,but comfortable.Location,fantastic-shopping,restaurants plentiful,food and drink on the run,plenty,entertainment from people watching to movies,plentiful.Bars galore.
Public transportation nearby,or walkers paradise.
There seems to be more than an average amount of homeless and Occupy was seen quite abit.That's more of a sign of the times rather then anything to do with the hotel.
In room wi-fi available for a fee,good channel selection on the television.In room-requested and received a separate fridge which was a plus.
Overall,stress relieving experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Plush bed,inviting entry hall,professional staff,view from the room included Mortons Steakhouse,Central location.
review.negativeRemarks: No free wi-fi in the room,although it is available in the lobby.
review.locationRemarks:
Union Square,near everything one could need,food,restaurants,fast food,bars all nearby.
Shop til you drop in this neighborhood.

review.title: Nice trip
review.reviewText: Loved the location, great for shopping!!

review.title: Nice Union Square hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed just one night over the Thanksgiving weekend. We were in the old part of the hotel, but room was clean and we could see Union square from room 814. Location couldn't be better, close to shopping, restaurant, and even temporary ice ring. We forgot our daughter stroller, but they offer a complementary one. If you can get a good price, definitely recommended.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: Thanksgiving Dinner was terrific. We had excellent service throughout our stay. Gym access should be free to guests though.

review.title: Will stay again
review.reviewText:
It was a wonderful stay. The room was imaculate and smelled fresh, though there was some pealing paint in the bath. The view was fantastic. The hotel was decked in holiday attire, which put me in a good mood. The neighborhood was filled with restaraunts and shopping...and regretfully homeless. Three blocks away is the biggest soup kitchen in San Fran. A sad statement of America today. The Westin is also seperated from many of the traditional tourist locations (Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard St, Coit Tower) by what seemed like Mt. Everest to someone who is more familiar with the flat East coast cities.
I enjoyed the history of the hotel...home of Fatty Arbuckle's downfall, an attempt on Gerald Ford's life, home of presidents and queens.
A curious thing I've noted about hotels...the more expensive they are the less free commonalities you get. I've stayed at cut rate hotels and have gotten free sewing kits and internet. Here I had to ask for the kit (it was free though), but intenet was $20 for 10 minutes. Wow! You'd think they could wi-fi the whole place for the rates they charge.
I shouldn't paint a bad picture, though. When I return to San Fran I will definitely stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is a good base. It is easy walking distance of most "must" see tourist attractions. Easy being a relative term in HILLY San Francisco. These include Coit Tower, Lombard St, Pier 39, and Little Italy (North Beach). Most tour buses originate here. Make sure to catch the Muir Woods tour. Bay, Salsilito, and Alcatraz cruises originate from neighborhood piers. It's the neighborhood you MUST see when you want to say you've visited San Fran.

review.title: Excellent Stay!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. Right in the center of the city. Literally across the street from Union Square. Trolley and tours buses were feet away...very convenient. Friendly staff
review.locationRemarks: Take a hop on hop off tour. Its the best and cheapest way to view all the tourist spots that the city has to offer

review.title: Probably will stay their every time we go to S.F.
review.reviewText: Love this hotel. A little more detail to cleaning in room. Like shower grout. The mirrors, and baseboards. A hotel with that history, it's a landmark, should be sparking clean. Room 2795, awesome view.
review.locationRemarks: Union sguare where the hotel was. Especially if going to a play or opera. Great restaurants and shopping. Can take cable car to the wharf, etc.

review.title: Location...Location...
review.reviewText: Love the location! Expensive parking but worth it! But the airconditioning is not cold enough first night and i had to complain about it, the woman who took my call said she will send someone but we fell asleep and no one came, the next day i called again, someone came in fast and said that the filer of the aircon is so dirty so no air is coming in. I told frontdesk and they gave me a free breakfast that i dont really care at all.
review.locationRemarks: Area is good for couples not with small kid

review.title: traveler from new york
review.reviewText: My room was cramped, loud, hot, and it faced an alleyway. The manager refused to let me out of the 2nd night of my two-night reservation. The place is like a bad Stephen King movie. Stay away.

review.title: Good location, but that's it.
review.reviewText: Stayed in the older of the two wings and was not happy with the stay. I'm surprised that it's operated under the Westin name. It really is a fantastic location, but the thin walls and musty smell was enough to put me off of this place. I'll look for another location on my next visit to San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is a great base for all of your San Francisco needs.

review.title: Excellent staff, immediate response to my needs
review.reviewText: Hotel staff is extremely professional and helpful. Walked in and requested rooms after leaving our original booked "boutique hotel" around the corner which had no air conditioning. Staff accomodated us right away on a busy week. The last night we needed was sold out. Searched Expedia - got the room and Westin staff honored lower price. Stayed 3 nights. Bed was excellent in new tower. Location excellent! Oak Rm Restaurant - excellent food and service! Went to wine country- decided to return to city. Searched Expedia again - great rate! Booked 3 more nights. Original room in older section of hotel had terrible bed and hallway smelled musty. Requested to be moved to newer tower after first nigt was immediately granted by Liz. She even gave us a larger room and sent bellman up to help move us within 15 minutes of phone call. Jeff at concierge desk is superb! Will definately return!
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, safety, transportation, shopping, restaurants and events.

review.title: The heart of the City.
review.reviewText: This is the best hotel. Not only does it have history and style, the staff was very generous and helpful. It is on Union Square, the center of fine shopping. I was able to continue shopping into the night and felt completely safe. Will definitely stay here again. Thanks for a great stay!
review.locationRemarks: We have also stayed at various hotels at the Wharf. There are many things to do there, and being next to the water is wonderful. We just love this city.

review.title: Location was only thing that would make me go back
review.reviewText: Staff was totally uptight. 1 friendly bellman and the rest could careless. Don't bother tipping because they don't appreciate it. Room was stuffy and never cooled down.

review.title: San Francisco's Best Hotel
review.reviewText: There is always a great welcome at this hotel. Location is ideal for everything -shoppin, restaurants and the cable cars. The facilities are superb, staff attentive and facilities good. The Heavenly beds are divine.

review.title: Perfect location, great service
review.reviewText: Perfect location, room was quiet and clean, impeccable service, just price during conference time was skyrocket-high

review.title: Great local in San Fran
review.reviewText:
our stay here was fantastic! Really close to everything, and hotel staff gave great suggestions for restaurants, directions to where we wanted to go, and taxis!
we will definitely stay here again

review.title: Ideal for Union Square
review.reviewText: This was a return visit, and was a well located hotel with a good sized, clean ,comfortable room. Only negative point was the lack of room free wifi, which considering the room rate is not good.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText:
Only good thing about this hotel is the location. Hotel is old and run down. Very overpriced compared to other hotels nearby which I've stayed at.
Didn't give us king bed we had reserved. Water pressure in bathroom went up and down. Shower drain was partially plugged. Rooms are small. Would not allow late check out as a courtesy.
The hotel is so busy and popular because of it's location that they can afford to treat you like crap and offer you a sub par product. They know that if you don't come back there are a dozen suckers out there who will.
We usually stay at the Parc55 when we come to SF. Decided to stay at westin just to try something new. Will not stay here again. Do yourself a favor and stay at parc55. Same location, recently remodeled, better rooms for the same price.

review.title: Worried at first, Happy when we saw the place.
review.reviewText: Was nervous at first when we booked the room, but when u saw the place it was better than I could of imagined. Exelent place to stay and plan on visiting again. I would recommend this place to any female interested in shopping at designer stores all in walking distance from the hotel. My wife had a great time and loves me even more for taking her here. Thanks guys.

review.title: West St. FRancis - San Francisco
review.reviewText: It was a great place to stay.

review.title: Very nice,clean and luxury hotel.
review.reviewText: This was very nice and clean hotel. The biggest advantage is the location. Its feels like staying at times square. If you have a short trip to san francisco, then stay at union square and stay at this hotel.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Wonderful location and their Steak restaurant the best in San Francisco.

review.title: Very Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with how friendly and professional the hotel staff was.

review.title: Great Weekend Get Away
review.reviewText: Was in SF for weekend get away. We almost always stay at Westin St. Francis and have never been dissappointed there. Had a Bayview Grand Suite on a high floor in tower. Stayed in historic part of hotel once - rooms are way too small, but they're nice if you like tradition. Corner suite we had was very large, clean, well appointed with fantastic views from 2 big bay windows - well worth the upgrade price. Front desk, concierge & housekeeping were all very good - pleasant & efficient. Westin St. F has all amenities one would expect - tour desk, health center, free computer station for airline check in, print boarding passes, etc...Had to use the business center one morning and it had everything I needed. Hotel is in best location right on Union Square. Close to all shopping & cable car stops right in front to take you to the Wharf. Walk 2 blocks from hotel to Chinatown. Lots of great restaurants all around hotel. Great place to spend the weekend.

review.title: Perfect stay.
review.reviewText: Perfect. Gorgeous bathroom. Comfortable beds. Great service.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Room was small. Bathroom was tiny. Drains were not maintained. We stood in 6" of water during showers. Not what I remembered from my previous stays.

review.title: One beautiful night in Union Square
review.reviewText: Only one night, but it was lovely. Beautiful linens, cushy bed, clean and quiet room with quite a view. What more could you ask for?

review.title: Mismanaged hotel, what a pity
review.reviewText: The hotel is in the best location in San Francisco, but it is so poorly managed. We checked in for 4 rooms and front desk immediately confused all our names, registering 3 rooms in one erroneous name even though our reservations and documentation were clear. Front desk could not find any envelopes left for us, and calls were not put through to us. When we pointed out their error, the operator said the names could not be corrected. The rooms were very old, some very small. Maintenance has been poor, and housekeeping only did the beds and did not clean the rooms. People in front desk said "we understand you are upset" but it was clear they were just mouthing lines for guests. Suggest those who wish to stay in the area check into JW Marriott nearby, or if you have the budget, Four Seasons. What a pity that this hotel is not better run. Westin should invest in modernizing and upgrading the rooms as the hotel is a gem. Front desk people should all be fired.

review.title: union square
review.reviewText:
The location of the hotel was great. I paid extra to get recently renovated room in the tower. The room was comfortable with adequate space-some reviews said that the room sizes were small. However, for a recently renovated room it was not THAT update or great looking. All of the amenities in the room were typical of other hotels that I have stayed in(though not in the SF area). The bathroom sink drain did not function properly, which is surprising that any housekeeping staff would not have noticed it during cleaning and reported it to get fixed. But it wasn't a huge deal since my stay was short.
Bottom line the hotel was expensive for typical space and amenities however for the San Francisco area I don't think you could get much better.

review.title: San Francisco review
review.reviewText: Good vacation

review.title: Great Location, Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location. Lots of dining options and if it is not close the cable car stop is 1/2 block up.

review.title: Loose articles on Mini Bar fell over got charged
review.reviewText: Awesome view, great service, even got a free upgrade. Was happy with everything until checkout when I had to pay 8 dollars for a small can of pringles that fell of the rack on the mini bar and they refused to credit even after I showed them the can that was not opened or eaten.

review.title: Had a very nice stay
review.reviewText: We recently had a very nice stay at the Westin. The location is very convenient to just about everything, including the cable car. and shopping Our room was a little noisy and we could hear sounds from the street, even on the 16th floor. But the sounds come with the convenience of the location. The doormen where very friendly and helpful, as were the concierge and garage staff.

review.title: Okay
review.reviewText: The hotel is going through renovations. Occasional elevators were out of service. They have a good health club with lockers and massage rooms but it's $12 extra. You can max out for $35 for unlimited use. Food counter in lobby appears to be all Starbucks products but don't accept Starbuck's cards. Avoid rooms facing Union Square if you hope to get any sleep.

review.title: Fine wether
review.reviewText: It was so nice and beautiful in the city.

review.title: Great, convenient hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice. SOme of the rooms are small (mine had a double bed) but I was travelling for work and was alone so the room size was perfect for me. The bed was cozy and the room was clean, which are the two most important things to me.

review.title: Palacial Home away from Home
review.reviewText: The history and grandness of this magnificent palace of a hotel is breathtaking! The finess of the staff was so greatly appreciated and welcomed, felt like were were arrving VIP's! The valet was so pleasant and fun! I wish I could have given him triple what we did and we did tip well! but he was worth it with his pleasantries, smile and goving above and beyond in getting us settled in to our beautiful room, The view of Coit Tower, partial of the bay, and the other old glorious San Francisco hotels was like being somewhere else in time! We will be back and know that we will be treated and welcomed as this visit!

review.title: Resting on its laurels
review.reviewText: This grand old hotel, very conveniently located, seemed a little tired. No-one was making any extra effort, which, given its high price, seems inappropriate. The toiletries were meager. There was no bathrobe. There was no newspaper at the door. There was no directory of hotel services. When I asked for a room with a chaise longue, which I'd enjoyed on a visit five years ago, the desk clerk didn't know what I meant and just assured me the room had one, which it didn't. None of these things are deal-breakers, they just make the difference between a high-class hotel and a not-so-high-class one.

review.title: Beautiful hotel and setting, paper thin walls
review.reviewText:
The hotel is clean, well maintained and well staffed. The only problem we faced was that the walls of the room were paper thin. You could clearly hear the conversation going on in the room next door... you could even hear when someone got on or off the bed as the springs creaked.
As much as the hotel provides a lovely room to stay in the heart of downtown San Francisco, it also needs to protect the privacy of the guests. while its not possible to see what is going on on the other side of the wall, one can tell by the smallest sounds what goes on next door.
We could tell we were staying in the older part of the hotel and I hope the newer part of it has better sound insulation.

review.title: Great location - a classic
review.reviewText: Very well located hotel. The hotel itself is a little older but charm and convenience make it a winner

review.title: Fantastic stay!
review.reviewText: had a lovely time....would recommend this beautiful hotel to anyone!!!

review.title: Great experience, really nice hotel
review.reviewText: The Westin is really nice; very elegant and classy. We only stayed one night, but the room was clean and had nice furniture, the bed was comfy, and the front desk was professional and courteous. If you have a car, the valet is expensive; consider parking overnight in the lot in the middle of Union Square, it's a bit cheaper.

review.title: Great time in San Fran
review.reviewText: hotel was great staff was great walking distance to china town and great shopping will come back again for sure

review.title: Awesome!
review.reviewText: First class accomodations and service at an affordable price!

review.title: an absolute treat
review.reviewText:
easy to get to from SFO
car taken care of
reception easy
room first class
great foyer area to have coffee
favorite feature photos and histories in foyer
unfavorite feature paying for internet connection

review.title: Our home in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We love this place and always stay here when we come into the city.

review.title: Amazing Location
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel and the Heavenly Bed! The cable was a bit fuzzy on certain channels and there wasn't AT&T cell phone coverage in the room which was difficult.

review.title: SFO is Great
review.reviewText: This hotel is great and would stay here again but next time for longer.

review.title: Best in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: love the St Francis!

review.title: Westin St. Francis
review.reviewText: Overall a very nice hotel. It was conveniently located, and was near some very nice restaurants.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: not great, hotel was just disorganized, small problems compounded into big problems which resulted in an argument with management in the lobby.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Our stay at St. Francis was great! The only downfall was that we weren't aware that the weekend we were there was Chinese New Year and the surounding hotel streets were going to be closed down. Made things a little dfficult!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel. Bed was heavenly

review.title: A great place to stay in Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: My husband and I wanted to celebrate a very important anniversary and wanted it to be in the area of SF that we have had many fond memories. We were able to book a 1 night stay with no issues via Expedia. Upon our arrival we were greeted with a lobby host who took the time to get to know us and the reason for our stay. As a result, she made sure that our accommodations fit the occasion. All the staff were very friendly and helpful through our stay. Our lobby host even check-in with us upon our departure to ensure our time was special. Although we ourselves live in SF, we just wanted a night away from home and this hotel and location were perfect for what we wanted. We would recommend anyone local or from out of town to stay here. We especially liked the wine tasting room and hope that this is something the hotel continues to host ongoing.

review.title: Our experience was ok, not great not worse
review.reviewText: Our experience at St. Francis was okay. In spite of booking our room in advance the person made us wait for 10 minutes. After that we got the keys to our room. The hotel is great from the outside but the room itself is not so great. The bathroom doors do not have a lock and are like closet doors. We were on the 24th floor and the view from the window was good. Our experience living at St. Francis was not really luxurious as we expected it to be. There were no glasses to drink water in or a jug to store water, there were just 2 paper cups to drink water from which were actually meant for coffee. Throughout our stay we felt more inconvenient because basic things like glasses were not available, then the shower would not get hot enough, the wash basin had gunk stuck in it and whenever we turned the tap on the whole sink started to get filled and almost overflowed. These look like minor things but made us feel inconvenient. Our stay at less luxurious and cheaper hotels has been way better compared to St. Francis. Overall, in my opinion, staying at St. Francis does offer luxury due to it being a historic site but does not offer value for the money.

review.title: St Fancis
review.reviewText: A little run down. No bathrobes as promised. No shower cap.

review.title: The best located hotel in SFco
review.reviewText: This is the perfect place to enjoy San Francisco: BART, Muni, cablecar, shopping malls, everything you need is at a walking distance. Besides, the hotel is gorgeous

review.title: Good but not great.
review.reviewText:
Overall the experience was wonderful. The service was impeccable, the room was very nice and the room service was great. Though not exactly the 4 star stay I expected from the St. Francis.

However there were a few problems. The first problem was that the bathroom wasn't completely clean - the tub, toilet and counters were, but the rest of the shelves were un-dusted and dirty. The other problem was that there was a huge amount of noise at 11pm and we could not get a hold of the front desk to complain about it, I eventually had to use my cell phone to call the front desk.

review.title: After many visits to this hotel, this was my last
review.reviewText:
While the room was passable and the lobby terrific, overall the old tower is was tawdry. Misled into considering the The Oak Room as appropriate for New Year's Eve black tie dining (it's their coffee shop). Marginal effort by the concierge to book more appropriate dining reservations that led to a nightmare experience. Water service to the room failing completely New Year's Day (while wife was washing her hair). Poor communications and poor service, overall, for a hotel of this stature.

Never again.

review.title: great location... inside needs improvement
review.reviewText: Location was amazing.. beautiful... rooms r old and its too expensive for what it looks like inside...

review.title: not really impressed
review.reviewText: hotel was pretty in the lobby, check in was okay. 15.00 for a glass of wine is way to much. restaurants way too expensive. room was okay except for the bathroom grount being so dirty when it is suppose to be white, and the big yellow stain all around the base of the toilet. bleach is cheap.

review.title: Enjoy it every time
review.reviewText: I love the architecture and the great views from the elevator. I got a pedicure in the hotel spa and the woman who did the pedicure was great. The wait to check in was much longer than I expected, but it was a busy time during the holidays.

review.title: Holiday Stay
review.reviewText: We stayed at the St. Francis on December 23rd and 24th so that we could be in the middle of all the Chrismtas decorations and shopping. Although the lobby always seemed full of guests we never fetl that any aspect of our stay was impacted. Overall, very good service and decent size rooms.

review.title: Almost perfect
review.reviewText:
Even thought they've done a great job with the remodel my room was relatively small by modern standards and also in relation to the price (however I got a good rate for this hotel). The street noise came right through the closed window and made it difficult to sleep while the guy downstairs was playing the drums on the street.
I guess this is the kind of thing that "comes with the territory"?

review.title: Great location! Great Restaurants! Lacking room.
review.reviewText: The lobby and restaurants at the St.Francis were beautiful and very "posh",however our actual room had peeling wallpaper and was lacking adequate towels. The room and bathroom were very dark seemed as though they were trying to hide something.We did enjoy dinner at the Bourbon Steak House. Food was delicious!

review.title: Amazing location for tourists !
review.reviewText: A Grand Old Hotel with an unbeatable location for tourists to start a San Francisco adventure..

review.title: Historic, but tired SF icon
review.reviewText:
I couldn't wait to stay at the Westin St Francis. After all what could be better, a Westin hotel right on Union Square?
I must admit I was a little disappointed - this is not a cheap hotel but it is looking decidedly tired and old. The rooms are clean, but tatty. My bathroom was in real need of a refurb.
I'd say that if you are looking for a luxury SF experience best try somewhere else...and lets face it, there are lots of hotels in this area.

review.title: Vacation...
review.reviewText:
There were stains on the floor in the bathroom, it had not been cleaned. I called them and they said they would clean it the following day.

The location is great. I was disappointed because I have not had a dirty room with them before. It was our anniversary too.

review.title: Good hotel, great location but food & beverage is unreasonably expensive
review.reviewText: The St. Francis is a storied hotel and in a great location. If you find any "deals" on rooms, be aware that meals in the hotel, especially breakfast are outrageously expensive.

review.title: room for improvement, great location
review.reviewText: room for improvement, most good hotels offer free internet acces

review.title: Already planning another annual girls weekend
review.reviewText: My friend and I were celebrating a milestone birthday with a third friend. For her special day we surprised her with a stay at the Westin St. Francis. What a special time we had. The hotel is stunning, and right in the middle of Union Square. What could be more fun than walking outside the door and shopping. Everyone at the hotel was so helpful and polite. The only negative at all was that someone had a dog that barked in a nearby room, and that isn't the hotel's fault.

review.title: Old, and it shows.
review.reviewText: We got the smallest room we have had in years. The view was a just a wall. No housekeeping during the first two days. On the departure day housekeeping came 09:00, which made it impossible for us to use the room till checkout time noon. Union Square is a OK location, but the area behind the hotel is not an are to go "after dark"

review.title: San Francisco's best
review.reviewText:
The Westin St Francis is luxurious without being over the top. As with the best hotels everywhere, the style is traditional. No "boutique" nonsense here! A sense of history is present throughout the hotel, particularly in the displays of historical documents and photographs, and adds greatly to the ambience. The location is the best in town.
Our room was spacious, comfortable and well equipped and staff were uniformly pleasant and helpful.
This is a great hotel and we will definitely be back.

review.title: Great Location and Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: Check was fast and efficient. The hotel is beautiful and is in a great location. The room was small and the lighting in the desk area was very dim. Otherwise, it was great. We walked everywhere. Although, if walking steep hills is a challenge for you, I'd suggest grabbing a cab or taking the trolley. A trolley stop is right in front of the hotel. If you are planning on using the valet service, you have to go around the corner for the garage. This was a little confusing since there aren't any signs explaining this.

review.title: Night at the St. Francis
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, have stayed there many times. Only complaint would be the lighting in the bathroom. Everything else is as advertised. Great location at Union Square, everything you could want or need is within walking distance.

review.title: GOOD BUT SEVERAL SURPRISES
review.reviewText:
THIS IS MY HOTEL OF CHOICEI SAN FANCISCO. MY ONLY DISAPP
OINTMENT IS A LACK OF LOBBY SEATING. IT IS AN ELEGANT SETTING,
HOWEVER, SEATING HAS BEEN CUT BACK DO TO OUSIDERS USING IT.

THIS IS ALSO THE FIRST TIME THAT I HAVE ENCOUNTERED THE HOTEL
INITIATING A CHARGE FOR INCIDENTALS UP FRONT ($80.00 PER DAY).
IT IS RECONCILED AFTER YOU CHECK OUT AND I WOULD NOT HAVE
NOTICED IT HAD I NOTGONE ONLINE TO REVIEW MY CHARGE CARD.
I HAD TO CALL THE HOTELTO FIND OUT ABOUT THIS. IS THIS BECOMING A NEW SGTANDARD PROCEEDURE?

review.title: Union Square Hotel
review.reviewText: clean, professional, courteous, great location in Union Square, historic building

review.title: Not what I expected for the price
review.reviewText: no comment

review.title: Crowded, slow elevators, needs a makeover
review.reviewText:
The location couldn't be beat, however, it's a very busy hotel with lots of people staying in the hotel. If you are staying in the towers, expect up to a 10 minute wait just to get an elevator, and then expect another 3-5 minutes on the elevator while it stops at every floor. The elevators are bad. The rooms overlooking the bay have excellent views. The rooms in the other direction give you a nice view of other building's roofs. I booked my room on Expedia for a Tower Room, and got a view of a roof. When I went downstairs to the desk, they did change my room and gave my a very nice view.

The minibar is one of those ridiculous minibars, where if you move anything in the minibar, you get charged for it. When I complained and told them I simply needed to store some medicine in the fridge, they brought me up a gigantic half fridge to put in my room. They told me I couldn't use the mini bar fridge. The thing was ugly as heck and the last thing I wanted in my room. When I went to check out, they did reverse all the charges, but it was a total pain to deal with.

If you want a cab, expect a long wait of up to 20 minutes. The $50 for parking is a ripoff.

This is a big hotel with marginal rooms. The first room I was put in had chipped furniture and peeling paint. When I was moved to the 28th floor, I got a nicer room with awesome views, but it was only a 3 on a grade of 5 stars. The front desk staff at the Starwood line was very nice and helpful, but not sure I'd stay here again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. My only disappointment was hair in my shower and maid service. When I arrived I noticed hair in my shower as it wasn't cleaned from the last visitor. When I called to get extras towels in the evening the guy who delivered the towels seemed like I was bothering him. He wasn't very pleasant.

review.title: St. Francis - Union Square - San Fran
review.reviewText: I liked this hotel. The only thing I would say is to see if you can get into the newer tower. One of our group was in the original hotel and the air conditioning was somewhat noisy and the bathroom is bigger in the new tower. Otherwise, we were very happy with the hotel and would book it again.

review.title: It was OK
review.reviewText:
On the good side, the view from the 27th floor was amazing and the room itself, while small, was fairly comfortable.

On the bad side, tiny room, not well cleaned (had a wine cork and other trash under the bed), the internet connection (additional cost to room rate) repeatedly stopped working, and the LCD TV was very small. The room was also fairly noisy.

On the whole, I would have expected to a room at that price point at a hotel as highly rated as the Westin St. Francis to be much nicer than it was.

review.title: Great location and amenities
review.reviewText:
My stay at the Westin St. Francis exceeded my expectations. I had been in the hotel lobby before, but never stayed there. I chose this hotel for this stay due to a combination of location, price and "stars." although I knew it was in a vintage building, and that sometimes there can be issues.

However, they have done a wonderful job of renovating and updating the hotel. While maintaining its historic charm, all of the bedding and fixtures have been updated to the highest standards.

My only complaint is that the noise from the hallways, and adjoining rooms was a bit more audible than would be ideal. Not great if you were looking to sleep in.

review.title: Two Westin Hotels...different experiences.
review.reviewText:
Over the space of one week in San Francisco I spent 3 nights at Westin St Francis and 2 nights at Westin San Francisco. These hotels are just a short distance apart in San Francisco city centre.

Being part of the same group the overall facilities at each hotel were similar. The Westin St Francis on Union Square was larger, and the staff there were significantly less courteous and friendly than those in the Westin San Francisco at Market Street, (who were as helpul, friendly and courteous as anyone could wish for).

I was in the original building at the Westin St Francis (they have a newer tower). The decor in the corridor areas was a bit tired, but the room was OK You can see the grandeur that that must have been there 40 years ago. The hotel is in a great location, and is ideal for both tourist and business travellers. However, it was the service and demeanour of the staff that was the main disappointment, on two separate occasions I was shocked by how abruptly I was spoken to when asking for assistance or information. (...that and and the remnants of nearby rooms' room-service meals that seemed to always lay in the corridors.)

At the Westin San Francisco, just a few blocks away, I was treated like a friend rather than a "money generator". As a business traveller who spends a lot of time in hotels, it is the small things that make a big difference. Given a choice again, the Westin San Francisco will get my business.

review.title: Expensive extras
review.reviewText: Good Hotel, nice room and hice people. THe only problem is that they charge you for everithing. 2 dolars for each ATTEMPT to call an 800 number, 20 dolars per night for wi-fi, very high charges for room service, etc. I were 9 night and spend over 300 dolars just in this items.

review.title: Way too big
review.reviewText:
I almost always prefer staying in hostels rather than in hotels, I was kind of forced to stay in this hotel. And indeed the stay justified my original preference.
It's not a big deal. The location is great, but it's just too big for me. No personal touch, too industrial, too artificial and urban. The bed is too high, I couldn't sit on it, haha, my feet were in the air. Elevators are a little annoying, waiting time is too long IMHO. Can't use the fridge, I was afraid of touching something from the mini-bar (If something is removed there - even by chance - it charges the account in 10 seconds automatically). Luckily I didn't get lost in the maze of the building, but maybe they have a rescue team for such cases (account charged automatically) :)
Great for those who like hotel comfort, and don't care about all the above.

review.title: excellent hotel in best possible location
review.reviewText: really great hotel

review.title: 5 Stars for Front Desk Staff!!
review.reviewText: The front desk staff was extremely courteous and helpful and looked up some stuff on the internet (the operating hours of the local Muni/bus ticket office, etc.) while I was checking in. When I checked out, I mentioned that my room charges did not include a movie that I watched the night before and the staff member said it was "our gift to you!!"

review.title: I´ll definitely come back
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, well situated. Prices not included are very expesive, not free internet in rooms.

review.title: I left my heart in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I love this hotel and the memories I have there. The only problem was, I called down for extra towels that never came and the shampoos and toiletries were never replaced even though the shampoo and conditioner were used.
