One bottle is only enough for one use. What was the housekeeper thinking? I wondered if it was a budget issue.

review.title: Great location, average experience
review.reviewText: Room condition was good, although we booked a basic room, so it was *quite* small. If location is the primary concern, this hotel is pretty much the best option in Union Square.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: It was a beautiful hotel. Comfortable beds, excellent view of the City. Everyone there was extremely helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is going to visit San Francisco.

review.title: Visitor from CT
review.reviewText: Once we were switched to a room on a higher floor with a better view, our stay was quite pleasant. The room had been recently updated, the beds were extremely comfortable, and the hotel's location on Union Square was ideal.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Confused check in; plastic curtain in bath tub instead of glass; dirty carpet in room floor.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful and historic. It is well located, right on Union Square and the street car line, and steps away from the BART. There is great shopping nearby, as well. The room was tastefully decorated and spacious. Our view of Union Square was a beautiful. The only complaint was a huge stain in the carpet that I couldn't overlook. I had certain expectations from the web site, and I paid more for a room with a view, and was very disappointed in the huge, ugly stain. It was right in the middle of the floor, and couldn't be missed. It was the first thing I saw when we walked in the room upon check-in, and every time I entered the room thereafter. I just expected more from a hotel like the Westin St. Frances.

review.title: Can't beat the location; and the view ... if no fog
review.reviewText:
Fairly busy hotel, spread between the historic building facing Union Sq and the new tower behind, where we stayed. Stayed with my wife near the top of the tower -- the view could have been spectacular if it weren't for the fog. Still, to get to the room, we took the full-glass external elevator with a direct view on Union Sq (once you cleared the 15 or so stories of the historic building).

Room was spacious and comfortable; a little coffee shop in the lobby served fruit and pastries -- perfect for a light breakfast.

With about a million things to do in SF there is no single location that will satisfy all the needs. But if you're looking around Union Sq (mainly shopping and theater) you just can't beat this!

review.title: LOVED IT!!
review.reviewText: Also enjoyed watching program showing history of hotel. My children learned quite a bit.

review.title: Nice but small...and warm
review.reviewText: We weren't expecting the room and bathroom to be so small, but it had everything we needed. No matter how low we turned the a/c, the room remained at 73 degrees - warmer than the outside temperature.

review.title: Classic Excellence
review.reviewText: There are few hotels with the history and reputation as the St. Francis. It was a rare treat to stay there. It is absolutely an amazing site to walk out the door and be greeted by a passing cable car on Union Square. The service was excellent. We treated our teen daughter to a room service dinner. She was floored when dinner arrived on a fully decked out linen cover table. Rooms with Marble baths, chandeliers and a century old charm make this a must stay.

review.title: The only place to stay
review.reviewText:
This was my first trip to San Francisco. We were in walking distance from China Town and all the shopping you would care to do. And believe me I shopped! We took avantage of the Spa which was terrific. My husband wanted to eat at the Oakroom every night.
We took our 19 year old son with us and he soaked in all the history and took beautiful pictures when we did the open top bus tour (twice).
Our room had a coffeemaker with a few options of starbucks coffee which was great because that helped us get ready in the morning to start our day.

review.title: was nice
review.reviewText: The Hotel was in an excellent location. However, I was disappointed with the lack of charm,character and coziness of a the so called lobby area, nor was this hotel luxurious.

review.title: Great classic hotel
review.reviewText: health club fee of $12 high given equipment available

review.title: wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: stayed in new tower. 20th floor- great view. employees very professional. be careful of mini-bar - your account will be charged for anything you LOOK at if not put back in 10 secs! also must pay extra for internet, gym, parking etc

review.title: Loved it.
review.reviewText: We loved everything, the hotel was great, the area is the best, I would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Excellent Loation
review.reviewText: Perfect for shopping

review.title: Can't beat the location
review.reviewText: The Westin St Francis provides consistently good service and a clean, reasonably sized room in an excellent location, and thus is probably more worth the cost than other hotels in the area. There is good parking in the public garage under Union Square across the street for those of us who can't bear to hand the keys to an attendant and have no idea where our car is parked nor access to anything left inside. There are some nice breakfast restaurants within a couple blocks of the hotel.

review.title: Slightly below expectations.
review.reviewText:
The hotel itself was fine for the most part. We had a "known problem" of our mattress/boxspring falling through the bed frame 2 of the 6 nights we were there. Fortunately we were only sitting on the bed each time this happened.
The location of the hotel is great - we used a 1 week MUNI pass during our visit to get around, so the union square location would perfect. Tons of shopping and restaurants surround the area.
Prices were absurdly high for cocktails in the lobby. I travel to large cities within the U.S. frequently, so I was surprised that 1 drink would cost the same as a bottle of liquor.

review.title: An Oldie But Still Goody
review.reviewText:
I have stayed at many hotels, in San Francisco, since my first visit to the city. However, until my most recent one , I had never stayed at the Westin St. Francis, one of the city's oldest hotels. I throughly enjoyed my five-night stay. The great service began, literally, at the front door, where I was warmly greeted bt the doorman, Riley. Among other things, he recommended a restaurant, The 1300, which I tried and liked. I arrived at the hotel rather early in the morning, so my room was not yet ready. The front desk person indicated that I could check my luggage with the bell captian and that he would call me when the room was ready. Since I wanted to do some sight seeing, this was fine with me. However, I was never called. I did not know that my room was ready until I returned to the hotel, late in the afternoon. The person who was on duty, when I returned to the hotel, profusely apologized for the oversight. This was the only negative thing which occurred during my stay.

The room was large and very nicely decorated with what appeared to be fairly new furnishings. The bed was the most comfortable in which I have ever slept, in a hotel. The shower/tub had a twin headed shower, which I have never experienced before.

The location of the facility was perfect for me, right across the street from Union Square. It is readily accessible to all forms of public transportation.

The hotel management has done an excellent job in upgrading the facility while maintaining its gradeur.

review.title: Highly recommended!!!
review.reviewText:
We spent three nights at the Westin St. Francis in San Francisco in August 2010.
Everything was perfect: the surroundings (famous cable car at the front door),
the cleanliness, the view, the comfort, etc.
If you go to San Francisco, don't hesitate to book there.

review.title: I left my heart in St Francis
review.reviewText:
I absolutely loved my stay in San Francisco, and this hotel was a big contributing factor! Located right in front of Union Square, St Francis was ideal. Great location, beautiful, big rooms with plenty of space, even in the bathrooms. The curtains were heavy and dark so they blocked out sunlight in the mornings. Every single staff member we came across from front desk staff to housekeepers were all very friendly and helpful.

Only problem faced was our room being too close to the lifts. Sometimes would hear them going through the night, but the noise was more of a background sound.

Would stay here again in a flash!

review.title: Nothing special
review.reviewText: Bathroom was large but boring. Only small hand-held shower head. Only 2 bath towels. Expensive internet access and work out room access.

review.title: Location Location Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was everything we expected. When the hotel found out we were just married, they sent up a bottle of champagne and we got coupons for a complimentary breakfast. The service was exceptional and everyone was so friendly. Would stay here again. The only negative was parking, which costs $$ per night.

review.title: We loved it!
review.reviewText: My daughter and I loved this hotel. The bed was heavenly, as advertised. The staff was pleasant and helpful without being constantly on the lookout for a tip. We did leave a daily tip for maid service which was acknowledged with a nice thank you note. Location was great! We would definitely stay here again

review.title: Historical, fun, perfect weekend get away!
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel! So historic, so cute, so central to everything we needed -public transportation, food and so many things to do. We had a blast and the service was great!

review.title: SF's BEST.
review.reviewText: We love the St Francis, it's in a perfect location to walk to the trolly, the bart, shopping, China town and great restaurants. Our room was clean and quiet. The hotel is beautiful, we had stayed there 20 years ago. Its has that San Francisco charm. The bed and pillows were comfortable.My husband never sleeps in and he did every day we were there. It was a great vacation and enjoyable hotel stay.

review.title: GREAT AS USUAL
review.reviewText: THE ONLY NEGATIVE ONTHE ST FRANCIS IS THAT THEY HAVE DRAMATICALLY REDUCED THE LOBBY SEATING. THE REMAINING SEATING IS ACTUALLY A PART OF THEIR CAFE. THIS WAS ALWAYS A VERY RELAXING PLACE TO SIT EITHER WHILE WAITING FOR SOMEONE OR JUST KILLING A FEW MINUTES.

review.title: NOT IMPRESSED AT ALL
review.reviewText: I expect to get more for my money. The hotel may have history, but it is history. Next time is the Hyatt Regency for me, at least the do give you the comfort and service they charge you for.

review.title: Stay in the towers
review.reviewText: Didn't like the room in the older part of the hotel. Switch to rooms in newer part of hotel in the towers and liked it much better. Great location.

review.title: Over-Rated
review.reviewText:
Thought that if it is a Westin things would be nice and clean.....it wasn't!
Had to pay $20/day for internet! $57/day for parking!
The hotel was booking my credit card $100/day for insurance, and that made it hard for me to purchase anything with that credit card.

If I knew that before hand I wouldn't have gone there at the first place.

Truth is, the location was AMAZING! smack in the middle of San Fransisco's Union Square. It dos't get better that.

But there were lots of hotels near by which might have had an even better deal! I should've done my research before hand.

review.title: A Great Hotel in a Fabulous City
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Close to everything.

review.title: It was OK...shame about the view
review.reviewText:
Great hotel location...awesome city! Fantastic history in the hotel!

Really disappointed that despite spending a bit more for the room to get a view of the city....i was on the lowest floor of the selection, looking into another building. The room was a bit tired...with mould under the window and a big crack in the basin.

Couldn't believe that at 9:30pm when ordering a light supper...they had sold out of cookies!

But...great Westin beds

review.title: St Francis
review.reviewText:
The hotel is great and location is excellent.
but the rooms are too noisy, we suffered during 5 days by hearing everything around.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: San Francisco is a great place to visit in the summer because the temperature is such a relief from the heat. There is something for everyone and the city is extremely easy to navigate with tons of hotel options, and things to see and do in the city and the outlying areas. Muir Woods was amazing.

review.title: A Generally Good Experience
review.reviewText: Reservation was for new wing and this was good. Old rooms were not as spacious. A friend was staying in old wing. St. Francis is a lovely older hotel and I have always stayed there when visiting San Francisco. Michael Mina Restaurant was suberb and the Oak Room for lunch was very tasty. Starbucks in lobby was good too. Concierge was very good but I can't say that everyone was as polished as other times I have stayed there. Some of the staff just could have been more welcoming or accomodating. On getting there hair-dryer and robes were not in the room. So a little bit more attention to details would be appreciated.

review.title: great hotel in ideal location
review.reviewText: The St.Francis is a classic grand hotel right on Union Square, so its location cannot be beat, It offers all the amenities of a first class hotel. The service was excellent, the condition of the room top notch. We could not have asked for anything more in a hotel.

review.title: Vibrant SF hotel.
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed the St. Francis. It's a busy downtown SF hotel that offers a lot. If you are looking for a quiet, relaxing place to stay, this is not it. It is a bustling hub of activity in the Union Square district of SF.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The location is great, but there are lots of other hotels in the Union Square area. We thought charging $50/night plus taxes for overnight parking is a bit much. Also, charging for internet service in a hotel with higher room prices just seems tacky. There was not a computer with internet in the lobby for checking flights. The front desk staff said they could help, but that is inconvenient. The hotel is beautiful - old, historic charm. But, it seemed very deserted and unwelcoming. We stayed in the older section, where the rooms are small compared to today's standards. It was okay with us for the brief time we were there, but might be a bit small for others. We will look for another hotel on our next trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Memorable Experience at the Westin St. Francis
review.reviewText: I absolutely loved staying at the St. Francis!!!!! It is in the heart of Union Square, and my corner room (which I was surprised to receive based on the relatively cheap room price on Expedia.com), directly overlooked Union Square. I was a little worried it would be loud staying right on the street, with the cablecars going by and the street noise, but it was not a problem at all. The hotel is so historic, and feels luxurious the second you walk in. There are many dining and drinking options right in the hotel, or you are steps away from numerous restaurants, bars, and shopping. I asbolutely will not stay anywhere else next time I am in San Francisco, I loved my stay at the St. Francis and will return again soon.

review.title: Great choice
review.reviewText: I found the Westin St. Francis to be very customer-oriented. All staff were friendly and helpful. The room was clean and spacious. A mini-refrigerator was provided for no extra charge. The location is very convenient to shopping, buses, trains, and cable cars. This is my hotel of choice for my next trip to San Fran.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText:
We were quite pleased with the location of the hotel. Our room was in the newer part of the hotel and was well appointed.
We were disapointed with the room overall as when we got into the bed, it was soaking wet. We pulled the bed apart to find it soaked with urine from a previous guest. Apparently the maid just put on new linens with out thinking that it wouls soak through for the next guest. We voiced our concern with the front desk, who did move our room, but offered no form of reimbursment or discount for the inconvience.
Overall this really upset us, and made the rest of the trip very difficult to enjoy based on this unacceptable condition of our room.

review.title: Best Hotel in Sonoma Valley!
review.reviewText: Amazing hotel, especially for what else is available in Napa and Sonoma. The Suite we stayed in was amazing, their spa was very inexpensive and worth every minute, and the restaurant Sante was easily the best dinner we had that week. Four star rating wasn't high enough for this hotel!

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: Have stayed here before and it was a great hotel in a great location.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: My husband and I picked to stay at the Westin St. Francis mainly because of it's convenient location ( Union Square ). The rooms were a decant size and the beds were very comfortable. The rooms and many areas of the hotel seems to be very out-dated and needed a facelife. We didn't get the amenities that many hotels offer. It may sound silly, but things like robes, q-tips, a pool/spa is what were were expecting based on the rates we paid. I suppose it's more for business travelers, and in our case our stay was for pleasure. For a more relaxing experience we would have picked a different hotel. But like I mentioned earlier, the beds were comfortable and the staff was helpful and friendly.

review.title: 2 Westins in Same Neighborhood
review.reviewText: Warning! At first I went to the wrong Westin in SF. There are 2 very near each other (near enough to walk if you make my mistake). The St. Francis is the more expensive of the 2. Once I got to the right hotel, everything was fine.

review.title: Great hotel; leave the car home
review.reviewText:
Wonderful old world hotel in the heart of the city, Union Square. Easy to get anywhere. Great staff!

Gym facility was good, but mixed with the spa, which could use its own space.

Valet parking was a bit steep I must say; check rates in advance! Driving around Union Square was perilous, too!!

review.title: Nice Hotel, Noisy Neighborhood
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful and traditional for its era (the old section). It is right across from Union Square Park which can be a good thing or a bad thing. I was there for a conference and was exhausted due to getting up very early to catch a flight to San Francisco. I was unaware of street bands playing outside (may have been in the park, couldn't see them). I was up on the 9th floor and it sounded like they were right outside my window. The sound of drums bounced off the buildings and right into the window. They do quit by 10:00 but I was ready for bed at 8:30. Walls are thick but doors are not. Drunks from another conference were speaking very loudly in the hall 3 different times in one night, the latest at 1:00 a.m. It would be nice to have more sound proof doors.

review.title: Greatest location!
review.reviewText: Amazing hotel which was in an optimal location for walking to many places or hopping on public transportation. Large, clean, well-equipped room, great closet. We had many items to charge - more outlets w/ table next to them would have been helpful.

review.title: Good location and ok hotel.
review.reviewText: This was a nice hotel but honestly not THE nicest hotel we've stayed at. But we're used to going to Vegas so I think that us a lil jaded. Room was nice & quaint. The Oak Room was ok but have had better & had a facial & pedi at the Spa, which wasn't anything to write home about either. But the location was phenominal! So 4 that reason I recommend it.

review.title: Not impressed at all
review.reviewText: The rooms were outdated. Yes they did have a flat screen tv but I guess that does not mean much these days. The rooms need renovation. The location is great. Could not ask for a better location. However staying in the room is a dread.

review.title: Good Deal Next to Prime Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is right in the heart of Union Square. It is walking distance to everything. Even Fisherman's Wharf is only a good mile walk away. This is San Francisco and it's best to see everything walking! And if you're not in the mood to talk, the trolley isn't too far from the hotel.

review.title: That would be the hotel I stay whenever I go back
review.reviewText: Great hotel with great location

review.title: The Best Location
review.reviewText: This is the best hotel you can stay at in the union square area. You really don't want to risk staying in the tenderloin by paying less.

review.title: Terrific but...
review.reviewText: This is a fabulous hotel but two negatives---the tower elevators are incredibly slow in arriving once you push a button for them AND our heavenly bed needed to have a mattress or mattress pad replacement as the indentation on one side was huge and hard to move out of. Too many people had slept on one side!

review.title: Management does not respect workers
review.reviewText: Workers were on strike. Felt sorry for them. Unhappy workers make bad hotel experience.

review.title: Great service, amazing beds
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was wonderful and let me check in hours early when I was sick. Westins are always a good choice because of the Heavenly beds. I had to be in bed a lot that weekend, and I was as comfortable as I could be.

review.title: Well worth the stay
review.reviewText:
I spent 3 nights here. The decor in the lobby is fabulous. I stayed in the older building. The room was small but quite functional. The bathroom was extremely small with the sink in a corner and minimal counter space. There was no street noise with the windows closed and the a/c functioned well. The Heavenly bed was excellent.
The location is great; right at Union Square and next door to a Macy's and Cheesecake Factory as well as many other dining establishments within a few blocks walking distance. I stayed at the Westin even though my meetings were at the Marriott Marquis (4 blocks away) due to price and ambience and was not disappointed. I would stay here again.

review.title: Tucson Tom
review.reviewText:
I have been able to travel all over the world and going to the Westin St. Francis always feels like going "home". It is warm, wonderful, classy and perfectly located.

Like a good restaurant, the service is perfect and inobtrusive. The staff is congenial and pleasant. The location is perfect.

review.title: great location - updated room needs updating
review.reviewText:
The service at hotel was excellent. My room was ready when I arrived at 1:00. Check in desk was very accomadating especially since I was waiting to see if my flight home would be cancelled due to a snow storm. They held a room reservation for me until the last minute. Location was very convenient. The cafe in the lobby was a great meeting place and convenient for coffee and light breakfast at a resonable price. However, the restaurants in the hotel were extremely expensive.

Negatives: I specifically booked the tower room through expedia to have an updated room. However, the updated room needed updating. The paint in the bathroom was peeling off the wall and there were layers of dust on the vent over the bathtub. There weren't any outlets near the bedside to plug in a cell phone. The business center was very expensive to use the computer. Bring your laptop.

review.title: Charming hotel in the heart of the city
review.reviewText: Everything you would expect from a Westin - super comfortable Heavenly beds with plush duvets, a wonderful dual-head shower with great water pressure, great service and clean rooms. The lobby area is beautiful and elegant and there is a fun bar inside the hotel. There's also a little coffee stand in the lobby that offers fruit and yogurt cups and pastry items for breakfast, and lunch items as well. One thing I would recommend if you are going to rent a car is walking two blocks to the Hertz office instead of renting from the Hertz desk inside the hotel - the rate was almost half price and it's very close to the hotel. Also, room service is quite expensive but that was to be expected. Overall a great place to stay within blocks of great shopping at Union Square and right on the trolley line!

review.title: Will be returning next Spring!
review.reviewText: The staff were all extremely helpful, the location was excellent in Union Square, the room was great. The 'heavenly' bed was so comfortable it was like sleeping on a cloud. The 'heavenly' shower was blissful, and I'm still missing it now 3 weeks after I returned home. I will certainly be returning to this hotel when I come back to the Bay Area for a holiday.

review.title: Couples Weekend at the Westin St. Francis
review.reviewText:
Had a great time on our exteneded weekend in San Francisco with friends. We got a tremendous deal theough Expdeia on air and hotel. Our room was in the older part of the hotel and had no view (thus the huge discount) but that was "ok" as we were only there to sleep. It being the older part of the hotel, the room was very small, no bureau to put your clothes. The bed was comfortable, pillows were tiny. The bathroom, could've been cleaner. I gave "clealiness of room" a three because of that. But overall - the hotel was great no issues checking in, location was perfect for every mode of public transportation. Would I stay there again, yes, but I might want to upgrade my room to the newer towers.
Also don't be afraid of public transportation, very easy to use and is cheap, especially to get to the airport - only $8 on the BARTand VERY easy.

review.title: A Classic San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: We booked two rooms for a weekend before Christmas for three generations - grandmother, 50 year old daughter, and two teenage grandkids. The area was perfect for getting into the holiday spirit, with the beautiful decorations around Union Square and the streets filled with bustling shoppers and festive storefronts. The hotel is legendary and perfectly located if you plan to do a lot of walking. There are rental car offices a block away if you want to take a day trip, as we did one day. The Oak Room was a quiet, cozy place for a late dinner, and we enjoyed our room service breakfasts before heading out for the day. We stayed in the new tower, with stunning city views and lovely amenities. We will definitely be back the next time we visit the Bay Area.

review.title: Great trip.
review.reviewText: Had a great time. Great view on Union Square. Close to everything wanted to do and see.

review.title: cant wait to go back it was so fun
review.reviewText: I have been to san francisco many times but never stayed in the downtown part there was so much to do after 3 and half days need to go back to see everything we did not see. Loved it we had a great time

review.title: Just okay..
review.reviewText: Usually Westin has been a great experience. This time, not so much. The room was comfy but the beds didnt seem so heavenly. The people who worked there were unhelpful and unfriendly. For the money we paid we were expecting slightly nicer of a hotel and better service. Try the W hotel or the Sir Francis Drake.

review.title: Old Fashioned Elegance in the Heart of the City
review.reviewText: The Westin St Francis is one of the premiere hotels in San Francisco. Located right in the heart of the city on Unuion Square, it combines old fashioned elegance with superb service. Our hotel room was spacious and the hotel staff very accommodating. We booked the hotel over the New Year period and got a remarkable deal on the price through Expedia. Just a wonderful visit

review.title: Terrible Experience
review.reviewText: To our surprise the room had not been cleaned since the last guest. The bed was unmade, dirty dishes scattered, bathroom a mess. We did not receive an apology when asked to have another room. The other room then had pubic hair on the shower wall. Then they offered us a free breakfast (which was nice). I must say the breakfast staff at the restaurant were incredible!!! Would NEVER stay at this hotel again!!!

review.title: FUn in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We had a great time. Expedia helped get our lodging taken care of.

review.title: overall ok
review.reviewText: Overall hotel is fine, location, facilities etc,,, all perfect. Management need some cistomer training, many excuses when 'help' service' questions asked due to peak periods.

review.title: San Francisco's Westin Hotel
review.reviewText: The Westin St Francis was every bit as glamourous as we imagined it. The only downfall was the maintenance on the exterior of the elevators-cold air was blowing out through the work opening without any deflection.

review.title: We had a great time
review.reviewText: I take my girls to SF every Christmas and this is the second time we have stayed here. The only problem was they put us in a room that only had a double bed and there was 3 of us. We had called the hotel and requested 2 double beds. Try not to stay in the older part of the hotel the rooms are small.

review.title: Best bed in town
review.reviewText: We stayed two nights at the St. Francis. Our room was spacious with a very good view of Union Square. The best was the bed in our room. It was the most comfortable bed and pillows that I have ever slept on at a hotel. The service and valet parking was also excellent.

review.title: Good hotel, but not so good experience!!
review.reviewText:
Overall experience of hotel was good until the last moment.
Location couldn't be any better! Room was okay and people working was kind and willing to help out for many things.

Only thing which really made this stay horrible was, elevator broke down at check out time and elevators were not fixed for next hour or so.

I had to walk down the stairs with my large luggages and also the stairs were like a maze, I had to walk down in one stair and I found out it could not be used at the ground level and had to carry my bags up the stair again and had to find other stairs and also found that it was not the right one.... it was pretty tough for me to coming down and checking out.

Because of many bags that I and my friend carry, I went down with small ones first and tried to come up again to help my friend with large bags, but since I was checked out they did not let me go up and my friend had to struggle with large luggage by herself down the stair because elevators were not fixed for hours and we had to leave.

The hotel itself could be 4 star rated hotel and people working in there have been kind and helpful, but the experience was horrible and people had to walk down the stairs are not so much fun.

Also when they do not say anything to apologize and also treat you like a nobody after check out, not so much fun!

review.title: CHarming Christmas
review.reviewText:
The staff was very nice, great service attitude. The hotel has the most Beautiful Christmas trees in the city and an amazing Gingrebread house.
If you are staying for over 3 days you can get a mini fridge in your room for your personal use. Our only complaint is the cleaness of the room.

review.title: best place to stay for luxury accomandations as well as the Campton Place hotel
review.reviewText: As a business traveler I'm frequently in SFrancisco and like to compare my accomandations by staying at various hotels..The St. Francis Tower level is the best choice as I do not recommend anything less..the rates are Affordable and the service and food great...only hotel that can compare is the Campton Place...LOVE that hotel...its like staying on Park Ave or 5th ave in New York City and they give you GREAT freebies in the room!!...its pricey but very worth it!

review.title: The Grand Dame
review.reviewText: Top to bottom excellence. Impossible to beat the location and the overall class and elegance of the Westin St. Francis. Service was perfect as were the rooms. I stopped at the registration desk during my stay to break a $100 bill for a short cab ride and the person there stopped what they were doing and took the bill upstairs to get broken. Absolutely gorgeous Christmas decorations in the lobby and the room was immaculate.

review.title: Great location, great service, hotel room DISAPPOINTING!
review.reviewText: The location is great. The hotel overall is great. My room was very disappointing. Old, worn out carpet. Wall paper in the bathroom was peeling off the wall. Seems as though it had been that way for months. TV was located at an angle that was not really visible from the bed. It literally faced a wall. Not even a chair. Maybe 2 of 10 channels on the TV actually worked. I have stayed at nicer rooms at 2 star hotels.

review.title: The place to stay in San Francisco at Union Square
review.reviewText: We have stayed many places in SF, wharf, Marina District, etc., depending on our plan for the weekend. This trip we wanted to stay in the Union Square district during Christmas - this was not a mistake, we had a wonderful stay. The hotel is located right on the square, next to the shops and the trolly cars. We parked our car and took the trolly & bus everywhere we could not walk and never used our car. The hotel is located by very nice stores, restaurants and the hotel itself is beautiful. We had a room on the 23rd floor in the new tower. Be sure to pay and get a view room if that is important, my mother in law didn't and she looked at a wall. So, if that matters to you, fork over the extra $$ to be sure of a view. Beautiful hotel, beautiful location, lots of fun in the Union Square part of town.

review.title: Great Weekend Trip for Couples!
review.reviewText: From check in to check out, everything was pleasant. The room was better than expected, it was lovely. The bed was so comfortable and housekeeping came to clean it daily! The hotel itself was a piece of history too.

review.title: St. Francis, not impressed
review.reviewText: Great location! Everything else was not so good. This hotel tries to nickel and dime you for every little thing- internet= $15/day, gym=$25/day. Also, it is an old hotel which means you can hear everything through your door. Housekeeping starts at 7am which makes it hard to indulge and sleep in.

review.title: A gorgeous hotel! it was an absolute delight!!!
review.reviewText: the hotel is in heart of union square, when you walk out of it, you see macys, saks fifth and a beautiful skating link. it was really gorgeous! I love staying at Westin and loved every single westin i've stayed in so it wasnt surprising but for the price i paid, i fell like it was such a bargain! i highly recommend!

review.title: somewhat disappointing
review.reviewText:
The hotel check in staff were friendly and helpful. Upon opening the door to my room, I was met with a musty-moldy smell emanating from the bathroom. There was no fan/vent in my bathroom, so taking a shower would really fog things up and probably caused the must smell.

At one thirty in the morning, there was a crash at the door. I got up to find the door had been opened. When I told security, they said they would get back to me, but never did

Beds are comfortable. The 'green' option, not to have housekeeping is nice. Location good.

review.title: a good time was had by all
review.reviewText: There is not much negative can say. Great room, 28th floor, view of Golden Gate Bridge, just what I wanted. There was some construction going on, that diJamesM not ruin the experience. Overall a very good three days.

review.title: I love westin st. francis
review.reviewText: It was a extraordinary service in the hotel, Im satisfied

review.title: Very impressed!
review.reviewText: The Westin St. Francis is located on Union Square with shops, restaurants, and access to cable cars just across the street. We enjoyed great service, a wonderful room, and friendly staff. We can't wait to go back!

review.title: Recommended for location only
review.reviewText:
The hotel was undergoing a renovation that time. The elevators were not working and there were only 2 elevators servicing one part of the building. In the morning, there was construction noise and I had to inform the front desk that this was disturbing.

Apart from the noise, the room I was placed this time was small, felt cramped and had a view of the adjacent building.

review.title: Location is the only redeeming quality
review.reviewText:
Like others, we found the location of this hotel ideal: near a Bart station, right on a Cable Car line, and near a lot of shopping. That and the incredible price are the reasons to stay here. If you have any other expectations, you will be disappointed - it's kind of a dump.

We upgraded from the old building to the newer building, meaning 1970s. The entry way to the room was really small with dark woods. Bathroom was on the left and had French doors that latch on the top (instead of a regular knob) made a lot of sound when opening and closing.

The room itself was nothing special except you get to hear everything that happens in the next room. The first night we thought we had unusually loud neighbors. The second night we had a family that clearly were loud.

The second night we were laying on the bed trying to figure out a map. I scooted over to my husband's side and actually fell in. They replaced it right away.

In the bathroom paint was chipping and blistered; the caulking between the floor and door molding was filthy; the shower head had to be replaced because a screw was missing which left it limp and unable to be moved; the toilet was very loud and ugly.

The common areas are small so there is a lot of congestion. Most lighting is dim.

review.title: we really liked it
review.reviewText:
we've decided to stay to the St Francis/Westin when we saw the Expedia offer. Then we had some moments of panic when we read the other tourists' oppinions. Fortunately none of the critics prooved to be real: the neighbourhood is more than ok: the Union Square is, I presume, the commercial heart of the town. Ok, it was crowded, as it was weekend, but it could have been scarier, with no one around, no?
Look in internet for breakfast, if you don't want to have it in the hotel. We consider it more interesting this way. There are a lot of lovely caffees as you walk down the street.
WiFi is 15 USD a day but if you go out u can catch the Union Square's free wireless connections, if you want to login in for small matters.
distancesc: SF is small if you want to see the city you can really do it walking. Most of the City Tours in dobule deckers have a stop in the Union Square, if you want a guided tour.

review.title: will be back
review.reviewText: great place to stay. right in the heart of the city. we had a nice and very clean room, bigger than a usual "2 queen beds" hotel room. cant wish for the better location. cant wait to go back.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: Beautiful historic hotel. Great location, close to many attractions and fantastic shopping. Spacious, clean rooms. Would recommend to everyone and would definitely return.

review.title: Disappointed...
review.reviewText: I was very excited having booked this hotel for our anniversary. Although the location and the building itself were both excellent, the service leaves much to be desired. At no point were we made to feel welcome. We were treated more like just another bit of work for the staff than actual guests. Even phoning to request a room with a particular view was met with indifference. If you're looking for a place with a great view and great location, this is the place, and that is the reason I would recommend it. If you're looking for that added personal touch, especially for a special occasion, go elsewhere.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The best thing about this hotel is the location - the cable car stops on the corner and the trolley and local buses are two blocks away. It's about a three-block walk to Chinatown. It's also an easy commute to the airport. The hotel's restaurants are nice but expensive, but there are lots of places to eat in the nearby area. The hotel is old but extremely well maintained. The room was small, but it had everything you needed, the bed was comfortable, the shower was very nice. Most hotels seem to save money by using very low wattage bulbs - not here. The room had enough light, the bathroom was very brightly lit, and there were enough electric outlets for charging cell phones, laptop, etc. The desk was set up very nicely for laptop use. When we got back to San Francisco, we will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Best location!
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the best location, right in the heart of Union Square. Entertainment is right outside your door. Highly recommended!!

review.title: The Grand Dame
review.reviewText: In San Francisco there are scores of excellent hotels to stay at. I have stayed at different ones but only the St. Francis now. The original part of the hotel has rather small rooms by today's standards but they are wonderfully furnished by Westin. I prefer the tower for the views and larger rooms but the lobby area is pure, turn of the century, grandeur.

review.title: Exellent
review.reviewText: It was an excellent hotel. in one of the most beutiful cities in california

review.title: SImply perfect
review.reviewText:
Since we arrived at the lobby our stay in the hotel was superb.
Awesome check in, spacious room for the whole family (2+2), unbeatable situation, high standard staff
Thank you very much, you made us a perfect vacation

review.title: Very nice accommodations, great location.
review.reviewText: Room was a good deal, though inside location, not on street side, the advantage, it was quiet. Close to BART, trolley, street cars, shopping, restaurants.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: My 14 year old and I went for a mother/daughter getaway and loved this hotel. The location was great, the view was great (we were on the 25th floor, higher levels recommended), our room was super nice and cozy and the staff was wonderful. I can't wait to go back now for a trip with my husband. The only very minor con was that there was a little bit of remodeling going on in the lobby area, but it was not intrusive in any way and it's only going to be that much nicer when it's done.

review.title: Great location, comfy bed
review.reviewText: The room are not extremely big but it is comfortable with all the essentials.

review.title: Loved IT!!!
review.reviewText: The Hotel was beautiful and beautifully decorated for the holidays. Our room looked down to Union Square to a beautiful Christmas tree and ice skating ring set up in the park right across the street. The staff was very kind and knowledgeable. They directed us to all the right places to visit and eat. The location is great with the trolley passing right in front of the hotel and plenty of shops and restaurants. I recommend getting a multiday trolley pass if you'll be using the trolley, if not each individual ride could get pricey after a few on and offs. No complaints. I love San Francisco and would definately stay here again.

review.title: the best location, very nice, great view from the room, definetly will come back
review.reviewText:
GREAT HOTEL, WE WENT FOR OUR 10TH ANIVERSARY AND IT WAS GREAT FROM THE MOMENT WE STEP IN, VERY NICE ROOM IN THE TOWER, LOCATION IN FRON OF UNION SQUARE, YOU CAN TAKE THE CABLE CARS IN FROT FROM THE HOTEL, TWO BLOCKS FROM CHINA TOWN, GREAT SHOPPING AROUND , THE ROOM VERY NICE FROM VIEW TO CLEANNESS.
DEFINETLY WILL COME BACK

review.title: Can't wait to go back with our kids
review.reviewText:
We absolutely loved our hotel. San Francisco is an amazing city and it was amazing to walk out the hotel door and hop right on to an type of transportation you are up for. The street car to Lombard and the Wharf (Pier 39) run right in front of the hotel. You have to only cross the street and you will be at Macy's with rooftop dining although we suggest the burger bar 2 floors below.

The staff was very nice, the hotel was amazingly beautiful. It even houses a Victoria Secrets. We booked for the prenatal massage at the spa and it was worth it. We booked in a king suite with a beautiful view all the way our to the bay. If you get on the correct side you can see the Golden Gate bridge from your hotel room. We will definately stay here again.

(The lobby was under a little construction in some areas during our stay. It was never noisy or interuptive of our stay.

review.title: Comfortable stay in great location.
review.reviewText: Very central and comfortable hotel. I arrived in the middle of a (noisy) staff protest outside, and was moved to a room in a quiet part of the hotel which was great. Once the protest was over I moved to a larger room in a renovated part of the hotel which was no problem for them. I thought the decor in the hallways and parts of the hotel was a bit tired, but overall a lovely hotel. Excellent concierge service setting up tours and making recommendations for me. Variable bell service and had to struggle with heavy bags myself at times. Great location in the centre of town as the hotel faces Union square and the cable car runs right past it. The shopping is wonderful on the square, with all of the large department stores there. If you want to buy groceries, there is a good supermarket in the Westfield shopping mall about a block away; Borders and Walgreens close by. The information centre is also about a block away. One downside with the location is the number of panhandlers on Union Square (not the hotel's fault but depressing nonetheless). Overall, I'd recommend the hotel. In fact I'm now a convert to the Westin hotel brand and will stay there in future.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: the room was small but equiped with the essentials, the location is great.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Absolutly the best location. One disadvantage though, breakfast isn't inscuded with Expedia packages. The Hotel's breakfast is so basic. The good thing was the surrounding restaurants that serve breakfast.'[

review.title: Maintenance Unpleasant
review.reviewText: Maybe when hotel finishes with the refurbished upgrades, the hotel will seem like a construction sight. The scent was not fresh in the lobby as well. I wouldn't return there until I knew all was finished and corrected.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: It is a great property with a ton of history, the two towers offering it's guests the choice of historic or modern. Mina's restaurant, in the heart of the hotel, is truly a fine dining experience. Great location, great dining, and great service.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The Westin St. Francis was in the best location with so much to do in the area. My room was neat and spacious. The view was amazing.

review.title: Historical hotel
review.reviewText: This is the second time I have stayed at this historic hotel. The first time I went on business the room was fantastic, clean, large and the location perfect. When I went again for a second stay for my holiday, we received a sub-standard room that was more of an after thought than a room.It was so close to the stairs that one would fall off them if the happen to open the door and not look at the floor when they stepped out. After voicing my concern to the front desk, immediate action was taken and we were given a much nicer and room in the newer high rise section. It had spectacular views of the city and was a lot more roomier and located in a much better part of the hotel. Suffice to say that this hotel is undergoing rennovations and it would have been nice to know that upon booking. It's a nice charming historic hotel, which has lost a bit of its glam over the past year or so (which I think they are rectifiying) but overall is in a perfect location right in the heart of the city near the cable cars and Union Square.

review.title: I read newspapers on Sundays too
review.reviewText: No newspapers were available in the hotel at 7:30 in the morning--the gift shop had a sign saying it opened at 7 but it was closed. This is unacceptable in a major hotel. If they can't get the shope open they should have newspapers at the desk. Not everyone wants to read news online.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText:
A beautiful but older hotel. Also a bit pricey and there are other hotels less
expensive in the same great location. Definetly would hev preferred to spend that money shopping or sight seeing rather than sleeping

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Definately stay there again. Located right in the heart of downtown business area; close to great shopping, cable car, china town, and adjacent to Union Square. Bathtub didn't drain properly and light in closet didn't work, but we phoned and someone came right away to fix things. The light was fixed, but the tub still didn't drain properly. Otherwise, great room.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: The only people who were nice were the Valet staff as well as housekeeping. Everybody from the front desk to the conceirge was "snobby." One would expect to be treated well at these fancy hotels. Also, you had to pay $40/day for the hotel gym. An additional $50 per night to park your car plus parking tax. I usually don't mind spending a lot of money on hotels as long as the service is worth it. I don't think I would stay at this hotel again. I have to admit, it does look fancy on the outside but the rooms are old.

review.title: San Francisco, Union Square
review.reviewText: The stay at the hotel was fine - except I wish I had been able to upgrade to a room with a view (my view: "court yard" which actually was a room across an open area viewing rooms on the same floor. The hotel would have accommodated my request, except there was a big event in town, and many participants had taken all the rooms with a view. Would I go back? I would probably try another hotel, but not for any negative issues with the hotel.

review.title: All show and no substance
review.reviewText: Not impressed!!! Walking into the hotel there is great expectation as the foyer and dining areas exude luxury - what a shame the rooms are anything but. I don't think I have ever stayed in such a cramped hotel room. There was not even a stand for luggage as there was no room. Everything about the room was basic which was disaappointing considering the hotel is not advertised as such. Many small things were overlooked which added up to an overall very disappointing experience. Do not stay in a standard room in this hotel as it is not value for money!!!!

review.title: Great location; nice views.
review.reviewText: This was a nice stay. The lobby was under rennoavation which was sort of a bummer, but they did keep things draped off and I never heard any construction noise. We stayed on the 21 floor in the new tower and never heard a peep from the hall or neighbors. Cool views from the very fast exterior elevators. Room was comfortable for the three of us and the bathroom was nicley appointed with marble. The Ansel Adams portaits of the hotel in the lobby were fun to look at and elements of the old, elegant charm were still around. Staff was pleasant and efficient; we didn't have alot of interaction with them, but what we did have was nice.

review.title: It was ok
review.reviewText:
I thought a 4 star hotel would have been better. The lobby was undergoing reonovations. The maids wer quite noisy in the morning with the slamming of the doors. The doors themselves wer heavy and made noise if you were not careful.
Staff was sometimes very helpful and sometimes not. I asked about some noice on the street and the dest clerk kept addressing me a 'man' Eg. "I can't do anything about that , man" or "I'm telling what I can do. man". Whatever happened to 'sir'?
Hotel was convenient to shopping, restaurants and transportation.

review.title: Great Location, not so good service
review.reviewText:
This hotel is in a prime loation on Union Square. when we arrived in the room i noticed that the bathroom only had one bathtowel for two people! Also no robes. Then when i started to log on to my laptop i noticed a sign that said in room internet was not free! This after paying a lot for the room. even most one and two star hotels now offer free internet. So i went back down to the lobby and complained about the lack of robes and towels and the price of the internet. To their credit they offered complimentary internet for the two day stay and brought robes and more towels to the room. But on check out i still got charged for the internet and had to go back down and wrestle with them again.
I loved the hotel but was dissapointed in the lack of amenities like robes and free internet. That should be a given in a hotel of this caliber.

review.title: Best Hotel In Area
review.reviewText: The hotel and location of hotel were fabulous you just need to make sure you get a room with a view. Everything was within walking distance and the cable cars ran right in front of the hotel. I would recommend staying at this hotel again for the right price.

review.title: Old but not chic
review.reviewText: I was expecting better from a Westin Hotel! I understand that it is an old hotel with a lot of history but it was just a sad experience all around. I could have forgiven the impersonal and almost rude behavior of the doorman and front desk personnel if the room was up to par. I paid a little more for a higher floor and larger room. It was very spacious with a good view, so they got that much right. The room was shabby, the carpet stained and worn. There was mold in the bathroom grout all around the bathtub and the bathroom smelled like cleaning solution layered over old socks. The toilet was like the kind you find in an airport or public restroom (without the motion sensors). I try to stay in Westin Hotels because of its impeccable service and beautiful rooms (bed and bath included), but I will never stay here again or recommend it to my fellow travelers.

review.title: Just Okay
review.reviewText: The quality of the older rooms was just okay for the price that we paid. The beds were comfortable, but the bathroom was surprisingly run down. It was small and awkward...tiny sink, toilet in an awkward location and it didn't flush. The hotel staff was helpful and the toilet was fixed within a hour. We couldn't use the fridge because it was so high tech that if we removed or added anything the room would be charged within 30 seconds of the weight change. When we called the front desk they initially were not helpful problem solving this. However, on a second attempt they offered to bring up a fridge for us. The location right on Union Square was convenient, and the Oak Room restaurant in the hotel was convenient and delicious to a bunch of tired runners who did not feel like walking very far after running a half marathon.

review.title: The most comfortable bed ever...
review.reviewText: Wonderful room, bed was extremely comfortable and cozy as well as the double headed relaxing shower. Location was fabulous, very convenient for a fun San Francisco weekend. Staff was very firendly and helpful, we had a great time and can't wait to return.

review.title: Wasn't that great
review.reviewText: I don't know what I was expecting exactly but my overall experience wasn't too impressive. The room was dark and too modern so that it did not feel truly comfortable. If you even open the mini-bar and pull out the items to look at them, their system thinks you used them and tries to charge you for it so you have to make sure that doesn't happen. They have a service that if you hang the notice on the outside of your door they won't come clean your room (to save on environment). However, when we did this, we noticed they cleaned our room and saw in the fine print we had to have this on the door before 2am?? I thought that was really stupid. They don't automatically deliver a paper to your room in the morning and when we checked in they never offered that to us. All the hotel employees seemed 'distracted' and there was a lot going on with hotel remodeling and Nike Women's Marathon. The only great thing was that it was right downtown and walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go.

review.title: Great Hotel for Nike Women's Marathon or Half
review.reviewText:
Just steps from the start line!

Only 20 min. taxi from San Francisco airport and easy to get arund the city on the cable cars or taxi services.

review.title: Very classy hotel with excellent San Francisco location
review.reviewText: The Westin St. Francis is definitely one of San Francisco's best hotels. Service is excellent, everything is impeccably clean, staff is friendly and courteous and you just can't beat the location. You walk outside of your hotel and you're right in front of Union Square and also right in front of Cable Car and Bus stops. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Small rooms ,mediocre service, below average value
review.reviewText: I was really disappointed in this Expedia pick.The super deluxe room was small even by SF standards although we bought the upgraded view room...Service was mediocre from room service to car valet...The hotel no longer lives up to its venerable reputation.Several other Union Square hotels give much more for the same or less money.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Great location to launch from as we were in San Francisco to see the President's Cup golf match. Lots of shopping and food choices available. Will use the St. Francis again!

review.title: Very nice classical hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in the best area of San Francisco (Union Sq) with the best shops close to the hotel. One of the best restaurants of the city, Michael Mina, and excellent rooms.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Excellent location, right on Union Square. The room was small but had everything you would expect in the room. Good value. Well worth recommending for a base in San Francisco. Not a place to linger in the room but then wwho would if you are on vacation,

review.title: NOT VERY CLEAN
review.reviewText: I was unpleasantly surprised to find the hotel not exactly "Westin quality clean" For the price I paid, I expected the room to be ultra clean, but found cigarette stubs on the window sill (I asked for a non-smoking room). had to wipe the bathroom mirror and walls since there were toothpaste stains on the wall by the sink:( Very unimpressive

review.title: Great location, great hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel was beautiful in pictures and in person. It was well-maintained and even undergoing renovations in the lobby, but hardly noticeable at all. We had the standard room so it was a little smaller than I expected, but normal for a hotel in SF. However, it was still very comfortable and we enjoyed the flat screen tv. The best thing about the hotel is the location and convenience. There was so much to do and see from every direction and seemed pretty safe even for late night walks. Overall, it was a great experience and I would stay here again.

review.title: Great hotel and location
review.reviewText: We stayed on the 26th floor of the newer tower. Very comfortable rooms. Beds are definitely heavenly. Don't take stuff out of the minibar as they're on sensors. Front desk was very accommodating when we told them we moved stuff to store some leftovers, they took off the charges. Location right in Union Square can't be beat. Right on cable car lines and lots of shopping nearby.

review.title: It was noisy, service was terrible, very user unfriendly.
review.reviewText: I have stayed at many different hotels in this fine city, but this was the worst.

review.title: westin st francis SF
review.reviewText: excellent location! comfortable beds .. nice gym but expensive fee

review.title: Grand old lady of Union Square needs renovation
review.reviewText: Recommend the convenient downtown location on Union Square, but this hotel has seen better days. Lobby dark brown and gloomy. A popular conference hotel, so can be over-run with corporate delegates, so long waits for lifts. Horrendous charges for internet - US$39.50 for 2 days and $2 charge for 1-800 numbers. The rooms in the 'contemporary tower' are not of a quality fit-out; quite basic. But the bed was very comfortable.

review.title: It's the first choice for an over-night visitor in SFO
review.reviewText: The great location, the historical building, the perfect room condition...Best of the Best Hotels in SFO for visitors

review.title: Wonderful Stay at the St. Francis
review.reviewText: My wife and I just returned from an eight-night stay in San Francisco and the Westin St. Francis. We were celebrating our 5th wedding anniversary. We chose the St. Francis for many reasons. Its reputation as being a San Francisco icon was a major reason. The place is filled with history. We were not disappointed. From the minute we checked in to the minute we checked out, we were treated like special guests. The rooms were five-star, the view breathtaking and the experience one we would definitely like to have again. Also, the Concierge was extremely helpful, friendly and dead-spot on in their recommendations. If there is one negative, it would be the costs that are associated with so many amenities that used to be complimentary to hotel guests. The charge for hotel parking was staggering. But, the St. Francis is not the Lone Ranger in this department. Parking in San Francisco is extremely expensive. But, there are garages a couple of blocks away that were less expensive. We saved a lot of money by parking off site. We absolutely loved our stay at the St. Francis. I do recommend to anyone who is looking to stay here to request a room in the Tower. The ride in the glass elevator never got old. What a view. Stay at the St. Francis. You won't regret it.

review.title: Grand Old Lady
review.reviewText: Location and views can't be beat. Friendly professional staff. First class all the way.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The location, at Union Square, is excellent. Fisherman's Wharf and the Golden Gate bridge are a $12-$15 cab ride depending on traffic. We rented a car and there was a Hertz kiosk in the hotel which was very convenient. I would stay at this hotel in the future.

review.title: the best hotel yet
review.reviewText: I have been to san fransisco three times this was the best I got muddled with the hotel name and should have booked the sir fransis drake I only realised when we arrives I,m very p leased i did make a mistake as the westin st francis on union square was first clas, the beds were very comfortable and the room was spotless. the hotel staff were very helpful at all times and would love to go back well worth staying in

review.title: Always wanted to try that place on Union Square
review.reviewText: Returned to S.F. a year after moving away. We always wanted to try the huge hotel on Union Square we had always walked past when we were locals. After a minor blip at reception (we had paid extra for a specific class of room and reception placed us in another...they were able to get it straightened out relatively quickly) we had a very enjoyable stay. It's definitely better if you're not a zillionaire to visit San Francisco occasionally and stay high up in a reasonably priced hotel such as the St. Francis so you can look down at the city from above. If you're a local, you'll typically always be down on the street looking up, wondering what the zillionaires and tourists are doing. If you aren't familiar with San Francisco, you may think you're in Calcutta with all the panhandlers and scary people. Face it, contrary to how it may seem the St. Francis is in a GOOD neighborhood. That's why you get the most persuasive and convincingly desperate professional panhandlers and shysters hassling you. Consider yourself fortunate not to have booked a hotel in the Mission, SOMA or Tenderloin where the desperate looking souls are truly desperate and your safety is really an open question. Imagine yourself as Rick Steves traveling through Europe - San Francisco is sort of like a big French city plopped down in the USA - keep your wits about you and your money belt tightly fastened and you'll be fine. -StFo

review.title: Would use this hotel again
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay at The Westin St Francis very central,clean the only thing was the bath room was very small but you manage.

review.title: Excellent concierge
review.reviewText: We asked the concierge for dinner recommendations, and they steered us to the right place two nights in a row - good food and within our desired walking distance. Of course, SF is a great town for food.

review.title: Views from the Tower were great
review.reviewText: The old section of the hotel is beautiful, the staff was very attentive especially the bell personnel. Dining in one of the hotel restaurants was excellent and the service again was great. Union square and fine shopping is just outside the Lobby door. It was very central to all one can do in San Francisco. Would stay again anytime.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: Great mattresses, slept great

review.title: You're missing out on a awesome hotel!
review.reviewText: The Westin St. Francis was such an amazing hotel. It more than exceeded my expectations. The hotel staff was extremely helpful by making you feel that you were a special guest no matter what room you were staying in. I will definitely stay at this hotel every time I come to San Francisco in the future.

review.title: Say, YES to the Historical Hotel and NO, to the Modern Tower
review.reviewText: We first took a room in the "modern tower". The rooms looked new and modern on the website but when we actually got into the room - it was really in poor shape. The drapes were tattered,the bases of lamps were cracked, the carpet stained, paint peeling off the walls and the bathroom toilet was ancient. The bathroom doors provided little privacy. There was nothing "Modern" about that room. We called, immediately, to complain and the front desk put us into a room in the "Historic" part of the hotel. That room was beautiful... a little noisy, from the street level traffic, but so much nicer than the "modern tower".

review.title: Nice hotel, great location, not so lux
review.reviewText: HVAC was very loud - we opened the windows instead - outside noises were very loud, but not as random as HVAC. Room was small but nice. Staff was hard to find. Great location.

review.title: Westin
review.reviewText: The rooms AC unit was not working, they gave us a broken fan to help out. I could not even open the windows.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is worth every penny.

review.title: Excellent choice
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Westin St. Francis over Labor Day weekend 2009 and found that it was an excellent choice. The location is perfect - Chinatown is a short walk away, and shopping and restaurants are all nearby. We stayed in the newer tower of the hotel, on the 29th floor, with great views of the City and a spectacular ride in the glass elevator. The room was perfect for our needs - king size bed, large flat screen tv, great shower/bathroom. My one complaint: the Hotel charges an extra fee (either daily or for the duration of your stay) to access the fitness center, which clearly did not have a sufficient number of treadmills for all of its guests. Putting that aside, we had a great stay.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: The hotel is located right at Union Square, on the cable car line, and the amenities were great. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Old world charm with new world character
review.reviewText: The Westin St.Francis does not need my recomendation, it's reputation is over 100 years old and the character of the hotel has been a sentinel of San Francisco grace and elegance for decades. Jesus was the first to greet us. His charm and warmth reflected the comfort and elegance that has become a St. Francis tradition. We were offered a change from a King to two doubles which meant a larger room in the main bulding. When asked if the robes were standard placement, Jesus indicated that if that was our wish it would be taken care of immediately. Two minutes after arriving in our room the bath robes were delivered and a courtesy tip was refused. The St. Francis is first class from the front desk to the five star dining room in the main foyer. Room service and housekeeping staff are all extremely helpful and caring. If you want to be in the heart of San Francisco on Union Square wit access to the entire city, look no further. From Ansel Adams photographs to the clock in the foyer The Westin St. Francis will meet your every expectation.

review.title: Very nice hotel, room Ok, but things got better......
review.reviewText: The room we had the first 2 nights was quiet & nice, but the bathtub did not drain after showering. The hotel sent someone to fix it but it wouldn't drain the next day after showering. I called front desk & informed them. After returning that evening we were upgraded to a bigger room with two beds (which I had originally requested). Staff was friendly; rooms did have cracks on wall & ceiling. Good experience overall, would recommend to a friend! Cool, fast elevator!!

review.title: Fine hotel in the center
review.reviewText: Nice big hotel, exactly what would you expect....

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Everyone very professional and helpful.

review.title: Awesomazing!!
review.reviewText: The hotel is in an amazing location. Transportation is available as soon as you walk out of the hotel, cablecar pick up right in front. Nightlife, literally right around the corner and up the street. Food can be found everywhere there, a lot of options. The hotel is beautiful inside and out. While we were there we learned that the Westin is a very historic hotel, made us feel special. The room was great, loved the chandelier. The bedding and pillows were very comfortable, which to me was a super plus. The only negative that I can think of is that the walls are a bit thin as we could hear our next door neighbors early in the morning while we were trying to sleep in. Overall, great hotel well worth it!

review.title: Great location, but...
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our trip to San Francisco and felt we couldn't have stayed in a better location. The hotel was very nice and the concierge was more than helpful. However, the room was quite small (hard to get between the end of the bed and the TV stand) and I was very disappointed to find out the exercise facilities were an extra $12 A DAY charge!!! When looking for a hotel, besides location, available exercise facilities were at the top of my list of requirements and no where on the hotel's website did it say there was an extra charge to use them. We quickly discovered there were extra charges for every little thing and were even afraid to ask for more pillows!

review.title: Very impressed!
review.reviewText: My sister stayed here and absolutely loved her room in the new tower but didn't like her room in the old tower because it was too small and she didn't like the decor. However, my boyfriend and I still opted for the old tower, and we were not disappointed at all. Our room was REALLY nice with a great view of Union Square. I loved the decor, and the bed was super comfy. The hotel is beautiful and very romantic. We can't wait to go back!

review.title: Quick Weekender
review.reviewText: I arrived at the hotel at 9AM, and they had a room ready. 8th floor, older tower with a view (and for the steal I got here, I was thoroughly impressed). No couch, just a side chair. The room is definitely older, and the closet/bathroom/front door had all been banged against each other, leaving several large dents in the doors. Other than that, the condition of the room was superb. The heavenly showerhead was fantastic, although the heaevnly bed sheets were bleached and starched one too many times. The TV was spectacular (a huge LG flatscreen) as was the Starbucks coffees and teas just waiting to be devoured. Note of caution: do NOT touch anything in the minibar. Even if you just moev an item and not consume it, you are still charged for the item. There are 2 signs on the fridge, but it's worth repeating, since you'll be stuck with an insanely high charge for a bag of peanuts.

review.title: Great Historical Hotel
review.reviewText: Room was really big, bed was very comfortable, good location, Michael Mina was wonderful.

review.title: Wonderful Stay
review.reviewText: The Westin St Francis was an excellent experience. The service was outstanding. The room was very clean and comfortable.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The parking is to expensive

review.title: Worst hotel I've ever been in--nickel and dimed to death
review.reviewText: This was the worst hotel I have ever been in. It had no class. It was a roadside motel masquerading as a 4-star hotel. The reason to stay at a nicer hotel is for the amenities. This hotel had none. Listen to this, without exaggeration: * Parking was $49 a day. * Internet was $15 a day. That was for slow internet. If you wanted fast internet, it was $20 a day. (I'm not joking. They really did charge $20 a day for "fast" internet.) * I didn't get new soap every day. The maids would judge for themselves whether it seemed like I had enough soap left for a shower the next morning. One night I had to call the front desk to request more be brought up. I expected to get a handful--soap, shampoo, conditioner, so I was sure to be satisfied. Nope. The bellboy arrived with a single new bar of plain soap, not even the "designer" soap, since this one was extra. * The "Business Center" $10 for 10 minutes on the internet. That's after already spending $15 a day in my room. And $1.50 per black and white copy. I've never been in a hotel before that charged for using the printer. I had to keep my credit card with me at all times in case I was going to be charged for something else. * Here's the coup de grace. The room had a minibar. It had some kind of system in it that monitored if you ever moved a bottle. I like to buy soda and store it in my room for convenience. I was charged $175 over 5 days for simply rearranging the bottles in the minibar to leave room for my own bottle of soda.

review.title: Fitness Center Fees
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with our overall stay. However, we feel that there is no need to charge a fee for using the fitness center; it should be included in the cost of the room.

review.title: Location, Location, Location
review.reviewText: Classis Union Square establishment - very convenient to all parts of the city

review.title: Bit small but excellent quality
review.reviewText: clean, comfortable and beautiful if a bit cramped

review.title: Excellent hotel- superb location
review.reviewText: Great experience overall with this hotel- can't beat the location- right on cable car stop- close to BART train system- right across from park- discount theatre/music tickets at park entrance- close to shops and restaurants- excellent tours offered at hotel

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Hotel is located in a area that is close to resturants and walking to various sites.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: I thought the Westin St Francis was absolutely stunning old-style hotel. Totally comfortable. Some may say the rooms are small, but how much do you need? Fine for wife & myself. Only minor complaint is that they have a coffee maker but charge for the cofee. Never encountered that one before.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: Beautiful old hotel, great location, can't wait to get back

review.title: Westin St Francis equals small room
review.reviewText: This was the last night of a two week holiday. We checked in to find our room was the size of a postage stamp and the walls so thin you could hear the conversation next door. The carpet as you entered the room had lifted, so you tripped over it everytime you walked in and out of the bathroom. To say the least, the room and service was a major disappointment for such a well known hotel brand.

review.title: Beautiful!
review.reviewText: We loved our stay at the St. Francis! Everyone was friendly, helpful and knowledgable about the area. The room was quiet and the beds were comfortable and everything was clean. Our only complaint was we would have liked empty space in the refrigerator for our own use rather than all mini-bar items. There are lots of things to do nearby. The cable car stops right outside and shops and restaurants are easy walking, as is Chinatown and the BART Powell St. station.

review.title: A Little bit of Luxury
review.reviewText: On our two-day visit to San Francisco, we went a little over our budget and chose the St. Francis, and were glad we did. We stayed in the Historic Main building, and loved the spacious room, the high ceilings, chandelier and overall decor. The room was very clean, beds comfy, overlooked Union Square but high up enough to be quiet. Concierge was very helpful with dinner reservations and information on the restaurant a friend had referred. Definitely will stay again!

review.title: Location, Location, Location!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel is so conveniently located and close to all sorts of restaurants in all price ranges. I ate one night in the hotel and was quite impressed. I tried the prix fixe menu and thought it was great value, delicious and beautifully presented.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, great location, comfortable bed, BUT
review.reviewText: WE booked a week at the Westin and upgraded to a King bed. My parents booked the standard Expedia room. Be aware that if you book the standard Expedia room, it is a VERY small double bed with a view of onlyother people's windows. I feel that the king upgrade was well worth it, and front desk was willing to upgrade my parents the following day when the hotel wasn't full, free of charge. My only other complaint is that internet and gym usage are not free. If you stay at the Sit Francis Drake up the street, you have access to the Westin gym for free, FYI.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: For a four-star luxury hotel, I was disappointed. First the costs. There is a fee if you want to use the gym. There is a fee if you want Wi-Fi. There is a fee if you want to use the business center computer. There is a fee for the continental breakfast. There is a fee if you accidently bump into the dresser and knock something from the mini-bar out of place. Second, the cleanliness and maid staff left something to be desired. The bathroom was never cleaned properly. The maids would take used glasses and not leave replacements. I broke the bottle opener and it was not replaced until I called for a new one (a couple of days later).
