Besides one bad experience with the person who checked us in, the staff was generally friendly and helpful. I just expected a little more from my hotel for the pricey room expense.

review.title: Love the older part..high ceilings chandelier
review.reviewText: The room was the larger one of this class so I could get a roll away in it.. and they checked me in early so I did not have to wait. The bed was perfect and even if on the 4th floor I didnt have a great view it put me right above the convention and their wifi connection worked perfect in my room without additional costs for my internet. It was quiet and I felt safe even right off the main hall. When I had misplaced my key card they immediately replaced it. The Oak restraunt wasnt anything to right home about. I had mushroom raviolis.. and besides the undercooked gooey pasta.. they compensated quality by dousing it in butter. You order something that should be rather healthy..not just floating in butter. Great place amid SF busy streets.

review.title: Comfort and convenience in SF
review.reviewText: The Westin St. Francis is an excellent place to stay, convenient to many locations in San Francisco.

review.title: Best Location In Town
review.reviewText: Throughout the day we felt as if we were at the center of everything happening in town. We could shop, go to the theater, eat, and relax right where we were. We had a great relaxing weekend in the heart of the City!

review.title: Wonderful view of the city
review.reviewText: The King bedroom was very big. We had a corner room on the 30th floor with amazing panoramic views of the city and bays. Very comfortable bed too.

review.title: Nice hote...be careful of conventions
review.reviewText: We had rooms in both the new and old part of the hotel. Both rooms were excellent though completely different in character. I believe that the rooms in the old part of the hotel vary in size and quality by quite a bit. The new part of the hotel has a restaurant on its top floor that is used by conventions. When the entire convention group went to the restaurant, it clogged the elevators for 45 minutes. There was no way to get to your room. this is a big design flaw that should be fixed.

review.title: A disappointment for the price
review.reviewText: The "one cup coffee maker" had coffee disks for a full pot (luckily I had my own tea disks!) Coffee area was not cleaned in the morning. Used coffee cup (disposable) was not replaced. Concierge had an attitude when I booked my transport to SFO...insisted I leave an hour earlier than I planned or "we cannot be responsible if you miss your flight". On a positive note, front desk people were helpful. This is my second try--I won't bother again.

review.title: 2nd stay there and would go again
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean and convenient to everywhere we were interested in going.

review.title: Always one of the best
review.reviewText: Great hotel, in the middle of the downtown action--shopping, dining, nightlife, always a great place to stay

review.title: Great hotel.
review.reviewText: Great place to stay. Good location for shopping and even great for fisherman's warf. Take the trolley at $2 each way. Expensive parking at the hotel was the only down side at $49 a night. One block away you can park for $27 and two blocks away it was $20. Quiet room although it was a little small it was very comfortable. A/C and windows that open what more can you ask for.

review.title: Nice hotel but...
review.reviewText: Had a great stay at the hotel. However, the concierge guy we had seemed kind of condescending and haughty. He must not realize that even though customers may be dressed in vacation clothes like jeans & a T-shirt, they probably average an income ten times of his, so he has no room to be condescending.

review.title: it was average hotel with average service.
review.reviewText: The good thing about this hotel is location. It is central location for all activities. Otherwise, this is just average hotel with average service. Rooms are very small and so does bathroom. Also walls are very narrow so you can hear everything from next room or hallway. Be careful what you are doing! The bed is very comfortable and cleaning staffs are very efficient, our room was always cleaned before 11am. One good thing is they have Michael Mina restaurant in the hotel. You have to try his restaurant. He is one the top chef in SF. Based on what I sew, I would recommand to stay with other smaller boutique hotels around the area. Your money will stretch better.

review.title: A great place
review.reviewText: Was in the tower with a great view. only thing was that the tower is very modern while the lobby/main bldg is old-school historic. Want to try the rooms in the main hotel next time.

review.title: Wonderful place to stay!
review.reviewText: This Hotel is definitely worth the money! Located in probably the best location in San Francisco! Almost everything is in walking distance. The staff was very helpful and our hotel room was spotless. We stayed on the 23rd floor, and our only problem was getting the middle glass elevator to go to our floor, it would skip and go to 24 the entire time. Other than that, it was the perfect place to stay! Would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: we had a good experience at this hotel for a recent business trip- the beds are comfortable and the double-headed shower was a treat.

review.title: Beautiful Place To Stay
review.reviewText: Our room was comfortable and clean. The staff friendly, helpful & always had a smile. Great location. Close to lots of shopping and restaurants. Public transporation also close by. Would stay again.

review.title: old and needs updated
review.reviewText: While this Hotel was nice it is old, noisy and expensive for what you received. Pipes were loud and AC needed to be repaired

review.title: Excellent Union Square Hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent location right across from Union Square itself and only a few blocks from the start of the cable car. Lot's of good restaurants nearby and tons of shopping. The hotel is very nice with great service and services. Highly recommended.

review.title: great location for shopping, sightseeing, restaurants and dinners all around, would stay again.
review.reviewText: did take our dogs, staff extremely polite about them. Only bad part: you are not alowed to leave them alone in the room even in the crate, have to be at all times someone with them, park right across the street great for walking the dogs at any hour.

review.title: Small but comfy
review.reviewText: Room was very small, but clean and comfy. The location, amenities and history of the hotel make it worth staying at.

review.title: Westin St. Francis
review.reviewText: This is a lovely, historic hotel with outstanding service. Our room was in the older section of the hotel and very spacious. At check in, the front desk said we'd be in a renovated room and it appeared to be so, however, the carpet appeared stained. This was my only complaint--otherwise, the hotel is well located, the staff is helpful, and it's a wonderful place for a getaway weekend.

review.title: Not a Westin caliber
review.reviewText: The walls of this hotel are paper thin. We heard everything in the room next to us. The concierge desk proved very unhelpful--all three people were poorly prepared to direct and answer questions. Would I stay here again? No way.

review.title: comfortable and beautiful
review.reviewText: High, high ceilings, friendly staff, HD, great beds, all in a hotel with a history. We stayed in the old part, but the new part looks great too, and has glassed in elevators that provide the best view of the city, free! Even though we were visiting one of the most exciting cities in the world, we really enjoyed just spending time in the hotel.

review.title: Awesome Hotel
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at the Westin St. Francis in July and we would go back. I loved being in the historic part, sleeping in the same room someone did back in 1903. The staff were amazing and very helpful, valet parking a bit steep, but you are in San Francisco. Room was wonderful, bathroom was drafty but what do you expect in an old hotel. Truly wonderful. Can't wait to go back. Location was awesome, right there at Union Square.

review.title: a mixed bag
review.reviewText: No matter who I talked to, from check-in to Caruso's coffee bar, everyone was personable and extremely helpful. However, while the lobby areas continue to be beautiful in classic San Francisco style, I found the upper floor hallways and my room to be disappointing.....and very noisy at night.

review.title: Lovely hotel
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Westin very much. Staff was helpful and the room was very comfortable.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Westin St. Francis. It is in a wonderful location. Our room was spacious and clean, and the Heavenly Bed was awesome! The lobby is beautiful and it was fun to see all the photographs decorating the walls with all the famous guests who have visited. We also enjoyed the Clock Bar.

review.title: The Old Lady Still Has It
review.reviewText: My recent trip was the first time back in the hotel in about 12 years. The room was neat and fresh, decorated in an up to date style that still recalled the historical period. The bathroom was small, as it is in all of the historic hotels, but everything worked, was clean and classy (and, of course, had those Westin double shower heads!) The place gives you a true San Francisco experience.

review.title: Very nice hotel, we loved it.
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and the staff was great. Close to everything in SF. Really enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful with nice rooms and beds. We have stayed in many hotel in San Francisco and this is our favorite. It is a great find.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: Really, really liked this hotel--one and only one complaint--the waitstaff at the restaurant were not the friendliest bunch.

review.title: Great Location in SF
review.reviewText: This is a great location, right in the heart of the tourist district and it's very easy to get to other parts of the city from here. The hotel is very nice, clean and the staff is helpful.

review.title: Wonderful location
review.reviewText: A hotel with much history, it has a wonderful location across from Union Square where many of the city sightseeing tours have stops and department store shopping is in abundance. There is also a cable car stop directly in front of the hotel. The bed was very comfortable and the shower was great. The desk staff were extremely helpful and courteous when we had questions. The view from the glass elevators in the new section is beautiful.

review.title: Fantastic San Fran Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotels is amazing. We came here for our honeymoon and were amazed at the beauty of the hotel and the great service they provided. All of the staff were extremely helpful and efficient. Our room was in the new tower and was very comfortable and modern. We loved the wonderful bedding and mattress that they offer their guests. It's worth it to upgrade to a tower room with a view. We especially love that the hotel was within walking distance of the Powell/Hyde trolly station, Chinatown and many other restaurants. If you are considering this hotel for a weekend get away or a week long trip, you won't be disappointed!

review.title: It was nice
review.reviewText: We got a good price so we decided to stay here. The only issue we had was at the Clock Bar. It seems that if you are not dressed in expensive clothing you won't get service. Two servers walked by us and after 5 minutes of not even being looked out we decided to leave. However, the staff at the front desk were very nice. Also, the location was great. We didn't think the Wharf was too far of a walk. The room might have been small, however the bed made up for it. It really wasn't that small at all. We would stay here again.

review.title: hotel great--room needs improvement
review.reviewText: Hotel beautiful, classy, historic. Location FABULOUS. Room amenities unacceptable, especially bathroom. Broken phone and toilet.

review.title: great stay, great location
review.reviewText: would visit this hotel again, provided the hotel rate is reasonable.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is great location for many activities! We had a blast! The service was great too!

review.title: St. Francis exceeded expectations
review.reviewText: First of all, the Hotel is amazing. The history of the place is an incredible story unto itself. The hotel is very nice, very clean, and the heavenly bed and shower do not disappoint. Second, the hotel is right in the heart of S.F. The cable car stops at the front door, union square is right there, all of the shopping is right there, lots of places to eat, and the waterfront is only about 10 minutes by cable car.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Loved the location of the hotel with restaurants and shopping nearby. The cable car goes right by the front door and Union Sq. is a fun place to relax. Sometimes there is a line to talk to a concierge (they had 2), so go early or if you see no line.

review.title: A treat to stay at
review.reviewText: Staying here was the perfect match for a great vacation. The hotel is impressice, quiet, clean,and comfortable. The service was helpful and friendly. The history and location perfect. Everything we could ask for.

review.title: WESTIN ST. FRANCIS
review.reviewText: SAN FRAN was our first time. It's an AMAZING CITY!!! Especially the Rte.1 drive to Seaside, Carmel/ Monterey, CA. Great Starbucks coffee everyday! If they refill it w/ sweetner or cups. Bed was comfortable & nice. Pillows could use more stuffing. Great view of Union Square. Don't get the room by the elevator. NOISEY ELEVATOR!!! Didn't want to give up my view & deal w/ it instead.

review.title: Beautiful hotel.
review.reviewText: The St. Francis was amazing. It was my wife's birthday so they upgraded our room and sent us a bottle of champagne & chocolate covered strawberries for free. Very classy. The staff was lovely as was the room. We truly felt pampered.

review.title: Long Live St. Francis
review.reviewText: St. Francis is what it is always made out to be... excellent position with friendly service.

review.title: Had a wonderful weekend
review.reviewText: We booked a room at the Westin St. Francis for our 10th Anniversary. We were very impressed by the large, elegant lobby. We were offered a room upgrade to a Jr. Suite and were very pleased with the room, which had a small kitchenette, six person dining table and small living area. The bed was a pull-down wall unit, but was still very comfortable. We have been in other hotels in San Francisco before, and usually the rooms are quite small, this room, was very spacious. All furnishings were new and stylish. We were on the 31st floor and could see all of Union Square, the bay, Coit Tower and AT&T Park from our room. Right outside of the hotel the many restaurants and stores of Union Square, as well as Cable Car line. We were very impressed.

review.title: Love the Heavenly Beds!
review.reviewText: Everything about the Hotel was wonderful. The only shocker was the price of the parking at the hotel and around San Franciso in general.

review.title: Best Hotel in San Fran
review.reviewText: I would definitely reccomend staying at this hotel if you have no idea what hotel to stay at in the city. THe location is very convenient and walking distance to all the shops, Chinatown, Japantown, and Little Italy. The room was also very spacious and accomadating. The only drawback is that the walls are very thin, so I could hear my neighbor talking. Overall, I was very satisfied and would stay here again.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Westin for a Friday/Saturday. DO NOT get a room across from the elevator. It was a busy weekend and the noise kept us up. The hotel was VERY understanding and moved us to a room in a quiet area. The staff was very great. The hotel is in the middle of shopping, a easy walk to China town.

review.title: What we expected
review.reviewText: We expected the St. Francis to be superb, and it was.

review.title: Lovely place,very comfortable
review.reviewText: Inviting, central location, has a feel of the city

review.title: Great Location + Great Service = Great Time!
review.reviewText: This was our first time in San Francisco and had heard from friends and reading the reviews that this hotel was a great location to stay at. We were not disappointed in the least. The hotel is directly located in front of Union Square and all the shops and sights to see. Right outside of the hotel is the trolly which can be used to get to Fisherman's Warf and to more shops. When we arrived we were greeted with very friendly staff, this was a positive start as we arrived at midnight... Our room faced Union Square so in the morning we were able to see the people begin to walk through the square and perpare for the day. Walking to the elevators, all the staff that you passed greeted you with a "Good Morning" and a smile... The consierge was very, very helpful; they had maps and the list of different things going on in the city. I suggest a stop at the desk if this is your first time visiting. I am a big fan of the Westin chain of hotels and the Westin St. Francis is no exception. A wonderful hotel with great character, in a perfect location, and great service...

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: For the money and the 4 star rating, this hotel was a real let down. The service was not impressive, prices outlandish. Services offered were all pay for ala carte. I've had much better service and ammenities at a Comfort Inn.

review.title: Nice hotel at nice location
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. But the room is too small, but other than that, everything else is great... Very nice location, shopping, cable car, buses and BART are easily accessible.

review.title: Would have preferred more free features
review.reviewText: I was impressed with the quality of the Westin, but was disappointed to learn I would have to pay extra for both the fitness center & wireless internet. For a business traveler I can comp wireless to my employer, but having to pay such a high amount of money to work-out was disheartening. I'd choose a different hotel with these accomodations included for my next travel, to be totally honest.

review.title: Can't wait to get back
review.reviewText: Everything about the hotel is excellent, with one exception, the price of food. The prices at the coffee stand are ridiculous. On the plus side, the views from the tower are beautiful and staff could not be friendlier. The cable car to North Beach is in front of the hotel. Lots of great shops within a block.

review.title: Oldest hotel in San Fran and has great charm!!!
review.reviewText: I was in love with this hotel from the start. We walked in at 7am because we had a really early flight and check-in isn't normally until 3pm, but they let us have our room right away! 8 hours early! I thought that was very nice. The lobby and restaurants are beautiful. The room had a chandelier above the bed. The rooms are very small, but sweet. The bathroom was a little hard to maneuver at the same time as my husband because of it's small size, but it was very nice and up to date.

review.title: Beautiful hotel but ask for a room with a view.
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel with extremely nice staff. Shopping is right outside in Union Square. Be sure to ask for a room with a view otherwise you will be looking at a brick wall. This was disappointing for the price. The rooms were very nice and clean but, they don't give you enough soap. Great location and would definitely stay here again.

review.title: great hotel but no soap available....
review.reviewText: We booked for 2 nights and occupied 3 rooms. It was my father and mother inlaws 50th anniversary weekend. The hotel was perfectly located in Union Square and easy walking to all areas. We had adjoining rooms which suited the family. Although we checked in past 3pm...we expected to have all the rooms ready but they were not. We didn't have any soap in two rooms and asked the housekeeper in the hallway if we can have some. She probably didn't understand and only gave shampoo, conditioner and lotion. Overall, our experience was good.

review.title: Would recommend.
review.reviewText: Paid extra for a room with a view of a Union Square, very glad for it. Excellent view and location. Close to everything. Clean and comfortable rooms. Good to know before you arrive that parking costs $50/day.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful and a living museum. The staff is fantastic but we were in a room directly across from the elevators and it was noisy all hours. There was also a periodic noise in our walls from either the water system or air circlation system that got to be annoying.

review.title: Great accomodations in the heart of the city
review.reviewText: The hotel's two buildings are very distinct. If you like clean and modern, ask for an upper floor room in the tower for a fantastic view. If you want a more historic touch, opt for a room in the historic building, but know that the view even from its top floor is still 20+ stories below the top of the tower. Even if you stay in the historic building, make sure to take a ride up in the glass elevator that serves the 30-floor tower (as long as you're not prone to motion sickness!) The view from the elevator itself is something to see.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great spot if you want to see a lot of the city. Our room was very small and dark. There was one window, but it looked out to another window. The furniture was comfortable and clean; the bed was comfortable & the walk-in closet was great!

review.title: Concierge was not helpful at all! Other than that it was wonderful!
review.reviewText: Gorgeous hotel, the room service we ordered from the oak room restaurant was ok but definatley not for the price.

review.title: Can't wait to return!
review.reviewText: This hotel was absolutely beautiful and the perfect 'cherry on top' to a wonderful vacation. Conveniently located on Union Square, this hotel is only 3 blocks away from the MUNI and BART stations, which are subway trains that can take you across the city in minutes *highly recommended*

review.title: Good location Very pretty, historic hotel
review.reviewText: We upgraded one category from the Expedia standard room and were very satisfied. The room had a city view which we found very interesting. We were right by Union Square and could watch locals, tourist and street entertainers from our room. The room was clean, a nice size, had a small chandelier and was charming. Central location, very near all public transportation.

review.title: Heart of the city
review.reviewText: Great place to stay, we did some business there and went to my daughters graduation.. The room was very comfortable and quiet for downtown San Francisco.... Great for shopping, seeing the sites and right in the heart of San Fran. The only drawback was it was 49.00 a night for parking. Although it was great how fast they were able to get your car when needed, it was expensive. I think it is the most i have paid for all the times we have been there. All in all i would stay again, the elevator are a wow and fun to ride as they are one the outside of the building, giving you the best view of the city. Favorite places to eat, Maya on 2nd street. And the Cheesecake Factory right on the next block, above The Macys store. Wonderful times...........

review.title: Service is not as it was in yesteryears. Also expect to be charged for surprise extras.
review.reviewText: Our room was not made up. There were tufts of dusts spilling over the moldings in the bathroom. Some fixtures and appliances were in need of repair. We were charged for a local call. When the concierge was contacted for assistance with a resteraunt reservation, we were given a phone number and told to call ourselves. Though we had called the hotel garage ahead of time to ensure our car top tule box would clear the garage height, we were never told there would be an extra charge for the "oversized" vehicle. The old bar is gone. In it's place is a nice restauant, but hugely overpriced. Don't expect to workout either without being charged (this used to be included).

review.title: Fantastic hotel
review.reviewText: I kept my expectations low because of the great deal that I received from Expedia, but much to my surprise hotel was excellent. Clean, elegant, fantastic location and service. Couldn't ask for more and price was almost a steal.

review.title: Super location
review.reviewText: Our room was large and very comfortable, staff was friendly and helpful. Can't beat Union Square location! Would definitely recommend and stay again.

review.title: Central to everything
review.reviewText: If you want a wonderful hotel that is just about central to all that is San Francisco, you can't go wrong with the Westin St. Francis. Cable Cars stop right outside the front door...a short walk to muni station...Union Square perfect. Cab ride to and from airport for 40.00 each way. I would stay there again.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: They were wonderful, the facility is top notch... great place to stay.

review.title: Worth the money. Good price for good quality.
review.reviewText: For the low price I paid, I got a good place to stay in a very good lcoation close to union sqr with good quality of service. The room is bigger than other hotel within the same area with the same price.

review.title: Definitely recommend
review.reviewText: Amazing place to stay in.

review.title: Wonderful San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed at the Westin St. Francis on our honeymoon. The room was quite luxurious, and we had a wonderful view of San Francisco from our window. We both got sick on the last day of our honeymoon, and we discovered that this is actually a great place to be sick at! The hotel staff checked to see how we were doing and even sent up hot tea and chicken soup to our room. If you are looking for a hotel with old-school charm and luxury, this is the place for you. Also, the location, can't be beat. It is right on Union Square, within easy walking distance of some great shopping, and the cable cars stop right at the hotel. We are looking forward to going there again on our 1st anniversary!

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Im not raving about the experience I had at the Westin, but I also wouldnt hesitate to send my friends and family to stay. The room was clean, comfortable and had everything I needed. Everything about the experience was pleasant, but nothing wowed me. If youre looking for a spectacular experience try somewhere else, but for a solid hotel - the Westin is great. Good Location & Historic Charm.

review.title: Romantic Getaway
review.reviewText: Overall, we enjoyed the hotel. We ended up in a room with a Murphy bed (a sacrfice we made to have a room with a view!), so the bed was not super comfortable. Other than that, no complaints. We got a great price and would stay here again. The location was perfect, right in the middle of everything and just a short walk from the BART and steps from the cable car.

review.title: Old School
review.reviewText: Original hotel is an old school atrium hotel and half of its rooms have share that very uninteresting view. Otherwise it's a fine old hotel in a very convenient location.

review.title: Glorious! I'd definitely stay here again.
review.reviewText: What I especially liked, aside from the luxurious feel of the place, was the fact they gave you incentives to do the things I do anyway, and they make it easy. If you choose to be a little more environmental, and not to have housekeeping clean up and provide fresh towels everyday, you receive daily a $5 coupon for their restaurants. If you choose not to have a paper delivered to your room you get a discount. It's nice to see a place as posh as this encourage people to make environmental choices without diminishing the experience. The other great thing about this hotel was its location! Right on Union Square next to the historic street car, lots of shopping, and even ready access to the open bus tours. Also there are so many great restaurants within walking distance; it could not have been more ideal a location for us. Cab rides were inexpensive to major attractions, and transit was also easily accessible. If I go back, I am staying here!

review.title: I'd recommend this hotel BUT . . .
review.reviewText: . . . if you get a room in the tower, be sure it is nowhere near the elevator. Our room was lovely, our view was great and our beds were comfortable, but we didn't sleep a wink because of the roar of that elevator running up and down the side of the building all night. It was like trying to sleep in a factory, and we left exhausted the next day.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Nothing is included. They have a fitness room but charge $12 per day to use it! They also have wired/wireless internet access, but it's not included in the price of the room. Wouldn't recommend this hotel at all. There are hundreds of hotels in downtown San Francisco. Pick another.

review.title: Great location, well maintained
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel for its location and well appointed rooms. The lobby is elegant and, judging by how busy it was, a destination spot to meet and socialize. The downside, its an old hotel so rooms in the old section are small. And, if you are unfortunate to have neighbours who come back to their room at 2 AM and want to talk, then you will realize the walls are thin. The gym is great, lots of machines, busy at 7 AM. Starbucks coffee in the room was a nice touch.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: The surfaces in the room were not clean: glass tabletops had smudges/fingerprints which were there when we arrived, and still there when we left. Coffee had been previously spilled near the coffee-maker; coasters were coffee-stained and had not replaced; and the tops of the long-life milk supplies were similarly stained with coffee. The shower curtain had mould on the corner, and there was more mould under the rim of the hand basin where the seal had fallen away. Biggest concern was on our day of departure. We left our luggage at the hotel in good faith, for safe-keeping until our departure for the airport. Our luggage was not kept in a locked room. I went to retrieve some travel documents mid-afternoon and found our luggage left by itself, on a trolley in the undercroft garage driveway, where anyone could have access. We were fortunate nothing had been stolen. We expressed our concerns to the hotel staff and were not given a satisfactory response. They merely said they had never had any problems before ... but that doesn't mean they won't have any problems in the future. In this day and age of high security, we thought this was very poor practice indeed. Paid for 24 hours internet access, but this was automatically terminated on checkout at 11.00 a.m. so I was unable to use wifi in the hotel lobby during the afternoon. Big thumbs down for this hotel. Won't stay there again and wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

review.title: Nice hotel but would probably stay elsewhere in the future
review.reviewText: We stayed here for a couple of nights when visiting northern California. The hotel was clean and the staff were very friendly and knowledgeable. We had a room in the 1904 part of the hotel and it was quite small for two people. The cost of in room internet was also very high. Given the price we payed per night, we could have stayed in other equally equipped hotels in the area for less. I would recommend this hotel for its historical value but there are likely to be better deals out there.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: If you are not too concerned about slightly higher prices you should definitely consider staying at the Westin St.Francis on Powell street. Excellent all around and very close to everything right next to Union Square in SFO. Can't complain about anything really. Pleasant experience.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: We walked into our room and the room was a mess. We walked back down to the lobby and requested another room because the original room was no way near ready for the next guest to arrive. One of the member of the staff wasn't very pleasant and he said "that's house keeping problem not his". He didn't even bother to apologize. He put us in another room which is much older and the hallway has an unpleasant odor. We didn't have a good experience there.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: parking cost too much

review.title: Great location; great service; comfy beds
review.reviewText: The Union Square location can't be beat - close to lots of options for dining, shopping, and transportation. The lobby of the hotel is beautiful, the staff is very nice, and the beds are indeed "heavenly". The only thing that I could complain about is that the rooms are a little worn and small. The bathrooms are nice and fairly large, and the desk and TV were serviceable, but for a 4-star hotel I would have expected the rooms to have been a little nicer. The paint was old and the carpet was not great - it just looked "worn". Other than that everything was great!

review.title: Very Convenient location, great view
review.reviewText: We were pleased with the price for the room on the weekend, and the location on Union Square worked very well. The service was outstanding in the parking garage. We went in and out a lot. Room ammenities were skimpy for this level of hotel under the guise of being ecologically responsible. In all, fine for what we needed. Excellent gym, worth the $12 fee.

review.title: Great location for San Francisco!
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel & would stay here in again in a heartbeat!

review.title: Heart of Union Square, SF
review.reviewText: Right on Powell St, cable car line. Across the street from Union Square and Westfield shopping center. Main Flagship stores most most large retailers within blocks. Check out Clock Bar inside hotel. Pricy Martini's, but great!! Tower side rooms are newer and modern, while the other side is original motiv`. Parking is rediculous at $50, literally behind hotel is Ace Parking, (Mason and Post) where you can park overnight for $20. Overall, i like the smaller boutique hotels in SF, but this was a nice place.

review.title: Awesome Hotel, Perfect Location
review.reviewText: My husband and I went to San Francisco for the very first time and we did not know what to expect. To look for a hotel is a very risky business specifically when you do not know the city at all! Well we took our chances and book Westin St. Francis Hotel..we were amazed...the location was perfect! just a couple steps from Union Square and walking distance from Chinatown, public transportation is around the corner(for someone who has never visited San Francisco I recommend you to not to drive, it is insane, the streets are too narrow and parking impossible) and it takes you all the way down to Fisherman's Wharf...just awesome, the staff is very friendly too. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everybody, ohh one more thing, the white tea body lotion is one of the best I ever had the bad thing is that they do not sell it at the hotel you have to buy it online....Well Enjoy!

review.title: turn of the century charm
review.reviewText: The rooms in the older part of the hotel are gorgeous, though a bit small. The walk-in closet was a nice touch as were the crown moldings and chandelier. Glad we were at the back of the hotel as Union square is quite noisy at night.

review.title: Great for a night
review.reviewText: Was just in town for one night, the room was a good rate, lobby and decoration really nice. The elevator was a fun touch, loved the location in Union Square. Did NOT love the parking so much.

review.title: Why didn't I stay here sooner?
review.reviewText: I've avoided this hotel on past trips thinking it would be too expensive or too stuffy. I was pleasantly suprised to find it neither. My double roon was huge, and the "Heavenly Beds" were just that! Staff was friendly, room was immaculate, and the location was perfect. I loved this hotel and have already recommended it to several friends.

review.title: Under construction
review.reviewText: We didn't hear any noise due to construction, but we stayed in the older part of the hotel that had not yet been renovated. The un-remodeled room just seemed a little below standard for a Westin. BUT.. shower and bed were fantastic!

review.title: nicely located, good level of service
review.reviewText: This is a nice address and the service is good. Don't expect a very large room unless you choose the superior suite, but it is far enough for a short stay in town. Make sure your room is NOT located close to the elevator ...so noisy! We asked the hotel to change this for us and they did excepted that we lost the benefit of the King size bed we initially booked and paid for. Other than that, the service was good and this is what you expect for a 4stars hotel.

review.title: Great place!!
review.reviewText: Lots of character and excellent location. The spa was great, my wife loved the end of teh day massages. Definitely will return.

review.title: Very nice - would stay again.
review.reviewText: Pros: Extremely helpful staff, room was nice sized with lovely view of bay, very clean and for the most part had everything we needed. Location in downtown was fabulous. Doormen were more than accomodating. The spa was outstanding. I had a pedicure and reflexology. They really know how to pamper. Cons: Apparently hotel no longer supplies note pads and pens. I needed to make notes and had nothing to write on. When I asked at desk, she gave me a plain sheet of paper - no hotel stationery. The heavenly beds gave both my husband and I backaches. Concierges were a bit brusk and not all that helpful. That said, we would definitly stay there again.

review.title: Had a great time
review.reviewText: The Westin Heavonly Bed is the best. The hotel was in a great location. We were only there for the weekend and had a great time. We ate at the hotel restaurant for breakfast, that was pricey for breakfast. We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Will go again
review.reviewText: perfect location. nice hotel room.

review.title: Has been a five star hotel since the sixties.
review.reviewText: Our stay met all our expectations that have been developed over a period of 45 years. The addition of the new lobby bar is a hit.

review.title: Downtown deal
review.reviewText: Great deal on old classic hotel on Union Square. CLose to shopping and restaurants. Easy to make connections to get around town. Room was in tower -- very nice, corner room on 22nd floor. Bathroom tile was cold, though, and alarm clock had strange buzzing noise. Overall, very nice, large room with great views.

review.title: Wow what a great place
review.reviewText: This hotel has it all and you can walk to so many places it is a 5 star +

review.title: Good quality for reasonable price
review.reviewText: The bed was super comfy. Room service was quick and friendly. Only complaint would be the consierge who was not very helpful. We were dressed for a nice romantic dinner and michael mina was booked. Asked the consierge for help and he sent us to a little whole in the wall sushi place. That would have been fine for lunch or a low key dinner, but we specifically said "nice dinner place." Front desk clerk was very friendly and quick as well.

review.title: very nice
review.reviewText: very nice

review.title: Everything great but the cost of thre overnight parking,
review.reviewText: Excellent facilities and service, Parking lot very expensive. USD$50.00 por night while the car rental was less than that.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: This hotel is extremely beautiful and we can't wait to go back to San Francisco just to stay there. I will definitely recommend it to others. Also the view of Union Square from the hotel elevator was extremely breathe-taking.

review.title: nice room
review.reviewText: The bed and pillow were fantastic! The best reason to stay here. The room view wonderful. The area outside the bathroom was dark and hard to use when dressing for the day. The lounge drinks/food very expensive. The check-in clerk didn't tell me where to find the elevator (hidden down a hall and around a corner). The concierge was overworked and not helpful. The location was a great place to meet people, and for sightseeing.

review.title: Best Stay in San Fran
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the St. Francis more than we had imagined. It's wonderful having your own chandelier.

review.title: Peace of Mind!
review.reviewText: This is the second time I've stayed at the St. Francis, it was great the first time and better the second because I was familiar with the property. The location is perfect for site seeing, shopping, dining or just staying in your room relaxing - everything!

review.title: Will visit again!
review.reviewText: This hotel was very clean and impressive looking. It looks like you would have had to spend a lot of money for the room, but it was quite reasonable. It was very clean and comfortable. The staff were very professional and helpful. The conceriege did a great job giving us ideas where to go and restaurants to try during our short stay. We we're just surprised by the extra parking charge of $50.00 for our rental car. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: The forgotten room
review.reviewText: The Westin St. Francis is a beautiful hotel, but I think maybe I just had a strange room. One of my business colleagues even suggested the room was haunted. It was at the end of a long hallway (the only room at this end, next to the stairs) and I really think it was located in a place where the hotel service staff just "forgot" about it. When I entered my room, the window was open, the TV was on, and there was a duvet cover wrapped up in plastic sitting on top of the bed. There was a bolster/pillow next to it (in the middle of the bed). So it's like housekeeping got 3/4 of the way through cleaning the room and then left? Strange. The front desk wasn't quite sure about it either, but offered to move me to another room. I declined since it was late and I was going to bed. I hung my breakfast order on the card outside the door at about 10pm. The next morning, the card had not been picked up. (But I did have a newspaper...) I called roomservice and they apologized and got me my order very quickly, which was really appreciated. My review would definitely be worse if the front desk and roomservice had not been so apologetic and willing to fix the problems in a hurry. So a huge plus goes to those folks who know how to fix issues quickly! All that said, if you're looking for a hotel with a lot of old charm and maybe a few ghosts, in an excellent location, the Westin St. Francis is a good bet.

review.title: Huge Dissapointment
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Westin Hotel with my Fiance for her Birthday. I was highly disapointed. The room and the bathroom was dirty. When I mentioned this to the front desk they said that they were sold out and could not get us another room. This is the first time I have stayed at a Westin and have always heard great things about the Hotel. Unfortunately because of my experience I will never stay at a Westin again.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: this is a very classy hotel and whenever I visit San Francisco I try to stay there. Beautiful, historical, great service,perfect location. There is not enough I can say about this hotel.

review.title: San Francisco at its best
review.reviewText: Awesome top-notch hotel at prime location vis a vis Union Square. All you can expect; very nice rooms in great condition. We stayed at the 'classical' half, i.e. not the tower. Would definitively come back.

review.title: st francis
review.reviewText: very nice hotel, with the added bonus of having Michael Mina inside the hotel, one of the best restaurants in SF.

review.title: Nice hotel, snooty staff
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel right on Pioneer Square. Watch out for the greeters on the top floor conference center. Very snooty and don't want you looking around at the view.

review.title: bad view.
review.reviewText: i guess everything has a price. we booked with expedia and got a deal but whene we got to the hotel we asked for a room with a view, were declined.

review.title: A Dream Come True
review.reviewText: Having grown up in the Bay Area, there was never any reason to "spend the night" in the city, since I could just drive home. But now I live in New England and was finally able to stay at the St. Francis - met and exceeded all my expectations. Except for the fact that the Compass Rose was no longer there and the restaurant that replaced it did not look inviting at all. The memories will have to suffice.

review.title: Great Hotel but you should know a couple things.
review.reviewText: You will be staying the in heart of San Francisco. Very close to the Bart. So you can take the Bart from the airport. There is plenty to do around the hotel. The rooms are very nice but the walls are paper thin and you can hear everyone walking in and out of there rooms and I could here my neighbors conversation. The hotel did do a nice job of changing my room and I was around less noisy people. But I could still hear everything. There is plenty of street noise as a local band plays outside the hotel every night. The hotel itself is high class. Very nice. I did see a prostitute being thrown out by an overly aggressive security guard you called her an awful name (even if she is a prostitute, she still a human.) Other then that very very nice hotel, nice gym. Located next to a big shopping center and easy assess to transportation. Noisy but what do you expect when your in Union Square.

review.title: Perfect place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located, everything is around the hotel (shopping, pubs, restaurants, cable car, etc). The room that I got is really big and nice. The rooms are old but well maintained. The check-in process was excellent, the reception staff recommended a perfect room for me. One thing to consider is that the bathroom does not have an exhaust (which is normal in old, historical buildings). The hotel rate during my stay was really a bargain. I will definitely consider staying there again if I return to San Francisco

review.title: Will stay there again
review.reviewText: Prime location in the city at Union Square

review.title: Interesting historical hotel with NON responsive house keeping service
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a historical building and it was very classy inside and outside, it would be like you had traveled in time, so don't expect the facility to be modern at all. We had a room with a King size bed facing the Union Square. The view is beautiful. The room was clean and nicely decorated. The front desk was polite and helpful. House keeping service was bad!!! The room was kept clean and tidy, but there was a big problem, their "Express Service" was not so express. we called the hotel's "Express" service for one extra soap on the first night(only 1 in the room) and 2 shower caps on the second night(0 not in the room). On the 1st night: waited for 30 minutes to get that one extra soap; On the 2nd night: waited for 45 minutes to get the 2 shower caps. I had called 4 times, each time they said it is on the way and they will check on it, but they were just not there. On my fifth call, they said there were 12 orders ahead of mine that they had to deliver first, and they are shorthanded. Let me be direct and clear, I would have got my soap 3 times faster in any hotel, even Motel 6! They should be ashamed to be called a 4 star hotel. I understand that the first night was Christmas, so it is understandably that they were shorthanded, but the 2nd night was not even a public holiday! 2 thumbs down down to Westin San Francis.

review.title: very happy with the hotel
review.reviewText: We really liked the traditional king room we reserved. It was lovely and very attractive and roomy. Enjoyed the view onto Union Sq. at Christmas time. The only thing we were unhappy about was the fact that the loveseat really was overdue to be cleaned or replaced, numerous stains and spots on the upholstery which made it unattractive to relax on. Otherwise, very happy with our choice!

review.title: Bad Service
review.reviewText: Very bad service. Very small rooms. Linens were not changed. used towels were not replaced, they were just taken away for laundry. morning room coffee packets were not replaced. Wrong billing from the refreshment counter, when nothing was consumed from the refreshment counter. Glasses used for water were not replaced. In short there were no replacements after use.

review.title: what you dont get
review.reviewText: when i reserved this room i was lead to believe that my room would be a panaramic view of the bay and SF instead i got a view of a hotel next door. I was very disappointed with what was offered and what i really got. Room service was lousy to say the least and way to long the food was good once you got it after calling three times to see where it was at.

review.title: Great location-Great service-fine room
review.reviewText: The rooms in the tower are large, gracious and comfortable. One suggestion: Pls include MSNBC on your cable list. In this political year, the station is really missed...and is one on most first class hotel menus.

review.title: VERY NICE
review.reviewText: Although the hotel was very nice. I did have a huge problem with the restraunt that was in the hotel itself. Me and my date sat at the bar and watched, not one, not two, but three of the chefs eat food as they prepared it. I complained to the manager and he only offered to buy me a drink. We had to switch rooms the first night we were there because the bathtub clogged up. Overall a very nice hotel. But not to happy with the hotel staff.

review.title: Nice Place for a Meeting
review.reviewText: Good Location easy access to all the meeting facilities. I like the historic aspect of the Hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel but do not stay in the Historic section
review.reviewText: I didn't do a lot of research before staying at the Westin and overall was impressed. The hotel is in a great location and the lobby is very nice. However, the room we had was in the Historic tower (aka: old). When I made the reservation I requested to stay in the Tower, which I hear was recently renovated. I wasn't told until I checked in that the type of room I booked was not available in the Tower. Apparently there are no standard rooms in the Tower. I would definitely stay at the hotel again but not in the Historic tower.

review.title: it's a classic
review.reviewText: this is not the hippest or most interesting hotel, but we were on a trip with a 7-yr-old who was thrilled with the 'elegance' of the St. Francis, and with the fact that the cable cars and Union Square (with the Christmas tree) were right outside our door. Rooms were comfortable and clean, and concierge and front desk staff very cordial and helpful.

review.title: Very good location, friendly staff.
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for our honeymoon. It has an excellent location, the staff was very professional and friendly. The room and bed were very comfortable. I will not hesitate recommending this hotel. If I go back to San Fco, I will definitely stay at Westin San Francis again.

review.title: Fantastic place to stay
review.reviewText: My girlfriend and I were celebrating our two year anniversary and I reserved a suite on the 25th floor to propose to her. The suite was beautifully appointed with a fantastic view of the San Francisco skyline. The king size bed was so incredibly comfortable and the flatscreen tv had an excellent picture. I was also impressed with the service during our one night stay. We were missing a robe when we first got into the room and called down to room service and they brought one up right away. The Westin St Francis is an elegant grand dame of Union Square from its' gorgeous lobby and bar area to its' glass elevators and friendly staff. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel and look forward to doing so again myself.

review.title: location location location
review.reviewText: I love this hotel. It is lovely and close to all sn francisco attractions.

review.title: A Special Memory
review.reviewText: We stayed here for our 25th Anniversary. Didn't spend alot of time in the room, as there is too much to do and see in San Francisco! Bed and pillows were very comfortable. Bathroom was clean (altho the hotel's water shut down in the middle of my shower!!). Water was restored in a couple of hours. They had a roof issue with engineers.....not the Hotel's fault. When we arrived, the bell hop asked if our stay was for a special occasion. We mentioned our anniversary and when we returned late that first night from dinner down at Fisherman's Wharf, there was a bottle of chilled champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries waiting for us! How wonderful! and they were on the house. I would probably stay here again.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Fantastic value, great location, most comfortable bed, close to all of the great shopping in the city

review.title: Enjoyed stay, would stay again
review.reviewText: We enjoy visiting San Francisco approximately once a year and stay in a variety of hotels, various locations. This was our first stay at the St. Francis. Very much enjoyed being in the heart of Union Square with everything just outside the door. The hotel had a bustling atmosphere. Staff was helpful and attentive. Rooms (and linens) were very nice. Would definitely stay again.

review.title: We are really looking forward to coming back!!
review.reviewText: Great hotel in every way: beautiful rooms, nice bar, great service, perfect location.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The bathroom was very small and had plumbing problems. The walls were so thin that with could hear everthing and I mean everthing from the next door!

review.title: Perfect Union Square Location
review.reviewText: The Westin St. Francis was a great place to stay in the heart of Union Square, SF. Our historic corner room was perfect for a weekend getaway. Small space, but high ceilings and classic decor made for a memorable stay.

review.title: A fine hotel with service flaws
review.reviewText: Our mini bar had an open drink in it. We could not find some of the items on the list. We used two items. When we checked out we found we were charged for items we didn't use. Those items were removed from our bill. When did the mini bar get serviced? If it did, why did they not re stock it?

review.title: Very nice and with one of the best restaurants in the us
review.reviewText: Excelent

review.title: location location location
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice. We will definitely be spending more time there. The location was perfect. We were in walking distance to great food, shopping, Ferry building and we were not accosted by all the riffraff that hangs around other S.F. hotels.

review.title: This place survives on its reputation.
review.reviewText: The Hotel was expensive and the room uncomfortably small. The location is great but that's it.

review.title: union square atmosphere
review.reviewText: It is a spacious and old-fashioned hotel in a great downtown location. The roomrate we got was good but we were a bit surprised at the charge for 24-hour parking ( no, I didn't say what it was ....but it was high ! ) The room was nice & big. The dining room has a lovely wooden ceiling. I would go there again.....

review.title: Excellent all round
review.reviewText: This hotel offers excellent service, location, amenities. I would throughly recommend staying here. Nothing was a problem for staff. It is located right on Union Square. Everything is at your fingertips. Loved our stay. Thank you.

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText: Overall this hotel was ok. Clean and pleasant surroundings. The staff were ok, but nothing particularly special, they were nice enough, but certainly didn't go out of their way to assist. The room was really spacious which was great and the hotel location was fantastic. The biggest problem I had was with the air con. The room was too hot to sleep without it on, and it was too noisy to open the window at night. The air con unit was right next to the bed and extremely noisy expecially when it flicked on according to the thermostat. Other guests reported that the walls seem really thin ,but I certainly didn't notice this. Also they seem to nickle and dime you for everything, internet rates are pricey and you need to pay a significant additional charge for the health club. We were at a conference at the hotel and the food provided was kind of average. All in all it is a good place to stay if you are just looking for a room. If you want the whole experience then be prepared to pay for it or look elsewhere.

review.title: would come back
review.reviewText: Eventhought our stay was really short it did not take away from the feel of the place. very elegant and great service. also it is located right at union square where the Shopping is. its about a mile away from Fishermans' Warf & we took a 1 hour bike ride to the GG bridge.

review.title: Will Definitley Go Back
review.reviewText: Had a fabulous 4 night stay in this classic hotel. Great room, great view over Union Square, wonderful concierge service. Will be back, no question.

review.title: LOVEDIT!
review.reviewText: We loved everything about the hotel and were more than satisfied with everything EXCEPT their check in. It took over 30 minutes to check us in. There were 8 people ahead of me. I found the check in not only bad but actually unbelievably bad.

review.title: location great but no 4 star room
review.reviewText: as title suggests the hotel is in the heart of union square but if you happen to get a good deal for a room at the westin st. Francis don't expect perfection; They keep the old and really small rooms for the bargain hunters. The hotel has everything you could need at a really huge price but not a bad experience dont get me wrong.

review.title: Westin St. Francis San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the heart of the city, and very easy getting transportation any where you would like to go. A very romantic hotel.

review.title: superb!!
review.reviewText: Loved it! from the moment i entered the hotel when the manager herself introduced herself and walked me to the front desk, to the fact that I got UPGRADED just by asking, to an AWESOME room with a full frontal view of union square!!!, oh, and on the 27TH FLOOR! talk about moving on up... :) I had only paid for their least expensive room which there is no view... they really made me feel like a high roller.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: good access to shoping area

review.title: Must Stay Here
review.reviewText: This was the third time I stayed at the Westin St. Francis. It has great customer service and the location is perfect. Trus me. You will be happy.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Right on Union Square, the location can't be beat. The staff was friendly, the rooms quiet, and the bed and linens were heavenly. Nice bath robe provided. Wallpaper in bathroom was peeling a bit but other than that the room was well maintained. Well stocked fridge but items in the fridge and room service pricey. Standard toiletries provided in cute bottles but would have been nice if they provided a product for soaking in the tub, a nice scented bubble bath, as the tub was good size. Nice double shower head, making a shower for two quite comfortable. No room in fridge to put your own items but they do offer a portable fridge they will deliver to your room, you just have to ask early enough as I was told that by late in the day they run out. No freezer or microwave but if you are staying in the heart of Union Square, everything you need is close by.

review.title: Nickle and Dime
review.reviewText: This is a high end hotel, so I was a bit surprised by the nickle and dime attitude. Want a late check, sure for $70. Want to park your car $55/night. We didn't check in until after 10pm and we only used the parking for 12 hours. From a high end hotel I expect better. For example, comlimentary and automatic late check out, especially if the check in is so late. There are so many options in the city I was hoping Westin would set themselves apart. Location is great and rooms are very nice. Service as I said could be better for the price.

review.title: Excellent location.
review.reviewText: We always stay there wheN visiting SF. Very satisfactory all round.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: I've stayed at this hotel half a dozen times and each visit is different from the last. I must preface this by saying that in the past, I have had some outstanding visits at this hotel. I have stayed in some incredibly beautiful rooms, and stayed in other very average rooms. The room I was in this visit was in the Towers and had stains on the carpets and curtains. Not impressive considering the price we paid through Expedia. The service from the front desk was excellent. They were pleasant, accomodating, and helpful; however, the service from the restaurant in the lobby as well as the concierge was not impressive. The complimentary pretzels they served were stale!!! We had to find someone to clear the table when we sat down and our server was unpleasant. The woman at concierge had an attitude that we didn't appreciate. It may have been an off night, but overall, my most recent visit was a huge disappointment.

review.title: Good hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel is old and the rooms for the most part (especially if you book through the internet) are small. The bedding was very comfortable and we got used to the cramped quarters. The bath was very small by today's standards. The location is excellent and is very convenient.

review.title: Centrally located.
review.reviewText: Everyone was very pleasant. San Francisco landmarks right out our window.

review.title: First Class
review.reviewText: This hotel is first class all the way. From the cleanliness of the room, to the service from the staff, it was first rate. Also, the location is perfect. It's right in the heart of downtown. I will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great weekend getaway
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with my room at the St. Francis - It was clean and large enough.

review.title: best in san francisco
review.reviewText: well located,nice rooms,landmark

review.title: Westin St. Francis Union Square
review.reviewText: Nice location for an old hotel. The rooms are quite small. The beds were nice when new, but in my home i have the same bed that Westin calls the Heavenly, and it the hotel one is clearly worn in. The towels for the bathroom are old, and rough, from too many washes and high heat drying. The bath towel is also not much larger than the hand towels. The hotel, like all upscale hotels nickels and dimes you for everything including $12/day for use of the gym. I didn't think the hotel had much character past the exterior and some trim work in the rooms and hallways. The staff are extremely nice and the service is impeccable. However, having lived in San Francisco, we only used the hotel as a place to sleep and a base to jump from. For the money, it's a bit expensive for what you get, but you are paying for location too. It's a fine hotel if you are used to staying in lower end hotels, but doesn't compare to the newness of a Crowne Plaza or say the Omni. And it's no where near the Mandarin Orientals or Intercontinental out there. Then again, I was also disappointed with the Renaissance Hotel Kowloon in Hong Kong last month.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The Westin St. Francis hotel has a great location on Union Square. Customer Service was excellent, and I loved the room, a Delux King over looking Union Square. We stayed in the older part of the hotel, and the decor reflects its 1910 construction. We arrived early and was given a room right away. My only complaint is the floor that we were on was being painted. The smell was not in the room, but walking to the elevator was not condusive to the standards of a 4 star hotel. This was the second time I have stayed at the Westin, and plan on doing so again.

review.title: Road trip to SF
review.reviewText: This was an excellent hotel although when traveling with children I would not recommend. Fishermans Warf would be the ideal location.

review.title: Centrally Located Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location however, room was small. But, when in San Fran, you're better off out enjoying the great city! One quirky issue was that the hotel phones did not work well. Room to room calls went through however, they also gave a bussy tone when you speaking. The hotel was reluctant to address the issue after several calls to the front desk.

review.title: What a great hotel
review.reviewText: the Westin St Francis was a wonderful Hotel. We got a terrific room - a corner room with an excellent view of Union Square. We were very happy to be in the "older" section of the hotel. You can just imagine the history that has taken place there. Queens and Presidents have stayed there. The staff was great. They greeted us with the utmost respect and were extremely helpful. Thank you!

review.title: Beautiful Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: The Westin is a gorgeous hotel that is centrally located to all major San Francisco site-seeing destinations. The cable car and buses run right outside the hotel and the street car is right down the street. It's easy to get around on the public transit. Most union square attractions are within walking distance or are just a short ride on the cable car. I recommend this hotel to those of you who enjoy a quality hotel and won't mind a little noise from the square. There's a great concierge to offer advice on how to get around and to offer maps and directions. By the way, everything in the Hotel is "Heavenly" from the beds and pillows to towels and soap. P.S. Do the Bay Tour!

review.title: Great hotel on Union Square,
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel with door front access to Union Square. Staff was wonderful and hotel was imaculate. Hotel met and exceeded our expectations. We can not wait to return to this wonderful hotel.

review.title: Luxury Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was luxurious and a good location for shopping,dining and muni. Everyone was friendly, including the parking attendants. Be advised there is a daily parking expense due to limited marking available in San Francisco.

review.title: Hotel was great
review.reviewText: The hotel was wonderful. The only sad thing about the trip was the number of homeless people milling around the hotel and surrounding area looking for a handout. I know every city no how hard it works has homeless. But the impression I got was San Fran had a lot more. I couldn't walk 1 complete block without getting approached for money. I know there must be shelters in the city and programs to help them. Is this really the impression your city wants to give to the world. I met people from Canada, France, all over Asia, England, Australia and Germany. I fear they went home and said San Francisco is full of homeless people. Just something to think about.

review.title: Historic Tower means Decrepit Tower
review.reviewText: Upon arrival, we learned that our room was in the "historic tower." The hotel's other tower had been remodeled. The door to our room was at a 45 degree angle to the entrance to the next room. Inside, it was dingy & depressing. The bathroom was tiny & so old that it was hard to tell if it was clean. With so many great options in San Francisco, we would not return there.

review.title: Great location - historic feel
review.reviewText: Perfect location on Union Square - can walk to a lot of shops, restaurants, etc. Historic feel to lobby - rooms can be small, although we lucked out with an upgrade and had a large suite. Extra charges (internet, fitness center) are way too high.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in the middle of it all...
review.reviewText: I had a wonderful stay at the Westin. It was very comfortable as well as convenient. We had access to everything so that was a plus. I would definitely go back.

review.title: Love this Hotel
review.reviewText: I love this Hotel. It is in a great location for shopping and entertainment. The Hotel is very comfortable and quiet.

review.title: Smallest Hotel Room so far
review.reviewText: The hotel was very convenient as it is so close to everything. The room we got however was a little disappointing, it had no view and was so very small even when compared to the room we had in London. There were no slippers provided and the coffee maker was in the closet which only had one robe. It smelled nice at least, not musty and the housekeeping was good. Might try a different hotel in Union Square next time.

review.title: Just as it should be.
review.reviewText: Only trouble was not being able to play music through cable service. Everything else was great. Carefree vacationing!

review.title: Definitely Going Back
review.reviewText: This was my first visit to San Fransico and my first experience staying at a Westin Hotel and boy was I impressed....The most impressive of all was the Heavenly Bed I was so impressed, I am looking to purchase one for myself. Overall the stay was very nice and the hotel was in the best location in the city...... Like LL Cool J said... "I'm going back to Cali".

review.title: Very cute and quaint!
review.reviewText: The room was just the right size - small enough for the two of us who only slept in the room for two nights. the decor was very classy & service throughout the hotel was great. Thanks & we will be back!

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: You can hear what's going on in the rooms next door.

review.title: Fabulous Location
review.reviewText: The Westin is convenient to everything in San Francisco. The service was excellent and the concierge people gave great recommendations. We will always stay at the Westin when we visit San Francisco.

review.title: Beautiful and Perfectly centered in downtown San Fran
review.reviewText: A luxury hotel that was so convenient for getting anywhere in San Francisco. Our room was quite big (Deluxe King) with unbeatable views of Union Square. I would DEFINITELY go back in a heartbeat.

review.title: Unbeatable location, updated old-world glamour
review.reviewText: This is a great choice of hotel for business travelers who want Westin's usual standards for frequent visitors but also like a little glamour. The lobby and oak room are filled with memorabilia from the old St. Francis, and Michael Mina's restaraurant brings some serious modern style to the front of the house.

review.title: Just Wonderful
review.reviewText: Wonderful old charm with contemporary luxury! Close to everything downtown. Took traveler's tips and tried Sears for breakfast -loved it so much we went back again! Great food at a great price! Definitely ask for higher floor room if you want a good view of the city and the bay. Hope to go back soon!! Had dinner in Oak Room - good food for a fair price.

review.title: Wonderful place to stay
review.reviewText: The Westin St. Francis is a wonderful place to stay.The location is great and the hotel is always delightful. The staff is helpful, the rooms are attractive, and the view is fantistic.

review.title: Depressing room
review.reviewText: I've stayed at the St. Francis a couple of times in the past and been impressed by everything about the property. This time I found myself in a gloomy room in the bowels of the hotel. I had just assumed they didn't have any bad rooms. Now I know better.

review.title: 2nd stay. Great room/great location
review.reviewText: This is the second time I've stayed there in the past 30 days. The rooms are comfortable, clean and the staff helpful. The one major drawback is that the internet access is expensive and SLOW SLOW SLOW.

review.title: Best Location
review.reviewText: Best location in San Francisco. Most central to almost anywhere you want to go. It was like being in Times Square. Second walk for shopping, restaurants, cabs, trolley, bus stops, everything.

review.title: Amazing Service
review.reviewText: The service at the hotel is amazing. Call in any request and they will be in your room in a matter of minutes. At around midnight, my girlfriend realized that she had not packed any saline solution or contact lens cases. I called the front desk to ask where I could buy some, and instead, they sent someone up with a case and a huge bottle of saline solution at no charge. I am only staying at the St. Francis from now on.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: The location was very convenient, the hotel was very pretty, and the room smelled so good! I would highly recommend this hotel. Request a room in the historic tower. I think that part of the hotel had more character.

review.title: Too noisy for me
review.reviewText: The walls are thin, so be prepared to hear your neighbors, and their televisions. This is the only thing that will stop me from staying here again. I like my privacy and quiet when I travel.

review.title: Very satisfied!
review.reviewText: I was very satisfied with my stay at the Westin. The rooms are gorgeous, the bed was very comfortable, the shower was roomy.. I felt like a queen. It was my honeymoon so the front staff upgraded my room two times AND I had a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries awating me in my room. They were great. My stay was pure royalty!!!!

review.title: We love The St. Francis!
review.reviewText: Excellent, first class!

review.title: Expensive hotel for what you get
review.reviewText: They dont eaven teake your lauggage when you enter the hotel. The room is very small.

review.title: I had a great time at my best friends wedding. You can't beat the view from the penthouse!
review.reviewText: A very comfortable hotel.

review.title: Good central location
review.reviewText: The Hotel itself was nice and in an ideal location. We were 25 floors up so what a view we had! Room itself wasn't the cleanest - dirty woodwork. Bath was tiny and hot water too cold. Air conditioning was good - very effective. Staff were very, very helpful - nothing was too much trouble. But then again that's what we thought of all customer service in san fran - nothing was ever too much trouble. Have never been somewhere were the people were so friendly. Would totally recommend you go!

review.title: We loved our stay at the Westin San Fran, the heavenly beds are perfect
review.reviewText: Great spot to stay/right in the hub of the city, beautiful view, great shopping and dining at you finger tips, there is know better place then right at Union Square.

review.title: Very nice but expensive
review.reviewText: Very nice but expensive

review.title: Cannot wait to return.
review.reviewText: We expected a tight fit vis-a-vis the room so we weren't shocked to find that quite small.Would have suited our needs better if the gym was open later.We found the staff exremely helpful and responsive to our needs:did not have one negative interraction at all.Meal at Michael Mina may have been the best we have ever had.Would stay again at this hotel with or without a discount.

review.title: Historical just means old and not updated
review.reviewText: The rooms in the historical section were small. There was no closet space and next to no drawers to store clothes. There were hairs in the bathroom that didn't belong to me.

review.title: Location, Location, Location
review.reviewText: Great location, Great hotel, Great Service. I could not have ask for more. A very good value for the money. Will always look for other Westin Hotels in other locations!

review.title: Loved It, Loved It, Loved It!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel was by far the best we've ever stayed at!!! You can feel the history of the hotel from the moment you step inside. The hotel staff, from the bellman to the cleaning ladies to the hotel manager were nothing but supurb! This hotel is in the heart of Union Square, within walking distance to EVERYTHING... We are DEFINITELY going to come back and and stay at the St.Francis!

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: The St. Francis was a great choice of hotel for our trip to San Francisco. The staff is extremely nice & helpful. We had a terrific view of the city from our room. It is right in the middle of Union Square so it was really easy to get to everything we wanted to do. We will definitely stay there on our next trip.

review.title: a historical must
review.reviewText: the hotel comes with alot of history from earthquake and fire survival. many of heads of state have stayed at the westin from queens to presidents. this was a beautiful and friendly hotel.

review.title: I left my heart....
review.reviewText: The Hotel St. Francis is the "Grande Dame" of all San Francisco hotels. Elegantly restored, wonderful rooms and a spectacular view of Union Square and downtown San Francisco. The Powell Street Cable Car runs right in front of the hotel and with some of the world's great shopping available in the Union Square area, this hotel has it all.

review.title: Location Location Location
review.reviewText: The Westin was not only far more luxurious than the price led on to be, but it was right in teh middle of all the shopping and things to do at union square. The showerhead was a nice amenity, the soft comforter was great and the staff gave me no grief when I had a problem with the bill concerning the mini bar. No need to look further, book the St. Francis.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: It was a very nice hotel. The beds were extremely comfortable. It's very close to lots of sights to see in San Fran. Would stay again.

review.title: The best place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The lobby of the hotel is gorgeous! A reminder of the past. The service was great. Our room was clean and had a very nice interieur. And the most important thing, never slept better in this comfortable bed.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, centrally located
review.reviewText: Everyone in the hotel is friendly and well informed. The area is clean and safe. The Market-Hyde St. cable car picks you up outside the hotel front door.

review.title: Good location for shopping,close to attractions, hard bed.
review.reviewText: Never been to San Fran, so went w/the historical St. Francis. It was glamorous and fabulous! The room was in the historic portion of the hotel.
