Great charm, luved the view, incredible shower, but the "heavenly bed" was hard and uncomfortable. If you luv the fast-paced big city and want to shop, this location is fantastic. I dont like to spend my vacation shopping, instead wanted to sight see the tourist spots. The concierge was there to answer a specific question, however I was disappointed with the lack of suggestions/brochures for sight seeing. Once I went to Fisherman's warf and checked around at the ticket offices, then I found many choices for tours/places to see etc.. wish the concierge would have had more optional information to give out for those wanting to do the touristy thing. There were many club choices nearby too. Overall a great vacation and luved the location and ambiance of the hotel!

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: San Francisco and the Westin Hotel - a great match.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was only a few blocks away from the Powell st station so it was really easy to get to from the airport. The hotel was lovely, and the staff were always willing to help. The room however was rather small, and beacause the hotel is so old, noise was at times a factor. I would stay at the St.Francis again, but next time I would be sure to get a better room.

review.title: Fabulous history. Very elegant.
review.reviewText: they play a video on the hotel history on the TV and it is truely amazing and impressive. Request a room overlooking the Union Square. It's worth it!

review.title: I will stay there again and recommend it to others
review.reviewText: Hotel location (union sq) is great, very convenient to all shops, restruants, and walking or cable car distance from popular sites

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: This was our first stay at the St. Francis Westin in San Francisco. We had a fabulous time and can't wait to go back. It has a romantic and historical feel to it. Not too mention its in a prime location. We intend to stay at this hotel from now on!!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco.

review.title: Great hotel, just be sure to avoid the outside rooms near busy hallways.
review.reviewText: The room was great, clean and nicely decorated. The bed was actually a little too firm even though it is promoted as a comfort bed. The only complaint was that the noise in the hallways each night was so loud, I was awakened each night several times from people talking and laughing in the hallway.

review.title: Small room, but elegant accommodations
review.reviewText: If you like the opulence of a crystal chandelier,all-marble bathrooms, silk draperies, and exquisite paint jobs in the rooms, then this is the hotel for you. Our basic room was quite small - not too much walk-around space and only one person could be in the bathroom at a time. But it was absolutely beautiful. Perfect setting right on Union Square, too. Couldn't ask for better placement!

review.title: It was a great experience
review.reviewText: It was such a great experience- we had a problem and they solved it for us right away and our stay was wonderful

review.title: Great time!
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time. The St Frances is very nice with alot of history. It's in a great location for shopping and you can catch a trolley just down Powell St. The older rooms are small, but we were site seeing most of the time and it didn't matter.

review.title: Great time in San Fran
review.reviewText: First trip to San Francisco...lots of fun & great location! Very convenient & close to plenty of shopping, restaurants, cable & bus lines..even when just walking. Not overly impressed with the front desk welcome, but concierge service very helpful. Watch out for multiple mini-bar charges! We took 1 item but were charged for 4....heavily overpriced. Would definitely visit again!!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the middle of Union Square making it easy to walk or ride the trolley to most of the tourist features (Fishermans Wharf, Chinatown, Telegraph Hill, etc). The hotel itself is impressive with a newly renovated foyer but the standard room lacks character and many amenities such as in room coffee and a pitiful selection a cable channels. Be aware that all amenities including wireless internet and the workout room are daily additional charges. However, the bed and linens are exceptionally comfortable and the room is very quiet (albeit very small) even being surrounded by very busy roads. I was able to get a fantastic deal on this package from expedia, and as long as you get a special rate (actual rates are astronomical), this hotel is worth the price for the location and the comfortable bed.

review.title: San Fran's Best Hotel
review.reviewText: They have the most comfortable beds! My floor was very quiet from the hussle and bussle of the main lobby and the city. The location of the hotel is prime. It's close to everything and a block or two from cable cars, subway, buses,etc. Don't ask the front desk anything, ask the Consierge, they know everything and are very friendly! My favourite thing about this hotel are the elevators, half of it is enclosed with glass so you can see the whole city. The view is spectacular! The chambermaids could have been a bit more thorough, but nothing too terrible. I'd definitely stay here again!

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: Great lobby. Deluxe room was adequate, not spectacular.

review.title: Mark this one with a star
review.reviewText: Loved location. Rooms are spacious and very clean in the old part of hotel where we stayed. Staff friendly. Would definitely go back.

review.title: Top Notch Concierge
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Westin St. Francis for 4-nights and the experience was fabulous. It was our first time in San Fran and we chose this historic hotel in the heart of Union Square because of the convenience and the 4-star rating. Would definitely stay here again... the location was close to all the great shops and the cable car was right across the street so we were able to explore and get around town with ease. The best part was the attentive and knowledgeable concierge, especially this one gentleman, whose name I can't recall--a soft-spoken, caucasian man with glasses--anyway, I gave him a list of 5 or 6 places that I wanted to visit in one day and he basically mapped out my entire route, complete with buses I needed to take and strategic ways to get from A to B in the least amount of time. He really impressed me and made my time at this hotel that much more delightful. The rooms are spacious and ultra clean... there is peace and quiet to be had and though the views weren't the best--most likely due to the low fog obstructing our view of the Golden Gate Bridge--it was a still a top notch hotel experience. We also at the Oak Room (within the hotel) on one of the nights we were there and the wait staff was very friendly and accomodating. The live music (piano) added a touch of elegance and romance to the ambience and the food was delicious. The Westin St. Francis is where you should stay if you are seeking quality, comfort, class and conveniece.

review.title: Great Location and grand ambience
review.reviewText: We stayed for 3 nights in July as part of a West Coast holiday. There is no doubt that the hotel has a fantastic location; the public rooms are impressive and the reception staff etc were very pleasant and efficient. Overall value for money is good at Expedia rates. However the bedrooms are not in the first flush of youth (we stayed in the old part of the hotel) and were not quite as clean and immaculate as we would have hoped. Good beds though and overall we were satisfied enough.

review.title: Would stay there again.
review.reviewText: The hotel is located right next to Union Square. The rooms are large and the beds are very comfortable. The bathrooms are nice and clean. We needed an extra bed so they brought us a roll away bed 5 min. after the request. We didn't use the restaurant or bars but the location of the hotel allows you access to many nice restaurants deli's and shops.

review.title: Beautiful hotel- Great Location!
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay at the St. Francis. The location on Union Square was perfect for us. We enjoyed the downtown area for shopping and Chinatown just a short walk away. Near SFMOMA and many restaurants. We had wonderful service and a great room. I will try to stay here again.

review.title: Feel like royalty!
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location for taking in all kinds of events, shopping, and San Francisco culture! Staff was friendly and helpful from the moment we entered: greeted us, offered hotel info, speedy check in, and held our luggage between checkout and flight time so we could take in more of the city. Decor was beautiful, like a step back in time with marble columns, crystal chandeliers, and winding staircases. Room was very comfortable with high quality comforter, towels, big window. We will stay at the St. Francis again.

review.title: Best Location in San Fran
review.reviewText: The Westin St Francis is the perfect location to get around San Fran using all forms of public transportation. It's not a bad walk to the Ferry Terminal (and not up hill !!!!). The cable car stops right in front of the hotel but get on early in the morning to avoid the crowds. The room was small but quite comfortable and very quiet given that you are smack dab in the middle of Union Square. The staff was very helpful, very professional and very friendly. Check out the hotel history on their inhouse tv channel.

review.title: Loved the hotel!
review.reviewText: Will stay there again! Staff is very helpful, nice and professional.

review.title: The only Hotel to go to
review.reviewText: Once you arrive to this hotel you'll know that you are about to be treated with first class service. The room is average size, but very cozy. The bed is truly heavenly, its so comfortable that you should ask for a wake up call or you'll end up sleeping in. Room service is prompt! Their Concierge top is notch; got us a reservation in one of the best restaurant in San Francisco (try to do it at least a a day in advance). There's a lot of history about this hotel that will make your stay so memorable. We were out most of the time we were there and we couldn't wait to get back to our room. It was our first time going to San Francisco, and I think it won't be as memorable if we haven't stayed here at the St. Francis. We can't wait to go back to this hotel.

review.title: Definitely a class act
review.reviewText: Upscale, rich in history and close to BART, Union Square, fine eateries and shopping. Next time I'll have to stay in the towers.

review.title: Management and reservations staff extremely rude
review.reviewText: I have never been treated so poorly at any hotel of any class, and certainly not at a 4-star hotel. I will never stay at a Westin Hotel again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location

review.title: Westin St Francis
review.reviewText: This hotel was wonderful -- service was great, and location couldn't be better. The one downside of our stay was the room placement, which was adjacent to the elevator so we could hear the faint noise of the elevator going up and down. And we also didn't have a view. But they did satisfy our request for a queen size bed. Overall, would definitely go back!

review.title: small rooms, expensive garage
review.reviewText: nice location

review.title: Small but comfortable
review.reviewText: Room was small but comfortable. Pictures are much better than the actual room. Bed was small but very nice. Staff are very friendly and smile alot. For the price - shop around. Great location.

review.title: Awesome location!
review.reviewText: Very central and safe. Easy access to busses and trolley cars as well as Market Street where numerous bus lines are available. We felt they could have provided better service by advising the location of the Visitor Information Centre which is very close by as well as not to venture into the Tenderloin district which is directly west and not the safest. Disappointed that although I have contacted the hotel twice since my return to Calgary, I have not heard back regarding my camera case and memory card which I left behind in our room.

review.title: Not Impressed for the price
review.reviewText: Ou room was very small & the glass elevators in the adjacent hotel tower faced our bedroom. There were light and some noise from the elevators. I couldn't believe that there was no complimentry coffee & small coffee maker in the room. The location, however is excellent across from Union square & close to shopping & restaurants.

review.title: Classic Hotel! Very Nice.
review.reviewText: Very nice place to stay.One of the best in the Union District.I would highly recommend this to anyone.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: I had much higher expectations of a Westin property. If all you want is a "heavenly" bed and a "heavenly" shower than that's what you'll get.

review.title: In the center of it all!
review.reviewText: This stay was a second honeymoon for my husband and I. The location is great, within walking distance to great shops and restaurants. Didn't need a car. We were upgraded to a much nicer room than what we had booked and the entire staff was very helpful and freidly. Take advantage of the concierge service.Jeff at the conceirge desk helped plan our entire itinerary and made great recommendations that made our visit great!

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: Terrifically located on Union Square. Beautiful and impressive lobby. Room rate was an excellent value. Room, however, was tiny. Additional fees, such as parking and internet services, were outrageous.

review.title: Had a wonderful time. Locationh was perfect!
review.reviewText: A wonderful old hotel in a spectacular location.

review.title: cant wait to go back, i was so impressed
review.reviewText: wonderful stay i loved it!!! it gets five stars from me

review.title: Beautiful Hotel- Great location!
review.reviewText: This hotel was beautiful. No its not a state of the art hotel but this hotel has history and you feel it the moment you walk in. Definetly a plus when staying in such a historical city. Staff was extremely nice and friendly. But be sure to put the do not disturb sign out if you plan on sleeping past 8am- the maid was there at 8:15am!

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: The first room I was given had not yet been cleaned from the previous guest who had apparently just vacated the room. As the maid hurried to make the bed and clean the room, I noticed the "view" from the window was a brick wall only a few feet away. Since the room was already very, very small, it had the ambiance of a prison cell with very little indirect light and drab blue walls. I was given another much better room upon request. But when I saw an ad on the hotel sponsored tv channel that spoke of free coffee from the in-room coffeemaker, I noticed there was none. When I called to inquire, I was told that one was provided only upon request; a benefit few guests would know about unless they happen to view that channel and listen carefully to that ad (but automatically provided in every guestroom in other hotels I have visited). Also, lacking were little things such as a shower cap in the bathroom that other hotels provide. Overall, I was not impressed.

review.title: The Westin - St Francis, San Francisco
review.reviewText: Overall, a great hotel, in a great location. Would stay there again.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We had planned to stay one night, but change our reservation and decided to stay two. The hotel was very accommodating, making sure we got the room we had wanted. Would recommend to anyone. Absolutely beautiful hotel.

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: It was a wonderful experience. The hotel was beautiful. I was impressed with the history of the hotel. The room was large, comfortable and clean.

review.title: We have stayed at the St. Fransicis several times. I love it!!!
review.reviewText: The hotel is lovely. The room was facing Union Square and could not have been more comfortable. I am very particular about my accomadations and I have never been disapointed.

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: Very elegant hotel with a rich history. The rooms are clean, the staff is helpful. The service is fantastic right down to the door man.

review.title: so so
review.reviewText: Not bad, not great. Conveniently located to downtown SF. Lobby is quite elegant and historic, rooms and hallways are a bit dowdy. Does not have all the amenities of a more modern hotel catering to biz travelers.

review.title: Had a great time
review.reviewText: Excellent stay

review.title: A Tase of Old San Fransisco
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel based solely on my online research and I was pleased with my decision. The hotel lobby reminded my of an expensive New York City hotel with its elegant appearance and hustle/bustle of guests and tourists. We stayed in the historic part of the hotel. Being historic, the room was small, but very detailed in its decorations. The floor had a distinctive "old" smell, which is common of many historic hotels. The concierge was extremely helpful and all of their restaurant recommendations were outstanding.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Excellent location, great workout area. Very satisfying stay!

review.title: The beds were heavenly!
review.reviewText: The hotel was built in the early 1900's, but you would never know by the guest rooms. The rooms were modern, and very comfortable. The bathroom was a decent size, and had dual shower heads. The beds were wonderful. When I got home I went online to find out how to purchase the linens, and bed. The hotel staff was very friendly, and helpful. It's a great value for your money. In the future I'll look for a Westin Hotels when I travel. I believe that all the Westin hotels have the heavenly beds.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: Nice old hotel, right in the heart of Union Square. The Staff was very courteous and helpful and the small room was clean. Windows open for fresh air and the sounds of the City can filter in. The only thing that was disappointing was there is no coffee maker in the room and none available, despite what the amenities list says. Coffee is available in the morning for purchase. In all, a very pleasant hotel.

review.title: Great Location, Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: The St. Francis is centally located in Union Square, great for shopping. The cable cars stop right outside the front door. Great hotel!

review.title: The best place I've ever stayed...Amazing...
review.reviewText: I love San Francisco...I love this Hotel...

review.title: Dont stay in new area of building
review.reviewText: The new area of the building was crowded and elevators took forever because of all the people. The valet was also a pain and was very expensive ($40 a day)

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: I wish they had a wider selection for in room dining.

review.title: Center of everything
review.reviewText: The hotel is old and the rooms are small but the service and location of the hotel is excellant. The trolley and other public transportation was easily accessible from the hotel. Union square is a great area for shopping and theaters with plenty of places to eat close by at very reasonable rates.

review.title: Westin St Francis - cramped et al!
review.reviewText: When they indicated the rooms were small it should have been more graphic!

review.title: Grand Dame Experience
review.reviewText: Try to get in the old wing so you can experience the old San Francisco elegance. Great location, too. Because all hotels need tons of business these days, the original exclusivity feeling is gone, but once you are in your room, you can safely dream of times gone by.

review.title: Great Classic Hotel in the Heart of Union Sq
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed her for our Anniversary. We actually live right across the Bay in Oakland but were having dinner at the hotel to celebrate and did not want to drive home. I went on-line to see what type of rate I could get on short notice and I was able to get a room for a very good price. This was a smaller room but not as small as I expected. The room had a very large closet, nice decor and good sized bath room with lush towles. The Bedding is great too. The room did not have a view but for the price and location I did not expect it to. The service was excellent and you cannot beat the location.

review.title: Not what I expected, but okay
review.reviewText: The Westin was a beautiful old hotel with lots of charm and class. I really enjoyed the architecture and the ambience of the hotel. It certainly has a sense of pride and nostalgia when you're sitting and enjoying the architecture. However, we stayed in a room with no view in the interior of the hotel. Very small room and comforts were less than modern. Sheets and bed were comfortable enough. Room smelled stuffy and old, so did hallway. I received a great deal with expedia for room and air and felt that I received what I paid for. Have I stayed at better, cozier, with better amentities, yes. But the location and the experience was worth the small room. We barely stayed in the room so it really didn't matter. The room served its purpose and when walking around the hotel, adjacent shops and restaurants, it really didn't matter how big the room was. It was San Francisco at its best. Overall, great deal from expedia, nice room,fantastic location, and great city.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is situated in Union Sq, great location for shopping, galleries, restaurants. Hotel room sevice is excellent, had my am coffee delivered within 5 minutes of call, and hotel food is surprisingly good. We had dinner in the Oak Room one evening and the food was 5 star. Hotel is historic, slightly shabby chic, room was well appointed with sitting area, great for in room gathering. All hotel staff were so nice. Bed was a little hard but ok.

review.title: Good Hotel Amidst Many Neighboring Hotels
review.reviewText: The hotel has a nice, clean and tidy look overall. The decor and color combinations are pleasing to the eye. The ambience ranges from olden to modern. The staff were very knowledgeable, helpful and efficient. Food was appealing and delicious.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The Westin St. Francis was right across the street from Union Square and right on the cable car line. It was very convienent to be able to walk rather than drive everywhere.

review.title: Wonderful, romantic, old world grandeur, best new world features
review.reviewText: The people were the best. The apex of professionalism. Made us feel like rockstars. Fantastic view. Fancy crown molding. 400 threadcount sheets. Doorman calling you a cab with a whistle. Call room service or the front desk and they call you "Mr" and your last name before you say anything. The shower had hot water and lots of it. Great pressure, double shower heads, both of them the massaging type. Set the room thermometer and hot air or cold air immediately rushes in through a big (but not obvious vent) to accomodate you. Ask for a blanket or coffee and it's there within a few minutes. Absolutely top of the line. Only drawback is... of course it's pricey. But you get what you pay for and that's a fact.

review.title: Absolutely my favorite, but be aware...
review.reviewText: This hotel is probably my favorite hotel in the world. Watching the channel they have with a video of the history of the hotel has become almost a past time, the hotel is definitely 4 star, the staff is fabulous, at one point on this trip the vacuumer in the lobby stopped vacuuming without even being asked just so we could talk to the concierge. The rooms are always clean, and the ones in the main building (as opposed to the two towers) make you feel like you're a part of that history. It's well worth the money, but be aware.... if you're renting a car/need internet be prepared to pay for it (in the case of parking in San Francisco - Seriously pay for it) Sometimes it looks like a great deal, but be sure to factor those costs in.

review.title: Great location, beautiful hotel, older & noisy........
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful and had historical ambiance. However, the original towers had very small rooms and it was quite noisy at all hours. The small rooms were very quaint, as long as you know what to expect and we did. The noise was fine for us to handle as well, but once again, we knew to expect this. There was no coffee maker in our room which was surprising. The air conditioning in our room was not the best. The location was great for traveling by cable car and was right in Union Square with tons of shopping and many restaurants very close. All in all, we were happy with the hotel and would stay there again.

review.title: Worth the money
review.reviewText: The front desk was very helpful and upgraded our room at no additional charge. The hallways had a strong carpet odor when you walked down them. It was a bit nauseating. When walking into the room we were overpowered by the smell of bleach. The overall cleanliness of the hotel was great. The room had a very comfortable bed and a roomy shower.The location of the hotel could not have been better.

review.title: The best location
review.reviewText: The St.Francis Hotel is the Best situated in San Francisco, the hotel is very good ,but in my opinion Westin Should invest more in Room maintenace, it is old and it looks like it is, and it is supoesed to look glamorous not old.

review.title: old but great location and nice staff
review.reviewText: the room was old, small and smelled a bit too much like "grandma's house". however, you are in a prime location and the staff was excellent and the lobby/public areas are nice. was a good value for a weekend visit.

review.title: the best location in the city
review.reviewText: Beautiful entry and lobby. Beds very inviting and comfortable. Furniture looked a bit run down. Over all, it is a relaxing experience.

review.title: The Best Hotel Ever
review.reviewText: Everything was perfect. Very clean, lovely view, pure elegance.

review.title: There are better hotels in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel overbooked and had to turn away many reservations. Very disappointed after a long drive and had no room. Some staff were professional and helpful but not all. There are much better and newer hotels in San Francisco where you will be more comfortable. But the location of St. Francis is great if you want to be in Union Square.

review.title: Classy
review.reviewText: This is an old hotel that has captured the feeling of SF. This hotel is really great and the people are even greater.

review.title: Everything smells old
review.reviewText: I realize it's SF and the building is really old but everything smells like your Grandma's house. The rooms are SMALL (queen beds) and the heavenly bed??? HA! Westin has so cheaped out on these. The sheets are scratchy. You can't beat the location though!

review.title: Westin but old building
review.reviewText: It is Westin's good service, but the buidling is so old that you will hear Elevator noise and if it rains you hear walter running all day long (you can imagin it it waterfall, then it is bearable.) Make sure to ask for better room, for they try to put you into cheapest room (dark, small, dirty). As a guest staying in nice hotel you will be the prime target of homeless guys hanging around this hotel. They ask for $20, instead of a quater or a few dollars! I guess they are as expensive as hotel services... And don't even think about this one if you have a car, parking is $49 per night! Fitness center is $12 per day use!

review.title: Excellent San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location. On Union Square. Two blocks from BART station which takes you to and from the airport. Rooms have been renovated. Very clean and nice. Only downside was that on one day they were not able to clean the room until evening. This was the only negative. Very friendly staff. Don't miss the Daily Grill right across the street.

review.title: excellent!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: excellent accomodation...ps don't settle for the 'standard room'

review.title: Location, Location, Location....
review.reviewText: I love the St. Francis and the friendly staff! Our Tower Corner King Room on the Preferred Starwood Floor was large, quiet and very comfortable. The spa was small, but clean. The massage therapist was experienced and polite. The location is close to everything- Cable Car, Union Square, Shopping, Starbucks. The only improvement the hotel needs to make is more lighting in the bathroom.

review.title: Will Never Go Back
review.reviewText: I stayed at St. Francis Westin Hotel (Union Square, SF). It was a horrible experience. First of all, the bathroom was not very clean and had stains on it. There was no shampoo or lotion which was kind of odd for a 4 star hotel. The air vents had dust inside it and the blow dryer was extremely dirty. The room had some scent probably from the dirty drapes. There was also a little bit of hair in the sink.

review.title: Central and easy
review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located in Union Square. The area can be a bit hectic during the holiday season. The check in staff was ok, the concierge was not very helpful, but the housekeeping staff was excellent!

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: had a great bar but renovated it and lost it, rooms are comfortable but maintenance is fair, used to decorate for the holidays but no longer

review.title: Sneaky extra fees
review.reviewText: I really loved our stay at the St. Francis. However, I was surprised to find that the fitness facility required an additional fee, to make a local or 800# call was an additional fee and a package I had delivered to the hotel had an additional "handling" fee of $15. I thought it all was a bit excessive. But, the location was fabulous and they were very helpful.

review.title: Rooms were old and small
review.reviewText: I think I would have been VERY disappointed if I had paid the regular price for this hotel, and not booked it on expedia. The room was extremely small, the bed too. I had requested a king size bed and we were put in a room with a double bed. The bathroom and closet were huge in comparison to the room itself - go figure. Our room overlooked Geary St. and the street performers, so it was really loud at night until about 11:30. When I called the front desk they told me that they could not move us the first night, but would be more than happy to for the second night. They were very nice about it. I think that was the only above average thing about the hotel - the friendliness of the front desk people.....

review.title: Westin St Francis
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, thin walls, can hear your neighbors and plumbing through the walls. First night neighbors woke us up at 2:30a.m partying called front desk and noise stopped right away. Second night neighbors started partying again called front desk and move to another room, everything was good from then on.

review.title: Within walking distance to everything
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel and a piece of history. If you like to shop, it's within walking distance to some of the finest shops and department stores. Everything was terrific.

review.title: Elegant Lobby
review.reviewText: The Westin St. Francis service was GREAT! We took the red eye from Hawaii and arrived at about 6:30 am. The front desk clerk let us check in early, which helped out a lot. The lobby is elegant and beautifully decorated. We got the older room in the original building (the only complaint was that the room felt a little small and cramped initially, but after a few days it seemed to get bigger). One huge bright spot was that the St.Louis Cardinals baseball team was in town and stayed in the same hotel by coincidence. I also got to take a photo with one of the players! That made my day! We checked out on time & the hotel allowed us to keep our luggage in storage until we had to depart for the airport (which was fantastic!) Overall, the Westin St. Francis is HIGHLY RECOMMENDED & we would stay there again! Mahalo & Aloha to all the staff there! Malama pono!

review.title: Will book in this hotel next time I visit San Francisco
review.reviewText: The staff is courteous and friendly. The room was very comfortable and had a good view of the city. I will definitely go back to this hotel and book a much longer stay.

review.title: convenient location
review.reviewText: great location but hotel is dated which is all part of the experience

review.title: Great Choice for San Francisco
review.reviewText: My husband and I were very pleased with the Westin St. Francis. For a change the hotel more than lived up to the magnificient pictures displayed on the interenet. The hotel staff were very accommodating and friendly. We really enjoyed our stay and will definetly choose the Westin St. Francis on our next trip.

review.title: Not the best - but that's changing
review.reviewText: I got a great deal on this place but I think I checked in early. My bathroom was dirty, the ceiling paint was peeling and the room seemed a little bit kept. I did notice though that all the other rooms on the floor were being 'redone'. Therefore I bet the place will be in stellar shape in a few months. I will also say that the "lobby" drinks/dessert place is quite nice for apres dinner.

review.title: Wonderful and charming.
review.reviewText: Great hotel in Union Square with terrific shopping all in walking distance.  Just three blocks to BART!  Wonderful restaurants in the area and a quick trip on a trolley to Fisherman's Wharf!

review.title: still a classic
review.reviewText: the westin st. francis is still a classic, especially if you stay in the old wing.  the standard rooms are small (the bathrooms especially so)  but you're in san francisco..who is hanging out in their room?  having a drink in the downstairs open area bar (compass rose or onyx...never was straight on the name) give you a sense of sophistication as you watch the arrival and departure of your fellow travelers.  the proximity to everything is key.

review.title: Beautiful hotel.
review.reviewText: Very elegant, with modern ameneties in a great location.

review.title: Middle of the road
review.reviewText: Although the hotel is maintained in excellent condition and the Heavenly Bed truly is exactly that, the rooms at this Westin were far too small (unless you upgrade to another room and pay more for it).  Location is right in Union Square and convenient to everything.

review.title: Westin St. Francis
review.reviewText: Overall, I was very happy with my stay at the hotel. We got a room in the old tower and it was actually quite nice. Besides the room was quite small it was quite comfortable.

review.title: great location and service
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful and the location was perfect.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: A real San Francisco classic.  A wonderful hotel!!!

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Although our stay turned out to be pretty nice, it did not start that way.  Our first room was in the "vintage" side of the hotel.  The wallpaper was peeling off, it had mold behind it, the tiles in the bathroom were all cracked, and the room had a small stall shower.  We made several attempts to contact the front desk and after 20 minutes of trying to reach someone we were finally switched to a room on the newer side. The hotel staff did not offer to transfer our bags, we instead had to wait in line again at the front desk and move things ourselves.  The new room was a lot better. Much more like the Westin's I have stayed in previously.

review.title: "Right in the heart of Union Square"
review.reviewText: An older regal property right in the heart of Union Square.  Many great restaurants and lots of shopping within walking distance.  Trolley stop right in front of hotel.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the heart of union square. Guest services of any type were excellent. Concierge recommended great restaurants and had answers to all of our questions. Halls and room smelled old and musty, my only negative comment.

review.title: Beautiful and Classic hotel in SF
review.reviewText:
The Hotel was restored beautiflly from the lobby to the resturant to the hallways.  the rooms (at least the one I stayed in) was quiute small, but the fantastic work out room and spa made up for it.
I would reccomend this hotel for someone who does not mind tight sleeping quarters but wants to make up for it with the elegance and history of a classic odl downtown SF hotel.

review.title: Excellent hotel!  The best location!
review.reviewText: We stayed in January and even though it was raining we still had a fabulous view from the 29th floor of the Bay, Union Square, Coit Tower and the TransAmerica building. The staff was super - from the receptionist to the doorman!  The location can't be beat.  Your right in the heart of shopping, restaurants and bars. Plus we are always in love with the Heavenly Beds at Westin and this on didn't disappoint.

review.title: Living it up in the Hotel California - The Shining with a Happy Ending
review.reviewText:
Walking to my room in the 'old section' of the hotel, I felt a bit like Shelley Duvall exploring the haunted Overlook resort.

The halls have a weight and scent of age that a little refurbishing could cure nicely.

However, the room was comfortable, if a bit dark due to its location by an interior patio well.  This also made it extremely quiet, and with no sun or sounds to wake up to, it was very restful.

Room service menu was nice and what I ordered was relatively good.  Caesar salad was quite nice, but the shrimp cocktail was not fresh.

This location is excellent. There is nothing like waking up, walking downstairs, and stepping onto the streets of downtown San Francisco early on a crisp morning.  Grab a latte and watch the flower vendors setting up around Union Square. 

I was within four blocks of work in the financial district and a block away from all the shopping I could want.  The hotel even gave us a 12% discount at the nearby Macy's.

The staff was very courteous and it was a very nice 'getaway.'  

I highly recommend this hotel, a reasonable rate and better service and location than many of the B&B's I have seen in the Union Square area.

review.title: San Francisco's traditional jewel
review.reviewText: The Hotel location, facilities and personnel were just extraordinary.  World class ambience, friendly and helpful staff and just an amazing experience for anyone wishing to have a complete, rewarding trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: I try to stay at Westin wherever I go cause I love the heavenly bed - room was small but comfortable and you can't beat the location

review.title: Decent, clean, centrally-located hotel, but small room
review.reviewText: This hotel is conveniently located at Union Square and is close to major attractions, shopping and public transportation.  The service at the hotel was good and the room was well-kept and clean.  I also loved the double shower head in the bathroom.  My only complaints (minor complaints) were that the room was a little small, the food I ordered from room service was lousy, the concierge wasn't always available by phone when they should have been, and I had trouble arranging for an airport bus pick-up through the concierge.  I would stay at this hotel again if I got a decent rate and would recommend it to others.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Clerk at check-in was not friendly.  Rooms were very old and tiles were cracked

review.title: Fantastic Location in SF
review.reviewText:
The St. Francis is right on Union Square, all major shopping is right there.  The cable Car stop is in front of the hotel, jump on at Powell and Post and avoid the huge queue at the base of Powell St.  The Hyde St. or Mason St. line will take you to Fisherman's Wharf, the Hyde St. line provides you with the postcard views of Telegraph Hill and then Alcatraz as you descend to the Wharf.

Staff was very accomodating at check in and friendly, despite comments to the contrary.  It helps to be as pleasant as you can be yourself, not easy after a cross country flight.  

The St. Francis has ruined their lobby area, formerly known as the Compass Rose.  The space has been leased to a restaurant and what had been a very confortable place to lounge and drink has now been reduced to a pitiably small area right off the Powell entrance. It used to be a terrific spot.

Our room was good, bed was very comfortable (marketed as heavenly beds), and we had a nice sitting area as well.  The bathrooms are ready for a full makeover, at least ours was.  The hallways, we were in the newer tower, are also kind of dreary.  

St. Francis is tough to beat, however, for location, location, location.

review.title: great staff
review.reviewText: All staff very well trained and everything was fast!!!

review.title: Historic Hotel offers great location
review.reviewText:
We did not stay in the towers, so our room was very small yet comfortable.  The reason to stay at the St. Francis is the location and its history. 

They have modern conviences like the work out room and a spa, both were well equipped.

review.title: Very comfortable rooms
review.reviewText: Excellent experience.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco.

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and service was excellent.  There are shops, restaurants and bars within the hotel.  All offered excellent service.  One could not ask for more!  When I visit San Francisco, I will again stay at the Saint Francis!

review.title: Room cleanliness
review.reviewText: I found the bathroom to not be  very clean.  There was significant hair (from previous guest) All over the bathroon florr and shower.  The toilet had stains and had a flushing problem.
